title: Nice transportation system in bangkok
review: As you known bangkok traffic jam is very famous Bangkok have BTS mass transfer system by train now This system is very good system and convenience in BKK I think about 45 min interval train go and comegood comfortable train systemI like it

title: Outstanding
review: Greta way to get around Bangkok  Very easy to figure out and use  At times it can get busy so try to avoid before and after school

title: Interesting experience
review: If you have the time give this a go  being on the train itself can be a very reflective experience I would recommend reading up on the history first to truly understand the significance of the railway The views are beautiful and the windowless carriages good for keeping cool

title: Best way to get to and from the airport
review: Beat the Bangkok traffic and take the sky train Affordable seemed reliable to us  and connected right with the skytrain that took us to our hotel

title: convenient yet a bit expensive
review: BTS Skytrain helps avoiding the private transport with all its advantages You can go from A to B without a risk of being cheated (Which is sadly a common issue in nowday Thailand) All cars are highly air conditioned The train is highly overcrowded during rush hours

title: Prepare for the crowds
review: My mom wanted to see it since she saw it on National Geographic Our group opted to take the train to the last stop where everyone was waiting with their cameras out Personally it was the best part of the trip We also really enjoyed the fried rice and shrimp at the restaurant The rest of the tour felt overcrowded If you can take the floating boat that only uses the paddle it is better The long tail boat that uses the motor pushes out so much exhaust

title: Direct access to Bangkok City
review: Tip don't use the 150baht Express Service  just use the ARL regular city run at 45 baht It's makes 3 or 4 extra stops and takes 15 minutes longer In my view not worth paying 3 times over the normal price to save 15 minutes Apart from that it's a great inexpensive and hassle free way to get from Suvarnabhumi airport into town (Phayathai station)

title: Super efficient
review: We used the skytrain to visit Jim Thompson’s house a traditional Thai house that is now a museum  The train was very clean efficient and fast full of local people as well as tourists Cheap too

title: Handicap or have issues with stairs.....take a cab!
review: I am sure its been noted many times befoe but the  BKK's Sky Train system  is total unusable for handicaped individualsthey have lifts but none are in use to my knowledge Take a cab if you don't mind the wait or have bladder control issues For non handicapped it's great

title: The most expensive mass transportation in Asia (except Japan)
review: Got down often  and the price is unreasonable high than other cities in Asia no toilet and not convenient for people with big luggage or handicapped people The worst service but we still have to use it since it’s exclusive supplier

title: Does the job
review: Easy to understand rate plans and trains are always on time  It is Bangkok so plan ahead relative to tight quarters duiring rush hour

title: Trains, boats
review: Great experience Covered a lot in a short amount of time food is great at the end Tour guide gives good insights into Thai culture

title: Traveling around Bangkok
review: Fantastic way to get around Use it its cheap and easy to use It's in English you can't really go wrong also just ask the staff they are great for information

title: Easiest and cheap way of traveling
review: If you can take the skytrain to your destination it's the best way of traveling in Bangkok It's cheap and fast Taking a taxi is more axpensive and Bangkok is very busy

title: Quick & Efficient
review: Usually we take a taxi to downtown bangkok costs around 450 baht but now feeling adventurous we took the Airport Rail link 45 baht per person and is quick efficient and takes you right into town where you can change to the BTS Keep in mind not all BTS stations have elevators or escalators all the way down The Airport link is an excellent alternative to the taxe and potential horrific traffic jams on the way in or out of bangkok to the airport

title: No problem taking this in to the city center
review: No problem taking this in to the city center Cant belive we never done that befor in Bangkok Its esay cheap and takes on time at all And the best part is you dont get stuck in the ceazy BKK trafcik

title: Inexpensive and efficient!
review: We took the train from the airport to the BTS It couldn't have been easier The station is in the airport and the line ends at the BTS Much better (and more fun) that taking a taxi

title: I may never take a taxi from Suvarnabhumi again
review: If your arrival time at Suvarnabhumi airport is between 6AM and 1130 PM and your hotel is near one of the BTS Skytrain stations you might want to consider taking the train instead of a taxi    Taxis from the airport cost anywhere from 500 to 600 THB depending on traffic and "other charges" (the driver explained that they charge extra between midnight and 6 AM  not sure if that is bogus or not)    My latest experience Flying back from Phuket to BKK I arrived at 4 PM  I took the Airport Rail Link (the City Line) all the way to the last stop at Phaya Thai fare = 45 THB  I walked over to the BTS Skytrain and hopped on the next train to Asok station fare = around 40 THB  The Park Plaza Hotel Sukhumvit was less than a five minute walk from the station  I was checked in and relaxing in my room around 5 PM  I do not know how long it would have taken in a taxi fighting Bangkok rush hour traffic  and with a meter running that might end up being quite pricey  The trains are very clean  The ticket vending machines are pretty user friendly  It also helps if the nice lady in line behind you explains the system  o)  Of course having a backpack instead of bulky rolling luggage makes it easier to transfer stations  And like in the NY subway (or any metro train) just have your wits about you and watch your valuables   For perspective  Coming from Sukhumvit back to the airport I took a taxi  It was 3 AM and the trip took less than a half hour  The meter read 197 THB  Go figure  (I gave the driver 300 THB  He looked real happy)

title: The Only Way to Travel!!
review: Just do it   130 baht per person for a Skytrain one day pass  You can't beat it  We were staying at the Grand Centre Point Terminal 21 and Asok Skytrain station was right next to the hotel   Grab the Skytrain to go to the Victory Monument King Power Duty Free MBK shopping centre Siam Centre or the Hard Rock Cafe   It's simply the only way to see Bangkok without getting caught in that traffic snarl that is well known in Bangkok

title: Suvarnabumi Link
review: The best link to Down Town Bangkok to and from Suvarnabumi airport Is very easy to use has English directionsinstructions and the ticket offices are very helpful with directions  Has an easy connection with BTS Skytrain to go to Siam Center shopping area  Faster than taxi or bus

title: Very good.
review: Very good all the lines cover almost the whole city but they should reduce the charges for babies It's clean and connects with most of the malls and buildings of the city

title: Only 2 lines
review: The BTS is a good way to travel if the place you want to is close to where it goes There are only 2 line but you can switch to the MRT underground (although they use tokens and not the rabbit card) at a few different stops The cars are clean and pretty safe

title: Pretty average
review: Took a second class air conditioned carriage from Chiang Mai to Bangkok during the day  I think it was a "sprinter" it didn't stop at every stop  I decided to train it so I could enjoy more of the Thailand scenery The booking part went well I booked over the internet with 12goasia and picked up my ticket on the morning just prior to boarding the train The train was waiting at the platform 30 minutes before departure time and had only 3 carriages so it was easy to find the right carriage First impression was how dirty it was and the toilets smelled really bad Found my seat which was quite comfy The train left 10 minutes later than scheduled (about 9am)  I had an empty seat next to me for the first 3 or 4 hours which was great  A meal was served about 1130am which was rice green chicken curry and satay mackerel The chicken curry was good although spicy I decided not to try the mackerel  There were two additional snacks served which were biscuits and something else that has escaped my memory now (sorry) Tea coffee water and juice is also available free of charge  I did mention that I decided on the train to see the scenery  Well the windows were so dirty you couldn't see out of them very well I think the windows are a double layer of glass as there was moisture in the window it wasn't on the inside and if it had been on the outside the movement of the train would have cleared it somewhat It didn't clear at all  The windows on the other side of the train were cleanerclearer but I got a sore neck trying to see out those windows  The scenery that I could see from that side was stunning All up an 11 hour journey it was not worth it  I would fly next time the price of tickets is not that much  If you are on a tight budget then possibly the train would be the way to go They did have a lady cleaning the toilets on a regular basis and there was even toilet paper supplied but the toilets did smell very bad

title: The fast way to travel to town
review: This service takes you from the airport directly to town the trains are airconditioned have TV and comfortable seating the service is very economical it only costs 35 Baht to take you to Makkasan where you can connect to the MRT underground of 50 Baht to take you Phaya Thai where you can connect with the Sky train the Airport Link has ample space in each carriage for your luggage it is truly great value for the money when you consider it only takes less than 30 minutes to get you to the centre of Bangkok

title: Let the train take the strain
review: I get dropped at AL Latkrabang when returning to Bangkok after a few day's work It is very convenient and quick to get into the center of the city while watchinng the traffic jams on the motorway The cost is very reasonable Recommended

title: Very well organized
review: It is very easy but too crowded  We had old parents as well as very young children  It was very well organized and superbly informative You can't go wrong there  Must try as it saves a lot of time  And saves money too )

title: Take the BTS
review: Very easy to get around using the Skytrain Very clean and spacious despite the thousands of locals and tourists

title: Good transportation
review: Inexpensive mode of transportation Doesnt take you everywhere but expansions of the lines are underway Try to avoid rush hour

title: Overall good ride experience, can't say the same for the ticketing machine
review: The train rides I had in bangkok weren't too noisy quite smooth (nonjerky) and the commuter flow was pretty smooth even during peak hour Train tickets can be bought from either the counter or the machines The machines aren't userfriendlystill backwards some only accept coins and you can only buy one ticket at a time When waiting for the ticket to be issued from the machine don't try to grab for it when it's still coming out cos if somehow you "obstruct" the incoming ticket the machine will swallow your ticket and not refund you the money

title: Loved the skytrain! fun, cheap, accurate timming, good views and has AC
review: Super fast and accurate timing and so cheap it´s an excellent idea to travel in the sky train not just because you get on time and it is really cheap but because it is an experience itself You can see the city from on top it has AC you avoid terrible traffic and people behave according to the place respectfully

title: easy access and user friendly
review: cheap and cheerful but best of all no traffic jam  even in Bangkok  Cost only 45 Baht one way and easy transfer to BTS at Phyra Thai station

title: Fast and inexpensive
review: I arrived on a Sunday afternoon with luggage The train was not crowded at the airport and I departed at Makkasan and connected to the MRT Petchaburi Cost was 45 THB Trip was fast and inexpensive with good aircon I would consider other alternative during busier transit times if you have cumbersome luggage The train gets crowded as it gets closer to the city stations No luggage racks on the train The walk to connect to MRT or BTS is considerable with luggage Still a great alternative to the traffic and cost of a taxi transfer efficient and easy to use service

title: An efficient way to get into Central Bangkok.
review: Goes from Bangkok Airport (Basement level) to Phayathai station where you can link with the Skytrain system 25 minute journey for less than £1  The link is only two years old so very modern and efficient

title: Easy to use
review: We decided to use the sky train for our visit to the weekend market Easy to navigate and you get a different perspective of the city Air conditioning was also a bonus

title: The only way to travel into BKK!
review: Taxino way The Airport Rail link is so so much better and you won't get ripped off by some unscrupulous taxi driver claiming his meter doesn't work etc etc We were only in Bangkok for a few hours so timings were very important Trains run about every 15 minutes are clean and security checked prior to passengers being allowed on The journey to the terminus took about 35 minutes from the airport and cost I think  45 baht each way Ticket machines can be used in both Thai or English and are simple to use but there can be quite long queues The journey will be quiet as most people have their heads buried in mobile phones It was relating to this that my only complaint arose and it's certainly not the fault of the train company There are priority seats meant for the elderly disabled etc Unfortunately  people( and I have to say mainly young people) take no notice of the priority seat signs and even when an elderly lady fainted one person refused to give up their seatshame on you

title: Excellent mass transit
review: Easy to access and use the Skytrain was our first line of mass transit with the railway the subway and the water buses as means of getting places it didn't go  It's clean and fast as are most of the transit options in Bangkok  Never had any issues and it is welllit and safe

title: Hope to have it here in VIETNAM
review: Hope to have it here in VIETNAM FAST and CONVENIENCE  mean s of transportation should have in every country

title: Very fast and clean
review: The BTS covers most of the places that tourisms will go In the city of Bangkok the traffic jam is very serious BTS is the best choice as it is convenience and fast Most stations are origanized with small shops and provide with signs showing different directions and the inside of the train is clean and air condition is strong enough to cool down the heat from outside

title: Good for rush hour traffic jam in BKK
review: The carts is a bit too short You may sometimes find that you have to wait for second on third train to get in on rush hours between 800  930 hrs and 1730  1830 hrs The other time of the day was just fine it ran smoothly and save a lot of time from BKK traffic

title: Clean and convenient
review: We have used the skytrain in the last couple years when we visited Bangkok The most recent one was three weeks ago   The BTS skytrain is very cheap clean air conditioned and convenient It connects to famous malls in the center of Bangkok  It has two main lines and is easy to use   Make sure that you have plenty of coins since BTS only uses coin  You can exchange at the coin machine but it has a long line at rush hour though  I really love the BTS skytrain system and will  continue to use it whenever I visit Bangkok

title: If you want to avoid Bangkok traffic and you are traveling light ,this is the way to go
review: I booked my stay in Bkk near the MRT so that I could avoid traffic and use this line From Asoke it was one station to makasan and a 5 minute walk to the connecting Airport linkwith clear signs to show you the way From Asoke to the airport including the change of lines took me 35 minutes I only had one bag with me making things a lot easier but I did see some people with more luggage although I would imagine that might make the trip less apealing It also costs a fraction of what a taxi would charge I paid a total of 50 baht

title: Overnight train is worth it! + a few hints / things to take
review: We weren’t on a back packer style holiday but we were recommend to give the overnight train a go for the experience and we didn't regret it It was a really comfortable journey and something I've never done before   Upon booking our tickets to my dismay first class was sold out so we had to travel second class however once on the train the only real difference I could see between the two classes was with first class you got your own room whereas with second an open carriage I would certainly recommend giving the overnight train ago however I would recommend the following 1)	Assuming you’re traveling with a friend make sure you book the same top & bottom bunk – or two bottom bunks – if you get two top bunks once the beds are made (which is the majority of the journey) you won’t have access to a window unless you make friends with someone on a bottom bunk 2)	Book a bunk in the middle of the carriage – the ends of the carriage are a lot more nosy as you can hear the bathroom door opening & closing and the train carriage couplings 3)	Take ear plugs – its not the quietest train ride I didn’t have ear plugs and really wished I did  If you do this you’ll have a really pleasant journey and an experience to add to the list  Oh  one last thing we ordered the dinner on the train and we’re pleasantly surprised at how good the food was

title: Great way to get aroung Bangkok
review: The skytrain is a quick convenient and cheap way of getting around Bangkok An all day pass is only 130thb giving unlimited use between 600am to midnight   We always get great use of the Skytrain  and with Bangkok having daily traffic chaos could not imagine travelling to Bangkok without using the Skytrain

title: Good way to get to the airport
review: Caught an evening train from Phayathai station to the airport Even though I got on at the terminus I had to stand the whole way because there is limited seating  they allow a lot of space for airport passengers to take luggage I suppose It takes only about 30 minutes I think so no big deal The fare is quite cheap  only 45 baht so good value A little tip for people planning to catch a plane  take the elevator up Otherwise it's a long walk

title: Great service
review: travelled on BTS few times and very easy to travel on and wonderful connections to almost all parts of Bangkok Price is reasonable also

title: Quick, cheap and customer friendly
review: Very convenient Saves time (faster than cabs drives or buses) Saves money  Had to reach Sukhumvit Go up on the ARL at the airport Takes about 10min to reach the platform from the departures (2 levels) Another 2min to buy the ticket And only 30min and 35 Baht to reach Makassan From here on one needs to change over to the subway (Bridge to Phetchaburi Stn) and next stop is Sukhumvit (16 Baht) The cab would have charged ATLEAST 500 Bath and taken about 1015min more   The trains are clean superfast Enough space for you and your luggage User friendly Language is never an issue Can buy tickets using Ticket machines (in English) or head to the ticket office

title: An adventure on its own
review: We used this traspo for easy access to BKK Really crowded and cheap and can get you around Beware of pickpockets they are all around and you travel shoulder to shoulder most of the time

title: Fast & efficient
review: I first used the MRT Blue Line when it was opened more than 10 years ago Have used it every time I visit Bangkok  This year I took the aging MRT Blue Line (underground) and changed to the new Purple Line (above the ground) at Tao Poon Station  In June 2018 they didn't set up new ticket machines yet so to go to Purple Line I bought the ticket with the staff They are all very friendly On my way back I forgot to use the new ticket machines of Purple Line so I don't know how they look  Don't buy separate tickets just buy 1 for the station you need to reach  They have a website you can know which station you need to stop and how much

title: Impressive
review: I didnt know that take a train to anywhere to the city was so good clean and confortableits cheap and safeYou can take from whre you are and go wherever u feel like

title: cheap and fast
review: stable timetable and get you to airport without traffic jam problem the fare is much cheaper than taxi which only cost you about 45 baht from city to airport but most of the BTS stations not with elevator so you may need to carry luggage up and down by your own hope this would be improve later on

title: Convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: To avoid the traffic jam my friend Suren took me to his favorite watering hole by train  Though we don’t understand Thai language or script we still manage to pay the correct fare and ticket  Good and clean BTS train cabins Stations feel safe enough Frequency of service not as high as MRTs in major cities like Hong Kong and Japan

title: Best form of transport.
review: Use  it  if  you  need  to  get  around town  and  forget  the  taxi   that's  always  stuck  in  traffic  Easy to use Not to worry

title: My ride on the BTS
review: I like the BTS the maps are good it took me awhile to get my bearings gas and where I wanted to go The staff are helpful even you can ask ant Security personnel for help

title: Great way to get around
review: Very clean regular service Good to see Bangkok from above out of the crowds Also worth using the pedestrian walkways

title: It is easy and convenient
review: From Suvarnabhumi airport with airport rail it is so convenient and away from the traffic jammed The sign to get to the rail also easy

title: More improvement
review: I visited Bangkok again (after two years) found that BTS has improved a lot in getting people to use it (it is pretty crowded nowadays) Now to use the train it is paper ticket and can easily buy at the window and the machine that leaves rooms for nonfrequent users and tourists a quick way to buy from windows  Using BTS is th best way to stay in the heart of BKK esfpecially with when combining the use of because Airport Link It also lessens the use  of taxi especially in the conjested area of Bangkok Great job Bangkok  Hope they find the way to link with the subway rather than having to get out of subway (or BTS) to connect to one another

title: Quick way to get around
review: The BTS is a very convenience and cheap way to get around the center of Bangkok The waiting time is around 3 minutes and there are links to the MRT railway service which is actually cheaper

title: BREEZE THROUGH BANGKOK
review: The BTS in Bangkok is the fastest  safest  and the most comfortable way to travel within Bangkok  Dont bother looking for a cab  You will only crawl in traffic  no matter what time of the day or place it is Most places to visit are comfortably covered by the BTS network  And if youre staying long  get yourself a prepaid Rabbit card  You will avoid queues completely  which can be long at times  So  breeze through Bangkok on the BTS

title: Fast and efficient
review: By far the best way to get around Bangkok notorious for road congestion 140 baht a day also makes it one of the cheapest metro in the world  Stations are 23 minutes apart which is great in temperatures of 40+ and it only costs 1baht per trip

title: Easy to use
review: Very new and clean  Ride cost depends on how long you ride the train  People in ticket windows do not sell you tickets just give you change to use the machines which I thought was weird

title: Easy and chip access to anywhere
review: I used several times BTS it was very chip and easy to connect famous places including lots of shopping mall You can buy ticket on vending machine very easy Free for kids under 100 cm Very cool inside and very kind passenger for kids

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Plan your stay to be near the sky train and you can easily visit multiple parts of the city for very little money Clean safe sometimes jam packed

title: A MUST - The experience is out of this world
review: I have done many activities throughout the world but nothing compares to this experience It was amazing And what made it even more special was our tour guide “Natty” Natty is incredible and so kind I feel more connected to Bangkok because of this tour and Natty You will not regret this life changing experience

title: Fast, cheap and efficient !
review: Great way to come and go to main international airport Easy connection with MRT subway and BTS Sky train

title: A great way to see Bangkok
review: Easy to navigate and cheaper than travelling on the London Underground It took us to all the places we wanted to see whilst sightseeing around the city

title: Overnight train Bangkok to Chiang Mai - excellent!
review: We took the overnight sleeper service from Hua Lamphong station in Bangkok in a 1st class sleeper arriving in Chiang Mai the next day What a service  Comfortable cabin smooth ride quiet air conditioning not too fierce and great views when it was daylight  A smashing way to travel to the north of the country and reasonable price too  Would recommend every time

title: Great service
review: MRT works great easy to move around You pay according to the distance or station you are going to at the token machines and use the same token to enter and exit Great AC for hot days

title: Easy Bangkok travel
review: When you are tired of sitting stuck in traffic I recommend to use Skytrain (or the Metro if that is applicable) It is easy much quicker during rush hour and very cheap

title: Clean and efficient....a major consideration to avoid jams.
review: This efficient transport is very clean and organised  If you know which stations to board and alight it can become your transportation mainstay during your stay in Bangkok  While taking a cab would have given you your private time Bangkok traffic is notoriously jammed up    One major gripe you don't get escalators everywhere so it can be very daunting for the elderly to climb 3 storeys up to the boarding platform  It was an issue 8 years ago and it still is  I have seen some escalators installed at major stations like Siam and Mo Chit  Some escalators however are too far to walk to    Heard an interesting story that the people actually lodged a court case to get these escalators installed

title: This is a great service but slow
review: Love the airport link I took it for the first time this week Waited a bit for the train but it came eventually Took me right to Makkasan then a walk to MRT then that train to Lumphini about 1 hour from airport to hotel in Sathorn What a great service inexpensive way to get to the city center Better than dealing the ripoff thieving taxi's and BKK's irritating traffic   There is quite a bit of walking to get to the rail express from arrivals and the walk from Makkasan to the MRT is a bit of jaunt but not too bad overall I only had carryon luggage so if I had full luggage it may be more arduous but still doable  it's the savings that make the journey worthwhile

title: It makes city life a little better
review: Well admit itit's not the best mean of transportation compare to the rest of other big cities However it makes your life a little easier when you travel in Bangkok CBD The expansion of BTS to more residential areas is not quite beneficial for travelers unless you want to explore different parts of the city

title: Nice and cool but nothing amazing
review: I liked the sky train it was good and functional and the aircon a relief from the heat But it’s nothing special as a thing to do unless you are trying to get somewhere

title: Convenient Way to get around
review: We only used the Skytrain a few times but each time it was efficient clean and wellairconditioned Rush hours and weekends are more busy

title: Awful
review: If you're claustrophobic forget this mode of transport it's always packed with very little space for anyone Getting a seat is rare at any time of the day It is clean and air conditioned just unbelievably crowded I know I unfortunately have to use it everyday or risk using other forms of transport and getting stuck in Bangkoks very famous traffic jams

title: Easy, Cheap & Fast
review: If you do not have too much baggage is a good choice to use the Airport Rail Link  Good connection with BTS or MRT to your destination

title: Efficient, clean, cheap
review: It's embarrassing coming from England seeing how other countries run their underground systems  Everywhere is spotlessly clean the trains are quick and everyone knows how to queue sensibly and politely

title: Good way to get around
review: Things have improved tremendously compared to 20 years ago Now they have escalator and lifts access in most places However it may still not be the most convenient option for the physically impaired as stairs is still the main mode of access   Can get really crowded during peak periods   Get a rabbit card for ease of movement

title: Nice way to get around
review: It was the cheapest way to get around Bangkok Avoid the rushour and you are good to go   Easy way to book tickets and stations at major places

title: Super
review: Fantastic experience made all the better from some amazing hosts knowledgeable friendly and fun to be around our day was perfect from start to finish

title: Cheap but poorly located.
review: We were staying in a hotel not far from its terminus but for those who aren't you have to alight and catch the local train into Bangkok OK for us as it was fast clean spacious and cheap but very empty

title: Tammy! The best in Bangkok!
review: You must do this tour you will Be in the best spot to be in the train Always ask to book with Tammy she will give you nice tips to visit Bangkok

title: Needed transport and reliable
review: Reliable transport from city centre and not very expensive  Still  this is very full  make sure u board at the starting station (Phaya Thai) if u plan to go to the aiport otherwise u might not be able to board the train

title: Get around "in no time"
review: The absolute best way to get around Bangkok city centre is to take the Skytrain It is easy and very convenient and offers service every 3rd minute or so The price is reasonable and some may say it's cheap  Try to avoid the skytrain between 07000900 1200 1400 17001900 and 21002200 as it'll probably be crowded with locals going tofrom work lunch school etc Recommend you to buy a Skytrain card to avoid queues at the ticket counter or the self service machines You need 5 10 bath coins for the self service

title: Great way to get to the airport
review: I liked the convience of it and use it through links from BTS I wish it was all the same so I could use my Rabbit Card Always timely and clean

title: Easy and safe ride in BKK
review: Free ride for one station  On time  Clean and air conditioning  Safe ride  Cheap and quick to move in Bangkok where traffic is big issue

title: Floating Market at best
review: Sara’s enchanting personality made the activity even better Her English was  great and that made receving new information easier She also shared nice stories among the facts The boat ride and the market was absolutely stunning

title: Hands-down the best way to get around BKK
review: Clean safe economical  Better yet no parking or haggling with cabbies (though I really enjoy a tuktuk ride from time to time)

title: Good Transportation
review: Skytrain in bangkok is one of the best and easy to move around with The only downside is too may stairway to climb before you reach the station as not all station has escalator from gound to ticket counter

title: Fast and needs service
review: BTS is a budget transport system that provides fast and reliable service will connect to major renowned places and shopping malls in Bangkok City

title: Very efficient and easy to use
review: This is a great way to travel in Bangkok I used cash and that was a little hassle because you have to buy one ticket at a time and some stations only accept coins However it looks like you should use the Rabbit card for this a trick I missed That being said this is still a pretty great experience and service

title: Family tour
review: A great way to travel in Bangkok  Although it's a shame that you cannot see Bangkok as you travel due to the advertising boards and sun barriers

title: Best way to get around Bangkok in the day
review: Cheap clean and efficient perfect way to get around Bangkok especially during the day as by taxi you'll be sat in traffic jams on a Tuk Tuk you could end up all over the place whilst they try to collect fuel vouchers from shops by taking you there and on a motorbike taxi good luck as they don't seem to realise that your knees stick out more than their handle bars

title: Mode of transportation
review: Mrt is a recommended mode of transportation to get to and fro in Bangkok It's an easy and fast way to get aroundtraffic in Bkk can be a nightmare so please dont be timid to use the Mrt One factor that stood out for me was that people actually queue up to board Which this can be practise throughout the world

title: Cheap & convenient way to travel
review: The Airport Rail Link is the most economical & convenient way to travel tofrom the airport to anywhere in the Bangkok city It offers ease & beats the traffic in peak hours The fares are also reasonable as compared to the other modes of commute in the city

title: Easy transportation in Bangkok
review: We traveled several times on the Skytrain We found that it was clean efficient and not difficult to use We got some help the first time and after that it was a snap

title: MRT from bkk airport to Sukhumvit
review: Works well I’ve not tried the skytrain on this run yet there was a stage where you needed to drag your bags between trains

title: Great Time Saver
review: Very well connectivity & frequency One day pass available at affordable price BTS is best solution to avoid Bangkok Traffic Anywhere you can reach in 10 to 15 minutes

title: Easiest way to get around
review: Easiest way to go around the city it takes you easily to main city sights Air conditioning is great as it reliefs you for a couple of minutes from the scoarching hot weather No worries fir tourists as all announcements are made in thai and english same happening for all tran and station signs To buy tickets you'll need coins money is regularly changed at the ticket office Buying tickets only on the machines Select your fare according to the station you're heading to Even during rush hour people are very respectful waiting in line to get into the train so nothing to worry

title: Efficient, fast, clean
review: Modern transport to avoid the traffic gridlock on Bangkok roads If you stay for 3 days or more best to buy a rabbit card that's a reloadable fare wallet that saves you a lot of time bypassing the crowded ticket machines It also offers benefits with a lot of merchants including McDonald's

title: It's convenient.
review: Somehow it's convenient especially if you are travelling solo or there's just two of you The fare is reasonable airport to phaya thai bts station is just 45thb compared to a taxi fare that might cost you 200300thb It was not that crowded when I tried it maybe because it was songkran week well let me check how it operates on normal working days

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok - wish it was a larger system
review: Clean prompt efficientif you're traveling along Sukhumvit or Silom it's the best way to stay cool and avoid the crazy city traffic The pricing is quite modest and you can switch between lines or connect to the MRT (another great way to travel) It would be even better if both systems used the same payment system but for now you use different cards or tokens for MRT and BTS

title: More efficient than SMRT
review: Better and more reliable than SMRT Train master make their stand by blowing on whistle loudly Passengers are cooperative No delays like 1st world country

title: Quickest way to get into Bangkok central
review: Very smooth and quick way for getting into Bangkok  You have to buy your ticket from machines at the airport though thai people are super helpful

title: Fast and convenient
review: Trains are modern fast efficient and very regular The best way to avoid the heavy traffic on the roads You can scoot from one end of Bangkok to other in no time The network of Skytrain is well integrated with the metro and many of the key malls can be accessed directly from the Skytrain station

title: clean n cool......
review: very clean cool inexpensiveconnects to most placecan get crowded at peak timesits best to buy a pass rather than wait in line to buy a ticket for each journey

title: Great cheap way to go to the City
review: Normally I take a taxi to the City But this time I traveled light so I decided to take the Airport Rail Link The service was quite good Fast and cheap But there were many things that could have been improved  First of all once the train arrived passengers were told not to enter until the security check (and cleaning) was done But the doors were left open and when the check was complete there was no annoucement or sign that passengers could enter Secondly and more importantly once passengers arrived at the final destination there was only 1 (one) elevators and no escalator going down I didn't want to wait so I decided to walk down Quite a big mistake since the stairs were not made with passengers carrying luggage in mind Actually I saw a few escalators but all were for going up to the station The court in Thailand rendered a judgment some time ago that all stations had to have access for disabled persons But as far as I can see that would not be realized in the near future

title: Getting around in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around Bangkok Traffic is pretty bad and trains are fast clean and very economical

title: Great way to get about
review: Great way t get about once we worked out how to get tickets But easy and felt safe to use Much easier thank the roads

title: It was incredible!
review: Madame Sara is AMAZING  She has such a positive energy and vibe  She is so caring and sweet The whole day has been a treat 🥰❤️  The Driver (Mr Bank) is such a great person as well They are both so welcoming and warm ❤️

title: Easily navigated and fast
review: The trains like subways and trains in any large city are easy to use and fast They're clean and efficient and even nonThaispeaking people like myself have no problems using their trainmaps to get where we want to go

title: best deal

title: Great value for money
review: A great day out well organised and fun  The tour guide Tom was excellent great value for money and user friendly

title: Efficient and safe travelling
review: To beat the traffic jam of Bangkok Sky train is a very safe and efficient way of traveling The trains are also very clean

title: Absolutely the BEST way to and from the airport
review: We have been using Bangkok as our home base for two months as we travel around Asia  This means a lot of trips to and from BKK  We purposefully stay one stop from Phaya Thai BTS (SkyTrain Station) as it is the last stop on the Airport Rail Link  This has worked out marvelously  We skip all the notorious Bangkok traffic and drive at the airport approximately 35 minutes after leaving our hotel night or day    Having come in and out of Bangkok several different ways over the years (limo tax minibus and train) I can say this is the fastest way into central Bangkok  And at 45 Baht ($135 USD) each way it's a GREAT VALUE

title: Easy; Efficient; Economical; Fast!
review: What a joy to use the BTS Skytrain  Easy efficient economical and fast we had no problems navigating from the Chao Phraya River to Sathorn Bridge Pier (Central Pier) which is located on ground level under the Saphan Taksin Skytrain Station  We took the Skytrain to the final stop National Stadium where we had a short walk to visit The Jim Thompson House  So convenient both directions with ample trains and short waits

title: easy
review: clean cheap and convenient  costs about 45baht a person (a little over $3) and runs every 10 minutes or so between 6am and midnight

title: So easy
review: Either the fast link or the slightly slower link this is such an easy way to get tofrom the centre and so affordable Tip study the skytrain map to avoid confusion after a long flight You'll need coins for the skytrain tickets which can be exchanged at a separate booth

title: Clean, safe and efficient
review: Lots of stairs No escalators at the several stations we used Fast and inexpensive way to get around Taxis very slow due to traffic congestion seven days a week

title: Really easy to use and the air conditioning is a joy!
review: If you want to get between the main commercial areas this is the way to do it Each station has a ticket booth and machines If you are going to do more than 3 journeys in a day it's worth getting a day pass  something like £250 per day  There are some areas of the city (flower market some temples etc) that you can't get to by sky train but the best thing to do there is get down to the river and pick up the tourist boat which serves these areas very well Air conditioning is bliss Does get busy during the rush hour but that is easy to avoid Final warning you are not allowed on the train with a coffee (or even through the gates to the platform) You will get stopped

title: Easy to use
review: Getting around the city is easy with the sky train Cheap and cheerful very clean and staff will help you if you get lost or stuck An easy want to travel in Bangkok

title: Easy to find in basement of airport down 2 floors escalator
review: Great easy service Down the escalator City line ( Blue ) cheap but slower than the express and a little hotter 35BAHT to Makkasan about 30 minutes Buy ticket in English tap on station you want and it shows you the priceput your coins notes in( Gives change )I was told there was an easy number 556 bus straight to KhaoSan Road from outside Makkasan station but in reality there wasn't and just a busy dusty main road with only one bus stop which was difficult to find in the heat then displaying no bus numbersBut easy to flag down a green and yellow taxi 100 Baht to KhaoSan from here so all goodI did notice an MRT metro link sign from the walkway at Makkasan station though

title: clean, fast and easy
review: It was a little annoying to have to get change from the ticket window and then use it at the machine but it worked out fine (and there were no lines when we went just after 9 am) The train was fast (to arrive and along the route) clean (as you aren't allowed to eat or drink) and easy to navigate (with many maps int he station to help you figure out where to go and which platform to be on)

title: Clean and good enough

title: Lovely way to reach the city and airport

title: Best & fastest way to get around

title: The Easiest & Convenient Way.
review: We find the City Line as the most convenient way to commute between Suvarnabhumi Airport and the city center We were staying close to National Stadium BTS station so we get down at Payathai Station They charge you 45 THB per person which is cheap When you exit from the airport after picking up your luggage turn right and at the end you will find the elevator to go down to train link station One more thing to all travelers there is one money exchange right next to train ticketing counter exchange your money here they have the best rate on the airport DO NOT exchange anywhere at the airport Also there is small counter next to money exchange where you can get very cheap mobile sim (with datavoice) package I got one sim with voicedata package unlimited for 7days for only 150 THB We were in Bangkok & Phuket and trust me we didn't face any problem anywhere

title: Cheapest way to airport
review: I use this every time traveling to Suwannapoom airport  Never have a problem  The train run usually every 15 minute interval from 6am to almost before midnite I guess   Just be careful that it can be very crowded during rush hour because many local commuters also use the train to various stops before the airports   I usually jump on Ratchaprarop station and within half an hour the train reaches the airport at price of 40 Baht which is unbeatable  Normally taxi from city centre will cost you 300 Baht to the airport   The only complaint is that the connections to skytrain and other public transport are not convenient  But as a local I don't hv much problem    So if you are budget traveller this is difinitely the best choice to airport

title: Clean and fast
review: It's probably the fastest way of transportation in Bangkok The bts is clean and modern Easy to use and pretty fast compared to a cab

title: QUICK EASY Often CROWDED, the only way to get around other than boat
review: YOU CAN GET MANY CENTRAL PLACES USING THE SKYTRAIN AND CONNECTING TRAIN SYSTEMS (BOTH AIRPORTS SOON too) Firstly Thai Baht cash is king so have plenty in 20 and 50 and plenty of those pesky coins come in handy here Most one way rides you take will cost between 35 and 50+ baht per person Firstly know the name of the station you want to get off at You'd be amazed how many people stand in queues staring at the train map trying to work out which station to go to There are 3 ways to get tickets to get through the auto turnstiles 1 manned booth who sometimes give you tickets sometimes change only 2 Coin machine (smaller machine)   you pick the destination station which shows the baht amount (eg  42 ) press button for 42 then feed in coins to suit the amount as close as possible  ( change &) ticket comes out in lower tray 3Note machine (bigger machine) pick your destination as before  carefully feed in note (50 &100 baht best) change and ticket falls into tray So now to the entry turn stiles slot the ticket in the correct way has an arrow Proceed to platforms Make sure you know the end of the line station name for the direction you are going in as often 1 platform services several destinations and both ends of a line There are simple to read rail maps everywhere on walls including the ticket machines take the stair escalator lift to the platform which has the last station of the line of your destination name  So you are on the right platform now the incoming trains display the last station of the line they are going to  so look out for it on inbound trains otherwise you may be heading off in the wrong direction Get on correct train each carriage will have a static or live lit up station sign above each doorway for you to be able to follow the trains progress and there is an announcement made of the next station to be arrived at in Thai and english ( that can be difficult to understand sometimes) Remember many trains going to different destinations interconnect at many points so be clear where you are getting on and off and where you are interchanging if necessary which is the case more often than not  If you are returning to the same starting point remember you are looking for the lines that go to the opposite end of the line  Usually your hotel concierge is helpful with which line etc Have fun getting around Bangkok with the traffic hassels

title: Bts cheap and fast
review: Super cheap transport and better than being stuck in bangkoks traffic Just make sure you have change to skip the ques

title: Nice and concern

title: Best way to travel to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Very convenient and cost effective way to travel to and from  Suvarnabhumi Airport The downside is that you need to buy separate tickets if you wish to transfer to skytrain or metro since the systems are not integrated

title: Best travel option in Bangkok
review: Sky train is the best option in Bangkok to avoid he traffic It save your time and money Sky train are available to most of the places

title: Fastest and cheapest way to the city from the airport
review: To avoid expensive taxi fares and monstrous traffic jams in traveling from Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok's city center it's advisable to go down to the lower level of the arrival area at the airport and take the Airportlink train  The Airportlink will bring you to Phayathai Station where you can take the BTS Skytrain to your destination within the city

title: most convenient way for getting to City from Airport
review: on our way back from Phuket we took the airport Rail link to the city and it was so convenient for $80 baht for two people we were able to reach city center near our hotel in 25 minutes   I got off Phloem chit station and walked reached my hotel in less than 10 minutes   i didn't realise the true value of rail link until last day when despite a bad feeling I took a taxi to the airport instead of rail link and it took me over 2 hours to reach the airport I almost missed my flight and was the last person to board the place   If you intend to travel from airport to city or from city to airport This is the best way for you to travel

title: Railway and floating market
review: Very beautiful and unforgetful experience with kind and smiling Sara leading the way  We went by train trough railway market having the firsthand view from train to market It was awsome Floating market was also one in the lifetime experience going by boat and seeing all the shops on sideboats We are wery satisfied and we recommend everyone to experience this tour

title: Very convenient
review: Nice and clean trains can be very busy a little confusing at first but once you managed to get the directions right travelling is a breeze Great for beating the traffic jams

title: Floating market is a must see
review: The railway market was cool but our highlight was the floating market  The tour guide Russia was amazing  It's a bit of a drive to get to the markets but it was one of our highlights while in Bangkok

title: Great nights sleep considering it's a moving train!!
review: We got a class 2 ticket for the sleeper train to Chiang Mai 2 of us had bottom bunks while another girl I am with had he topmake sure to ask for a bottom bed when buying your ticket Plenty of storage on shelf above bed (I had a 65l rucksack and it fitted perfectly   The bed itself was decent size and reasonably comfortable with a fresh cover for you to use although it was roasting and you probably won't need this   The toilets are pretty grotty but there's been worse in some of the barsrestaurants I've visited   Would definitely use this sleeper train service again

title: A great introduction to the wonders of Bangkok!
review: An efficient mode to get into the heart of the city this was a simple and inexpensive and very efficient way to travel into the city of Bangkok Great to get some insights on the land the people and the customs too

title: Great Way to Enjoy Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain is the Great way to explore Bangkok without the hassle of traffic jam and suspicious taxi drivers   The trains are clean and cool in Bangkok’s hot weather Walk along the elevated walkway between BTS stations are also comfortable and great way to explore Bangkok main shopping area  Get a Rabbit BTS card so as to save time on queueing at vending machines or ticket office Recommend to have 200baht value for a 4 days trip for regular user  Avoid peak hours rush where possible

title: Efficient !
review: The Sky train proved to be an excellent choice for going to the shopping district It’s quick and efficient and proved to be the most convenient way to the shopping malls and one is able to avoid the congested traffic

title: An easy way to the airport
review: You could take a cab to the airport but if you don't have a lot of luggage the rail link is an easy option For about $150 the train goes from central Bangkok directly (with very few stops) to the airport It is both cheap and efficient However it is not meant for people with tons of luggage

title: Good!
review: BTS Skytrain helped me very much Cheaper and save my time Just pay a litter bit money but you can go all the city Good job

title: The fastest and cheapest  way from Suvarnabhumi Airport  to the city and  around Bangkok
review: If you are short on time and budget but want to have a city tour of Bangkok the skytrain is the way to go

title: Very convenient and cheap way to travel around Bangkok City
review: If you are visiting Bangkok for at least 3 days I would encourage buying the Rabbit Card where you can top it up when the value is low  Saves time from queuing to purchase the single trip tickets  You also get a small rebate from each train ride with the Rabbit Card  Just be prepared to use the stairs a lot as escalators are not available at every side of the stations

title: convenient but limited and expensive
review: Taxi in Thailand is very inexpensive but very unpredictable so that makes going along the BTS (Skytrain) a better option  although it is considered expensive for the country like Thailand  even their capital city Taxi is cheaper if you have 2 or more people traveling together for just 23 stops but to get a taxi you need sort of patience   The BTS is well maintained relatively clean and good thing about Thai are they are in generally clean and they all keep of good personal space and they always set the aircondition 35 degree C less that what it should be  so overall the ride is comfortable and each stop is quite close to each other and on the main line you get to access to many places (tourist places  shopping malls) easy  My first option to travel in Bangkok The only draw back is the toll system is very strange and ancient get a "Rabbit" prepaid car (refillable) is the best way

title: Easy to use
review: very easy to use and understand the map system very cheap journeys very clean trains regular trains didnt have to wait long

title: Awesome experience
review: This is probably the most vibrant place I have visited in a long time  The daily hustle and bustle of vendors is energizing  It’s a must to wait until  the train passes
