review: I don’t normally do these but these guys were great Easy to get along with flexible  and showed us what we wanted to see and then some At the time it was pretty hard to find someone who did both hellfire pass and the bridge over the river Kwai so the price may be considered a little high for some For me it was a pay for what you get thing Limo all day with a knowledgeable guide could not fault the service It’s a huge day taking 1214 hours  Highly recommend it though

title: BTS
review: Best way to travel They run every few minutes and take you to most of the best areas

title: Cheap Travel
review: Cheapest and quickest way to get into the city Very easy to use Gets a bit crowded at peak times especially if you have luggage but worth the squash Its not for long as the locals get off out of the tourist areas There is a non stop train much quicker and one that stops (cheaper) We took the train that stops as the route meant we didn't have to swop trains with all our luggage If you don't have luggage think the non stop will be a lot quieter and a better option

title: Super easy to navigate
review: You don't find too many things which are easy to use in Thailand for Englishonly speakers But the BTS is one of them Every stop is announced with many trains even complete with a light up map showing you where exactly you are Great system easy to use and you can't beat the price  Don't be afraid of it try it out Besides on a single rail line what's the worst that could happen

title: express rail
review: easy fast brilliant very clean  what ever did we do before if the route is what you need then wouldnt ever get a taxi again

title: Good services
review: Really helpful for travelling from one place to another   We enjoyed the ride from Nana station to asok

title: Very Convenient
review: The traffic in bangkok is just creasy much worse than in Paris Bts or mrt is very practical to go from one point to another one Very quick and not expensive

title: A day of fun!
review: Great fun tour which we really enjoyed Lucky was our guide and added to the fun  Great lunch at a reasonable cost too Thank you Lucky and driver

title: Great views
review: I love the Skytrain The views are amazing I've only been to places where the metro is underground but having it up in the air is sooo much fun The air conditioning is pretty strong and you might been chilly a scarf would be helpful if you're not used to AC or too sensitive The maps are pretty self explanatory but people are always eager to help if you need it A very nice experience

title: A ride on the Death Railway
review: The recommended tour covers visits to the Kanchanaburi Railway Centre and War Cemetery the Bridge over the River Kwai and finally a ride on the infamous railway where the journey starts up country and finishes an hour later at the Bridge over the River Kwai

title: Great way to travel
review: I use the BTS almost everyday Best way to get around much of Bangkok Add in the Airport Link and MRT and you can travel around most of Bangkok without having to deal with taxis or traffic

title: best, safe and economical traveling option in Thailand
review: The vey best safe and economical traveling option in Thailand Train starts from airport itself I paid only 40 THB to my hotel if I catch a taxi they charge me around 600 THB to reach the destination ARL starts from early morning till midnight Best option

title: First metro in Bangkok
review: It was my first train in Bangkok is airport rail link which quickest way to go to city We have been this rail and good experience

title: Highly recommended
review: The BTS the Metro (MRT) and the river and khlong commuter boats are all easy to use fast and cheap None of them get stuck in traffic either The staff are very helpful

title: Awesome!
review: Thank god for air con Ticket machines are much easier to use than previous years Prices are decent and trains are frequent Fast way to get round the city

title: A Good Way to see the countryside !
review: While in Bangkok we booked on a local train to go to Kanchanaburi to see the bridge over the river Kwai  The ride is about 2  2 12 hours from Thonburi station The trains are old and VERY basicnot built for comfort but it is a good way to see the countryside around Bangkok The fare was very cheap 200 Baht for the 2 of us We spent a few hours in Kancanaburi before taking the return trip to Thonburi Stationa bit longer ride this time The train is a great way to go to many smaller towns from Bangkok  The ride  however  is not the most comfortablebut bearable

title: Great way to travel
review: The Sky train made it really easy for us to travel from our hotel to the airport It cost us only 80 THB to get to the airport where taxi's usually charge over 300 THB

title: Avoid the traffic
review: This was our first visit to Bangkok We were warned by many friends NOT to take a taxi to the center of town particularly during rush hours Thankfully we heeded the warnings The trip to the center of the city takes about 20 minutes One can take along all their luggage Our cost to travel one way was about 45 Bhat Once we got off the train  we took our luggage to the street level and got a taxi easily to the hotel

title: Fast, easy
review: Fast easy & reliable way of getting about Fairly easy to figure out and navigate My Preferred way of traveling round the city

title: great way to get around
review: it is a perfect way to get around avoiding loads of pollution and traffic issues a bit chilly so I had to have a sweater

title: good service
review: Can get very busy at times but its clean fast and cheap travel and takes you right into the airport

title: Good way to avoid traffic and high taxi fares
review: If you are in touristic places like MBK or SIam Paragon the local drivers waiting will not accept taking you anywhere with the meter You have to walk away from this places and stop a taxi OR take public buses which can be a bit complicated since there is so many or underground or last but not least the Skytrain Skytrain does surely not connect all areas and is also not the cheapest way to get around but it is also not expensive You get to see a lot and get an overview over most points of interest in bangkok Take a Tuk Tuk or a meter taxi to get from kytrain station to your final destination

title: Easy if you have Google maps
review: Easy enough to get around  Found using Google maps helped us tremendously  I feel it's almost easier then my commuter train in ChicagoIL in America

title: Very economical service
review: Great service and price to travel around Bangkok Is very busy but you soon get used to that Get a day pass

title: Skytrain saves time
review: Do not worry about the language when planning to use the skytrain It is very easy and all instructions and notices easy to read in English language

title: Fast way to get around Bangkok.
review: Cheap and fast Limited routes so useful only if start and destination are near a stop  Fully air conditioned Cellphones work throughout the network  Have change or small notes to but a ticket  average journey is around 50 baht

title: Convenient!
review: The easiest and fastest way to get to the city The trains are clean Proper signage are displayed for our convenience I would recommend you to take the train rather than be stuck on traffic

title: Excellent shipping
review: The perfect way to get from the airport to Entrance of the city It runs often quickly the price is affordable the ticket purchase and the transport itself are convenient

title: Best way into town
review: Low cost easy convenient Best way into town from BKK Staff are helpful You get a nice view of the city on the way in

title: Economical mean of travel
review: We took a train fro Asoke to Thailand Cultural Centre Very clean fast and economical mode of travel

title: Part of Bangkok's Mass Transit
review: If you are touring on your own  or even some walking tours will use this above ground train system to move around  Easy to use

title: Ticketing system is a pain
review: Living in Moscow I get quite spoiled when it comes to the fluidity of public transport especially with the metro being all interconnected and the same ticket to be used for buses trams and metro Bangkok is unfortunately a different story with many different metro and skytrain lines and change The ticketing system is just annoying you have to see your fare on a map then pay the right amount of money to the ticket machine Not much information provided from the info office they only change your banknotes for coins to be used at the machine The trains are clean and new that's a good thing Just have a cardigan or a shawl ready they are air conditioned to the level of fridge

title: Train to city
review: After we ride a boat for us to able to rich the city we decided to experience the BTS transpo and its very convenient to us who had a short stay in bangkok and with limited time coz bangkok im is a busy traffic city Overall its fast and comfortable

title: Absolute saviour to beat traffic
review: It's an absolute saviour to beat traffic in Bangkok City The BTS or commonly referred to Sky Train a major conduit to get around the esp along Sukhumvit  If you're a regular user of BTS as my friend is recommend that getting a rabbit card is convenient and collect reward points

title: Take a taxi if you have large bags
review: The days that I used the Bangkok Rail Link from Phaya Thai station and later from the airport  there were no real people to buy tokens for the train  only machines only for a token now  no personal service  this is unacceptable and requires that you have small money it is also confusing to many  so takes a long time to wait for perplexed customers Station staff  slow and bad customer service Don’t use it from Bangkok to airport especially if you have bags  I later took the train from the airport to Bangkok and it was fine Totally over crowded with local commuters Packed like sardines on the train If you do use it get on at the end of the line Phaya Thai there will be no room elsewhere it is OK if you get on at the airport If you have big bags  get a taxi to the airport

title: Convenient but too cold and busy
review: I live in Bkk and sometime I use this transportation  The BTS is definitely the best choice in Bangkok as it's fastgo in the main attraction points of the city and its not too expensiveif you travel alone But the aircondition is crazily strong and have MANY people Thai and Foreigners The MRT is better can buy the ticket in a machine with notes and have less people

title: BTS is the most convenient mode of transport
review: Without a doubt BTS is the most efficient and time effective mode of transport in BKK Notorious for its traffic jam I will strongly recommend tourists to consider BTS which is often strategically linked to key places of interests

title: Transport
review: Not going to write 200 characters on Skytrain  Great way to travel around  Air cond and stable price using this plus the river transport best way to get around Bangkok

title: Great way to get anout
review: Get a all day ticket for 140 baht best value to do this It's very easy to get about good diagrams to show the routes  It feels safe but can get crowded

title: A terrific servic
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok to avoid all the traffic jams that happen in this very busy city It is fast and the trains are regular and cover a huge area of Bangkok A great way to travel

title: Can't fault this service
review: I have used this on numerous occasions and it has always been punctual and accommodating I will continue to use this service every time I visit Bangkok

title: Clean and Smooth
review: It was wonderful experience travelling in bts train it is clean smooth and helps you to avoid traffic but staffs can't speak english

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS is a great way to get to many parts of Bangkoksafe clean inexpensive frequent trains and stops all signage and announcements in both Thai and English   The only thing to watch is during peak hour when the trains can get crowdedyou may have to wait for the next train at times but since they run every 3 minutes or so it's usually not an issue

title: Alternative transport in BKK
review: BTS Skytrain to travel around BKK city are comfortable fast and has AC BTS gets you to most places a tourist would need to go to but avoid the peak hours where it is very crowded you can barely breathe with all the bodies surrounding you

title: Very convenient public transportation, but avoid peak hours
review: Everytime we visit Bangkok we never miss taking their BTS public trains system although taxi is also not expensive but we always take BTS for it location all of our favourite shopping malls hotels and foods are just beside the BTS stations so never consider others always BTS when in Bangkok But but but do avoid during peak hours especially during lunch times 1130 to 1330 OR dinner times 1630 to 1900 you will probably have to wait for at least 2 rounds before you can go into the cabin So remember ya

title: Super easy to use
review: Only cost 45 baht to get into the city from the airport Easy to figure out with English options on the ticket machines

title: Recommended for traveller
review: I recommend this because is easy and fast from Airport going to heart of Bangkok this is the best unlike the Taxi cab it takes forever

title: Metro limited but quick
review: The Bangkok Metro is very limited in where it serves but does an excellent job of moving people to those locations  Be aware that it can be difficult to get a token during rush hour and be sure to have plenty of change and 20 baht notes  Otherwise very easy to use but you need to know about Bangkok or have a good map

title: Airport rail review
review: Direct train to  Phaya Thai bts station  When we were travelling no direct service available but it was not too bad half hour or so trip

title: Avoid the traffic jams
review: The ONLY way to travel in Bangkok to avoid being stuck in traffic The service is quite reliable but they should seriously considrer remove some of the many shops on teh stations and make more passengers gates

title: Amazing experience - just a couple of tips
review: We enjoyed an excellent tour with Mimi yesterday She was so attentive and helpful in every aspect of the tour Pointing out attractions and sites along the way to advising of where to visit or go for dinner for our remaining time in BKK   We organised the private tour option  the car was excellent clean and comfortable the driver superb   We went on a Monday so the floating market was a little quieter than usual and perhaps a few less traders  But the canals weren’t overrun by tour boats Definitely try to get the traditional paddle rather than the motor boats… it’s cleaner for the locals who live along the canals and definitely better environmentally (And no I’m not a big greenie or anything just an observation)

title: Need a better tour guide!
review: Itinerary was fine Would hope the tour guide be more professional by providing time schedules background of each places feel like on a shuttle bus trip No lunch provided BTW

title: Clean and convenient
review: If you want to avoid the traffic in Bangkok taking the BTS would be recommended We didn't have enough loose change so we had to go to the service counter It was efficient The BTS route map was simple to read It has English as well as Thai

title: Great way to get from A to B. Or C.
review: I just noticed that this is the number two thing to do in Bangkok on TripAdvisor Whilst I agree that it is very clean and efficient there are better things to do If you spent your whole day just riding around on the BTS you would be disappointed This would be like rating buses or trains in England as being a tourist attraction Well ok  maybe not   It does get very crowded especially around Siam Some stations don't have escalators or lifts Hell  I'm being picky We live in Bangna on the outskirts and it is such a quick and easy way to get into the middle of the city We use it often Cheap too  If you're in Bangkok for a while buy a rabbit card for 100thb It's like be an oyster card Quicker to keep it topped up than always having to use ticket machines The BTS does link up with the MRT rail system as well You can't use your rabbit card there yet but plans are afoot to make this possible   To summarise the BTS is one of the best public transport systems I have encountered Use it to go and see some of the many incredible sights in fabulous Bangkok It is currently being extended towards Ancient City It seems that the BTS will keep getting better

title: BTS route maps is much easier than most of the country.
review: one of the convenience transportation in Bangkok to avoid the heavy trafic jam The BTS is clean safe and cheap Would suggest you to buy a BTS card instead of 1 way ticket (for more than 45 days traveller  it may need to queue very long during peak hour) Prepare coins to purchase the ticket as well you able change the coins at the BTS control station as well

title: Quick & Easy. All Aboard
review: great way to get about bangkok cheap  easy  efficient  clean and best part of all airconditioned If your buying from machines they only accept coins  don't waste time queuing at machine if you have notes  go direct to counter to purchase tickets Ticket sales can be purchased station to stations  and or you can purchase daily ticket depending how frequent you will use service  No Sitting in traffic wasting time with BTS

title: Excellent, but...
review: The Sky Train is a fast reliable and inexpensive way to get around Bangkok and not least to get to the airport But to buy a ticket is too slow and oldfashioned  and during peak hours count om standing up

title: Fastest way around Bangkok
review: Visited Bangkok many times and the BTS is the fastest way to get you around Bangkok above the traffic snarls very cheap and convenient opens around 0600 until midnight Best to buy a Rabbit card which you can top up at anytime instead of waiting in line for single trip tickets Can get extremely crowded at lunch and peak times

title: Best transportation!!!
review: Reasonable price best transportation to use and helps in avoid the traffic I used almost all days as it serves my purpose can connect to airport link at Payathai MRTetc Trains are very frequent and clean

title: Clean safe easy
review: The skytrain is fast functional and easy access Much easier than taxi Suggest you get tourist day pass about $250 bat to get on anf off all day Train is colored coded lines so easy to manouver😄

title: Save on cab fare to Platinum Mall!
review: We had a few hours in BKK before we head to Koh Tao So we took the airport rail link to Ratchaprarop station (Which is nearest to Platinum Mall) and found our way to the shopping paradise The best part of it was walking past my favourite stall that sells beef kway tiao soup Getting down from the station turn to the right and walk straight down That will lead to Platinum Mall Btw the beef kway tiao stall is one of the first stalls you past by when you turn right from the station Its kinda like a shophouse You can smell the fragrant soup smell when walking by

title: Very Good
review: Very good service and runs timely Specially if you want reach within schedule time this is the best

title: All tourists
review: I advise against going All tourists and almost no locals It's not worth going Take the opportunity to visit less touristy areas

title: Great time on the train.
review: On time pick up from my hotel and return to MBK Our guide MrDui was excellent he was patient and friendly and gave us good local insights Wonderful time

title: Service
review: Using the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok is good efficient and cheap particularly during rush hours when finding a tubtuk or taxi difficult  It is airconditioned and the system is easy to navigate

title: Good for experience but not doing it twice
review: Floating market it’s really expensive trip Worth a try if you are more than 6 people Cost you 4200 for 1 boat Good experience if you haven’t eat a lot of street food and restaurant there

title: crowded, but polite and the fastest way around town
review: The BTS is a great way to get about Bangkok and while it doesn't get to all the places you might want to go definitely take it to the nearest station before you walk or grab a cab Fast clean and they come very often

title: Perfect way to get around
review: Cheap and nice way to get around Bankok Can be very crowded sometimes dough  You pay for how many stations you travel We went from Nana station to Sala Daeng station for 30bath each

title: Wish we hadn't bothered.
review: Heaving even by London underground standards and not at all frequent when we traveled in early evening

title: Clean and affordable
review: I've been on trains in many other developed countries and Bangkok's skytrain is at par with trainsMetro systems in Sydney Singapore Japan to name a few  It is convenient stations are located near major attractions   It is clean and safe for foreigners to travel solo and also very affordable

title: Beats those Bangkok traffic jams!
review: It's limited network for such a large city but the service provided is pretty good Combined with the BRT {Bus Rapid Transit()} and occasionally the Metro (underground) Skytrain is an effective alternative and even outside of peak hour is a good alternative to the very good and cheap taxis Fairly inexpensive by western standards but not cheap by Thai standards Avoid peak hours It's packed And you can wait for several trains before you can find room to squeeze on  and you'll have to squeeze Benefit is it's effectively air conditioned Within the limitations of the network it's a good transport system Skytrain to the the airport is also a good system depending on where you need to get to   can take you as long to get to your destination from the train station and taxis are not always easy to get from certain  stations so travel light Avoid it if you have a lot of luggage particularly in peak hours

title: Clean and efficient
review: Signage is sometimes confusing but very efficient  safe and clean Serve it's purpose to bring you from point A to point B ( please bring your own map with you

title: Maeklong Railway Market and Damnoensaduak Floating Market
review: Bangkok is an interesting city but there are also quite a lot of places to visit outside the city I was glad to book this tour Our tour guide Mr T did an excellent organization of the trip He was giving always information about the locations and tips for making good photos ) I wod defenetely recommend this tour to everyone visiting Bangkok

title: Its an Embarrassment
review: And airport link is such a good idea and anybody who ever landed or better even left from Hong Kong with their train knows how beautifully it could be  Unfortunately is Thailands' counterpart exactly the opposite   First the trains leave to the most odd times and the express runs only every 30 minutes Even more funny the express from Payathai that passes Makkasan (the main station) doesn't even bother to stop hence the long waits in between The if you actually take it form the airport and you arrive at Makkasan you first need to be lucky to get a taxi and if you do the taxi has only one way to leave the station And that way is not towards the city centre So you probably have to spend another 2060 minutes in the cap after getting out   I took it in total 3 times and every time it took me twice the time it would have take if I would have gone straight by cap And I live just 20 minutes walk away from the main station   Its an embarrassment for thailand and a pity for all tax payers

title: Easy mobility in Bangkok
review: Using BTS during my visit to Bangkok was really helpful for my mobility because it was fast cheap and air conditioned Congestion in Bangkok was very stressful especially during rush hour so using public transportation like BTS is highly suggested

title: Great way to get around, even without reading Thai
review: We "discovered" using the BTS Skytrain late in our trip after getting tired of "negotiating" with Tuk Tuk and Taxi drivers Why didn't we do this before For 120 baht you can get an allday pass and get around to all the major areas of Bangkok Next trip  we'll get a week pass

title: Make sure you know what you are doing!
review: We should have know better after several recent visits but we took the Makkasan Express from the Airport after being assured that there was an easy connection to the MRT  unlike previous years  However this is not so and we had to walk up and down lots of steps and negotiate a busy road with our luggage to get to Petchaburi MRT Station for our onward journey to Hau Lamphong Station  If you don't know Bangkok take a taxi on your first visit

title: Skytrain is fast and cheap
review: First time when I used skytrain is was my worst day ever because I got confused from where to go in and out from where to get a ticket and all these coins in my hand and destinations where I need to go made me crazy but on the second time it was easy however i could not stop asking people where and what and how However seems local people they do not know themself where and what because if I ask 3 person there will be 3 different answers Lol

title: Great way to get around
review: Great way to get around easy to use cheap clean safe Air conditioned and with English announcements and easy to understand maps great for all

title: Good, quick cheap but busy
review: It's very convenient quick and cheap But it was packed  Good air conditioning and overall really well run

title: Fast and efficient way to get around the city
review: The MRT is a fast and efficient way to get around the city  I found the system very easy to navigate and ticket machines in English made travel easy

title: Great way to get around
review: The air conditioning is a welcome relief  Regular arrivals Great way to get around  Not expensive  Clean and comfortable

title: Reviewing public transportation?
review: OkI guess I can say more signage would be helpful as all the different routes and lines can be confusing The biggest annoyance is that all stations don't have machines that can take whole bills you'll need to get handfuls of change and pump them into machines unless you have a local transit card or the correct app  Can be crowded but very useful

title: Perfect
review: Perfect Sara is really really kind and knows so much She really looks out that her guests have the best time 1010 recommend

title: Grwat way to see the city
review: A fantastic and cheap way to get around bangkok Machines are simple to use to buy tivkets just remember to keep lits of change as queues to split notes can be lengthy good clean and air conditiobed but does get busy at rush hour

title: Bangkok Skytrain
review: Most convinient mode of transport for travel within Bangkok Helpful staff at the ticket counters checkin and exit points Very well defined legends inside the trains and at the stations with the exits clearly marked with points highlighted for each exit

title: Not bad
review: The train trip is a good experiencetotally differtent to the trains in Dubai  There is a lot to see if you dont manage to get a seat on the train Just looking out the window is interesting

title: Accessible
review: very convinient BTS in bangkok connectiong airport link and very accessible to all major tourist spots

title: Fast
review: Never took long to bbk from the airport entrance number 3 your in bbk in half an hour bit crowded but you can live with it fast as he'll great and reliableand cheap

title: Easy and cheap
review: Easy to get around A bit crowdy when rushhour Combine the trip with a tuktuk ( also cheap never pay more than 100baht for a ride)

title: very impressed
review: We travelled on the skytrain a few times whilst we were in Bangkok recently and we were very impressed at how efficient they ranour train was always on time and we were impressed at how clean the interior of the train was and how lovely and cool it was from the air conditioningwas nice to board after being in the humid hot weather Loved the colours and the advertising on the sides of the trainsvery colourful It's really cheap and queues were never that long at all I think Perth has a lot to learn in making trains run on time There was no graffiti no scratched windows with obscene writing Everything was clean but most of all we felt safe

title: Don't take a cab
review: If you get to BKK airport in the morning or around 5 PM don't take a cab it is horrible as the traffic is pretty heavy The Skytrain connect you with Phaya Thai one of the BTS station is about 30 minutes from the airport if you take the express train if you take the local will double the time the train live every 30 minutes from Phaya Thai and the first train is at 6AM is clean and cheap plus you don't have to deal with the traffic  Enjoy the ride

title: Save time and safe
review: We booked rooms at the Grand Diamond Pratunam Hotel so we chose to go to the city by Airport Rail Link It was very easy convenience and safe Out from the plane with a little bit walk to the Airport Rail Link Station then we were in town after 2030 minutes   They were really fast and on time We were out at the Phaya Thai Station and called Taxi for a short way to the hotel   The good thing was the cost were inexpensive and you can connect to the other part of Bangkok by BTS MRT or Taxi

title: Perfect organized to get the impression of 2 markets
review: Can fully recommend the tour We booked very late the evening before start and still everything worked perfect with hotel pickup The tour is very well organized and they even think about where you can use a clean toilet before going with the train through the market and than walk through it The floating market was discovered by a rowing boat what I also liked more than those smelling loud motorboats We just wanted to get the impression and therefore the timing was perfect if you actually want to go shopping at those markets it might be to short in time

title: Handy to get around
review: Cheap as chips and very easy to get around town with Very safe too and lots of english so u really cant get lost

title: Bangkok to Chiang Mai in three stages
review: Having read mixed reviews of the long trip from Bangkok to Chiang Mai I decided to do it in three stages  The first leg was the short (15 hour) hop to Ayutthaya where I stopped over to visit some of the fine old city remains  An important tip  the ordinary ticket is only 20 Baht but if you book a seat it is over 150  That guarantees a seat but there were plenty available anyway  The next leg was 7 hours to the small pleasant town of Phitsanulok where I overnighted  There is little there bu nice friendly people cheap prices and a pleasant flower market by the river  Apparently it is also famous for 'flying vegetable' acrobatics but I didn't know about this  Then another 7 hour trip to Chiang Mai  again it is MUCH cheaper to turn up in the morning and get a regular ticket rather than booking a seat  Very pleasant views out of the train window and more relaxed than doing it all in one trip

title: Very convenient
review: Easy to access from airport to mrt subway or bts sky train Mrt from petchaburi connected through makkasan airport raillink Express line and this line doesn't make much difference except the price

title: very convinient and simple to use
review: the system is easy to work out and use We ended us using the train by buying one way tickets We could have saved more money by buying a day pass if we were organised enough ) One way ticket is 15  35 Bhat (depending how far you need to go) and a day pass is approximately 150 Bhat

title: The best way
review: BTS is the best way for you go to almost every where in Bangkok Is not the cheapest way the cheapest way is by bus but in BTS you go fast and you can enjoy the most powerful air conditioner I've seen

title: Convenient
review: If you are staying in areas like Sukhumvit etc taking Airport link is good Taxi takes long time from airport and they charge as per their wish most of the time

title: fast and easy
review: The best way to travel in Bangkok city Good sign for tourist Ticket price are reasonable and very convinient

title: good train
review: Nice connection between the city & airport Better than taking a taxi for the longest part of your trip into town

title: Highlight of our day trip to Kanchanaburi!
review: After visiting the cemetery museum and bridge of the above city our driver took us to the train station where we paid 150 baht per person Our tour guide told us to stay on the left side of the train where views are better We passed by beautiful villages river bamboo groves hills in the distant etc  We were served cold water and some beverages At the end of the train ride we were provided a certificate evidencing our visit   Thanks to those who built this railway and current train personnel who made our visit very memorable

title: Travel from airport to shopping mall
review: Very quick and cheap way to travel to downtown and shopping mall from airport Scenic Would recommend Traffic is very congested Best use of time is rail link

title: Easy & best A/C in BKK!
review: Extremely easy to use Bring coins Look at Lingala to find the name & number of the stop you want to get off  At kiosk select that station number It will tell you the cost Pay and collect ticket for turnstile Keep as you need it for BTS exit  Great AC  As clean as possible given use level

title: Efficient, cool, but........
review: As others have written this really is a very efficient way to get around Bangkok It is *well* air conditioned and they seemingly arrive every few minutes so no big deal if you miss one  My only gripe is that the ticket machine does not take notes  so travelers (including it seems locals) have to queue at the counter that looks like a ticket booth to change money into coins then go to a ticket vending machine and throw in an endless stream of coins to get your ticket

title: Going to Suvanabhumi
review: There is a big improvement in the schedule being on time but it is always crowded and many times no seat offered to senior citizens

title: Good value, prompt and cheap
review: Took the BTS for a 6 station hop from Naha BTS to Victory Monument BTS today Very easy and cheap (34 Bt) Tannoys tell you the next station in Thai and English so it is as simple as ABC Avoids all the traffic and taxi meter scams The option of choice for a hop across Bangkok  it couldn't be easier

title: The best (and coolest) way around Bangkok
review: If you have never visited Bangkok you are about to see an busy and during most of the year hot and humid city The roads are usually clogged with traffic and it is not unusual to spend 15 minutes to travel less than one kilometer in a taxi If your destination is near a BTS skytrain station this is the way to go When you step on the efficiently run and fast BTS you will be hit with a very welcome and refreshing blast of air conditioned air The BTS will wisk you from one side of the city to the other in only a few minutes and also links with the Airport Rail Link train Efficient and relatively inexpensive

title: Good Way of Travelling
review: Any means of travelling in Bangkok which escapes the eternal traffic jams must be good news  The sky train delivers this and it is easy to use cheap and a good way of getting about the City Although it is a pain having to get change for every journey (as the ticketmachines only take cash) this is a minor  problem  The only criticism of the sky train I have is that it only covers a relatively small area of the city and so it is in desperate need of expansion But if you have been sat motionless in a taxi for ten minutes or more and making little progress you will love skytrain if it actually covers the area you need to get to

title: Clean and efficient
review: A stress free way to travel to the heart of Bangkok from the airport Just go down to the basement level of Suvarnabhumi Airport and buy you travel token

title: A great way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS is the one of the best skytrain I ever seen It's clear easy fast and there a lot every 2 or 3 minutes Wish all American cities had this

title: Accommodation great, service is a scam!!
review: As soon as we got on the train we were shown to our bunks that were ok in size perhaps a bit short if you're taller than 172cm or 56"  We travelled with the special express and the compartments were air conditioned if not a bit cold in the night Clean blankets and pillows were provided which was a big plus However as soon as we sat down we were handed a juice Not asked if we wanted one just handed one We were also handed a breakfast menu from which we could choose which set we wanted This was somewhat pricey but you could get coffee and juice in addition so we said ok The first thing in the morning we were woken up by the service lady handing us juices through the curtain not asking if we wanted one Assuming this was part of breakfast we took it Later on when breakfast arrived and afterwards when we had to pay we were presented with a bill of 800 baht A slight shock when considering we only had breakfast with 3 additional instant coffees and 2 additional juices We were charged for juices that were handed to us The juices and coffee that was part of the breakfast didn't show When we asked where these were (upon reception of bill) she brought them over We've never spent this much money on a meal for two in Thailand let alone a tasteless and poor meal and feel properly cheated Expensive learning and partly our fault for not being more suspicious Take home message bring snacksfood and water because nothing is included in the ticket price (even if it's handed to you) and nothing is complementary

title: Fast, Easy & Convenient
review: The only way to beat traffic in Bangkok Great prices very clean and easy to get around downtown and most stops are at a mall location

title: The best way to get into town from the airport.

title: Fascinating day out, value for money

title: Good to get around

title: Great way to travel

title: Great way to get around Bangkok

title: Nice transport system

title: Amazing BTS Stations in Bangkok
review: All BTS stations are located near offices shopping malls and tourist attraction sights which make it easy for travelers to reach their destinations They are all equipped with lifts and escalators In side BTS stations are so clean Inside BTS stations you can find stalls selling drinks and snacks but be ware that drinking and eating inside the trains are forbidden

title: fast but crowded

title: convenient way to travel to the city
review: The Airport Rail is a cheap and convenient way to travel from the airport to the city Sometimes it can get very crowded

title: Cheap and easy way to get around Bangkok
review: We bought a day ticket which was very cheap and allowed us to hop on and off for the day Similar to the London Underground busy at certain times but easy to understand how to get from A to B

title: Convenient
review: So far so good  some dun have escalator and BTS counter cannot buy 10 tickets in one go very polite staff  some place dun ahve escalator

title: Good service

title: Fast & Convenient
review: It is a direct link from the airport to the city areas and also to where our hotel is Cheap & Convenient

title: Easy and intuitive
review: Landed in Bangkok and had already decided to try the mass transit out to our hotel Possibly the easiest and cleanest public transport I have EVER had the pleasure of using  Very easy and cheap system to use would recommend those landing in BKK try it

title: Fantastic transport
review: Excellent way to get around Bangkok Just so easy totally recommend to everyone Not to mention cheap  Saves so much time rather than sitting in crazy traffic

title: Efficient but Crowded
review: Very crowded but certaintly a cheap efficient and easy way of getting around the many sights and shopping malls in Bangkok Recommend you get a Rabbit ticket which will overcome the need to queue up for access to the ticket machines for individual trips

title: Wonderful
review: Sara is awesome She takes good care of us Short trip but good enough to see the Thai local Will come back for another trip

title: Easy rider

title: TRANSPORTATION IN THE SKY . . . AVOID THE TRAFFIC BELOW YOU !
review: This way to travel in Bangkok is fantastic  Yes  at times it can be crowded but it is quality #1 to avoid the gridlock that you can view being above the congestion and chaos  Great cost and best in this heavily populated environment

title: Prefer it over any bus
review: Cheap and fast way to get around Very clean and user friendly Stations are well marked and in exit stations are near hot spots

title: SkyTrain
review: very easy travel about town  the terminals were clean as were the trains

title: Safe reliable and fast.
review: Just avoid the rush hours and note that this links with the excellent MRT (underground system) a great way to move around Bangkok

title: Good service
review: This train goes from airport to the center of city for about a dollar very good service From 6 am to midnight It is full at times Must buy ticket from machine in English

title: just a way of transportation
review: I am surprised that this is listed as the second sightseeing in Bangkok The skytrain is just a way of transportation It is easy to get around with it and it is cooled down to a very low temperature I was happy to have a little jacket with me It is cheap and worth taking it for long distances  What I enjoyed more than the skytrain was gettig around in a tuctuc and on the river by boat

title: Tour guide for the day
review: Great way of getting around Bangkok for value for money Information was provided in the stations at the change booth and was easy to purchase a ticket

title: So cheap and convenient!
review: A fantastic way to travel to BKK city from the airport highly recommended if your hotel is on the BTS

title: Waiting area
review: No express line Very hot waiting area Do not use at the prime time because it's very crowded at that time

title: Take a taxi instead?
review: I arrived at Suvarnabhumi at about 1930 and thought it would be interesting to take the train to Phaya Thai and thence a taxi to my hotel in the old town Surely it would be cheaper than taking a taxi all the way The train fare is only about 50 Baht but I had to stand Arriving at Phaya Thai in the dark I had no option but to descend onto an ordinary street After stopping a few taxis I realised I wasn't going to pay less than 300 to get to my hotel so I finally took one We had difficulty finding the hotel but the driver didn't seem fazed I later calculated that 100 would have been generous I don't think the taxi fare from the airport is a lot more than 350

title: Great
review: It's simple and fast Used it many times when moving around Bangkok There's a voice telling what stop is next both in thai & english

title: Easy and Cheap
review: Its my choice of transport city to airport when I'm alone The link to the BTS Phaya Thai is so convenient and for the price of 45 Baht its a no brainer The terminal in the airport is in the Basement and is very easily accessible This might actually be easier for tourists than waiting for an uber outside or making sure that your airport taxi will turn on the meter

title: Great way to avoid the traffic
review: Although not as extensive as other systems in Singapore Hong Kong etc this is a great way to get around Bangkok Look down on the stalled traffic from a nice air conditioned overground carriage It takes you to the major shopping malls and out to the markets to the river and the business centre And cheap and easy to use

title: Fantastic alternative to a taxi
review: Only used this once but if I was heading into BKK from the airport this would be my first choice of travel It is a little inconvenient if you have suitcases though

title: quick easy and cheap
review: avoid awful car traffic jam to and from airport by taking the Airport link railwaystraight from the airport to city center  7 stops in 24 mn easy safe and cheap

title: Great, easy, Comfort
review: Thailand's greatest transportation service Faster Easy Comfort Cheap Sometimes you may have to walk a little far to get PlatinumFashionMall or Big C pratunam  It has One day card and one time card One day card is for 140 Bahts One time card is depend on how far you will go Cheap Don't worryEasy )

title: Nice way to get around.
review: While not really an attraction unless you have never been on a train before it is a great way to get around  It cheap and safe  Just pay attention to the running times if you are going to be out late  Although its not really a big deal because there are taxis and tuk tuk's everywhere at all hours if they train closes

title: Watch our for rush hour, get a Rabbit card to avoid the ticket lines!
review: The only way to efficiently get around in Bangkok It get reaaaaaaly busy between 07000900 and 16001800 Avoid those times as a tourist   I spend my first few trips here using coins in the ticket machine but those lines can get really long Go to the window and buy a rabbit card (cost is 170 Bhat I think) then load it with money Most trips will be 3050 bhat so you can take many trips if you buy a card and load with a 500 bhat bill Plenty for a few day visit Use it just like the locals lay card on sensor to enter and exit It always shows the real time balance   Reload at the window Once you figure this out if you have return trips it will save you a ton of time

title: Convenient, clean, fast
review: Amazing the network of connections between the Skytrain elevated walkways and the street all connecting you to shopping malls  It's even easy to get to Chatuchak market The ride is smooth the bars are split into three so when it gets crowded you can find a space to hang on to the hanging straps from the ceiling are reachable even for a shorter person like me (under 5' 4") and the train comes to a smooth halt

title: quite clean station
review: it was great easy to reach very helpful to go around bangkok You could buy a card "rabbit" price THB 300 it's active for 5 years and you could go anywhere nothing to be disliked

title: Great cheap way to see the city
review: Easy to use great views of the city and you can get off when you see something you might like Only issue is that it only services a small section of the city

title: Fantastic way to get to the airport
review: This is such a pleasant trip to the airport  We took the express train and the cabins hardly had any people in them  The view from the train was great as we travelled above Bangkok

title: So much faster and cheaper
review: I am lucky that my hotel is close to one of the stops I can get from the river and up to the Siam shopping area for about a dollar Easy to use well signposted and people willing to use The last time I tried this trip in a taxi it took almost 2 hours due to traffic In the Skytrain I think it was about 15 minutes

title: transportation
review: Always on time and clean knowing when the busy times helps But rush hour is the same all over the world

title: Good system but crowded
review: We found it good to use and go from one end to the other but can get crowded It's good to give your legs a break from all the walking

title: Quicker than a taxi
review: On the plus side it's quicker to navigate around Bangkok but the trains are always so busy They have air conditioning though Very cheap for a single ticket and you get to see Bangkok Always very clean

title: fastest way from and to the airport

title: Nothing compared to it

review: 5 star Rating (55) Pathumwan Princess  Lovely stay  Will definitely Recommend to other travellers

title: Thumbs up !
review: This is fun Jokes apart it's really comfortable and fast The travellers with connecting flights need to walk from 1 terminal to other The airport being really big the walking distance is too much The airport rail link makes it easier for us to reach a terminal in the other corner of the airport within minutes Absolutely hygiene and safe

title: An airconditioned haven in Bangkok!

title: Convenient

title: So easy!

title: Well arranged

review: Great elevated view of some of Bangkok which you won't get by just walking around Doesn't take you everywhere yet with plans to expand the network but takes you to some of the main attractions such as the city centre the river and weekend markets AIRCON )

review: The BTS station is the cleanest I've ever seen of course this is because of the no food no drink rule It is also very simple to use You pay at the ticket machines or the ticket counter if they are open and use coins to pay for the stop which you are going to and you receive a card which you swipe in the machine before going to your station and again when you leave Simple quick efficient

title: Great service and convenience
review: The Skytrain is fast clean and very efficient and really the only way to get around in Bangkok #Love it

title: Convenient Way to Get into Town
review: The airport Rail Link is easy and convenient though the express line was not available when I reached Suvarnabhumi the city link was more than sufficient to reach Phaya Thai station and then move on to wherever you need to go in Bangkok

title: Efficient, English-friendly, just perfect
review: NonThais are never to fret when riding the BTS To make the experience even better highly suggest to download one of the many apps with ThaiEnglish names to better decide the best route and on the end station which of the exits of the BTS station to take

title: best way at to get around
review: get yourself a ticket for the day and hop on air conditioned and safe journey takes you to major sites announcements are made in english much quicker than your usual taxi and no surprises with prices and surcharges if you go to jim thompson house exit at national stadium

title: easy transport
review: very simple to get around once you have mastered the system sadly every time we used it the trains were full or next to full the weekend market at the end of the line was fantastic a must see if you are in Bangkok

title: Efficient way to get around Bangkok and connect to BTS/ARL
review: Cheap efficient and clean transportation away from traffic travelling underground to avoid Bangkok's notorius gridlock  Vending machines produce token to insert into turnstile type gates into gates

title: better than expected
review: air conditioning was working well people were civilised trains came on time and did not break down interesting that there are shops within the station  pricing range from 15 baht to 52 baht depending on distance travelled refer to map at ticketing machines  best to buy tickets at the machines if you have insufficient coins change with notes at the information counter but do not get tickets with cash over the counter as staff charge higher than the machine was supposed to get two 31 baht tickets but paid 20 baht more in the end

title: It's fast but....
review: Considering the alternative of having to take a bus the Skytrain is a godsend  It is fast and efficient when you actually get on    The main issue is buying tickets  Instead of having one fast pass for the public transportation Bkk has one for every mode of transport and they can't be used in conjunction with each other This creates long and slow lines  You can also ONLY buy you ticket with coins not bills  So you might have to wait on 2 lines one to break your bill and the other to buy the ticket  At popular stations like Siam it is just a mess  You might spend 1520 minutes just getting your ticket  If you're only going a few stops this is a waste of time and energy    If you're with one or two friends you want to consider just getting a taxi  It will probably be cheaper too

title: Easy and Inexpensive
review: This is an easy and hassle free way to get to the airport  You can take BTS Sky Train to the start of the Rail Express or take the Metro to it

title: What a pile of crap!!!!
review: I am currently lying in one of the beds of the sleeper train What a bad time I am having There is not a chance that I am going to be sleeping tonight   The start of our journey didn't go too bad staff at the Bangkok train station were helpful with our needs we purchased our tickets and shortly after boarded the train We had purchased 1st class tickets so had a private room between the 2 of us A little while after the train leaving a member of staff came to make our beds up for us Next came the food that we had ordered from a lady who previously visited our room and took our orders The food was not much to be desired and I wouldn't recommend it After the food we chilled on the bottom bunk for a while until we got tired The mrs wanted to stay on the bottom bunk so I climbed up onto the top This is when I really started to hate this journey The top bunk is a whole lot more uncomfy than the bottom It feels like I am laying on a boulder Dead in the middle of the bed is a rock solid bit of wood I wouldn't wish this discomfort on anyone There is also a constant rattling noise (metal on metal) coming from under the beds and the train is shaking so much so that I feel I am aboard Rita  Queen of speed To top off all that every now and then a great whoft of toilet stench comes in through the vents I shall not be getting any sleep tonight ( Please if you have any choice of other means of travel choose it over this god damn train   Pictured is the most solid part of my bed If you think that the mattress I am holding up would make things any comfier I am afraid you would be wrong

title: Easy Peasy
review: Handy and cheapwas stuck in traffic paid cab and got out at nearest  station and caught the trainto my destination Much cheaper and convenient to get nearly anywhere in the CBD

title: Well designed

title: Fast, clean, and cheap
review: Caught this train to get from the Chatrium hotel to the Siam Niramit show in the Thailand Cultural Center Train was clean and punctual Highly recommended to get around at a low cost

title: Easy to use.
review: The BTS sky train network is a really easy system to use The tickets are easy to by from the ticket machine provided you know where you are going Quite cheap and fairly clean There are security guards at each station

title: Great way to get around the city
review: Given the traffic in Bangkok this is a quick and inexpensive way to travel  The train runs every few minutes and tickets are easily purchased at the stations  The trains have good maps that indicate stations so it is easy to use

title: BTS Skytrain – Convenient to use
review: We were staying at Centre Point Hotel in Chidlom Bangkok We tried to use Bangkok taxi on two occasions and had bad experience of overly excessive charging There was also the problem of the Bangkok traffic jam Therefore we decided to travel around Bangkok on BTS Sky train as the Chit Lom station was close by BTS stands for Bangkok Transit system and is the elevated train line system  We found the BTS very clean punctual professionally run and safe to travel even at late night There are two lines in operation namely the Silom line and the Sukhumvit line The service is good and there is a train every 3  6 minutes or so between 0630 am and midnight The trains get very busy during peak hours (0700  0900 and 1600  1900) It is easy to find your bearing as the maps on the trains light up when the train approaches a station and announcement system also tells you the name of the station  Ar Chit Lom we found no ticket office only a booth manned by a member of staff who can advise and give you change We had to buy the tickets from the automated ticket machine The machine was a bit confusing at first but we soon learnt how to use it  When we had to travel to different locations we bought oneday pass for 140 Baht at our hotel reception When we were only going to one location we bought a single ticket each time as it works out cheaper  The only problem was that we had to have the exact change for the machine If the booth at the station is open then you can get change otherwise you have to ask other passengers Fares start at 15 baht for one stop and up to 55 Baht per journey depending on chosen destination There are buttons on the automated machine with a different number Each number represents a different fare First we had to check the map next to the machine The map showed the destinations and prices next to them For instance we wanted to go to Mo Chit from Chit Lom The map showed 42 next to Mo Chit This meant we had to press the button with no 42 on it and then drop the exact coins through the slot   We found the BTS very convenient to use
