review: Bangkok offers an excellent mode of transportation in form of BTS Its cost effective goes across town and above all saves a serious amount of time It also gives a view of the city's diverse community  Indian tourists specially for you please use this and enjoy what public transportation should be

title: The Best Way to get to the Airport
review: Cabs during busy traffic hours are not the fastest way to the airport The raillink is very convenient and fast I get it from the Phraya Thai BTS stop and I am at the airport in about 35 minutes

title: good transfer from/to airport
review: very convenient from to airport good service  MRT to Pechaburi station then take Airport link at Makkasan 20 minutes to airport

title: brilliant transport option
review: clean efficient easy to use and navigate this is a fantastic way to see bangkok and experience this bustling city for all it has to offer Dont be shy take transport when and wherever you can

title: Easy Transportation
review: It was cheap as well as quick mode of transport  140Baht around 5USD for unlimited day travel adult ticket  Have stops frequently Used it mainly on sukhumvit road green line for travel between Siam & Asok  Air conditioned and well maintained

title: Clean fast and efficient
review: The BTS operates like most subways with the end station determining the direction of the train Buy a smart card from hte ticket office and top it up as required for trips

title: Very efficient system
review: Comfortable and easy to navigate  There are two main lines (Silom and Sukhumvit) and it's easy to figure out where you're going because there are simple maps above the doors in each train car  Rides are relatively inexpensive  Make sure to save your ticket after you enter a station because you'll need to scan it again in order to leave the station

title: Another Cool Mass Transit Alternative in Bangkok
review: BTS Skytrain doesn't go where you need to go The MRT is just as good Clean inexpensive frequent service and most importantly good working ACs

title: Long day's journey into night
review: A 12hour daytime train journey by choice Am I insane you ask Well maybe We decided to travel from Bangkok to Chiang Mai by train for a number of reasons it was incredibly cheap it was a way to see a large part of the Thai countryside without the hazards of road travel it was a bit of an adventure For 8 or so hours it was interesting and possibly fun I love looking at countryside passing by and don't really get bored no matter how repetitive that view might be But 12 hours was really stretching the friendship The seats weren't very comfortable some didn't recline properly some flopped back all the time and couldn't be stabilised The aircon worked thank goodness and the snacks provided were filling and pleasant But there isn't a buffetrestaurant car so there are no options other than the two snack runs offered during the journey and the stops aren't long enough even for a speed dash to a station stop The view became more interesting as we went up into the mountains and I didn't really mind the journey but the most irritating part of it was that whenever any small track crossed the railway line the driver hooted three four eight or even more times and as we were seated in the first carriage only a few seats behind the engine room the noise was very intrusive and really even if you wanted to sleep some of the hours away you couldn't The toilets were surprisingly OK although it is hard to balance while you're rocketing around corners and frankly it shows after men have used the toilets At least there was plenty of toilet paper On balance if you don't have to don't If you do have to take earplugsheadphones and your own snacks and drinks

title: Great way to travel
review: Great experience If you visiting Bangkok you must try this Very easy to move around with a daily travel card for only 140 Baht It allows you for unlimited journeys till midnight Be aware that eating or drinking is not permitted in the train or on the platforms Cool air conditioned carriages and high culture of travel in total gives you a pleasant experience

title: Great way to travel when you want to avoid BKK peak hour traffic
review: My friend and I took the Airport Rail Link to avoid BKK Peak hour traffic We stopped at Ratchaprarop station However do note that there are no escalators going down to street level and we had to carry our luggage down a few flights of stairs

title: Great transportation
review: Great transportation when you want to get around Bangkoks hot spots Can however get quite crowded during rush hours

title: Easy and time saving way of communication.
review: Prices are reasonable but most important thing is you can save time and save money as well Taxi charges for halt also which make your trip expansive So if you have sky train line on your way then please opt it

title: BTS makes it easy to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is a very convenient and efficient system I believe there is a train every 8 minutes vs every 30 minutes for the Airport Rail Link Best way to get around downtown Bangkok's massive traffic gridlock Very inexpensive and the air conditioned cars are kept very cool  a great relief from the heat and humidity Gets you to all interests  Nana district for the naughty to MBK for the shopaholics and everywhere in between Very efficient system Makes getting around BKK a breeze There are maps at the coin dispensers to help you figure out rates and locations Canot say enough about BTS

title: World class
review: This is an effective way of commuting around bangkok but not cheap If you have used the tube at singapore or other countries you will find it easier to travel in the skytrain but it is difficult to remember names of stations u should write it down for easy remembrance

title: Clean, cheap and fast transportation
review: Provided your destination is in the vicinity of the Sky Train I definitely recommend using it as opposed to a taxi  You will arrive quickly and probably cooler  Taxis can sit in traffic for hours

title: Quick and cheap
review: Just as the title says really easy to buy "coins" which you use as a scan for the electronic portals It's really fast and cheap compared to taking a taxi

title: Best transport in Bangkok
review: Even if its crowded it is the best transportation service in Bangkok It follows Sukhomvit and you can easy reach the tempel area it the Chaturak market area

title: Fast, economical and easy
review: Took the City Rail (Blue Line) to Praya Thai Simple fast only 45 Baht single Made mistake of taking a taxi to guesthouse (180 Baht) Should have taken the Skytrain from Praya Thai (42 Baht)

title: Most Convenient way to get to the City
review: For the first time in my countless travels to Bangkok I decided to take the Airport City Sky Train and I must agree I am now a fan so much so that I chatted about it to allmy friends who visit Bangkok often before even I reached my Hotel  A train every 15 min runs from Early Morning till about Mid Night)   Its Fast Its Cheap (Airport to Nana  Sukhumvut Area) approx THB 70 and Time Taken approx 45 Min including one interchange  7 Stops from Airport to City does in 30 min and then the next next change  Though it was crowned from Airport but most were the passengers that boarded from Airport itself and only a few got on or off on way  Has some space for Luggage Hold (small but OK) on all coaches but since its mostly ment for Airport Traffic passengers adjust   The Interchange Station from Airport Line have been well connected to the MTR other Lines thus making the change with Luggage convenient  Knowing Bangkok Traffic and not knowing how much time one can take to reach the Airport in a Taxi I would definitely suggest this as an option

title: Best choice ? Ummm ..
review: Better waiting long time for taxi  cheaper & fasten to downtown directly without traffic jam  exercise your legs along the way but not too hard for seating as well      Oh  u can enjoy food & beverage (a bit expensive) and get good rate of money exchange rate before grab the train       Come  come to Bangkok The 1st of best destination voted by MasterCard 2016

title: Efficient, convenient transportation
review: Great system  Stairs and sometimes an elevator take you up to the ticket area  Buy tickets from the automated vendor according to length of travelstation  The prices are marked on the handy map  The machines have an English option and if you are buying tickets for a family you can opt to purchase the tickets in bulk  The tickets are plastic cards that you insert into the stylesgates and retrieve as you walk through  Be quick  If you have luggage go through the wheelchair gate instead  That said never saw a stroller or wheelchair on the bus just suitcases There are usually security guards at a table facing the gates  Sometimes rarely they will check your bag  Remove sunglasses and hats  There are stairs or an escalator up to the platform  Walk left stand right  On the platform there are places marked to line up  There is a barrier with sliding doors so the tracks are not accessible  This is great if you are traveling with young kids  The trains came quickly  The cars are very clean and very quiet even when packed full  There are many handles to hold if no seats are available  There is no eating on the bus system  Signs and announcements are in English but sometimes it is hard to see the station name when the train stops  If the train is very full it can be tricky to get out at your stop but Thai people do not push and are generally really helpful  They are also very quiet  If you have a backpack wear it in front  The cars are air conditioned  The exits are numbered so it makes meeting people simple to find  To exit the system you have to insert the same card  The machine keeps it this time  If you have not paid enough then take the card and the extra money to the attendant who will help you and only laugh a little

title: Brilliant
review: If only London had a similarly modern and user friendly service Of course the MRT has the supreme advantage of being modern and thus designed fit for purpose with its air conditioned tries and vast platform concourses Gets very crowded at peak times but otherwise is a joy to use

title: The Bangkok BTS and MRT are excellent modes of transportation
review: It is very easy to get around town using the Bangkok train system  The maps are very friendly to use the stations are staff with personnel to help with directions and they are staff with visible security staff which makes the system safe  The only drawback is the two systems (MRTBTS) are mutually exclusive

title: An experience
review: Visiting Thailand for the first time and wanted to experience the SkyTrain  It's most certainly was an experience Crammed sardines On the plus side it's so etching I can tick off my bucket list

title: Convenient transportation
review: I have been to Bankgkok on numerous occasions  The best way to get around in the city is via the BTS Skytrain  This way you avoid the traffic jam and get to see the city by foot  I always get the Rabbit stored value card  It provided me with added convenience of tapping in and out of the BTS stations On top of that  saves me the hassle of fumbling around for coins or cash to buy the single trip tickets and looking up to get the correct fare price for each trip  You must remember that the Rabbit card is valid for 5 years only  I always keep my Rabbit card for my next trip to Bangkok and get a refund before it expires  Than I will get a new Rabbit card again  For foreigners you will need to have your passport to top up or purchase the Rabbit card at BTS stations  My only gripe is that at some BTS stations there is a slight step down from the the train to the platform  Older folks tend to trip when alighting

title: the BTS system in Bangkok so easy to use
review: i have been to Bangkok three times (and about to make it four)  this is the only way i get around bangkok  close to all amenities and quick easy cheap  wouldn't use anything else

title: Great way to get around.
review: The best way tomove around Bangkok and easily combined with taxis and motorcycles The Rabbit pass works really well allowing toavoid getting ticket by ticket fares Can be crowded

title: Easy way to commute
review: I stayed in the Sukhumvit area Soi 2 at a hotel conveniently located between two stations Nana and Ploenchit   The BTS sky train is a good way to get around all the way along Sukhumvit road To travel to the Siam station which is close to all the major shopping centres like Siam Paragon or Central Word cost about 30 Baht from the above mentioned stations  Access to the stations are along Sukhumvit road for the Sukhumvit line U can change to another line at Siam station The train itself is air conditioned and clean Obtaining a ticket is quite easy Get change from the cashier before the entry point and then go to one of the ticketing machines to choose your fare based on the destination and get your ticket The machines only uses coins  All in all a good travel experience and slightly cheaper than using the metered taxis

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: This is the quickest most easy and cheap way to travel in Bangkok The traffic jams in Bangkok are legendary Use the BTS and avoid them

title: Skip Bangkok'c street level traffic
review: Raised above the bustle of Bangkok's sometimes manic street level traffic this is the best way to move swiftly across town Will be even better when there are more routes

title: Best way to get around
review: The BT's sky train proved to be our main mode of transport during our stay in Bangkok Our hotel the Holiday Inn was right alongside it so it was easy to just jump on a train every day We just bought individual journey tickets from the machines in every station The buttons tell you how much to push into the slots for a ticket and there's a handy map showing you the stations with the cost Everyone asks for change at the counter if they need it although there can be a queue The assistants behind the counter tend not to give out tickets There is however usually one machine that will accept notes The Thais queue neatly at each side of the doors for the train It's often crowded but somehow the system works You can change between the two lines of the BTS with the one ticket but if you change to the metro you'll need a new ticket

title: Best way to get from Point A to Point B
review: The sky train is a fast air conditioned (very strongly airconditioned) reliable means of transportation that does NOT GET STUCK IN TRAFFIC and reasonably priced Really there is no better way of going from Point A to Point B (assuming both point A and point B are near the skytrain) than by skytrain

title: Great views!
review: Great service and easy to get around  Quick and efficient very convenient to get form one place to another around very busy Bangkok

title: Very nice
review: The train is very clean (especially for Thai norms)  good airconditioning Was not busy when we took it It was 40 baht for a ride we calculated that taking cabs was cheaper as we were travelling in group But nice to experience

title: Awesome
review: Faboulus experience of my life in Bangkok with the family they also love  the ride & enjoyed a lot & entire look is also stunning

title: Good Mode of Transportation
review: Comfortable clean and safe ride to access shopping entertainment and other areas in Bangkok Connects to MRT and can be accessed at Sathorn Pier also  SILOM LINE runs west to south between the National Stadium (access MBK Shopping Mall) in the Siam shopping area and Bang Wa in Thonburi (across the Chao Phraya River)  SUKHUMVIT LINE runs north to east from Mo Chit to Bearing The two lines meet at Siam Station and also connect at two points with the underground (MRT) – at Sala Daeng Station (Silom Line) and Asok Station (Sukhumvit Line)

title: Have fun!
review: The railway market was a good experience However for fhe floating marketing as the place is getting more quiet the experience I believe is not as great as before

title: Better than a taxi
review: The Skytrain or overhead railway was the smartest thing the Thais have done  A to B in less than no time with fares from 10 Baht up to about 25  Very reasonable  They can get packed tho during peak hours but this is the same for every city you care to mention  They are impeccably clean as well  Definitely better than taking and taxi and being caught up in Bangkok traffic  Cheaper too

title: Half day Railway & Floating Markets
review: Thank you Mr Tee for great tour visiting Railway markets & floating markets  We really enjoyed your tour & commentary on the bus highly this tour Kim & Peter Aussies

title: Esay to use, frequent service
review: Modern efficient service for getting quickly across town Easy to use ticket machines Trains get very crowded at busy times most of the time we were standing

title: Easy
review: Convenient and easy and techy Really beat traffic and got around the city effortlessly

title: Best way to get into Bangkok
review: This is the best way to get into Bangkok and probably the quickest and cheapest Super clean very efficient if only public transit systems in other countries were as good as this

title: reliable and cheap
review: I like using this its good fast and you can avoid the Bangkok traffic some stops are right outside hotels shopping centres etc

title: Why a metro #2 attraction in BKK while not convenient
review: I really don’t get why people put the metro as no2 things to do in Bangkok First astandard widely used way of transport is not deemed to be an attraction to visit  unless you have never seen a trainmetro in your life second this metro is nothing special especially if you compare the ones in other cities around the world (Tokyo Singapore Lausanne etc) last but not least this is very inconvenient for tourists You cannot go to the old town where there are all the main tourist attractions (temples and palace) Either you have to switch to a bus or taxi few kms away

title: Clean and safe
review: Absolutely recommend You will not get stuck in heavy traffic When you enter any of the stations you get cooled they too control bags to prevent terroristic attacks

title: Reasonably efficient
review: Quite fast but not nearly as comfortable as the normal Bangkok BTS  Also very busy any time we have used it

title: The best way to move about in Sukhumvit
review: I love staying along Sukhumvit because of the wonderful shopping malls eating places and the tailor I go to The best mode or moving around is by BTS skytrain and the skybridge which links the stations and run above the roads and the nightmare traffic I buy the Rabbit card and just top it up with credit whenever I am in Bangkok and need to use the BTS trains

title: Great way to avoid heavy traffic
review: This is not my first time catching airport rail link to hotel It was a great way to avoid traffic jam during peak time in Bangkok Just a short distance walk from the station to my hotel   It's convenience not too long ride cool aircon and reasonable cost  One negative comment on how to purchase ticket it should be a better way Right now you have to get coins from station teller booth and then go to a machine to buy tickets  Hence you have to line up twice one to get your change and then buy ticket  Note that only station from Bangkok back to Airport I think from airport you can get ticket from the ticket booth

title: Very easy to use and air conditioned!
review: My friends and I mostly relied on Uber in Bangkok During rushhour though we found the Skytrain to be a very good alternative The maps are easy to read and the kiosks are user friendly The train cars are airconditioned which you'll appreciate on a hot Thai day

title: Great transit system
review: Loved the convenience of the trains in Bangkok They're clean air conditioned and easy to follow Great way to get around

title: Major transportation in town
review: BTS is my main choise of transportation in BKK You will know the estimate time of arrival and get your destination on time  Somehow it crowded in rush hour which is not the problem  The problem is it will be very cold in the winter like you are a duck in the frozen fridge  And super duper hot when you need it to be cold

title: Extremely User Friendly
review: The MRT is very easy to use with most everything being in two languages Thai and English Purchasing a ticket is easy as the first option on the ticket machines allows users to select English which is followed by a prompt to select your destination on the route map and then payment is made Most of the station machines I have used have machines that accept both bills and coins but the one station that had a machine that only accepted coins also had a manned ticket counter The stop announcements are made in English as well The stations and train cars are easy to use convenient have friendly helpful staff and are very clean  something some western cities should take note of when reviewing their own public transportation

title: Fast and easy!
review: Used the Sky Train from ASOK to the Market only cost 48Baht and it was a great way to see Bangkok

title: Fast - clean - cool
review: Whenever you have the choice of using your car  a taxi  a bus or the (BTS) sky train then use the train Nothing is faster When I visit Bangkok I always leave my car at the hotel parking and go by shy train No traffic and no police control will bother me   Just PERFECT

title: Easy and inexpensive
review: This is definitely the best way to travel into Bangkok  Whatever you do don't take a taxi or you will be sitting in traffic for hours

title: Xmas in Bangkok
review: A great & cheap alternative to a Taxi Check the timing as the 'local' line runs more often and is cheaper than the Express The transfer at Makkasan to the MRT isn't well sign posted but not too difficult to find & get to with baggage

title: Easy and clean!
review: I am more familiar with the BTS than the MRT but both are great transportation systems while in Bangkok It is cheap easy and has AC ) The BTS and MRT are so easy for foreigners like me because you either go this way or the other You can buy tickets from the kiosk and just follow the signs It is probably the best way to travel while in Bangkok since the traffic is horrible I would recommend the BTS or MRT unless you want to be stuck in traffic and pay more )

title: Cheap, fast, convenient.
review: Super inexpensive and if you have decent enough transit taking skill it's very convenient  The transfer at Makkasan for the MRT is a bit of a hike but it lets you access the city very quickly  Beats dealing with cabbies

title: A little bit confusing
review: They should upgrade the signage to bilingual as sone of it is a bit confusing But the service is good and the station is very clean

title: Great Choice
review: This Is A Very Great Choice Who Doesn't Have Much Luggage It's Very Fast And Comfortable Except The Doors Are Being Closed So Loud The Only Negative Thing is If You Miss The Train For City Line You my Have To Wait For Another One Around 12 Minutes And The Waiting Area In Other Station (Except The Airport) is Very Hot Since It Is Like Semi IndoorOutdoor Overall Very Great Choice For Avoiding Traffic In BKK

title: Cheap transfer
review: Try this if you are in Thailand it is easy to work out and you really get amongst it while getting to your destination for quarter the price of a taxi

title: Perfect transport solution
review: The system works always clean aircon the best way to get around Easy TO use pre paid and top up cards

title: Cooling down here,travelling around BKK
review: Perfect for travelling no que no trafficlot of people to meet fantastic commercial transportation

title: Takes you anywhere you need to go
review: Very quick & easy to follow where to go and trains very regular so you don't have to wait more than a couple of minutes to catch one

title: One of the best city transport systems in the world
review: Easy to navigate Reasonably priced and connects to the river boat system Go all over Bangkok without having to use a map and avoid Taxis drivers that will not turn on their meters and TucTucs that overcharge foriegners Use the Sky Train every time

title: Get above the traffic
review: Great way to travel and avoid Bangkok's congested streets The BTS is cheap air conditioned and runs very frequently Get from Sukhumvit to the Siam Paragon shopping Centre  also air conditioned The signage is in English and Thai route maps are clearly posted and change is available at all stations for the ticket machines Relax and enjoy

title: 6 hours from BKK worth a lifetime
review: We took on the real deal of hopping on the train from Bangkok to Kanchanaburi just to experience this historical railway It was worth every minute of our lives A peaceful journey that can inspire you to write a journal

title: Must use
review: Try to use the skytrain as much as possible very simple very cheap and no gimmicks like tuk tuks We used the skytrain to get to chatuchak market which took approximately 20 min and costed 40 bahts

title: Use it whenever you can to Suvarnabhumi
review: Avoid taxi's to the Suvarnabhumi as they are costly (over 1000 Baht) and he ride takes 152 hours sometimes This rail link takes than half an hour and is much cheaper Of course getting to one of he stations can be hard but there are various metro and Skytrain connection points

title: Fast & convenient
review: Easy to access from airport ticket machines are very userfriendly with clear instructions trains are clean

title: Air con!
review: Clean cool efficient way to travel around Bangkok

title: Faster way
review: Fast and cheap 😎 no traffic waiting good choice if u want travel from point to point Only before working hours and after hard to get in trains bet igs not a big problem if u are not in carry

title: Cool airport transfer
review: We used this as we trying to go to our hotel (there were 6 of us so taxi would be hard to look that can accommodate us with luggage) At night it would be less people so it would be easy for you to have a seat and have a room for your luggage It will go to the center of the city as we needed it to be

title: Extremely warm in summer but beats being stuck in jam
review: Unlike the MRT (platforms are airconditioned) BTS is above ground and you can literally melt waiting for the train during the hot months That said for someone who does not speak the local language and hates being stuck in traffic jams even the BTS is better than a taxi It is timely and inexpensive  I highly recommend that you get a BTS card to zip around so that you dont have to deal with coins and the long queues buying a ticket   Finally avoid the peak hours if u can Else be a sardine

title: Fast and Cheap!
review: Only 45Bt one way Splendid It was very easy to navigate around the airport on arrival Just take to Basement level and wala

title: The greatest answer to Bangkok traffic madness
review: Love it Easy to travel People are polite and accommodate in a crowded train Amazing movement to places in a traffic congested city

title: BTS TRANSPORT SAFE AND SECURE
review: I use the BTS to get around Bangkok It is clean safe and inexpensive Traffic in Bangkok is at times grid locked with taxi drivers not willing to go into heavy traffic areas The only problem is between 530pm to 7pm it is fairly crowded due to people heading home  BTS is easy to use fast and will drop you at areas to shop or eat Give it a go you will be impressed  John

title: The best
review: The best way to get to hotel in Bangkok and avoid daytime Bangkok traffic  Very easy and safe to get to Bangkok and to the airport

title: Superb!
review: Super fast way from the airport Thanks to interlinking with MRT and BTS you can get very fast to virtually any place in Bangkok

title: Excellent Mode of Transport
review: I still remember Bangkok before the Skytrain and the difference it has made is amazing I was able to travel from Sukhumvit to Silom do a few things and then return with a short stop to look at the Malls in Siam in about one and a half hours  that would have been impossible before If you are intending to use the system a lot the day tourist pass costing 140 baht is very reasonable and convenient The trains have strong air conditioning and the people are very disciplined getting on and off them The trains and stations are also very clean One shortcoming perhaps is the lack of escalators Most stations require you to climb a lot of steps before you get to the station which is probably very good for the health but can be a little tiresome at times There are also useful connections with the MRT metro system although you need a separate ticket for that

title: very convenient
review: crowded at peak time butgiven the traffic no better way to travel

title: most convenient
review: it connects to suvarnbhumi airport to phaya thai very cheap mode of transport from airport to city 2 types of trains  1 airport city line which halts at all stations 2 airport express takes u to city without halts

title: Slow with too many stops
review: I found the link is Slow with too many stops shame that they cancelled the express one Nothing more to say really next time I'll go by taxi

title: Good transport around bangkok
review: There was bts station nearby so used this frequently as transport as bike taxi are costly and normal taxis are stuck in traffic Good connectivity to tourist places nice frequency easy to view route and get informationStations have some small earing joints as well

title: Made Travel So Much Easier!
review: As soon as I arrived at the airport it was easy to navigate to the BTS The BTS covered most of the city so I was able to get to most locations and even my hotel The machines at the station only accept change but there are toll workers to supply change for bills The BTS is also cold so be prepared to take a jacket

title: Safe, fast and convenient!
review: I always use this public transportation since my place is close to the BTS station The station and the train are clean safe and situated in the middle of Bangkok and near the business area which can help decrease the traffic jam problems shorten travel time and reduce pollution The BTS officers are also polite and helpful A lot of big highend shopping malls famous firms and tourist attractions are mostly well connected along all BTS routes I can expedite and complete many missions or wish list within one day using this way

title: Perfekt transport from airport to city
review: We always take this train to siam from airport cheep and fast strongly recommend from or side its only one train change and go really quick Specially recommended when the high way have queue in morning time

title: Fast
review: it is very fast and cost only 40Baht to be in bts line in Bangkok I was use it last time 2 times to return back in only one afternoon

title: Use it if you can
review: Fast cheap clean air conditioned and not usually busy What is not to like about this Use it whenever you can and avoid sitting in the Bangkok traffic for hours An absolute no brainer tickets are easy to buy just have some change (coins) handy

title: Very handy
review: The skytrain is the best way for transportation in Bangkok because you An see the suroundings for better orientation Using the vendor machines is easy just click the station you want to go to select number of tickets and ready

title: Cheap for solo or couple of travelers with good information
review: Nana to Siam only 1015 mins In taxi 3040 mins depending on traffic Be aware while travelling more than 3 always prefer meter taxi where you pay according to meter Once we 6 got inside a meter taxi HAHAHAHAHAH the driver didnt complained this way cheaper than metro where you pay for single person Lots of information inside station which was helpful for travelers & tourists Automatic vending machines are easy to use

title: Cool and easy to use
review: A lot easier than travel by road Ticket machines easy to use as can select English Efficient and cheap transport

title: Awesome.
review: The skytain was simple cheap and cool  As foreigners we found our way around very easily The cashier clerk we initially spoke too helped us well on our way and from there it was easy

title: Fast, simple to use, AIRCON!
review: After weeks of budget trains buses and bikes going on this was so much fun They had aircon which is a luxury when the heat hits   The system is very easy to use cashiers also speak english

title: Clean, organized and inexpensive!
review: We live in India so seeing the BTS train is literally a breath of fresh air The stations and trains are clean and there are frequent trains The station staff and security guards were all very helpful to help direct us They really went out of their way There were plenty of elevators and escalators for us to use so taking luggage with us was not inconvenient

title: Excellent Public Transport
review: Really better than tuk tuk great connection low prices We took several times to go from my Hotel Sukosol to the main shopping centre Siam paragon

title: Easy to use but too crowd in the rush hours
review: Pros  Easy to use  Covers a lot of Bangkok  Consistency in time of arrival  Officers let you change for coins if you want to buy 1 time pass ticket  Cons  relatively expensive (100 bath balance + 50 bath card fee + 50 bath deposit with 15 bath for every station passed)  so crowded on rush hour

title: Easy to use
review: A very efficient mass transport system Just be aware of how it works Most tickets are purchased as one way and use coins into a machine Every entrance has a cash desk where they will either give you coins for the machine or is some cases give you a ticket To purchase a ticket get the correct fare in coins press the button for the fare you want say 40baht put in your coins and your ticket will appear from a slot The tickets are like credit cards and only go into the entrance barrier in one direction which is shown with an small arrow on the ticket When you reach your destination the exist barrier will keep your ticket so do not wait for it to come back out of the machine The stations are all numbered so easy to follow When you leave the station always make a note of the exit number so next time you will come out at the same point it is not easy to cross the road in some areas

title: Good way to get around the busy areas
review: Reliable and always on time Cheaper than getting a Tuk Tuk if you are only a 23 people group Can get rather crowded during busy hours but at least you get aircon inside

title: Do NOT take the train
review: The train will never get you anywhere on time They are almost always delayed a minimum of 4 hours Every time I take the train I always either miss the bus I'm supposed to catch afterwards or miss the connecting train that I am supposed to catch after The times are NEVER correct NEVER BUY JOINT TICKETS This is the fourth time I've been stranded for over 24 hours in a strange city missing my pre booked hotel bus or private taxi or ferry You would think I would have learned from the past three experiences but this is the last time If you ever have a connecting train you WILL MISS YOUR CONNECTION FROM DELAYS Save your money and buy a plane ticket The trains are old and derail constantly very dirty and are never on time I sincerely highly recommend taking a plane unless you have a minimum of 24 hours to waste And when their trains are late you get no refund on top of it

title: Runs like clockwork
review: So convenient and works so well although can be a bit daunting during busy times Informationticket kiosks are helpful when needed and everything is well signposted Take your time to read the signs or ask for help and soon you'll be on your way

title: Convenient transport
review: I can only recommend and at the end of the line you can find plenty of hotels for accommodation Just 20 min and you can save a lot of money for a taxi

title: Wow

title: Fast, efficient, but peak hours are madness
review: The Airport Rail Link is conveniently located at the airport and brings you to town areas such as Phaya Thai and Ratchaprarop   Exits at the stations are only numbered but do not indicate to which street they bring you to Other than elevators there are no downward riding escalators only staircases You also cannot purchase a token from one station but enter in another station even if the one you purchased from has a higher stored value Only tokens purchased at the station can be used there   I was at the Ratchaprarop station to catch the train to the airport at 650pm and the platform was packed with people  locals and tourists It was a stuffy and long wait especially since you most probably can't get up the first train that arrives One puzzling thing about the stations is given it is such a hot stuff smoky and humid country the train platforms are not equipped with fans or any sort You will be left melting into a heap of sweat while waiting

title: Relief from the heat

title: Hua Lamphong to Hua Hin.

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: We use the Skytrain whenever we are in Bangkok  While it can be crowded during rush hours the trains come frequently are clean air conditioned and so forth  Many parts of the system also have a Sky walk which is by far the most pedestrianfriendly part of Bangkok  If you are a frequent visitor or are staying for at least several days it is convenient to purchase a Skytrain card that can be loaded with however much you predict will be required and can be recharged as necessary this will save you a lot of time by avoiding the vending machines (which are OK but take a bit of time especially during busy times of the day)  The system is pretty good enabling the traveller to visit many of the most popular parts of Bangkok (though not all  it still takes a bit of effort to get to the Coronation Palace and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha for example)  The system is currently being extended so will improve even more in the future

title: 12Go.Asia sends Thai train trips off the rails
review: Booking trains in Thailand used to be straightforward and involved only dealing directly with courteous competent railway staff My most recent experience was wildly different My hotel called Hualamphong station for me to ask about trains to Hat Yai Oddly no one answered A nearby travel agent called the station for me a bit later and was told there were no tickets the next day for Hat Yai  Then I checked 12goasia which is trying to monopolize ticketing for Thai trains (Their pitch is that the station has long lines and they are helping you out by waiting in line and securing a ticket for you Mind you I've never seen a line of any length even in high season even for popular routes like to Chiang Mai a train I've taken a number of times)  In any case the 12goasia site indicated they had 20 ticketsodd since one can't buy blank tickets but rather must provide all passenger info on the spot so how could they have these to sell (Ticket scalping) Of course they don't give their phone number most likely because travelers might call with logical questions like how can you have tickets when the station supposedly doesn't And hey how much does your "service" add to the ticket cost (Note you will not discover their exorbitant commission till you get a receipt after purchase)  Nevertheless as I needed to leave the next day I took a chance and ordered online with 12GoAsia  Let it be known 12goasia is a ripoff and should be avoided at all costs I specifically asked for fan sleeper which I absolutely did not get I also ended up with a rearfacing seat as they do not even have a way to indicate a preference And although they are right across from Hualamphong train station (and seem to buy up tickets in advance leaving you no chance to avoid their "service") they take a long time to confirm the ticket perhaps hoping to get some buyers willing to pay for their "priority service" so they can bump people who ordered sooner Their order form also defaults to include a 1day insurance policy for 70 baht What a scam And the fee for their "service" 12goasia charged me 250 baht for a ticket that cost only about 500 baht That is a 50% commission  As for trip a horrible train I took this same trip in the other direction in 2013 with no issues This time however the train (though not the bedding) was dirty and there were no supplies in toilet also it was supposed to be a fan sleeper but was instead FREEZING COLD AC which sucked because I was upper bunk with a vent blowing directly on my head It was impossible to sleep anyway because all the lights were left on all night (which was not the case the other 4 times I've taken overnight trains in Thailand) The AC cut out at 430am and then it got suffocating because no fans were turned on until all beds were put away by which time it was stifling hot (Note although smoking is prohibited on Thai trains you'll encounter plenty of violators and no one seems to get fined despite signs to the contrary) I've visited Thailand 5 times in 25 years and never had booking problems until now Go to the train station and do not ever deal with 12goasia

title: Good or bad depends on your plans.
review: Taking the airport link is either a good idea or a bad idea First off it is very inexpensive if you are traveling alone and have few bags that are easy to lug around However it also requires that your final destination in near one of the stops of the various rail options in Bangkok as they all inter connect  A plus is it does get you past the bulk of Bangkok’s notorious traffic The down side is the monster traffic is only for a few kilometers and likely near your destination If you are not certain about the traffic real time updates can be found on Google Maps and other apps helping your decisions   Assuming you would look at savings taking a metered taxi to the Nana area may cost you about 300 Baht total  Where taking the Airport link would cost about 75 Baht total (per person) using the BTS Skytrain and the Airport link together to get you in the neighborhood Personally I would take a metered taxi and get delivered to the lobby of my hotel as after a long flight cramped up in a seat for endless hours extra effort is not appealing That sounds a whole lot better as opposed to becoming a pack mule with my bags on the Airport link and hoofing the last leg to where I would stay  So know where you are going and know how far you need to walk is the basic consideration to using the link

title: Airport Rail Link

title: Very Useful & Reliable

title: Good idea, cheap but executed badly
review: I've used this a few times and find it has good and bad elements    The positives first  It is clean fast cheap runs fairly frequently directions are clear and the staff are very helpful  You can choose the 'express' which stops once or twice or the slower one that stops more frequently  The negatives  It is not well integrated into any other infrastructure  You will need to haul your luggage from the destination station to the BTS or even (sometimes) to the main road to find a taxi  Sometimes taxis are waiting at the exit  sometimes not  I am sure this will improve but for now it is a pain  It is also unreliable in my experience  Twice I have had to change plans because the trains were not running  Again this may be due to teething problems
