title: Too fast and cheap
review: A taxi to the airport can cost more that 600 bath but this one was only 44 to go to a very central station in the city Don't doubt It is easy the airport is really clear in signs to get to the station inside

title: Super efficient, super air conditioned!
review: Do you need to get to your destination AND sweat less while in Bangkok Then I have a great option for you Quicker than a nonmetered taxi stuck in traffic Less exhaust than a tuk tuk BTS Skytrain is where it's at

title: Clean and efficient
review: I didn't expect the BTS Skytrain to be that clean and efficient in Bangkok This is the best way to travel in the city Quiet neat and with great views on the city

title: It's good for safe the time to the airport. but it should open early.
review: I live far away from the airport so much but this it open lately If you have a flight on the morning It's not good for waiting it until it is open

title: Great to get away from the hustle and bustle on street level
review: I have ridden on the train a few times On this occasion I just took the train from National Stadium to Bang Wa and return The trains are clean The seating is minimal It is airconditioned Staff at the stations are helpful The ticketing system is confusing

title: Excellent mode of city transport
review: Very convenient to travel around Bangkok Importantly can avoid traffic jam in the city The staff also very helpful to assist us how to use the ticketing machine

title: Cool, Quick & Comfortable!
review: I always stay in the "Sukhumvit" area as that's been my 'focalpoint' for manyyears And as such my traveloptions are limited to "taxi" "TukTuk" "Subway" or "BTS" with this being my alltime favorite  And because the Thai government has made it convenient fast inexpensive & airconditioned the locals love it too & can afford to use it So expect it to be "crowded" (most of the time) but well worth this 'minorinconvenience'  Further "routemaps" are everywhere in the Stations & onboard the trains & are 'easy to read' And of course IF you 'get lost' some friendly Thai will be glad to helpout  Good travels

title: best way to get around to many places
review: Not so much an attraction this is a very good way to get around significant parts of Bangkok It's very tourist friendly and i would say extremely good value Easy to use with very logical pricing structure based on stationtostaion ticketing Occasionally the station announcement system fails (provided in both Thai and English) but easy to rectify mistakes without additional cost Ticket machines easy to use and service staff also available to help (eg to give change if all you have is largedenomination notes)

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: I remember when it first started it used to be empty now people keep hanging out of the train Its jammed pack all the time but worth every penny for a quick ride across the city They should extend the network to other parts of Bangkok

title: Quick & convenient
review: BTS Sky train in the best & convenient to work around bangkok The service is frequency of the train in top class

title: Not bad but could be easier to get to
review: The airport link was difficult to get to as our hotel was a little far but it was convenient to get to the airport once I got there with my family As you may know the traffic in bangkok can be horrible this definitely helped us give plenty of time before our flight

title: Convenient to everywhere but too crowded
review: Convenient for those who come Bangkok from Suvarnabhumi  airport to town But it was very very very crowded when peak hour

title: Best way to go around
review: Bangkok is just like any other key cities  very chaotic  However best way to go is to use the tube  Fast clean and well maintained though you needed to avoid getting caught in between those doors once you hear the warning sound to avoid ending up like some of the tourists we saw in one particular day

title: Fast & Clean
review: I was pleasantly surprised by the swift and efficient BTS Skytrain Sure the route is very limited but I found that if you could incorporate it with the MRT and a little walking here and there you'd almost always beat the traffic on the roads

title: Best thing in Thailand
review: Not really but its very efficient fast goes every where you would want and connects to other transport systems in Bangkok At 130 Baht a day you cant beat ths mode of transport Shopping centres waterways attractions buy a card as soon as you arrive it lasts untill 12 pm that day You can get a card for a single day or 1 month or just buy a 1 stop ticket The infomation staff all speak perfect english and are very helpfull No food or drink to be consumed on the train system

title: Great
review: Takes you to the malls party areas  very clean  easy to use  if possible always take the train is faster than driving or taking a cab

title: Clean and  Fast Transportation
review: After I visited Malaysia and the Philippines  I think Bangkok  BTS is the best for cleaning  The system is not the most comfortable as MRT ( subway )   I will exchange the coin for the ticket vender machine but the service and maintenance is quite great

title: Back in time
review: We took the death railway from Bangkok to Kanchanaburi Already the station in Bangkok Thonburi  is a voyage back in time There are some old locks around the station you can have a look at and walk around  nobody cares The people who live in the area and are crossing the rails are doing so by crossing the waiting trains Getting in a wagon crossing it and descending on the other side  funny to observe The train is not very fast and you won't take it on your way back should you return to Bangkok But one way it's a nice thing to do

title: Not great going to the airport
review: My review is based on personal experience of 4 of us using the link to get to the airport from central Bangkok    I'm confident going from the airport to the city is much better But from the city It's hard work  All four of us had a large suitcase each plus our carry on bags The train was absolutely packed I squeezed myself on and wiggled my way down the carriage as far as I could thinking the rest were behind me The doors closed I turned around to see I was the only one of our group who'd made it on  At the next stop people wanting to get off had to pretty much climb over me most huffing and puffing and no doubt cursing me in Thai  After about 3 or 4 stops the carriage became less crowded and I was able to get a seat I arrived at the airport and waited for the rest of my group  Thankfully they arrived on the next train but told me they had to literally barge their way on the train upsetting lots of people    This train really isn't set up for people with luggage wanting a comfortable ride to the airport It's really a commuter train that just happens to go to the airport There isn't anywhere to put your luggage so you block the walk way It's really not very good and is quite stressful    I would only recommend using it to go from the airport to the city As it won't be full of commuters Just like minded people   For the money we saved it really wasn't worth the hassle We'll be taking a taxi next time

title: Touristy but Interesting
review: We enjoyed the tour A good way to spend the day with minimal effort  The floating market was geared  more for tourists A little less so at the railway market since local people were shopping there as well  The vendors were polite friendly and not pushy at all

title: Great public transport
review: A very quick clean and cheap way to get from the centre of town to the airport with a frequent service

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: A cheap and easy way to get around Bangkok Buy a 'Rabbit Card' ( like a London Oyster card) if you are staying a more than 2 days in Bangkok as it saves messing Around with tickets very clean stations an d trains with clear signposting in Thai & English

title: convinent transport & reasonable price
review: if yr hotel near to bts good to use the airport rail to avoid the traffic jam my suggestion for improvement should hv  a direct service to city maybe once every hr

title: Convenient...
review: Is very convenient Easy Every year getting better and better This time now can see on the train map have English description(eg Siam station "Central World") but also realise is not have it on every map Tip If you don't know how or which stop you should go Just goto the ticket counter tell them where you They will just give you the ticketEasy Thai people are very friendlyas soon as they see the eldest or child they will give you their seat

title: Good and functional transportation
review: A very good alternativ to tuktuks and taxi's in bangkok A daypass cost 140 baht and you can go wherever you want from 06 in the morning to midnight Go to Asok station and taste all the different kinds of food in terminal 21 or go to other malls at Siam station or the weekend marked at Mo Chit station or go to the Lumphini park at Sala Daeng station

title: Confusion about the rail link
review: The fast link is suspended The local trains run on the same track and are pretty efficient The airport is easy to navigate but the Bangkok urban light rail is limited and it is far too easy to find yourself a mile form your hotel spend an hour in a taxi going nowhere or battling with suitcases up and down crowded staircases and taking your life in your hands to cross roads filled with mad traffic watch out for the motorbikes using the wrong side of the road

title: Great
review: The best and the fastest way to go from the airport to your hotel Very good connected with other ways of public transportation Cheepclean and out of dirty roads

title: Excellent!
review: Really good  It's affordable comfortable fast air conditioned and very easy to use  Two stops worth noting are Makhasan for the MRT and Praya Thai for the skytrain  The service is reliable and safe  I strongly recommend using this rather than a taxi or bus as it is far faster and safer than road transport  If you're heading to Khao San Road area get off at Makhasan and catch the MRT to Hua Lumphong then either walk or take a taxi from there  Fastest cheapest and safest method

title: Efficient, cheap and convenient.
review: Get yourself a smartcard load it up and explore Bangkok  Trains run every couple of minutes stations are busy but well signed

title: Convenient
review: Frequency was a little Low and gets crowded with each passing station However it serves as a great link to the other lines in Bangkok

title: Efficient & Cheap Bangkok Transport
review: Built since last visit to Bangkok The Skytrain and underground are the most efficient & cheap method of transport to see the sights  Bangkok roads are jammed with traffic and Tuk Tuks are now more of a tourist transport and get stuck in the same traffic plus can be expensive you need to barter on cost Like most things in Thailand

title: Bangkok Train Station
review: Bangkok owns three types of train if I am not mistaken it is a BTS which is a skytrain type where the train never hits underground unlike their MRT which stays underground and the other one is common train I have tried their BTS and MRT system and we loved both They are clean and we do not have to wait too long for train to come The downside is they do not provide you with time arrival information unlike one in Singapore

title: Efficient and Easy
review: The best way to travel from one place to the other in Bangkok considering the traffic situation there  Almost all places are well connected by the BTS Trains are comfortable and airconditioned and tickets can be bought from the ticket machine or sometimes at the counters in some places

title: Easy transport to use
review: We have used the BTS every time we have visited Bangkok It's easy to use and runs 24x7 You can get day passes and jump on and off when needed which we found a great way to get around and explore on

title: A real deal if you aren't packing much stuff and want to go where BTS or MRT goes.
review: This is a clean fast smooth incredibly cheap way to get to town IF you arrive during operating hours (last time I checked it stopped at midnight)    you can find the routes and time schedules online   Also if you take BTS or MRT to the closest point to your final destination you can catch a taxi at that station and save a bunch of bucks over airport taxi  BUT if you arrive tired or are packing more than one medium sized suitcase forget it  All stations don't provide a lift (all do have escalators) and trains are packed in AMPM rush or after school

title: Clean convenient and cheap
review: We took the BTS to most places It can get very crowded during peak hours but we could manage it The only grouse is that some stations were only accessible via stairs and may be a challenge for elderly folks

title: Quick and Easy
review: This is best way to get to and from airport Takes very little time and is not usually too busy Price is reasonable

title: Great time and money saver.
review: Eventhough can be tight in the rush hours the skytrains (and mrt) lines save a lot of time and money It's the best way to move around bangkok and must be familiar with In addition many many attractions in bangkok are stated near the skytrains stations

title: super convenient
review: super convenient for your to reach the city center which you dont have to do much walking in the airport this rail link brings you straight to Phaya Thai for transit you can the hop onto BTS or bus or whatever your transport maybe

title: Efficient but nothing special
review: Not sure why this is considered a 'must do' while visiting Bangkok  Yes it is a good way to get around but then so are the train systems in many cities Being overground it does give a good view of all the high rise buildings but had we not used it during our stay it would not have mattered  We still saw all we wanted to by travelling at ground level by taxi and tuktuk  It really is just another city rail system

title: To log waiting time on platform
review: Do not use this train during peak morning time It is overcrowded and very inconvenient if you have a lot of luggage

title: Cheap travel
review: The sky train is a very cheap way to travel in Bangkok From the outside it doesn't look to have any windows but from the inside it's very different Roomy inside very simpler to the tube in London Only 2 lines at the moment

title: Suvarnabhumi Airport Transfer to Sukhumvit Road
review: This is a quick and cheap airport transferget the airport express train to BTS Station Phaya ThaiThe cost is 40 Bhat and the journey time is 30 minsthen use the BTS to the Sukhumvit Station closest to your hotelit cost me 35 Bhat to Asokso for a total of only 75 Bhat and 40 mins i was within a five min walk to my hotel

title: The best way to get around - inexpensive, air conditioned and reliable.
review: We always take the Skytrain  It is convenient on time clean air conditioned and the people aren't scary  We went to the Weekend Market and purchased WAY to many things  The Officer at the station helped us with our things and the people on the train made room for us with smiles

title: Clean transport
review: For those wishing to use the Skytrain a lot then worthwhile purchasing a 'Rabbit' travelcard Saved us heaps and you do not have to queue at the ticket machines for each journey which can get very busy at times

title: Gets you from A to B - With A/C
review: It's a train what more is to be said I rode it the first time I visited in 2007 and rode it this last trip (2017) The trains have improved a lot frequency and AC is much better

title: Great Time saver
review: Might be more expensive for a group of 4 But saves a lot of time I would stay only next to a BTS

title: If you are ever lost in Bangkok!
review: The staff at the sky train ticket office were amazing I showed them where we needed to go on my phone and they drew in several colleagues to help plan the best route to this out of the way place  so helpful Just ask them and they will sort you out

title: Travel with Ease
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok  so much easier than by road Thais are very polite on the Sky Train always waiting to get on in neat rows and stopping when the train is full Very little of the pushing and shoving the you experience in European capitals And very reasonably priced

title: Surely up there with the best
review: A great way to get around the city and dirt cheap too Aircon and a tv in all carriages and the usual Thai eentry and exit technique So civilised

title: So easy to use and get around
review: So very easy to use and get around  You would be silly to bypass this easy travel  Ticket machines are easy to use and change for these can be found at the manned ticket booths

title: good public transportation
review: be convenient to go around the city But I expect that there is a ticket system to connect all kind of public transportation (bus MRT BTS airport rail link) so we only need to buy ticket card one time

title: Amazing transportation
review: We loved our trips on the BTS  Miss all the bumper to bumper traffic and get off at stations located in close proximity of where we wanted to go We went 13 stops and Cole us 59baht each Not bad at all Usually standing room only as seats only on sides but I guess that's how you fit more people in Highly recommend a trip on the BTS

title: Hassle Free
review: This is a life saver of stress for many years landing into Bangkok was a hassle dealing with queues of people waiting for taxies and then pay for all the toll fees on top of the taxi fare and they would still want to rip you off and if you didn't want to wait you could get a taxi that was not on the taxi rank would refuse to turn on his meter and might try to rob you as well the rail link from the Airport to city center is a god send you just use the interchange at Phaya Thai Station to where ever you want to go in the city totally stress free and very cheap about 50 Bhat to city center if you can always you this transport system to the city

title: Simple and easy to use
review: First time i was in Bangkok and it was very simple and good way to use it Also it is conditioned and you have air because the train is really crowded

title: Skytrain
review: Easy to understand and to get around particularly when road traffic can be a bit hectic Plus great aircon which can be a wonderful respite from the heat and humidity

title: Fast, efficient and no traffic!!!
review: The only traffic you battle with on the BTS is human traffic Otherwise the commuting time between stations are relatively quick Takes just 15 minutes from Siam to Victory Monument  Also a single ride typically costs about 25 baht If you're a solo traveller it is worth the money Otherwise cabs are more of value for a larger group because when you divide the amount you pay lesser for more comfort

title: A blessing for city traffic!
review: By far the best organized and maintained transport sytem in Thailand and in my opinion a muststudy object for most of city majors worldwide Extremely effective highly appreciated by the public and almost never out of order Very easy to use and to understand all stations have change counters Sometimes very crowded which is compensated by the high frequency of traines Eating drinking smoking is striktly prohibited 'Use it almost daily and never had a negative experience even during (very) late evening It's not working between midnight and 6 am

title: Great transportation
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok and clean as a whistle It’s easy to learn the system and inexpensive to ride The skytrain will take you to varous places along the river we can catch a ferry and meander through the center Bangkok

title: Best public metro transport system anywhere...
review: As downtown Bangkok residents we use the BTS system on a daily basis and would be completely buggered without it Easily one of the most efficient and effective public metro systems anywhere we have lived Runs like clockwork but it does get very busy during peak times so don't be afraid to barge your way onto the train and squeeze in

title: Busy but fast
review: Grab your rabbit card and get around the city much faster than in a taxi Unfortunate that it doesn't have more locations and stops

title: great experience
review: So safe easy way to move in bkk avoiding traffic jam I was so impressed how clean and modern it is ppl were totally kind so easy to buy the ticket u only have to get sure what station u gonna leave because u nee to choose the last one before entering)

title: Interesting experience
review: It was a good experience If you are in Bangkok spend some time for getting lost in Bangkok using BTS Feel the "local experience" during rush hours using this mode of transportation Me and my friend went to Siam shopping centre We went for a walk from the hotel to the station 12 km and didn't feel like a long walk So many things to see We departed from Saphan Khwai station to Siam station Don't worry about the language Each station has English translation   A little tip at Siam station the vending ticket only accepted coins You need to change your notes at the counter

title: Good Tour
review: Tourist is kind lots of good food and souvenirs and many cute animals to take pic specially the coconut is sweet the boat riding was very fun many good places to take pic very comfy ride too and don’t recommend if u don’t like crowd place people are friendly too can visit alone

title: good for transpotation from airport to city
review: if you no have luggage you should use this airport rail link cheap and save but i think the train should be large and faster than current

title: Convenient but..
review: If you are some people together pool and tak a taxi  it`ll be directly to your hotelhostel etc and the price wont be more either then

title: Do it
review: This is the best way to get to your hotel Cost 45 baht per person and takes 30 minutes Links to the bts which will take you near to most central hotels

title: Its okay but gets busy
review: Definitely a fast way into Bangkok better if you dont have a lot of suitcases though unfortunately the trains are too small and everyone uses them for normal transport so they get packed but good from the airport and beats getting ripped off by nasty taxi drivers

title: The Best Way to Get Around Bangkok!
review: The BTS is cheap fast clean and the only way to make it from one end of Bangkok to the other in the minimum of time The ticket wickets only give change or top up for your Rabbit card to use instead of individual trip cards You must buy the individual tickets from the ticket machines The Rabbit card costs about 50 or 100B so not worth it unless you are staying in Bangkok for a few weeks or more

title: Convenience means of transport in Bangkok
review: At first I used a Limo from Airport to the hotel traffic gets horrible sometimesand I got into one of this traffics  A 1 hour drive became 3hrs and that was a good lesson as from then I asked about alternative means of transport and BTS skytrain became handy it will take you to many of the places in bangkok it si very clean with working air condition there is one after every 5 minutes so you dont stay waiting for too long On my way back i used BTS skytrain from my hotel to the airportthere is no traffic jams with BTS skytrain and hence more convenient way if you want to get somewhere on time  It is cheaper too it costed me 69BHT (2$) for the same distance which costed 1200BHT (39$) with a limo   Taxi use taximeters the drivers are so naughty they will take long route unnecessarily and or go at a lower speed just to make you pay more  I recommend BTS Skytrain as your convenientsafe and cheap means of transportation while in bangkok

title: Wrap it up I'll take it.
review: I don't have vast experience with the world's mass public transport systems but this one works for me Cheap and efficient If they had this in my home town (Melbourne Australia) a non user would become a user

title: An efficient way to get around the city center
review: I finally took my first trip(s) on the Skytrain Once you get the hang of destinationticket pricing it is quite straight forward Much better in off peak peak hours are a full on sardine can session without the orderliness and discipline of the Hong Kong underground

title: Very convenient and easy !
review: The BTS in Thailand is super easy to use The signs there are in Thai and English so it is pretty much easy to use It is not that expensive so if you are planning to go to different places from morning to night it is better to buy the OneDay ticket as it is cheaper that way and it will not become a hassle if you have to buy onebyone through the ticket machine Though it is advisable to avoid the rush hours for example 5pm onwards because it can be very crowded especially on station that is popular such as Siam Overall it is a good way other than taxis or tuktuk if you want to get to places It is quite clean as well

title: Easy to use
review: Ticketing is via a touchscreen which with 1 press can be all in English   You select stops graphically so as long as you know the name of the stop next to where you want to go it's a very easy to use system takes notes or coins

title: Easy to use as a tourist
review: So easy to navigate and very cheap to use  Go between the skytrain and metro easily   Reliable on time and frequent

title: Similar to a metro in india
review: It is an average experienceeconomical to travelIt is neat and clean Not  very well connected tough

title: Easy, clean, cheap
review: For 50 baht you can grab the link to the airport  The cars are big and clean  The ride is fast and drops you right off at the airport

title: Easy to navigate
review: Well run and extremely cheap We used the BTS to travel round Bangkok The staff are very helpful especially if you know a few thai words

title: Just checking the box
review: Tourist attraction to check off  list in Bangkok but if you miss it… meh Long ride to and from destination Guide gave lots of info while on bus Food was awesome  Boats were relaxing actually liked it Drive to and from was what wasn’t great but not reflection of tour company Not dropped of at your initial pick up at hotel Wasn’t aware of that

title: Would catch it again
review: Caught the train from the airport to bangkok Very fast clean and modern I found it not that costly and very comfortable

title: Good service
review: This is the most fasted way to go in Bangkok As you will be in the city you can bring a Taxi to hotel Easy way

title: Fast and Cheap to the Airport
review: I paid 42 baht from Silom to Phaya Thai on the  Skytrain Another 45 baht from there to the Airport on the Express train Total travel time was approx 55mins  You can't beat it for a deal on travel to the airport

title: Efficient
review: Very convenient May be packed during peak hours and the queues may be long then Fastest way to travel along with the MRT especially in the heavy traffic areas

title: Very good experience
review: Very well organisedno fussefficientpublic transport system I took the various routes traveling from the Airport to almost the extreme end of Bangkok

title: Excellent
review: Excellent efficient transport system in Thailand Bangkok always on time clean and friendly staff to all parts of Bangkok amazing transport

title: Best Airport Link
review: I went Swaranbhumi Airport through Sky Train in Bangkok I did not face any problemThe easy n best way to Airport Link is Sky Train

title: The ONLY way to avoid Bangkok traffic
review: Fortunately we had been to Bangkok previously and were familiar with the BTS system  It's a great way (only way) to avoid Bangkok traffic  Very efficient

title: Brilliant
review: A brilliant train system  So easy to use and easy to get to any part of the city very cheap clean great aircon I wish we had this system in my city

title: Good mode of transportation to the station
review: Its easy and economical way to get to the city and back to the airport During peak hours it gets crowded and therefore keep sometime handy if you need to catch a flight

title: Exciting Adventure
review: If you're going to Chiang Mai you've got to try this Here are a few handy guidlines 01}  Book early to get the date you want 02} Book with 12GOASIA Overnight sleeper fan class II (No need for AC) 03} Book a lower berth more width than upper bunk less noise from fan and a window 04} If you have a suitcase bring a luggage strap Tie case with strap to ladder leading to upper bunk This keeps your case from tipping and safe For extra security cycle lock 05} Bring your own water food and drink 06} We went in February it only got a bit cold for a few hours in night 07} The worst thing was the toilet Basin virtually on the floor 14 hours to test your balance skills ladies Not always toilet roll so bring your own along with waterproof shoes eg crocs goes without saying hand sanitiser 08} Exchange your voucher for ticket the day before departure 09} Get to the train station at least one hour before departure This gives you time to find platform train carriage and seats also great to get settled and relax Overall this was a great choice of travel to Chiang Mai The bed was clean and comfortable I'm 6'1" and I was able to stretch out fully The blanket provided was adequate Slept on and off for most of night checking my wife and suitcases when awake From about 0630 the views out of the window were amazing The only thing I would change would be the AC day return passenger train back to Bangkok for a plane as this wastes a precious day of your holiday

title: Most fast connection transport
review: Most fast connection transport to long distancesThe fare is comparable to those of taxis but the big traffic is a good solution

title: Fast Easy and Very Convenient.
review: Had to rush some documents out to the airport last Friday so took the Airport Rail Link from Ratchaparop Station Delivered us directly into the Terminal and took the lift to Level 4 Checkin to meet the passenger Reverse to Makkasan Station back in to city Forty Baht each way waited no longer than 11 minutes for the train

title: Great affordable transport.
review: So very cheap to travel on the BTScleancomfortable and large windows for the city views The trains run in frequent intervals from the airport (international) to many parts of the cityit's usually our first form of transport upon arrival

title: Quick, quiet, inexpensive transport airport to center city
review: This is a super cheap air conditioned way to avoid Bangkok's infamous traffic if your hotel is in the center city

title: Transport
review: Excellent service and quite convenient given its connection to the BTS Luggage is an issue if like me your wife can't travel with the full kit

title: Excellent mode of Transport
review: Bangkok city has a lot of road traffic and it is much more especially in the morning and evening peak hours We witnessed during our travel to and from the airport Hence during the entire stay we travelled using BTS The BTS service is very good We went to MBK centre using BTS Infact MBK is directly connected to National Stadium station  We went for Chao Praya river cruise using the BTS and getting down at Saphan Taksin station This station is directly connected to the pier for going for cruise Overall the connectivity of BTS is very good and feel it is the best mode of transport in Bangkok

title: So easy to use
review: Quick simple to use frequent service Often very busy around Siam but no pushy crowds  Doesn't reach far enough into Chinatown and the Old city

title: Very convenient form of transport
review: Fast and reliable connecting to most parts You will need only to walk a few min from any station to points of interest For longer stays you may want to get the rabbit card unlike the one way journey cards

title: Very easy
review: I like the BTS train system because depending on where you go that's how much you're charged Unlike the train station in the states it's not a solid fee With the BTS if you have to go one stop it'll cost you a few but  if you have to go further then the price increases The train system is very organized and clean Have fun taking this around the city

title: fast but expensive
review: If your destination is on the way of the skytrain it is a fast clean and convenient public transportation One way ticket are very expensive

title: Great service
review: Clean frequent air conditioned the BTS is fantastic What a shame there isn't a standard ticket system across the ts mrt etc

title: Accessible and Convenient
review: Sky train is very accessible from many parts of Bangkok and its really cheap and easy to use In the train itself they state the attraction sites on a particular train station so that travelers know where they could alight It is also safe and very comfortable

title: The fastest and most easy to city center from Airport
review: i have used this line 6 time since i must come back and pick up my friend to hotel cannot imagine what then if Bangkok dont have this line or my friend's landing in Don Muong Airport

title: Easy to use
review: Cheap and easy to use staff are very helpful if only Myki in Melbourne was as easy   Comfortable ride and easy to work out where you are or where you are going

title: BTS
review: The skytrain or BTS as it's called is the best way to get around Bangkok  Quite cheap  plenty of stations and it's above ground  RECOMENDED

title: Excellent Connectivity
review: If you ever come to Bangkok  then Airpot rail link is the best way to connect from the city  You can take a airpot rail link from 6am till midnight  The rail link starts from airpot at 6 am to Phaya thai and the last rail link to airpot is at 1130pm from phaya thai   Thailand infrastruture is good when the topic comes about connectivity

title: Essential to get into Bangkok within an hour
review: The train is excellent and saves a great deal of time over taxis in Bangkok It's easy to access from the airport and even travelling with luggage access via lifts and escalators are no issue The train takes about 30 minutes to get into Phaya Thai the end  of the line There are various interchanges to Metro and the Skytrain so I'd always advocate the use of this It's especially cheap at 35 Bhat per person

title: Cheap, aircon but very busy you never get a seat
review: A good way to beat the traffic fast clean modern but you will never hope for a seat cheap too Idea for getting around Bangkok

title: If you have important appointment, you should try!
review: Traffic in Bangkok is truly congested All roads are stuck in the traffic jam especially at rush hour BTS and MRT are the choices you should not miss

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: An effective and inexpensive way to get around Bangkok You can use this along with taxis to stay out of the traffic jams

title: Very efficient
review: A great train service and not expensive It gets busy so you do get a good local flavour We used it most days and it seems very reliable  We went from the river to the shopping malls in about 25 minutes I think

title: Very unique experiences, and well-organized tour
review: This was a very well organized tour Pat our guide was very informative of all the places route history culture and specific guidance also for foreign tourists Especially her tips about cultural practices sensitivities foods and shopping guidance on the tour were excellent Not just a tour guide but she is an accomplished photographer as well Maeklong Railway Market is definitely a unique place and experience The tour ensured that our timing was excellent so that in a short span of time we experienced both arriving in the train itself with view from inside and also the view from outside as the trian left the station and passed through the market again While in between we experienced the market which still is an authentic and locally fully functional place Damnoen Saduak floating market as rightly pointed out by many has now become almost fully geared towards visiting tourists mostly with food merchandise and souveniers There remain few locally relevant vegetable and merchandize sellers etc That being the case I would still highly recommend the place as it still is again a very unique experience for visitors from other parts of the globe esp if one has not visited any other floating markets before

title: Nice transportation
review: Nice transportation and it stop in a famous place It help us to saving than take a taxi It connected to other train like MRT and airport rail link I hope my country can have transport like that also Its comfort and cheap And the train come every 5 min Fot BTS  you need buy ticket on ticket machine but it easy just read the intruction )

title: Dont waste your money on a Taxi
review: Unless you are carrying a ton of Baggage you can take this cheap Airport Rail link directly into the heart of Bangkok and vice versa

title: Fast way to approach
review: The sky train experience was niceit is the fastest way to approach at the required area as compared with the Taxi or Bus Very fast service  with the availability of repeated train service every 10 to 15 minutes

title: Cleanest and most air conditioned place in the city
review: The sky train is super clean affordable and the the air conditioning very cool The trains run often A great way to travel around Bangkok

title: Excellent
review: Used the airport link on our first arrival ever in Bangkok  Extremely easy to use clean and so cheap compared to haggling for taxis we found this so convenient  Would highly recommend if your hotel is close to an airport link station  We did it with 4 of us and huge suitcases with ease

title: save on traffic
review: Use the service quite regularly to travel to and from Airport to Bangkok service runs frequently and is always on time very fast transport both ways and always faster than a taxi if you know what the traffic is like in Bangkok cheap and reliable

title: Train and commercial traffic in Asia versus Norway.
review: I am mostly surprised of how good these offers are in comparison to the one I know in Norway Thailand is way way better

title: Very Clean and convenient
review: I have been to many countries and this is one of the cleanest one Even some of the train in Europe are old and noisy Unfortunately it didn't reach to Grand Palace but it is stay a great transportation choice for tourists

title: So easy
review: I love the BTS skytrain It's quick easy & cheap Get a day pass if you are hopping on and off regularly About AUD$7 per day

title: Very easy and convenient way to get around
review: MRT is a cheap and convenient way to travel around Bangkok Actually because we visited during the coronation it was free travel for 2 days You cannot get cheaper than that  The MRT (underground) carriages are quite wide but it gets very busy We were packed in like sardines and not everyone got on At least it is air conditioned   You do get mobile signal which is very convenient because I was able to google my next intended destination whist travelling

title: Fast and cheap
review: I took the airport rail for a few times when I was staying at Baiyoke Sky hotel  The service was fast and cost very cheap cabins were cleaned and plenty of space within  However if you are not staying at a nearby hotel the roads beneath the rail can be rather challenging  Most of the roads have pockets of pots and holes making it rather different to push your trolley bags unless you only have hand carried or backpack it will be very difficult to travel across anywhere  There are no proper roads or transportation (eg taxi stand) for proper pick up and drop off  It will be rather dangerous to stand at the roadsides with all your bags trying to flag down a cab esp during peak hours

title: Danger ..safety issues
review: Beware of taking the train between Bangkok  and Chiang Mai   There were two derailments in July 2013 and one caused multiple injuries There has been another derailment in August Then problem is in the northern section where a single track line goes through the jungle long tunnels and bridges After seeing one complete train on its side beside the track we cancelled our return tickets and took a plane  Also take officialclaims that the tracks will be repaired and duplicated by the end of the year Given the terrain extensive tunnels and bridges this is a huge project and will take much longer

title: Easy to use
review: Best way to travel to get to some of Bangkok's tourist attractions Very well organized and you can avoid the Bangkok's heavy traffic

title: The best way to move in Bangkok
review: Mobility in Bangkok is a madness too much hot to move walking too much caos by car Fortunately they have the BTS Sky train to let you move faster and quite comfortable to almost all important places in the city and for a few amount of money

title: spectacular business
review: to see very spectacular but too many people in our photos we see there on phones 🤣it's really a popular business but you can say have the view

title: Fun
review: You can go around the city with this you can buy one way ticket or a day pass ticket like tourist ticket

title: Advisable!

title: Super easy
review: Great alternative to the traffic you will undoubtedly hit if you're driving into Sukhumvit  Connection to MRT also

title: Very convenient
review: To avoid the traffic you d better use that 40 baht per person  Direct access from the airports take 35 min to get at the terminal

title: Fast
review: Great way of traveling Clear maps safe boarding Fast way of travel in the city Cool temperature

title: Easy and cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: Every time I go to Bangkok I use the Skytrain system it's fast and cheap Only problem is overcrowding especially at peak times in the middle of the city Buy a stored vale card for around 200ThB and add another 100ThB and it's typically enough for 2 or 3 days

title: Cheap and fast way from the airport to the city
review: Bangkok now has a train link to the city It links up with the skytrain to give you cheap fast connections Depending on where yoy are going you may need to buy two separate tickets and change trains even a few times Cost is low especially relative to taxi charges and the traffic that they need to overcome

title: Excellent and should be expanded
review: It's fast reasonably priced super clean with ample space for sitting standing smart handlebars (the branch out like trees) the only drawback is that it doesn't have as many lines one might want  you have to transfer to the Metro to get to a lot of places

title: Easy and Clean
review: Vending machin and train station in Thai and Englisha train every 3 minutes Simple to use cheap clean and safe

title: smooth; the fastes option to get from airport to the city centre
review: smooth cheap and so much faster thean other ways of transport (including taxi) Airconditioned and fast

title: nice trains.
review: Get coins before purchasing single trip tickets most stations have no escalators If there are any it's mostly interchanges

title: Easy and inexpensive
review: The BTS system is great It is consistently clean it is air conditioned and it is inexpensive For the most part the signage is clear enough for an English speaker to follow It is an excellent way to avoid being stuck in Bangkok traffic

title: Good
review: Found it well maintained like other city metros Only fact is bit crowded as I traveled on weekends Price is economical compared to tuktuk

title: Highly recommended
review: Very very convenient easy access and you can just book it on your own cheaper option than your taxi services

title: Comfortable - but please have ENOUGH time in hand when taking this
review: We used the rail link both the times  when we reached BKK and we were flying out of BKK While getting into BKK the ride was comfortable with no hiccups and it really didn’t matter as we were on our way to the hotel However on the way out towards airport  when we were time bound to catch a flight  we JUST MADE IT IN TIME because the train stopped twice for about 10 mins for some technical snag and was chugging slower than what it should be So if you plan taking it  would recommend that you account for at least 115 mins from Paya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport

title: Life made easy
review: It was always a trial getting from the airport to central Bangkok but now it is so easy and very cheep The connection on to the other bts lines is easy Just don't sit in the traffic

title: Good for getting around in busy traffic
review: Whilst this network isn't extensive it does get close to a number of key locations so its a fast way to get around Bangkok above the traffic Slightly more expensive than some similar transport systems in the world but not too badb

title: Sky train first timers...
review: The Skytrain is dead easy to use Basically it consists of 2 lines It is easy to navigate Buy a Carrot card like a London Oyster card It costs 200 baht which is about £4 We used it about 4 times then had to top it up A card also saves you from having to join long queues and fiddle about with loose change as the machines don't accept notes You can't eat or drink on the train

title: BTS Skytrain
review: Bangkok is a destination I MUST visit every year and the recent trip was my first attempt trying out airport bus + BTS skytrain to Bangkok city   From DonMueang airport take an airport bus (30 Baht) at Gate 5 A1 to Chattuchak take BTS skytrain (37baht) to Asia Hotel walk 500 meter to my check in hotel  I hv saved 333 Baht by taking the BTS skytrain

title: THE mode of travel when in Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok is crazy The cab drivers are really greedy always demanding extra money and picking fights when you refuse So skytrain is the best choice The price is not very cheap and is in fact comparable with taxi meter rates( but no cabbie agrees to go on meter rates) Frequency is quite good and is always crowded irrespective of time of the day It is also connected to to metro and airport rail link Pls note no food or drinks are allowed in the skytrain

title: Comfortable and quick public transport
review: In Bangkok always prefer BTS for travelling during peak hours Ticket staffs are mostly helpful I realized that I am not carrying my document just after entering the station and the ticket staff at Ratchadamri station helped me with reactivating the ticket I went out of station collected my documents and came back in 20 minutes The train is frequently available and have comfortable AC Just to mention that peak hours have heavy rush but manageable Better that get caught in notorious Bangkok traffic

title: Stunning !
review: Our guide Sara was superbly kind and smiling attentive with very very good English I highly recommend

title: Convenient way to travel within Bangkok City.
review: The connectivity is good but be very careful on the line as there are multiple platform heading towards multiple places This is the best way to beat the taxi scam and traffic jams in this bustling city however it is not so friendly for kids Some stations do not allow elevator usage Poor thing

title: Convenient
review: Convenient Well kept and in good condition Runs on time Only negative is lots of steps to climb and walk a lot to get to platform

title: Best way to move around Bangkok
review: Forget traffic jams Just take the BTS Skytrain and get almost anywhere in central Bangkok moving fast Whenever I visit this city the proximity oficina a hotel to a BTS station is one of my concerns

title: Night train
review: What a great experience The train was spotless beds comfy and bathrooms clean Easily exceeded our expectations  Booked through 12goasia and very happy there also Smooth and well coordinated From the online experience to picking up the voucher

title: Useful, easy and cheap
review: One of the best way to move in Bangkok Avoid the traffic jam and easy access to all the main bkk malls

title: Your good friend in Bangkok
review: Bangkok is notorious for traffic jams The BTS skytrain is a great way of beating trafficFast & efficient Reasonable fares Main downside not very elderly or disabled friendly

title: so easy to use !!!
review: Great metro systemno matter what language you speak it's easy to get around and a must to beat the crazy traffic

title: Best way to city
review: No express service at this time owing to maintenance but still quite efficient Clean and cheap45 Baht from airport to Praya Thai in central Bangkok

title: Efficient, but more expensive for a family
review: The BTS is by far the quickest way to get across Bangkok We stayed in Ari and caught the train from there The price of tickets was more expensive than a taxi for our family of four but worth the little bit of extra money to save travel time

title: Best way to get to weekend market
review: It is a good way to move around from Sukhumvit area to river and weekend market also to get to different pub areas What is strange is that for the metro you need a different pass Not logical

title: Well air-conditioned - look for the arrows!
review: one of the "must see" in Bangkok Very cold though especially when you are coming out of the warm   However security staff only uses a whistle to tell you off   Tip Always look for the arrows on the floor in which direction to go (otherwise you get told off)

title: Very quick and simple
review: Used the rail link several times when traveling from a distance It is not expensive clean and very easy to use

title: Easy acces
review: Easy acces and it shows all claerly where to go and where to buy tickets Clean an d reliable Much faster than taking a taxi or a tuk tuk especially during office hours

title: Convenient but overcrowded
review: Very useful for getting around but not frequent enough and overcrowded all the time Stations only have escalators up which is a real pain with bags

title: Excellent guide and driver, best way to see markets
review: Fantastic your Tum our guide and Tam our driver were excellent Tum met us in the hotel lobby and took us to our airconditioned car Tum was an excellent guide sharing her knowledge of Bangkok Tam's driving was also excellent The train market was busy however we had great train seats as well as great photo opportunities  Floating market was very good also Definitely recommend this private tour

title: Nothing changed since many years ago
review: The lack of lift access at the station to platform as well as from road level to station   Escalator is only available to access from station to platform but not the reverse unless at Siam station So if you have baggage to carry it's nightmare to climb down the stairs Phai thai station (interchange station w airport rail) horrible no lift no escalator   Very old type of trains too Overall disapppointed

title: Quicker than a taxi if your destination is in the centre of town
review: Costs THB 45 one way and takes about 35 minutes to the terminus There are some stops where you can transit to the Metro or BTS lines Runs every 15 minutes Quick Only downside is that it does get rather full which can be awkward if you have a lot of luggage

title: Most convenient way to travel around Bangkok
review: Over the years the BTS Skytrain have expanded its network to reach out to the suburb township of Bangkok It is always packed during the weekday office hours and if you are in a leisure trip avoid the morning (7 to 9 am) and evening rush hours (5 to 7 pm)  Despite the packed coaches it is still the fastest way to shopping malls and some major attractions  The BTS are also linked to the MRT (underground subway) at a few stations and also the river ferry taxi at Saphan Taksin station If you plan to use the skytrain for more than one day get a Rabbit storevalue card (refundable) which cut all queue to buy single trip tickets Highly recommended to go explore Bangkok on the BTS and you will certainly see another aspect of The City if Angels

title: Fast and reliable
review: This is one of the best train systems I've ever used it's fast and reliable clean and secure and easy to use

title: Cheap convenient travel
review: Cheap fare and quick access to the Occasional traffic jam Bangkok Clean and tidy inside with good announcement which is helpful for tourist passengers

title: It's ok but not the fastest
review: I went last friday on 15th December 2017 it was very crowded yet not sure why some of the trains were not open for all  The wait was ok but any changes it was announced in Thai Ended with english but then only we realised the train we were queuing will not open end up some of us ran over to other train some passenger were unable to go in even the train was quite empty abit disappointed with that incident

title: No wonder it's popular.
review: The Skytrain is the best way to get around in Bangkok The trains are clean cool very regular and fast All announcements are done in Thai and English so knowing where you are isn't a problem You can choose to either buy tickets from the machines or from the maned booths English isn't well understood so keep it simple when buying a ticket You can buy a smart card called a "Rabbit" card then load it up with 100 baht multiples This saves you time at the stations as you just swipe it on and off at the turnstiles and your card is debited for how ever far you traveled  If you like staying out late bad luck because the Skytrain does its last run at midnight and starts again at 6am It is very popular so if you need your personal space you going to have it invaded Very hard to find a empty seat and many times there are people pressing against you from all sides Luckily the AC is very cool and the fellow users are polight and don't smell  It's also likely that you are going to have to change trains when moving around Bangkok because of its size Here is the silly thing the Airport rail line the Skytrain rail lines and the underground Metro lines all use a similar but different ticket system So you have to get seperate tickets for all three rail systems The trains are the fastest way around Bangkok there are so many cars bikes etc using the roads that traffic is heavy any time of the day

title: Clean, fast,easy to use and cheap!
review: BTS skytrain is one of the things I love about Bangkok  It is on time very frequent and an all day ticket is very cheap  You can hop on and hop off as many time as you like and there is no distance restriction   Compared to European transport there is no comparison  The Europeans have a lot to learn from BTS

title: Efficient but busy
review: When we got on it was a bit squashed Lots of crowds I think you need to use coins if you use the ticket machines Train was clean and well lit

title: Fast and reliable
review: Skytrain is the most effective way for moving around Bangkok  if you want to avoid being stuck in traffic in a taxi for hours Airport link do phraya thai is as well to be recommended  even with luggage no prob at all

title: Saves you from traffic jam!
review: BTS is a good public transportation it connects you to major malls and some other attractions by a transfer of ferry If you aren't going to travel to long distances more than 3 times a day then don't get the oneday pass Its fairly easy to navigate the system

title: Convenient way to get to town
review: Good and clean Runs punctually Stations could exhibit more signages though We were told by our hotel to use exit 3 at Ratchaprapop station but there was no signage

title: A easy and good way to move around in the city
review: If you go by taxi you easily get stuck in timeconsuming trafficmess It's a cheap and easy way to move around

title: Economical & Fast to Bangkok city
review: This is the best option to reach the city from Suvarnabhumi int'l airportGo to the airport basement & take the Blue line (city link)  This is the slow train stop at all the station up to phayathai stationBut it took only 40 mins from airport to Ratchaprarop station & THB 40 to each we traveled in the morning time so not crowdedeverybody seated Makkassan express is THB 90 but nonstop between  Airport & Makkassan (Red line)  I suggest not to use Express because slow train (Blue line) is so quick

title: Easy to navigate from A to B
review: We bought day passes for only 140THB each which allowed travel until midnight  Most waiting times for trains were only around 10 mins  You could usually get a seat sooner or later as people were regularly hopping on and off and the air conditioning was very welcome Overall very clean and user friendly

title: The easiest way to get into the city
review: Who has been traveling to Bangkok already knows the annoying traffic jams all around town With the Airport Rail Link you can easily avoid most of this and just take the Skytrain to or at least to a location near your hotel If you choose your hotel to be near a Skytrain station you will never be wrong because this makes traveling and moving around town a lot easier Fares are very moderate and also taking luggage on the Skytrains is not a big thing as you have elevators or escalators at every station

title: An experience I would recommend for all those on tour here.
review: It was included in our tour A great experience and lasted about an hour It travels along part of the original line built by POW's and has some great views along the way The guide offered everyone an upgrade to a better carriage so that we could sit at either side of the carriage when ever we wanted to A few of us declined and we could do this anyway in the carriage we had

title: Sara is an excellent guide. Fun even if you’re travelling alone !
review: Sara is a great guide  very funny and thoughtful of her clients I felt very safe and she’s almost like a second mother to us The tour was well informed and happy through and through If you get her as your guide You’re guaranteed an enjoyable time

title: Floating Market Fun’
review: “Joe” was hilarious and very welcoming We had a great time Randomly got to see Conan O’Brien while on our boat Would highly recommend

title: Fast, efficient and most importantly, air conditioned!
review: One of the best ways to get around BKK  the trains are very frequent are airconditioned and you can generally get a seat with ease out of rushhour Note that if you are travelling with a backpack you may need to open it for the security personnel who are stationed at most entrances

title: Curtailed service on the more expensive express train
review: It seems that the Express is running less and less  perhaps because of the big price discrepancy with the local train (which stops at numerous stations between Makkasan and BKK The express is much better for those with suitcases However if there is not a long wait for the next train this is the fastest way to get between central Bangkok and the main international airport

review: its just quicker to take a taxi to the city especially for 2 or more people as the train will stop and only go one stop in town so you need to then take the skytrain to your hotel

title: Easy go!
review: Bangkok siam area always have traffic jam The BTS is one for the best way to use Of coz after shopping u would like to use it too

title: Great functionality
review: Makes life in the city so much more bearable Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the coin machines at most stations are broken easily

title: Great form of transport, just a pity it is not MUCH bigger.
review: The cleanest train system I have ever seen fast and always on time New lines opening soon Good to know that MRT offers a seniors discount while BTS will not  I use the service every week

title: Very good experience
review: The rail is connecting you to the major areas in the city Also it is budget on your pocket If you have to travel to the city from the Suvarnabhumi Airport It will just take 1 hour to reach its last destination

title: easy to use
review: The sky train is very simple to use and all information is available in English easy to navigate and use the system

title: Clean efficient, always on time
review: Skytrain is the very best way to get round Bangkok above the traffic checking out the skyline and getting where I want to go quickly and easily  Everyone on the train is also so civilised

title: Great way to get around Sukhumvit, the river, and the MRT subway
review: Having grown up in Los Angeles with its limited public transportation infrastructure over reliance on car ownership and the allmighty lobby on  oil dependence it took me a while to get used to this way of getting around Now I just can't imagine not having it It's not always necessary useful or enjoyable But it boils down to being the most efficient and effective way to get around certain areas plenty of times   You need  to have spent  time in the popular areas of Bangkok to understand

title: Only consider in rush hour
review: Airport link goes nowhere where you normally want to go It connects very badly to the sky train but by the time you have waited for tickets whichever you cannot buy at the airport and tried to get your baggage onto a crowded train you have saved little money and certainly reduce drivers you’re lifespan through the added pressure that this option gives you The only time to use the airport link is when you have handcarry baggage only it is between 5 and 7 on a last Friday of the month you hold a rabbit card for sky train and your destination is on the sky train route

title: Best way to beat Bangkok traffic
review: We visited almost all places by skytrain during our stay here Lot of places of interest are walking distance from skytrain stops including central mall MBK Centre Madame Tussauds and others

title: The best way to commute in Bangkok
review: Bangkok is a city of traffic jams and not very polite Taxi and TukTuk drivers Skytrain is very convenient and economical way of travel in the city It is very easy to go through the process and then the help is always at hand

title: A convenient way to get around in Bangkok.
review: Traffic jam in Bangkok make travelling time and experience very unpredictable sometimes fast and easy but the next time may be a complete nightmare Using the BTS (Skytrain) is by far the best and most reliable way of travelling within the city And also the best way to escape from the taxi mafia operating in the tourist areas BTS is great airconditioned and comfortable Just try to avoid crowded rush hours when people commuting to and from their work morning 79am and evening 57pm Buy a chargable card and you don´t need to wait in queuing to buy a ticket

title: Good option for travelling
review: Good option for travelling There are just two lines for it It is mostly crowded specially during peak hours You can easily take out tickets as per your stop from ticket machines outside But we found uber to be cheaper option specially for short duration trips

title: Great
review: This is the best way to go aroundin combination with metro Cheep and easy to use Very cleancomfortableclimatedfaster way to go to many attractions and your hotel

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: After a nightmare 3 hour taxi ride from the airport to our hotel we never stepped foot onto a car again Don't trust google maps it doesn't account for Bangkok's terrible traffic

title: Easy commuting
review: The best and quickest mode of transport just buy your ticket easy map the best way to go about the malls saves time and supa fast

title: Best way to the City
review: This is the best mode of transportation to the City It is FAST cheap and safe But if you have a tons of luggage this might be a challenge for you but still possible

title: Easy to use
review: Fast and easy to use  Signs were easy to follow and machine was easy to read and figure out how to purchase tickets  Make sure you have enough coins

title: Take the "BTS" to avoid the traffic and get nice views of Bangkok
review: I find it kind of funny that something that I use as a mode of transportation is rated #1 out of 240 attractions in Bangkok (at the time of writing this review)  The "BTS" as it is called by the locals is quick clean and fairly cheap way of getting around the Bangkok which is notorious for its traffic jams  However during peak rush hour the BTS will be quiet crowded so you may experience a kind of jamming yourself    TIPS  1 If you are a tourist decide how many times you are going to use the BTS in a day or over your course of stay in Bangkok  At present the most expensive ride will be 40 baht  However you can purchase daily or monthly cards that will give you discounts  It is also more convenient than having to line up to get change to plug into the machines  2 Make sure you get a map for the BTS  They are usually in front of the places where you get change  If there are none there ask the people behind the glass for one  The maps also state interesting information such as cultural events sometimes they have coupons on them etc   3  If you want nice pictures of Bangkok go to the opposite side of the carriage that only opens at Siam (all the other stations will open at the door you entered)  Please note that some windows may be covered by adverts so just find a window that is advert free

title: Best way to get around
review: Take the sky train  It is cheap clean and fast It is the best way to get around Thailand It travels to many places in Bangkok and it's easy to navigate

title: BTS
review: The BTS skytrain was very easy and efficient They were always running on time and trains came every 5 to 10 minutes Very convenient to take to the airport (BKK)

title: Fast and cheap
review: As the title says fast and cheap and a interesting alternative for a long taxi drive in a traffic congested Bangkok especially when you need to be in downtown

title: Fun on the water.
review: Sarah was a great guide Funny with lots of history about the culture It was a full day of food fun and adventure I would highly recommend this tour with Sarah

title: Super easy and efficient
review: It rivals the metro in Washington DC and goes to many parts of Bangkok with ease and safety It seemed to be easier to deal with than the taxis  It was also very clean

title: Efficient transportation in Bangkok
review: Easy to go by skytrain only hurdles during rush hours Train is clean quite well maintained but only some terminals are dirty

title: Good Transport Option
review: What can be said it's a train that gets you from where you are to where you want to go Peak times it can be crowded so if using the Airport Link to Makkasan and then the MRT be prepared to push your way through the crowd  Used the MRT from Sukhumvit to Phetchaburi one evening around 6PM and had to wait until the 3rd train before being able to get on

title: Super cheap and super efficient
review: To get from the Airport to say Rumkenhaeng costs only 30 baht which is $120 AUD this has to be the cheapest airport link transportation system i have ever experienced The trains are super modern and is always on time However the trains can become crowded very easily

title: Cheap n very convenient ...
review: I am regret I din take it from airport to city Which I spend 450 Thai bath from airport to city After checked with my hotel reception From pratunam to airport only cost 40 bath Omg It's very different a lot But the end I save 400 bath which I can do an hour Thai massage at airport

title: Easy and quick transporttation in central Bkk
review: BTS are obviously quicker than a Taxi because it run on a rail All station have info boards to help you navigate in their rout net If I remember right the ticket machine only accept coins Not specially cheap somake sure you have some 10 bath coins in your pocket Cabins are clean cold with only a few seats Be aware of the rush hour and place your self close to the exit doors Can be difficult to get off if you are to fare from exit because the stop and go time are short One of the rutes stop by the large weekend marked Visit to Siam Paragon and MBK are also made easy with BTS

title: Useful means of transport
review: Very useful means of transport which connects different parts of the town Very cheap Very easy to go Does not connect the old city center so you have to take a tuk tuk to complete your journey to the main attractions

title: the coolest (and fastest) way to get anywhere in BKK
review: if you want to get anywhere in BKK take the BTS  you can't get to everything by using it but you can get to most of the main things on the two lines that tourists will be interested in  forget the nostalgia of a tuk tuk you'll still be stuck in lung stultifying smog and heat instead of icy cool (yes if on it for long you might actually need a jacket) bliss of the fastest transportation in BKK

title: Very easy and cheap to get downtown
review: From Suvarnabhumi airport most of the times i grab the Airport Rail Link to get into town It is cheaper and no chance of cheating taxi drivers  At the other hand if you want quick and you arrive on a time where the traffic is not too bad i can be a lot quicker to take a taxi to your hotel

title: Getting around Bangkok
review: Bangkok’s public transport has pros and cons Don’t even think about using the clapped out buses but the sky train and metro are good for getting around parts of the city at least and the river boats bustle up down and across The sky train and metro are run by two different companies so you need different tickets and they interconnect in only a few places It’s a shame they’ve never built the extra lines originally planned People actually form lines when waiting and there’s no eating or drinking on board but locals get a full signal on their phones We haven’t used taxis but the tuk tuks mostly for tourists can be negotiated down a bit Buy a day pass for the skytrain to avoid the queues and an Oystertype card for the metro Reductions for seniors possible on the metro

title: Why sit in the traffic jams, when you can enjoy fast and easy travels with MRT through the city
review: Just like BTS Skytrain MRT (underground) train is a convenient and easy way to travel to many parts of Bangkok It also has connection points with BTS It also offers special price for Children and Seniors

title: The best way to navigate Bangkok
review: The length and breadth of Bangkok's BTS system allows anyone access to a large portion of the city's districts including major shopping areas malls and hotels  Fast efficient and inexpensive

title: All board
review: Clean and very efficient travel can be overcrowded but this is Bangkok Always on time and can transport you al over the city close to most attractions

title: Very easy efficient way to travel
review: Cheap easy accessible clean and well networked Definitely worth it especially with the traffic in Bangkok

title: Fast, cheap and easy way to and from BKK airport.
review: Instead of buying the Express Route tickets (PhayathaiSuvarnabhumi or MakkasanSuvarnabhumi) for 150 Baht we opted for the SA City Line (stops at 6 stations before arriving at the airport) for 45 Baht The 18 or 15 minute nonstop service is ideal for those who wants less travel time who wants to avoid the city commuters and who is carrying tons of luggage But for those people like us who isn't in a hurry loves the commute and is carrying a reasonable amount of luggage the SA City Line is good enough The trains are big enough so you can stand side by side with your luggage

title: Efficient transit
review: Skytrain is an essential part of Bangkok's crowded and chaotic transport system  The service is frequent and cheap with airconditioned carriages  The tracks and stations are all elevated above the traffic which makes it intrusive  but there's little option given the volume of business below  One thing that did strike me given that Skytrain is relatively modern is that there is little thought for the disabled  Access from the street to the ticket office level was by steep stairs with up escalators (no down) from there to the platforms  Ticketing is by coinoperated machine but there is a window where staff will give you change

title: Up above the city.
review: Wow Bangkok keeps growing out of the ground and it's even more dynamic than when I was there a few years ago The skytrain makes getting around this dense city so easy and there are plenty of staff to assist on main stations  You can purchase a Rabitt pass and top up easily at vending machines or with ticket sellers on the station and fares are very reasonable All carriages are fully air conditioned and access points to shops business roadways etc are really well signposted on all stations As a single female I felt really safe on the train and stations Its hard to fault the Skytrain which intersects with main lines and a number of points  I wish we had something like it here in Sydney )

title: EASY TO USE

title: Excellent fast service from and to airport
review: This is a great service that we recommend for 35 Bhat per person in our case to and from Makhasan Station (20 minutes)  Great security service  My wife left behind in the taxi her bag with computer and personal belongings and we managed to meet a motorcycle security who chased the taxi and retrieve the bag the biker declined a tip  This was amazing experience

title: Bangkok City Airport Link a Poor Service
review: While either the express train or the local stopping train takes you directly to the airport in 20 or 35 minutes respectively there are long waits for the trains  The airport link express train leaves only every 30 minutes with a similar schedule for the city link stopping train    On the city link there is no room for storing luggage and even the airport link has limited storage capacity in the carriages  A promised luggage car in which luggage would be stored and transported to the airport has not materialised  The connection to the BTS Phyathai station while easy to navigate the BTS Skytrains are designed and intended for people carriage only  So bulky cases cause a nuisance to other passengers on the often very full Skytrains  One then has to negotiate the few escalators and steps to the pavement level  The Airport link station at Makasan does not connect to any other transport system not buses underground trains nor the Skytrain and one either has to tramp across some pretty rough ground and a fourlane road or railway line to get to Petchburi Road metro station or get one of the few taxis from the Makasan terminal  The terminal itself is large and mainly empty because it is underused  There is a flight check in area but only one airline uses the facility even though it was designed for many more airlines  This again is underused and hardly worth the bother  From the ground concourse level to the platform there are only one or two escalators and lift(s) meaning that most people will carry heavy luggage up three flights of stairs to the platforms  All in all this facility is not worth using because of its inconvenient location and dearth of facilities  The last time I used it the oneway fare from the airport was 150 baht and the taxi to Silom Road in the centre of Bangkok was another 100+ baht  A taxi from the airport to my home would get me there in about the same time and cost a similar amount  A very poor badly planned facility for a busy city like Bangkok

title: Cheapest way to the city from Suvarnabhumi airport
review: The train is maybe the cheapest way to the city center depends on how many people are traveling A ticket from Suvarnabhumi airport is 45 baht per person to Phaya Thai  Get off at Phaya Thai and take another train to the center for 26 baht per person The trip takes approximately 30 minutes This is our first time taking the train The last time we took a taxi and it cost us 500 baht with include toll fee

title: Puts New York Metro to shame!
review: Yes I know it's much newer than the New York Metro so you might expect it to look more modern  but when you compare other heavily used metros (such as London Paris Moscow) with New York you really wonder why they can't even attempt to keep up with the standards achieved by other major cities (Rhetorical question  I assume the answer is mostly down to politics) So in Bangkok the metro is pristine  so clean you feel you could almost eat food from the floor The platforms have security screens to prevent accidental falls to the lines and the other side of the glass on tunnel walls are movie screens for advertising reminiscent of Blade Runner Announcements on the train are both in Thai and in English as are the signs Easy to navigate and great connections with the Skytrain (BTS) The MRT and BTS have made getting around Bangkok so easy

title: A little bit of history

title: Very convenient!

review: The airportlink from the main airport is suprisingly very modern similar to the ones you find in London or any other European City It is very cheap too I did not pay more than 50 Bath However the way to the main trains station (City Centre) is quite long about 45 minutes and the trains are croweded so you won´t find a place to sit easily Anyway you still have to take a Tuk Tuk from the Trains Station which is the last stop of this train I am not really sure how much the taxi from the airport is but is probably better to catch a cab from the airport as most turist do (There was not any european in the train except me ))

title: Excellent Service

title: fast and convenient

title: The best way to travel from the Airport
review: I love that Bangkok has this awesome airport rail link  After coming through customs you walk or rather escalator ride down to the Airport rail link (all signage has english wording and clear directions) as it is located in the basement  There you buy a ticket either via the ticket vending machine or a person at the ticket counter The machine is so easy to use and it is in english If you get stuck there are customer service reps right there to help It's 42 THB (NZD 180) one way and you need to keep the token It's ticket into the area and then your ticket out at the other end  The trains come every 15mins or so You don't have to wait long  The ride itself is really smooth and you see a lot of the country as you head into bangkok city centre Along the way you can get off and connect either with their BTS (sky train) or MRT (subway) lines  There are about 8 stops in total and by far the best cheapest and aircondition way to get to and from the Airport Unfortunately this rail link is only for the new airport and doesn't go to Don Mueang airport (the older airport)  Definitely value for money

title: Best way to town
review: Taxi cabs are all about making a buck With the recent protests in Bangkok this seemed like the more logical way to get tofrom the airport For 45baht (about us$150) you can take a direct shot with a few stops straight to the terminal or phaya thai station From there you can continue with the sky train or take a METERED cab If the taxi says the meter is broken either agree on a fair price (which you'll likely still get ripped off on) or move on to the next cab

title: Cheap, clean, crowded, fast, simple, safe.
