title: Excellent way to get around busy Bangkok
review: As others have noted BTS is an easy way to get around Bangkok and much better than taxis especially when the traffic is heavy It is worth getting a Rabbit Card and putting a couple of hundred baht on it rather than queuing each time The card works the same way as similar ones in Western cities and as you exit the station the automatic gate will tell you how much you have left As we visit Bangkok regularly we have an automatic deduction from our bank when the card gets low but you will be surprised how far a hundred baht takes you and if the card runs out a friendly conductor will advise you that you need to replenish it  You can get the Rabbit Card from the same window as individual tickets

title: Limited area but links with skytrain and buses.
review: The MRT is the subway or tube in Bangkok  It's very nice  At this point it basically only serves the Central Business district but it links well with other mass transit including the vast reach of the BST or skytrain system  One can get around quite easily in air conditioned comfort using mass transit in Bangkok  If you don't prefer walking to your final destination there are always car and motorcycle taxis available  Tuk Tuks are available at the tourist spots  I recommend them but you will be taken to shopping spots  Spend ten minutes in the store and the driver gets fuel credit  They usually charge less than a USD for 2 hours  If you just want to go somewhere ask for the "no shopping price"

title: Fast and Cheap, Less Good with Luggage

title: There is no choice, so Grin and Deal with It

review: The BTS Skytrain is a clean inexpensive way to travel within Bangkok But make sure you know where you are going and what line you need to be on to get there My wife and I took the skytrain to go a few stops to the local market Going we accompanied a couple who had already experimented riding the train a day before So no problems We returned on our own The language difference made our trip a little anxious Fortunately we made it without any problem But that was not the case for a woman pushing a baby in a stroller and holding the hand of another child She had to get off and retrace her path having gotten on the wrong line Remember to check the name of the station on which you enter the system so you can easy return without difficulty

title: Public  transport in Bangkok

title: Commute

title: the only way to get around town

title: Good to beat the traffic
review: This service is good to beat the traffic congestion and delays from airport and back There are frequent trains and the ride from Siam with one change takes around 30 mins   There are ticket vending machines with language options and easy three steps to get a token for the ride Scan the token to enter the station then deposit the token at the exit station  Few down sides   this is a normal BTS train so there are regular commuters who compete for the seats and there aren’t separate luggage storage areas If you are carrying more than one bag or large bags may not be convenient Being a normal BTS train it also stops at all stations between airport and city   Nonetheless the service is cheap at THB45   (Regular Taxi can be around THB 400500)per ride and great way to beat the traffic congestion especially at peak time

review: cheap price save time close to hotel convenient to us    the hotel price is cheap  hotel is little bit far from BTS Nana if walking take 10  minutes but hotel provide free TUK TUK service

title: Always clean and on time
review: In the hustle and bustle of Bangkok and its crazy traffic BTS is a breath of fresh air that is always on time Thai people are respectful and never hesitate to guide a lost tourist with accurate direction It is not only a question of saving money but also precious time and less noise and pressure

title: Fast Way to Travel in Bangkok
review: Very convenient system You can switch to MRT Chao Phraya River Express boat and Khlong Saen Saep boat to get to places BTS is crowded but manageable It allows you to avoid Bangkok traffic  You can buy Rabbit Card if you do not want to wait in the queue every time to get ticket

title: Easy access and quick
review: As a tourist in order to avoid road traffic you can prefer sky train were you can exchange notes to coins and use the ticket machine for one time entry

title: Cheap, fast and convenient
review: It only costs you 40 baht to go from airport to pratunum area or baiyoke sky hotel where I stayed Very easy to go and always too crowded  with passengers on cabin in time Still vote for it

title: Real deal Rail
review: Even though this is our first trip to Bangkok we were gung ho enough to take the airport rail to our apartment  Thanks to my husband's endless googling and preparatory work prior to our trip  It was relatively hasslefree to locate the rail from Suvarnabhumi Airport station  It cost only 90 baht for one way trip that ends at Phaya Thai station where you can get a connecting trip on a BTS Skytrain

title: one of the best public Transports
review: Very safe clean and affordable Can get very crowded during peak times Beats the daily heavy traffic jams

title: Its got to be done
review: We used the Sky train to get to the Jim Thompson House from the ShangriLa hotel This was our first independent excursion outside the hotel and frankly it couldn't have been easier Well actually it could as we were somewhat surprised not to be able to buy a ticket tat the ticket counter but were given change so we could feed the automatic machine opposite But when in Rome The trains were beautifully air conditioned and during our trips (2pm and 430pm full but not overly so They ran to time and frequently and gave some great views from it's elevated position

title: Not-in-rush-hour excellence
review: Notinrushhour service is excellent  However  at peak times it's too busy and one may have to wait several trains before being able to board

title: Bear with Multiple-stops half-an-hour trip on Airport Rail Link
review: The multiplestops halfanhour trip is over crowded but it is the fastest way of access to Bangkok city centre Give yourself at least an hour to arrive at your final destination in Bangkok via the Airport Rail Link

title: Wonderful tour and guide
review: This is a very wellrun and prompt small group tour Pickup was on time and efficient The railway market really is a musthave experience when you visit Thailand as is the floating market tour  Lin was our guide and did a phenomenal job keeping the group together and on time What I really appreciated about Lin was how she provided the group with a lot of guidance on bargaining and specific prices It was a great way to prepare for shopping in the market

title: Efficient,modern,
review: reliable and fast train system with connections to most of the important sites of fascinating Bangkok When no direct connection is available you can take this train to the station which is closest to your destination and from there you take a tuktuk It will turn out to be the fastest possible way to travel around in this multi million capital of Thailand

title: Very convenient
review: It's a very convenient way to travel Bangkok We used it for most of our transportation needs in Bangkok It's clean fast and airconditioned

title: BKK Train Transport
review: According to the way Bangkok has developed in the last decades this is not a bad system althought there are many areas not reached by train

title: Very convinient way to get in and out of Bangkok city
review: The airport rail link is absolutely the best way to get in and out of Bangkok city center fromto the airport And very cheap too 40 bath one way No need to worry about the traffic jams

title: Very Good Railway and Floating Market Tour
review: The tour description doesn’t really do this tour justice After an extended ride in the van you wait for a train next to beautiful salt flats The train ride is fun and you get to see the countryside The floating market is a bit of a tourist trap but it’s a great experience Enjoy the boat ride and don’t buy the overpriced souvenirs One other piece of information this is not an half day tour Our tour was solidly 8 hours Overall a very good experience

title: Nice
review: Can't go wrong with this rail system to go into Bangkok city 30 min or so will take you into Thaya Thai the last stop then you can transfer to BTS system to other desire places

title: Good public transport option
review: We used this as a station was near our hotel It's a relatively cheap and easy way to get around in Bangkok It's just a shame that the transport system is not fully integrated so you have to get a separate ticket for using the skytrain metro and bus Day passes restrict you to using the skytrain only likewise the metro It's efficient and air conditioned which is excellent in the heat of the city

title: Perfect Half-day Trip to see so much!
review: Sara our guide was absolutely AMAZING and perfect for our group She was knowledgeable funny friendly and almost felt like family The tour was perfectly timed and we got tastes and experiences we wouldn’t normally get on our own if we explored by ourselves We absolutely loved it and her Thank you to Sara and Mr D We hope to be back in Thailand again

title: Convenient
review: Good for avoiding the notorious jams in Bangkok Frequent trains and stations spread across most popular locations in the city

title: Transfer
review: Smooth easy cheap transfer from The airport into the center of Bangkok Easy to change to other public transports along the way

title: The Bangkok underground or something like that
review: I have been living in Bangkok since 2004 and so has the MRI It opened just a few weeks before I arrive It has proven its worth over the years and helped reduce the traffic in Bangkok So this is all good and I can find nothing wrong with the service It is still a modern service and puts the New York subway to shame  The only problem I have consistently found is the station cooling is underpowered During rush hour waiting for the trains can get very hot because of the mass of people in the station generating all that body heat But with trains arriving every few minutes it is not a big problem except for people who are sensitive and can overheat quickly  Over all if you need to get across town with minimum hassle take the MRT or BTS

title: travel with comfort
review: Airconditioned trains that bring you to connection places in the city You can during the trip enjoy the sight over the city

title: Roaming
review: Fantastic service and ease to access trains are superb with clear detailsstaffs are helping lot whenever have query

title: inexpensive and easy connection
review: If you are travelling alone and do not have big luggages it is a very  convenient way to get to center of Bangkok  It is actually quite good if your hotel is near the train stations

title: Great fast way to the city
review: This is a great way to beat the traffic if in rush hour if you can handle your luggage with ease then use this rather than a taxi but if you have heavy luggage it can be difficult when you transfer trains

title: Airport & Skytrain
review: Megacool and absolutely stressfree transportation within Bangkok also to the airport Suvarnabhumi Quick & Easy to go topclean and comfortable

title: Do it
review: It's was easy  Neither my son nor I spoke the language and this was our first visit  Just follow the signs  A few coins and your on Clean and fast  We went  down town got off found a hotel   Same thing back to the airport  Very modern comfortable and [plenty  of room  We traveled light found seats and used it to visit different parts of the city   Jump off explore the next  part of town Will do it again  So much cheaper than cabs

title: Quick and Convenient Transport Option (Airport)
review: It is without a doubt cheap and very useful to travel from the airport or to the airport I would recommend it to anyone who wants to safe up some money and also arrive a bit faster than with the taxi or any other wheel transportation because of the traffic The link is working from 0600 till 0000 local time completing each run in just 30min

title: Cheap and fast
review: Best mode of transport as it avoids all traffic and comfortable travel at a very affordable price Highly recommend for any type of traveller

title: Very quick and efficient
review: Excellent way to get from the airport to downtown Bangkok without the hassle of traffic  it is well airconditioned too

title: Oasis in Bangkok traffic
review: It is a lifeline for any tourist and I think for locals too Everyone knows what Bangkok traffic can be especially during peak hours and BTS connecting most of tourist attractions can be a major relief   Only issue comes when travelling with prams or kids or requiring handicap friendly modes or lots of shopping   In most places there seem to escalators to get up to the station but simple stairs when coming down Similarly there are no escalators or life from ticketing level to trains only stairs are available So be prepared to climb up or down few flights of stairs  It can be a bit crowded during peak hours but this is not an issue due to high frequency of services  Please don't eat drink or talk loudly in the trains as it is frowned upon due to understandable reasons

title: Quick and easy and inexpensive.
review: Quick and easy to navigate and at such cheap price wish transport for London would take a look at the efficiency and cheap price

title: Best way to get around, for sure!
review: Highly highly recommend the BTS Skytrain The train turns up every 2 minutes (literally) and it's an extremely efficient way to get around The train is air conditioned and although it can get quite packed during peak times it's worth squeezing in because the ride is usually quicker than you assume it'll be It's also affordable and even cheaper to buy a concession card if you plan on getting around quite a bit my husband and I bought a 15 trip pass each for our 4 day stay which was the perfect amount for us to see all that we wanted to within the short amount of time

title: Perpetum Mobile
review: Perfect way to travel round Bangkok 140 Thb for 1day pass  Never a long wait for the next train  Fast efficient and cool

title: Cheap transport but a little inconvenient
review: Since traffic is so bad in Bangkok the idea of a train to the city center is very appealing The trains from Airports in Hong Kong KL even London are excellent compared to Bangkok  The train is very cheap compared to a taxi or car booking but where it lets you off is not great if you are going to a hotel on Sukhumvit or Silom if you have luggage It's difficult to bring luggage to the adjacent BTS and there is not a very organized taxi line near the stationthe BTS is usually jammed and there is no place to store your luggage A metered taxi is more expensive but a far better option to the train if you have luggage and hour hotel is not that close to a BTS station

title: Comfortable, Air Conditioned and Traveller Friendly
review: BTS skytrain of Bangkok is one of the best things Bangkok offers to both tourists and natives The trains are clean with necessary English signs air conditioned (which is necessary for Bangkok) and maintained very effectively The maps of different stations and lines are in strategic places Very easy to use

title: comfortable to travel in city life
review: There's the map show you the directions and very easily take it as your main transportation Be careful with the station its a bit different from MRT but you can transfer to MRT if BTS couldn't get through Asok Saladang and Mor chit this three stations are transfer with the MRT

title: Not a half day tour
review: The tour itself was great  lots to see and very unique experiences  tour guide was very helpful good clear instructions and information  The only issue for us was that this was not a half day tour by our definition pick up at 8am and dropped off 30 minutes train ride from our hotel at 4pm  please be aware when you book that it’s a 2 hour drive out and 2 hour drive back… worth it but important to know if you are time conscious time poor

title: An adventure! But a cold one at that.
review: Caught train 51 from Bangkok to Chiang Mai leaving Bang Khen around 1030pm We wanted the earlier special express 13 but alas it was pretty booked up (we booked a month in advance) so we ended up getting the later one second class  Station master at Bang Khen helped us get onto the right train and the right carriage then conductors helped us to our seatsbeds (which were already set up)  If you're on the upper berth which we both had you'll have a less pleasant seat than the bottom berths You have to deal with the freezing air conditioning and the ceiling lights which are on all night Bring warm clothes  We got a surprisingly nice tasting hot bowl of jok (boiled rice soup) and a drink in the morning and arrived in Chiang Mai just an hour late

title: Great Cultural Experience
review: Great if you want to mix with the local population  Trains are somewhat aged but that is half the fun  The elevated train makes sightseeing a joy  Highly recommended for the view as well as getting around

title: Exellent city public transport
review: The train is clean nice and cheap The nearest station is only 10 minutes walk from the hotel

title: A worthy 24 hr investment
review: The Skytrain links some of the central parts of Bangkok and it crosses over the other lines for further reach It was accessible from our hotel the ShanghaiLa and for a 24hr pass it costs us 140 bat each Considering the traffic on the street it was a great investment and it’s available in different durations

title: Useful transportation
review: We use it everyday when visited Thailand It was really useful and fast The only thing I think it's disadvantage is it will cost you a long trip even you drop at one of its destination

title: best way to travel in BKK
review: the Best way to travel in Bangkok Without this you will face the terrible traffic jam or Bad manner taxi Driver who cannot communicate in English and try to take advantage from tourist I recommend anyone to travel this way

title: Best transport for BKK
review: Easiest and fastest way to move around in Bangkok Can be crowded but so far I have not been forced to wait for next train

title: Easy Access to Bangkok
review: we always use the Skytrain  itr got us through all of Bangkok easily and its easy to access and the staff are helpful

title: Excellent transport system
review: Think London underground on a raised platform A very busy transport system but don't be afraid  There are lots of signs in English  Take the time before travelling to be sure you know where you are going and where changes need to be made  Remember sometimes a change requires a change in level  Ignore the ticket machines and go to the ticket windows  most speak pretty good English  These trains never seem to be less that overcrowded  But on the plus side they are very well air conditioned and Thais are very polite and forgiving even when crowded together  Go for it

title: Very cool adventure (but diverting)
review: The train ride was so cool I can absolutely recommend it For me (as a person who really likes traveling by train) it was to short The train was very old and looked nearly dangerous but it was definitely save But you can call it an adventure ride The line was wonderful and the view amazing If you stay in kamchanaburi than do the ride

title: Best Way to Travel
review: The BTS will be your best travelling buddy in Bangkok It cuts your travel time by almost 60% as compared to cars  taxi The city is really jammed Be ready to do a combo of walk and BTS Although there are short motorbike ride available at certain location but I didn't try it

title: Cheap way of travel but can get crazy
review: Traveled a lot in Bangkok on the sky train Which is a cheap way to get around got a day pass for 140  baht Easy to use and their is a security guard on each platform who can understand enough English to help if needed I however do not recommend traveling from airport in rush hour time as it gets so busy locals will physically doing running charges to get on even when the doors won't close If you were to get on with suitcases and weren't near the door and on the right side which opens you WILL NOT be able to get off

title: Perfect to go to and from the airport
review: Our hotel was located in Sukhumvit The fastest way to get there take the airport rail link to Makassan station and grab a taxi from there Cheap and fast

title: Although sometimes a little packed...
review: this metrotrain system is one of the best around It an get you all around Bangkok very quickly and you know if you miss one there will be one coming shortly afterwards

title: Same Same
review: Not enough carriages so most people need to stand for the whole trip in both directions Escalators that have stairs leading to them makes so much sense when the main users would have a large and heavy suit case Elevator was also out of action at the first station when coming back to the airport

title: The easiest way to get into Bangkok
review: The airport rail link is easy fast and cheap Beats sitting in traffic The only issue is if you can't stand for long periods of time Going to the airport is always crowded and most likely you will need to stand Leaving the airport it was easier to find a seat

title: Generally good but...
review: The network has good coverage and trains are airconditioned and in good shape   However not all destinations are covered by this network notably the grand palace and temple of the dawn So a daily pass is not always your best bet Sometimes single tickets are a better option  Also metro and sky train have different lines and require two separate tickets which is a pain  Finally the government plays a dirty move placing many money exchange offices inside station premises so you are forced to pay 15 Bahts just to go in and exchange money even if you don’t want to use any means of transportation

title: Rapid Transit as Good as it Gets!
review: Bangkok Skytrain or as it Bangkok Mass Transit System (BTS) is at good as it gets when cities talk about Mass Transit  This sytem can move tens of thousands of people effortlessly every hour and the whole system could not be more user friendly  The tickets are purchases on a per station basis so if you are riding only one station you might only pay 10 baht but if you decide you need to go 4 stations your fee to ride might be 20 baht  It is all so easy a child can do it   The cars on the Skytrain are wonderfully air conditioned so even when packed they are still nice and cool  All the stops are announced by a pleasant recorded voice so you know what stop you are approaching just before you arrive at it   It is a very similar system to Vancouver Canada but I think they have the formula down even better  Primarily because they insist on the fair being paid up front you get far fewer freeloader bums then you do on the Vancouver system that makes it so disagreeable at times

title: excellent
review: excellent way to travel about Bangkok and we got a pass that we could top up anytime we came back to Bangkok Each trip is about 20 baht

title: Excellent mass transit system
review: Very fast and efficient Why sweat in a car for hours when you can get there in 10 minutes by Skytrain

title: Very convenient
review: Easy to use and takes you to where you want to go Don't have to wait long either Attendants will help you if you need it

title: Extra clean and super frequent
review: Extremely clean and very very frequent Easy to use ticket machines Dont bother trying to learn names of stops as all are numbered with letter and a number So sit or stand close to a screen and its easy Be warned there is no public toilets any station

title: Convenient to Bangkok city
review: FastcheapConvenientTo avoid traffic it is great optionsIt is connected to MRTunder ground train at Makkasan station & BTS sky train station at Payathai station for further journey in the city

title: Snow 2017
review: Just took the overnight train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai What a great experience firstly after mistaking carriage 2 for 2nd class we got the right carriage & seats We booked well in advance which I'm told is important via a travel company in Thailand  We travelled 2nd class which was fine After settling in a hostess asked us if we wanted to order dinner @ 210 THB bargain Meal arrived in no time & was delicious Only drawback no grog on board even if you bring your own apparently the fun police have made this a no no  After dinner a porter came along & turned our seats into 2 bunks to sleep in I'm a big Bugger 6'3" & the bottom bunk was comfortable for a trip like this had to curl up into a bit It's not 5 star it's a train ride😉😉😉  Waking up around 6'ish had a nice plain & simple breaky Careful the orange juice which you have to pay for (60 THB) is unbelievably sweet ahhhh  Anyway arrived in Chiang Mai got off train & went to our accommodation Fun trip I have to say   The crapper (toilets in Australia) are a bit of fun direct hole onto the train tracks just like in the old days Make sure you have your wipes & sanitiser other than that have a bit of fun

title: Clear indications at each station and exit sign with numbering
review: Easy to buy tickets and clear information to the tourist very helpful staff at the cashier well airconditioning

title: Airport Rail link
review: Excellent way to leave the Airport Quick and easy The price to my stop has remained B40 forever Clean and neat

title: Madness & Mayhem
review: Wednesday night market in Chaam is amazing but also madness & mayhem trying to park a moped let alone a car You have the opportunity to buy whatever takes your desire it is huge I have heard of bigger ones in Thailand but this is big enough for me For me it has to be the Thai food cooked fresh in front of you lush

title: Just arrived in Bangkok
review: The ride on the train from the airport to Silom area was straight forward and easy with the shuttle and BTS train I asked locals a few questions for directions all were friendly and helpful Now my trip begins

title: Quick hassle free ride into Bangkok
review: Pros This link connects you from the airport to central Bangkok BTS rail system for 45baht Saves you time and money from riding on taxis in the traffic From the MRT you can also connect to the MRT  Cons Dragging your bags up and down stairs and escalators connecting to conyence systems Eventually you probabnly will need a taxi to your final destination Either way airconditioning is provide Enjpoy

title: BTS Skytrain - Convenient and Reliable
review: We used the BTS Skytrain whilst in Bangkok recently and found it to be very convenient reliable and clean   The ticket machines are easy to use and even though the trains get crowded in the middle of the day it is so much easier to use the Skytrain than getting a taxi or a tuktuk    We always use the Skytrain whilst in Bangkok and have sometimes used the underground as well

title: What better way to avoid foot and road traffic
review: Generally ontime a little crowded sometimes but hey it's AsiaGood timetable apart from the 12am finish time

title: Fast!
review: One of the best Trajan systems I've taken Train was on time and although VERY crowded it got me to my destination faster than expected

title: Great Service
review: Worked like a charm Easy to use Routes well laid out transfer between lines very straightforwardEasier to use than Paris metro and Prague trains

title: Air Conditioned comfort with nice trains
review: The MRT stations and platformed are all fully air conditioned making for comfortable transit and the trains are quite new and move quickly from station to staion

title: Very convenient to go to city centre by Airport Rail Link
review: I enjoy riding this rail service whenever I landed in Bangkok It's the fastest and convenient to go to city from airport by its rail service

title: I use it daily
review: Best way to get across town without traffic hassles Clean cheap modern timely although can get busy at rush hours Also the ease of use makes it appealing although if disabled mobility wise it could pose some problems I have seen the station staff assist vision impaired persons on many occasions also the aged and pregnant

title: Clean, fast , reliable
review: Very nice convenient clean and fast way to get from airport to central Bangkok and other way around   Price is fair Very good ac and there is free wifi available too Better option than taxi or bus  Have fun  be safe and enjoy your travel

title: Convenient bypassing the crowded road
review: The train stop was right outside the St Regis so very convenient for  travel within Bangkok Quick avoids the interminable traffic jams but can be crowded

title: Works very well
review: The staff will help you with all your questions within no time you are in the right train Within a very short time your are at the airport

title: BTS (Skytrain) MRT and Airport Rail Link.
review: My overall experience of all train systems in Bangkok was excellent they are efficient regular and minutes away from most attractions From arriving at the Airport you have to options the Express and the City Line The express is 90 baht one way 150 baht return the City Line is 45 baht Both trains travel on the same track the only differences are the Express is not used by locals has better seats and does not stop until it reaches Phaya Thai BTS Station The City Line train is more like a convential train which is more popular with locals due to price and the fact that it does stop In terms of speed whatever train leaves first gets their first as they use the same track the Express does travel at 160 kmh but is forever slowing down in essence save your money and get the City Line The BTS Skytrain is costed against destination with fares as 15 baht for ease I bought an all day pass which gives you unlimited travel for 130 baht This avoids scratching for change waiting for the ticket machines and avoiding the line up for change as note machines are in the minority The MRT takes you to the further reaches of the city and is separate from the BTS using a tap and go taken available from machines at all stations Like trains throughout the world they are packed at peak hour and use 'shovers' on occasion to aid passengers on the train Overall use the various train systems they are easy to understand ( maps are free and available at the airport) cheap and frequent

title: Faster but crowded
review: One if the faster way when on traffic jam But very crowded in office hours Not all of BTS with lift  difficult for handicaped people or people with wheelchair

title: Primary form of transport !
review: This is efficient fast and goes most places on the visitor circuit  though can be a little expensive for families unless you buy a day ticket  no children's fares

title: Convinence
review: When you visit bangkok don’t choose taxi as your transportation You we’ll loss time for your vacat

title: Overnight and slept well
review: This is my first sleeper train  But the train was well organised  Advice is to go to the loo before biarding as the western and squat loos were both a It rank The bed however was comfortable and had to be made by the train crew they can do it early but will be done by 9pm Carriage is locked off after 10 so fairly secure but still keep valuable close The bending is clean and comfortable The journey is relatively cheap too

title: Great way to get around
review: Pretty user friendly Busy at times and can be quite crowded but never seems to be much of a wait Thai people are very kind not pushy so the experience was good Have to pay in change to a ticket booth but they do provide change there Cost is low but if travelling with 3 or more people way better to use UBER

title: Cheap ride!!
review: Took a dayreturn train from Bangkok to Ayutthaya Couldnt believe the ride on cost THB20 one way for 3rd class 2hrs ride No aircon but it was spacious and airy The carriages were full both ways with some passengers standing The view was nice once out of Bangkok (or else you can just see the slums) I love the vintage stations the we passed by along the way especially at Bang Su and Ayutthaya station In Ayutthaya there were some English students attached to the rail company helping out the tourists

title: Easy to use and runs often
review: Very easy to get to hotels in Bangkok Very efficient and clean Follow signs in arrivals area and buy tickets from machines Easy to transfer to BRT at the last stop

title: Sisters on an Adventure
review: We had a great time on this tour Our guide was Pat and she was very friendly and knowledgeable She shared a lot of facts and told us so much background about Thailand We got clear tips on how to beat enjoy the trip and the various locations She took photos for the groups in the train and where to sit for the best view And she alerted us of when it was the best time peak out and see our arrival She gave us a tip to jump on the boats at the floating market to really experience shopping on the floating market It was overall a great experience

title: Superfast communication
review: One of the best public transport system in Bangkok Interconnected with the BTS and the airport link Within an hour one can travel from one end of the city to the other Frequency is  great

title: Gets you there
review: I only used the BTS once but it go me to where I was going and back fairly cheaply Not great for sightseeing but you are above ground and can pick out some landmarks

title: its realy old but cheap
review: taking the thai national Railway i clearly an adventure the special express trains are ok but remaind me of eurepean regional tran standarts not express the night trains are ok if you go first  class but realy old if you are looking for a real adventure take a train if not take a taxi bus or airplane

title: Very convenient
review: a convenient and inexpensive way to travel from the airport Not expensive and much better than dealing with rude taxi drivers

title: Beat the Traffic
review: The Airport Rail Link is a commuter train from Suvanabhumi International Airport and Bangkok  Trains depart both ends about every seven minutes  I used it today for the first time but not really to commute from the airport to Bangkok  I live in Rayong 170 south east of Bangkok and frequently have to visit Bangkok on business   I don't mind driving in Thailand  in fact I have clocked up half a million kilometers in the past six years  but driving in Bangkok leaves me a nervous wreck  I came up with the idea of driving from Rayong to Suvanabumi which is on the Rayong side of Bangkok parking my car at the airport and catching the Airport Rail Link into Bangkok  It worked like a charm  With the parking fees and the 90 baht return Air Rail Link I almost broke even on what it would have cost me with all the tollways I would have had to use if I had driven into the heart of Bangkok  But best of all I was able to relax and enjoy the cityscape from the train as I travelled in

title: Great transportation choice
review: This is a great option which offers very inexpensive transportation in a convenient secure clean atmosphere The graphics are easy to understand and the staff is helpful  don’t be afraid to use it

title: Very good transport option
review: A very good transport option especially during rush hours Stations and trains are very clean All stations have lifts and escalators internally The exits to ground level might not be wheelchair accessible though (only escalators available) There is a crowd during rush hours which is typical of city subways just like other cities The MRT system stops at many key local attractions like Chatuchak area (Kampheng Phet and Chatuchak Park MRT) Union Mall (Phahon Yothin MRT) Talad Rod Fai Ratchada Train Market (Thailand Cultural Centre MRT)   Lumphini Park  Silom area (same name MRT) and Chinatown  Yaowarat area (Hua Lamphong MRT) It also provide convenient transfers to the BTS sky train at Chatuchak Park MRT  Mo Chit BTS and Sukhumvit MRT  Asoke BTS and also a link to the Suvarnabhumi Airport rail link at Phetchaburi MRT  Makkasan Station of Airport Link

title: 10 minutes every stop
review: Have to wait every 10 minutes at every station Not the most accessible in the morning Waste of time and mood destroyer

title: So easy!
review: I loved having the BTS available in Bangkok When you arrive at a station you buy your ticket from a ticket machine There's a map with a price next to each stop next to the machine Choose the amount on the ticket machine and put coins in If you don't have coins you can get change from the office You take your ticket and slide it into the turnstile Hang on to it because you need to put it in when you get to your destination It is great to fly over all of the traffic on the roads The BTS is super clean and quick (no eating or drinking in the stations or on the train) I only wish there were more lines that took you to more places like the temples

title: Easy way to get aroubd
review: We didn't use the BTS much on our trip but every experience was great Very easy to buy tickets figure out where you're going and make your way around the stations   Probably better for solo travellers as cabs and Uber are very cheap in Bangkok

title: Ideal city transport
review: Very clean efficient easy for tourist and very cheap modern equipped making traveling very comfortable and a pleasant experience

title: Fantastic Way to See Bangkok!
review: The Skytrain is so easy to navigate inexpensive clean & has aircon The train goes close to many places visitors want to see including the Weekend Market & the entire Silom area I recommend buying a reloadable  ticket to avoid waiting in line at every station I also recommend traveling outside of rush hour if possible The BTS map is very clear & can help you plan your trips before you get to the station I consider the Skytrain to be on a par with the HK and Singapore MTR & MRT systems  and light years ahead of most of the subway systems in the US I visit BKK frequently & always use the Skytrain to get around town My only caveat for older or mobility challenged travelers is that not all stations have escalators or elevators so be prepared to walk up several flights of stairs in some places

title: BTS is awesome!
review: If you are visiting Bangkok use the BTS It's an elevated train that keeps you out of the traffic Sadly not all stations have lifts or elevators for the elderly and disabled The beauty of the BTS is that you don't have to stay in central Bangkok  you can stay further out if you wish and be into the city center in no time For instance the line extends south to 'Bearing' which is right at the city limits and has some great hotels yet in 20minutes on the BTS you can be at Siam Square or any of the central locations When combined with the subway  the MRT  you can visit most tourist attractions without being stuck in a traffic jam

title: Easy & cheap
review: Good experience with link train Fast and always keep you away from busy road side in Bangkok Neat & clean & overall superb service

title: It is Magic
review: it is my first time to user the train  the service is very good  every thing easy to understand  instructions every where in English  maps available with easy understanding for 1st time user for the train  Super clean + nice AC  best way to move around bangkok and avoid the taxi or tuktuk drivers also to avoid the bad rush at the roads and arrive fast to your destination

title: useful to travel around Bangkok
review: Buy a travel card to avoid the long queue to get a ticket during peek hours you can refill your card as you want during your stay clean and safe

title: Quick
review: Taking the rail link is a cheap and quick way to get to the airport It can get busy at certain times of the day

title: Fantastic
review: What a great way to get around Bkk at 140 baht for a day pass Fast air conditioned and comfortable

title: Great Transport. Cheaper than BTS
review: MRT is underground transport with good aircon at all times  Ticket price is comparatively lower than BTS   For the access  it would surely be better with escalators instead of staircases Mainly at all BTS station

title: only way to get around in bangkok
review: a one day pass for THB 130 is more than worth it as to avoid the line for change and the another line for the ticket machine

title: BTS Sky Train Bangkok
review: The train system is being expanded around Bangkok It's clean and easy to use Avoid rush hours (0630 to 1000am and 1630 to 1900 pmvery busy) You can prebuy travel cards to save time and top up 200 baht is ample But of course with the Thai Baht being strong against foreign currencies The cost to travel around has risen significantly for foreigners coming to Thailand in July 2019

title: Save your money and avoid the taxis
review: The Airport link takes you from the airport to most places in the city  It stops at Phaya Thai but you can get a metered taxi from there if you are closer to the river  It is 65 THB for a 20 min ride from Airport to Phaya Thai which is about $2 US  Most Shuttle buses run about 150 THB and taxis are 200300 THB

title: Fastest way to go to most tourist attractions
review: Better than take a Taxi This is a fast and cheap transportation in Bangkok Can be overcrowded at rush hour

title: Quick and Easy to use
review: It has english instruction and we could ask the staffs to help It seems very easy quick and cheap way to go around the city It stops at many tourism places

title: Cleanest in the world!!!
review: The sky train system in Bangkok just has to be the cleanest in the world The cars are clean the stations are clean the people smell clean Just fantastic to beat the traffic in Bangkok

title: Easy way to the city!
review: It took me 31 or 35 baht from the airport station to Makksan Station and 45 to Phaya Thai  Station (Closer to city area) It will be cheaper to go by train if your hotel is near to the station 2 or less travellers no need to transfer much from airport rail link station to your hotel station as you will have to tap out and walk over to another BTS MRT line and re buy the tickets again Its not worth it BTS MRT and their Airport Rail Link are all separated There will not be any transfer within the line This is the only thing that is abit troublesome as sometimes you will have to walk quite a distance to reach another from one line to another and sometimes the total fare is even more expensive than cab

title: Everyone queue for the BTS even during peak hours
review: Everyone queue for the BTS even during peak hours Easy access to many locations for eating and shopping Walking distance to my hotel

title: Love it!
review: I love it when major cities build a train to the airport and don't listen to "Taxi Maffia" This train can be taken a few floors below the airport and goes straight through Bangkok's center If you are not staying close to the stations it is still wise to take them as close as possible then getting off at a station then catch a taxi (tell the taxi driver "Meter" and point to the meter or you WILL be screwed)  At the End of the line it meets the green line at Phaya Thai In Nov 2015 it was 45 baht from Airport to the end of the line If you are staying at or around Khaosan Rd you need to go to the last stop then catch a Taxi from there For some reason no trains or skytrains go to Khaosan Rd (probably the Taxi Maffia blocked it)

title: BTS is Best!
review: Absolutely the only way to get around Bangkok Easy for a traveller to experience the best the Bangkok has to offer with out the issues of the notorious Bangkok traffic

title: the best way to get around BKK
review: surface traffic can be horribly slow  take the skytrain everywhere and ride in air conditioned comfort

title: BTS Sky Train a must ride....
review: The minimum charges are 35 bath per station and its cleanwell maintainThe problem are very few people can understand Englishso communicate with some one is very difficultOnly Thai Language they understand

title: Clean Fast Cheap Easy
review: Used this to get too and from the airport It's suprisengly sufficient and cheap cost about 45 bht to get about Very clean and easily sign post

title: Fantastic markets tour with so much to experience
review: Such a fun day We were collected us from our hotel in a comfortable air conditioned van it was an easy drive to the market (much quieter traffic on Sundays) Alex our guide was so much fun and we really enjoyed his great humour and energy plus all the extra flourishes he provided From tasting local street food en route to ensuring we got toilet stops in at the best times We had a wonderful day at both markets maybe 1015 mins extra to explore each market would have been great but we thoroughly enjoyed the entire day Drop off at MBK was perfect too Well done great tour

title: Excellent Transport
review: Bangkok traffic is a nightmare Use the trains They are clean airconditioned and cheap Fantastic experience

title: Easy, Fast, and efficient.
review: It was a quick 45 minute trip from my hotel to the airport The trains are clean and well maintained

title: It's like the London Underground except 100x better...
review: We stayed in Nana so our best cheapest and often the quickest form of public transport to visit places in Bangkok was the BTS Skytrain The fairs are really cheap the trains are very often the carriages and stations are clean and frequent   The map  routes are very easy to navigate The trains can be overcrowded at peak times on peak routes but neither of us ever felt unsafe or uncomfortable

title: Great way to get around in Bangkok
review: Fast inexpensive comfortable  At peak usage times it is crowded but the air conditioning makes this more tolerable  Don't take lots of packages with you The Skytrain is a fabulous means of moving PEOPLE not luggage and so forth  Routes are being expanded regularly and more trains added If you have a lessthansatisfactory trip today it won't be long until it's better

title: Easy to use and quick
review: Great link to town very helpful staff to buy your tickets and you can be in downtown in the space of 30 mins this is the quickest form of transportation

title: Very Good
review: We took the sky train from our hotel (Shangi la) to the downtown shopping area  It was clean inexpensive and got us where we wanted very quickly  Note there may be long lines waiting to buy tokens to use to buy your train ticket  Find out first if you can purchase at your hotel

title: An amazing day packed with bus rides, train rides and boat rides.
review: Great excursion so many pictures taken Engulfed with the locals Many hidden gems uncovered Amazing tour guide Kiwi Give her a raise She’s the best

title: Convenient and Cheap if have small luggage
review: We used the airport rail link between Phutunam and Suvarnabhumi International Airport (BKK) Compare to the taxi this is cheapest and fastest way to Suvarnabhumi International Airport It avoid traffic jam which alway happen in the Bangkok Me and my wife use only 80 baht (40bahtpax) for one way to our hotel Very much recommended to use this to travel to and back from the airport However the station is not suitable use for large and heavy luggage due to you have carry the luagage a bit because the elevator not available

title: WORST Experience for Airport Transfer
review: If you travel during rush hour it will be a nightmare as it is only dedicated line tofrom airport It is shared with the normal train line where all people is rushing back at home at the same time so you will be packed into the train like Sardine Since the other form of transportation in Bangkok isn't that expensive I would suggest to use Uber Grab Taxi and spare a bit of time for traffic

title: Great way to travel in Bangkok
review: Yes it can get busy  but the fares are cheap  the train carriages are clean and very efficient With many trips on trains in several countries this one shows other countries how to travel and run a train efficientlyfast and with information also on stations coming up Have used it many times

title: Trip with the group of 10 folks
review: Airport link is best way to reach airport As Bangkok traffic is paining best way is to use this transport for reaching to Bangkok airport and avoid paid of being roads in taxis or autos

title: The only way to travel.
review: Yes its busy yes its packed but its air conditioned it takes you to all the destinations for shopping and site seeing Best of all its cheap  this is the best way to travel around BKK

title: Easy to use, convenient but may not be cheap
review: It's clean convenient to many major locations and great for locals and tourists to use However if you have a fair number of people like 3 4 or more people it may be more expensive after paying round trip For a trip down the main tourist area several stops away you may spend $3$5 per person roundtrip Taxi's are real cheap in Thailand as compared to other countries in Asia or Europe So you may want to compare the Skytrain rates with taxis for more than a couple of people

title: Clean and efficient
review: Quick cheap and easy to use Skytrain is a much better way of travelling once you arrive in  Bangkok Rather than sitting for ages in the horrendous Bangkok traffic especially if you've had a long flight

title: From Sucarnubhumi to ciry
review: Only done this trip once  A little tricky to get aboard  But once in an easy route to city   About 30 minutes  You may need to swap trains in city   Or catch a taxi with your luggage to your hotel   Clean  Efficient  Regular service

title: BTS is a great way to move around
review: The BTS service is clean safe pleasant convenient Highly recommended  Note that there is a 100Baht nonrefundable “issuing cost” to the “Rabbit” value card What is refundable is only the value balance If you are a foreigner you need to show your passport to buy the Rabbit card If you are traveling in a family buying multiple cards just show one passport will do  Note that the BTS (also kniwn as Skytrain (above ground)) ticketing system & the MRT (underground) ticketing system are two totally separate & unrelated ticketing systems BTS uses cards MRT uses blackcolored round tokens Not interoperable There is no single integrated ticketing system be it for locals or for tourists There is no single BTScumMRT tourist pass type card  That said there are BTS & MRT interchange stations  Generally the above ground BTS network covers the majority of the tourist places of interests including popular malls   The MRT network slightly more outlying So most tourist metro travel will be on BTS

title: Very convinient and clean
review: Bangkok is a very  busy city with busy traffic  When you go out for sightseeing or shopping you had better to use public transportation You might be free from the traffic jam  BTS Sky trainMRT subway & Airport Link are very convinient and helpful for foreingner and tourist  You can get the route map from the hotel and tourist center

title: Excellent way to get around Bangkok
review: You can get an all day ticket for THB140 which takes you to many of the shopping centres and tourist destinations in a quick and easy fashion around Bangkok  so easy to use

title: More comfortable than the London Underground
review: Based on my experience of the sky train the only real downside is the fact that travelling with a pram can be a pain due to the stairs There probably are lifts but we didn’t find them The train itself although busy at times is air conditioned and easy to navigate around using a digital map to show location Being above the ground seeing Bangkok is great and more enjoyable than being beneath the ground The downside is the network is not particularly extensive and unlike the tube in London it would be impractical to rely solely on the sky train to navigate Bangkok

title: I love Asok
review: I would ride the skytrain just to listen to the automated conductor pronounce the names of the stations Yes that's almost anorak until you imagine the Thai beauty intonjng the places Asok  my favourite and regular stop on the line along the Suhkamvit road  In Bangkok this is the only way to travel Airconditioned carriages high above the heat and melee The city grinds to a halt at street level  even in a tuctuc Great connections with the airport river express boats and all major districts Day and night  it's clean safe and gives overhead views of the parks and palaces

title: Very easy way to get to airport
review: My mom and I took the MRT to the Airport Rail Link to make it to the BKK airport Very easy to use and cheap  35 baht per person According to the hotel receptionist (we stayed near Asok BTS station) it takes about the same amount of time as a taxi Would definitely use this again next time

title: Really easy to navigate and see Bangkok!!
review: Really easy to navigate the sky train  Don't be worried about getting on it just by an all day ticket and make your way about town

title: Amazingly poorly thought out
review: The Rail Link should be the perfect option for getting downtown  It should drop you right by Sukhumvit and Central World  Instead it doesn't connect to the BTS (sky train) or MRT (subway) it requires you to lug your suitcases up and down stairs and because it was so poorly planned it doesn't get much business  Someone should be fired

title: Fantastic way to get around
review: This is a great way to get around Bangkok it's cheap clean & very friendly & I would highly recommend it it's also very cheap

title: Fast and cheap
review: It cuts out Bkk's horrid traffic and is very cheap What else would you want aside from taking the tollway It has an express train to the airport once or twice an hour too

title: fast and efficient
review: I was travelling with my daughter and took this train from airport to downtown BangkokIt was fast We traveled around noon so it was not crowdedSpent only 45 baht for this Hustle free and cheap

title: Fun
review: I really liked this tour The guide was fun and I had a good time The food at the floating marketing was delicious

title: Clean, Air-conditioned, cheap
review: What an amazing way to get around in Bangkok  Clean and airconditioned It does get very packed on the trains  Very reasonably priced

title: Public transit on BTS
review: It’s clean and cool on the sky train It may be crowded but it’s easy to us Lights show where you’ve been and where you’re going Exchange to other directions is easy and you can take a leg to the BKK airport too Some ticket purchase requires change or smaller bills but there’s a quick option for buying your ticket from a human being It’s easier than the DC metro for sure

title: Good for ride in from Suvarnabhumi airport
review: It’s inexpensive and clean and comfortable — and crowded during rush hour I think it’s best for locals commuting though because it’s not particularly convenient to most tourist areas

title: Busy but efficient
review: This is really the only way to travel East to West in Bangkok The sky train gets busier every time we go but it's worth the 'push and shove' to stay out of the traffic deadlock Suggest you buy a 'rabbit card' to avoid big queues at the ticket machines

title: sky train
review: Very busy and crowded but very convenient way of travel around a very busy City and very cheap Disliked the queues for tickets

title: best way to travel
review: i use this a few  days agoits fast and efficentno need to get caught up in the trafficfor 44bhat its good value and easy to use

title: Great way to beat the traffic in Bangkok
review: We travelled with 3 young kids it was cheap and convenient The only downside is you have to walk up and down a lot of steps if there is no lift or escalators but we were fine

title: Very easy to use
review: We used the sky train for a night trip up Sukhumvit Having not used it before and without change() we went to the ticket booth (not sure when it is open perhaps we were lucky) Very easy to use clean and COOL Don’t expect to be able to keep your ticket as a souvenir they WILL take your plastic card  For four people it was the same price as a taxi but you miss the traffic and get to your destination more quickly

title: Fast
review: It would help though if they have English translations on their map It's hard enough that they don't have English signs Harder still that the people in the booth or the security guards don't understand you when you ask for directions

title: An excellent way to travel to Bangkok from city.
review: this is an excellent mode of travel from Bangkok airport to city the fare upto Phon Thai station is 45 bath for normal train and higher fare(donot remember now) for direct train however i would recommend to go with normal train it makes only 57min difference From Phon Thai station one can get connections to other MRT stations easily I found this link much easier to use than taxis  if you want to go to center of bangkok say Sukhumvit then with taxis you may end up in traffic jams this is not with the rail link this link is less costly too

title: Excellent and well-organized tour
review: This is one of those tours where I need not worry much They were really punctual and even though in the morning I was at another entrance of the royal orchid Sherrington hotel the guy waited on another entrance but it's ok I still made it on time Maybe he should walk around to look for me next time  The lady Kiri tried to make us feel comfortable As I was carrying a bag pack (since I need to go to another hotel) she and the driver helped me ensure that it is safe in the bus  She also talked and introduce us on what to do at the railway and ensure that everything goes smoothly I almost got lost since the railway was crowded but she told us to meet near an iconic area   At the floating market she did discourage us on certain purchases eg taking picture with wildlife which is in line with my values I don't want to encourage wildlife trade too  At the end of the day she was flexible enough to get the driver to drop me off halfway cos my hotel is not near MBK   Excellent tour

title: Inevitable but need improvement
review: It’s really hard to use the other ways to go to work for most ppl in Bangkok but I feel like this you need to improve a lot so if you have better service in avoiding traffic

title: Great experience to do train travel like the old days.
review: I took the 0750 am train from Bangkok Thonburi station to Kanchanaburi Station It arrived at about 1020 am It is a very relaxing ride There is no air conditioning but the overhead fans and the fresh air through the wide open windows makes it fairly comfortable  The cost one way is 100 Baht (US$330) What a bargain At the Thonburi station there are plenty of vendors and food stalls so you can stock up on snacks and drinks before the trip  On the next day I travelled from Kanchanaburi to Hellfire Pass by local bus After exploring Hellfire Pass I travelled from the Hellfire Pass bus stop (located across the highway and about 5 minute walk back towards Kanch) back to Namtok Railway Station Its only about 20 minutes by bus The bus stops at Hellfire Pass at 1110 1210 1310up to 1710 which is last bus You want to catch 1410 bus at latest in order to make the 1530 train from Namtok The bus dropped me off at Saiyoknoi Water Fall about a 1 km walk to Namtok There were plenty of food stalls and vendors so I grabbed something to eat  The train from Namtok back to River Kwai station was about a 2 hour ride and one of the most scenic rides I have ever been on Just some beautiful views of the River Kwai Cost again is 100 baht one way

title: Very convenient transportation system
review: Access to these stations from your hotels will get you to many places on the cheap and comfortably from the Bangkok heat The MBK malls on the Skytain stops together with the upscale Siam Paragon mall are all very near Skytrain stops even the Jim Thompson House The food court at the MBK mall is called the Food Republic is very convenient cool and pleasant

title: Convenient and comfortable
review: The BTS transport system is a clean comfortable and convenient system to get around in Bangkok Very useful if you want to avoid traffic in central Bangkok and the annoying taxituktuk drivers who try to overcharge at every opportunity and travel in a cool carriage while its sweltering outside Ticket price depends on your destination (stations grouped by zones)   It is quite easy to navigate and use even for new travellers The only potentially annoying part is that it requires to queue up for coin change and then buying the ticket at the machines While very crowded during rush hours it's no worse than in London )

title: Great way to get around in Bangkok
review: The subway is designed as a loop line for inner city of Bangkok Best of all it has elevators for wheelchair access

title: First time user
review: I'd never used sky train travel I enjoyed seeing Bangkok this way Everyone in the stations was helpful

title: Best way into the city from the airport.
review: If you are staying in central Bangkok the rail link is the most efficient way to get to and from the airport

title: Bangkok Suvarnabhumi Airport Rail Link to Ratchaprarop Station
review: It was more economical and convenient to take Airport Rail Link to Ratchaprarop Station for 40 baht I was staying at Centara Watergate Pavillion Hotel so just walking distance from the station to the hotel

title: easy way to airport
review: Because of the traffic we were advised by hotel staff to travel by Airport Raill Linkwhich faster and to avoid bad traffic

title: Really easy.
review: I was a little dubious about using this transport in a land with a completely different language but it was painless with helpful staff Easy to navigate I'd recommend trying it

title: Best way to travel
review: Easy fast and no queue Taxi and tuktuk get stuck in traffic all the time and also cost more than the BTS Aircondition makes the BTS more comfortable than tuktuk

title: Great way to travel
review: With my granddaughter's help we were able to enjoy traveling around Bangkok on the Skytrain  You do need to know Thai or have a guide to be completely successful

title: Totally recommend!!
review: Modern quick cheap and really easy to use Great way to explore Bangkok without the need for taxis and traffic jams

title: No show
review: This was available when we arrived January 18  Disappointing and the commute on the other train was another 30 minutes   Big thumbs down

title: For getting around, it is essential.
review: There's nothing glamorous about the train network in Bangkok It's set up mostly to accomodate standing passengers  it the Air Conditioning works well and makes for a decent yet cramped escape from the heat when you need to get across the city   The ticketing system is confusing at first until you get your head around it Just look st the sign showing the stations and you'll see a number in the circle for that station That number represents how much money you need to pump into the machine to get to your destination   On one occasion one of the station staff that served us took our money and gave us a card I should have realised something was up when he didn't ring it up on the till He basically just pocketed our cash and gave us a useless pass   So be careful just carry coin to use in the machines or use the office to get change for your notes   Otherwise It's a good option to cover the longer distances across Bangkok as taxis are often reluctant to go too far

title: World Class
review: A world class service Easy for foreigner to navigate upon Cheap fast and clean service From Bangkok airport right into the heart of the city You can't go wrong

title: Very historic
review: Very historic place to visit when we went in January they had souvenir markets there Beautiful scenery to see

title: Great system
review: Only used it on a tour we did but the air con was amazing plus it was clean and easy to use Train map simple to follow and stations all clearly marked

title: Ask for Suzy!!! Great half day trip.
review: They are very punctual Suzy was our guide and was very informative Buys everyone snacks and makes sure everyone is having a great time During the train ride I watched her collect the whole group so they could have the best seat in the back of the train for the market view Some people complained it wasn’t enough time at each location but I thought it was just the right amount of time The Thai food you order through her is absolutely delicious I also recommend her friends shop Just tell her you’re with Suzy and no need to haggle She gave amazing prices Also she try’s her best to take pictures of her group and air drops them to you later which is supper sweet

title: Scenic and historical attraction
review: Very peaceful and scenic attraction although it is called the death railway You can walk along a stretch of the bridge and there is a Buddha cave nearby the start of the bridge

title: Excellent Mode of Transport from Suvarnabhoomi Airport
review: We used this as soon as we reached Bangkok Airport Just get to the lower basement from where you can board it   We had to go to Sukhumvit and understood that Makkasan was the nearest stop Oneway there is about 70 Baht which is a lot lower than Taxi (taxi can be anywhere in the range of 600800 including 100 Baht of Airport surcharge) and the rail link also beats the major Bangkok traffic From Makkasan there is connectivity via BTS to Sukhumvit and other parts of the city but we took a taxi and it was just 50 Baht to Hilton Sukhumvit We also took the rail link back to the airport and it was super convenient  The whole system is well maintained and managed The staff is very helpful with whatever limited knowledge of English they have  I definitely recommend Airport Rail Link to avoid airport surcharges Taxi hassles and the traffic

title: Excellent means of transport
review: We found this a quick efficient means of travelling from one place to another and it linked with other means of public transport  It can be very crowded

title: Clean and reliable
review: Bangkok's skytrain is very clean and reliable We used day passes to get around Bangkok that were easy to use and economical for hop on hop off

title: One of the easiest ways to get around Bangkok
review: Definitely one of the easiest ways to travel throughout the city  Cheap efficient and fast  Do be aware the during rush hour times (morning 730 to about 930 and evening especially 430 to about 830) the BTS can be very crowded depending on the day and time of year  Crowded as in packing people in as much as possible  Although finding a taxi motorcycle taxi or the metro subway are all busy and in use at these times so you may need to plan around rush hour if you are the type of person who doesn't have the patience to deal with it at rush hour times  However I would still recommend using this if possible because it is easy cheap and fast  Watch some videos online of how to buy a fare and you'll be a pro in 3 minutes

title: Convenient way to travel
review: Sad to see that the express train service was no longer available But the cost of the airport rail line is reasonable priced Can easily direct to main train lines Can be crowded at peak periods But trains are clean and quiet

title: BTS skytrain
review: The BTS is our transport of choice in Bangkok  forget taxis which are forever caught in traffic for hours on end Buy a Rabbit card (you need to show your passport for ID) and then keep topping up as needed It's fast and convenient

title: Effiecient during rush hour
review: This elevated is not he chaepest option but it's faster than a taxi during rush hour If you are with 2 or more persons the taxi is cheaper as well so the choice is easy there are only e a few lines but they don't stop at the major turist attractions aas Khao sarn or the royal palace

title: Convenient!
review: This is really a convenient way to travel around Bangkok Fast & easy specially if you're avoiding the traffic

title: Quick and clean train
review: IF you land in Bangkok and don't have a ton of bags Take the train This train I think is the quickest like to the BTS sky train Once you get to there you are free to go most any area of Bangkok and then you can get  taxi to your specific location

title: Depends on the time of Day
review: The airport rail link is relatively slow it takes 40 minutes+ from Phraya Thai station to get to Suvarnabhumi and only runs every 1015 minutes however if you happen to be travelling at peak traffic times it does offer the great advantage of missing the potential gridlock Rather old rolling stock do not expect a smooth BTS style ride

title: Regular visitoe
review: Look for value for money and location with easy access to transportlike to have a good breakfast includedCan leave luggage with hotel while travelling to other countries and areas in Thailandie we travelled to Japan and Hong Kong

title: reliable transportation
review: forget taxi use bts one of the reasons we love bangkok reliable bts with good cold aircon in the middle of a hot day

title: efficient and affordable
review: The BTS Skytrain allows you to get around the city very easily and the rate for the trip is really affordable However for me sometimes there are difficulties for me to get around when I get the directions wrong so recommending people to check the route map before hand

title: Please use it, really. It's that good =)
review: It's cheap  It's convenient  It's efficient and effective  It's suitable for everyone regardless of your age or physical capabilities  By the way the staffs at the ticketing counter were definitely welltrained

title: Way to travel
review: A real quick and easy way to get around once you understand the different train lines Highly recommended

title: Interesting way to travel to northern Thailand
review: We travelled return to Chiang Mai from Bangkok on the overnight sleeper train  2nd class sleeper  Reasonable conditions on board however due to length of time taken to do this trip I would recommend going one way by train and then flying back to Bangkok if the budget allows  The lights on the train stay on all night and if you are unlucky to land a berth next to the toilet and crew station sleep is hard to come by  Glad that we had this experience but not keen to repeat it again in a hurry

title: Feezing airconditioning
review: Limited lines and therefore of limited use Airconditioning was at freezing temperature and made the transition to 32 degrees Bangkok temperature unpleasant I prefer a taxi or tuktuk

title: Fast, cheap and efficient.
review: The only negative with BTS was the hoard of people using it but it was Saturday and the crowds were polite Signposting is very clear buying tickets quick and easy The north south east west system is clever The only way to travel across the city in Bangkok

title: Easy and Convenient
review: Easy access transportation from airport to city vise versa and it is clean cheap fare and nice friendly staff

title: Very steep steps and no escalator
review: It was not convenient for my mother who has Osteoporosis and knee cap problems There is only escalator that either goes up or down at all stations There were no stations with both up and down escalators This is difficult for elderly people to travel with

title: Cheapest way to and from Airport
review: Congested during peak hours but otherwise the best and cheapest way to travel to and from Bangkok and the airport

title: Cheap and Efficient
review: Escape the noise heat humidity and hazardous footpaths and take the train It's the cheapest public transport system I have encountered

title: Clean and fast
review: Practical train if you need something fast and cheap to go directly to the city Clean and fast I recommand it

title: Eliminate The Flat Rate Scoundrels
review: I decided to take the Airport Rail Link after my last experience in 2015 with a taxi driver Back then I arrived late so when I exited the airport it was already past midnight The driver won't turn on the meter He demanded a flat rate of 500 bahts After traveling for close to 24 hours I reached the point where my sanity mattered more than being right This time I stayed overnight at a hotel near Suvarnabhumi airport I arranged for the hotel shuttle to pick me up I had reserved a sim card I used it to call the hotel and tell them where I am and I was told where to meet their agent who called the driver to get me I checked out of the hotel at noon and took the hotel shuttle back to the airport I then bought a ticket from the machine that costs a little over $1 I got off at Makkasan Staation then took the MRT to my hotel The train can be overcrowded Maybe they need more trains running often Within 35 minutes the rain is in Bangkok  I told this story to the taxi driver who took me to the airport so he can pass on this information to other taxi drivers The moral of the story if they keep demanding passengers pay a flat rate then people like me will sleep at an airport hotel upon arrival late at night and not subject ourselves to being shaken down to pay a flat rate when at that time of night Bangkok has very little traffic and a taxi fare will be around 125 bahts that time of night minus surcharge for night service

title: Clean location and friendly people
review: My trip to Hellfire Pass was amazing we did a private tour and our guide walked us through the area and then a short ac car ride to a local Thai restaurant for lunch (included) then onto the train to go over the last wooden bridge then back into the car to Kwai River Bridge and the Australian cemetery then back to Bangkok total trip was about 12 hrs and cost us $120 each included lunch as much water as we could drink car rides train ride the tour guide entry into Hellfire experience and return to motel (seriously the best way to do this otherwise you are driving around in a bus picking up heaps of people and then rushed at the sites

title: Easy - fast - cheap
review: The BTS is a massive asset for Bangkok and a win for tourists   So much better than your options if taxi’s or tuk tuk’s  it is fast and smooth and clean    As an added bonus you are above the street and clutter and get a great view of everything as you roll by  it’s kind of like a free city orientation   I would suggest booking accommodation that is accessible from the BTS  it will make your stay so much better

title: "It is transportation not a destination"
review: I am puzzled about this skytrain getting the #2 ranking in things to do in Bangkok  There is nothing that special or entertaining about it Are we so excited because Bangkok has a subway  Yes I did find it modern easy to use and convenient but I would not make a point of using it if you have other means of transportation

title: Travelling about in Bangkok
review: Very easy and efficient way to access the newer parts of Bangkok Crowded during the rush hour but what city transport isn't

title: Easier than expected
review: Exactly what it says on the ti a fast air coned rail link to the airport cuts a lot of traffic time out No problems

title: Can be overcrowded but still fast and cheap
review: The underground is the fast and cheap way to go around Bangkok Maps are displayed almost everywhere with clean and understandable displays of how to get where you have to be

title: Fast and cheap travel
review: Can't praise this highly enough Trains are frequent fast and clean Fares are very cheap and the system is easy to navigate with stations close to most popular attractions Definitely worth using this wonderful transport system

title: Recheck your booking by contacting them
