title: Avoid the Bangkok traffic ... take the ARL
review: The Airport Rail Link is very convenient if you are travelling in small numbers if it's rush hour it's raining or you are running on the cheap If there are 4 in your group I recommend taking a taxi as it reduces the amount of lugging bags Hope you never have to travel on Friday evenings when it's raining  The Airport Rail Link is at the basement of Suvarnabhumi Airport You need to just keep going down the escalators until you can’t go any further Then you need find your way to the centre of that level and you will find a downward slope towards the ticket office and gates  This is also where you can change your money There are several foreign exchange counters in this area and although you can’t play one off the other you can work out which one is offering the best rate and plump for that one You probably won’t get such a concentration of foreign exchange dealers in one location anywhere else in Bangkok Also something to bear in mind these guys like big notes If you are travelling with large denomination bills you will see on the electronic boards that they offer better rates for those larger notes  The line that you currently have no choice but to take the the commuter line This also stops at Makkasan and Phaya Thai BTS stations but also every stop along the way The service runs from 0600 – 2400  While I can’t give you the exact prices for all the stations to get to Makkasan it costs THB 35 for Paya Thai it is THB 45 (about 6080p in real money) for about a 30minute journey As a point of reference a taxi could cost around THB400 (£7) and might take longer if it’s rush hour orand it’s raining  You can either use the machine (which will be in English or Thai) or you can go to the counter Very broadly if your hotel is near an MRT station you will need to go Makkasan if your hotel is near a BTS station you will need Phaya Thai In exchange for your THB45 you will receive a little token in the shape of a large coin — either yellow or red in colour if I remember correctly  Once you have gone through the gates you make your way down the escalators to the platform Usually there are people already queuing up at the doors This not the opportunity to show how clever you are and try to sneak to the front Thai people are generally nonconfrontational so probably won’t say anything but you will certainly get other visitors making comments to you such as “get to the back … buddy” or if you’re really unlucky someone just punches you one… no no … I jest but there is reason there is a queue people got there before you If you happen to have arrived just as a train has left you will find yourself at the front of the queue This does not mean stand right by the door You will need to stand behind the line If you don’t you will soon hear a blast of a whistle when the security instruct you to retreat — bear this in mind as it happens at all BTS stations If you’re wondering why the whistle is blowing it’s probably because of you  When the train does finally arrive don’t dash on before everyone has got off Firstly this is bad etiquette anywhere in the world (just because you left your home country doesn’t mean you left your manners behind)) but secondly yes you guessed it it will lead to a blast on that famous whistle The security guards will visually sweep the train to ensure that there was nothing left on the train or that there is nothing suspicious (other than tourists) Once they give the all clear you can go ahead and board  Bear in mind that this is a commuter train so you will be sharing the carriage with many other people Yes when you first get on it is likely that there will be plenty of space However as you get to more and more stations there will be many people boarding — especially if it is rush hour andor raining Remember how you feel when it’s rush hour Yeah you get pee’d off when people take lots of space so think about others Keep your luggage close and don’t take up those extra spare seats for your hand bag

review: The BTS Skytrain is pretty easy to navigate The map is self explanatory And the counter desk staff are always helpful as well

title: Best way to travel within BKK
review: The BTS is by far the best way to move around Bangkok especially considering the legendary traffic The clerks at the ticket office are conversant in English so tourists typically can ask for assistance if needed  Affordable rates great schedule and definitely most efficient

title: Easy to navigate, AC a God send
review: I definitely recommend using the BTS if you're in Bangkok Smooth clean trains that are easy to navigate They even have a ticket window if you want to speak to a person to buy your tickets Also a reasonable price

title: Best form of transportation in Bangkok
review: The BTS is very easy to use If you don't know where you're going the information desk is very helpful and will tell you which stop to get off at The BTS is very clean and seems to run very smoothly During times to high traffic this is much quicker and cheaper than the hourtwo hour cab rides through Bangkok

title: Aiconditioned, speedy way to travel round Bangkok
review: Unless you're travelling late at night the streets of Bangkok are gridlocked  The BTS will get you there fast and cheaply  If you need change for the machines go to the nearby ticket windows (They rarely actually sell tickets from them)  The machines are easy to operate once you've figured it out  look for your destination and the fare is highlighted next to it  Change is given

title: Fast but a bit expensive
review: fastest means of travel its a bit crowded and a bit expensive to my liking46 persons can hire a cab together at this price but will be stuck in traffic

title: Quick and cheap way into town
review: When you're booking a hotel booking near this line will make your life easier  It start at the airport and is easy to use  It's a bit of a shock to the system to see Bangkok for the first time outside the station in the city but we had a short walk straight to the hotel

title: Modern Efficient Skytrain
review: Linked to the excellent underground train system (MRT) and Airport Link the BTS  also known as the Skytrain  is a clean efficient and extremely convenient way to avoid traffic congestion and get around the city quickly The system has 2 easytonavigate routes running the length and breadth of central Bangkok maps help and information (in English) are freely available at all stops Rides are relatively cheap and frequent Avoid rush hours many escalators but not wheelchair friendly and no toilets available

title: Cheapest way for accessing the DMK
review: This railway is just opposite the international terminal of DMK If you have plentiful of time (at least one hour from downtown area  like Hualamphong station or Samsen Station it costs 5 baht to get to the airport by ordinary car but it's free when you are thai  just show your national ID on complimentary free train The station is very easy to navigate there is the slope way walking over the Vibhavadi road to accede the terminal without any difficulties Enjoy slow train service among busy Bangkok to the DMK via this type of transportation There is also very cheap lugguage deposit as compared to pricey luggage room service on the departure floor of the airport terminal

title: Excellent way to travel
review: Great way to get around the city free of trafficTaxis are not expensive but sometimes can be slow

title: BEST Transit system ever
review: Instead of adding to the everrising problem of pollution they are doing a great job at recycling The ticket you buy for a oneway pass is collected from you as you exit the platform at your final destination The trains were always clean and on time I never had an issue feeling unsafe as a solo female traveler no matter what time of the day I rode the train   If you are unsure how to read the map the customer service reps will help you out

title: Excellent trip
review: The trip was so fun and the guide was really nice and spoke good english We saw so much in those few hours

title: Fantastic Experience
review: You should try at least one train journey while visiting Thailand We travelled from Bangkok to Ayutthaya On the trip to Ayutthaya we travelled 3rd class  what fun  no windows in the carriages and as for health and safety forget it the carriage doors are open The Thai people are clever they know not to fall out of the carriage Cost of a single ticket 20Baht that's correct yes only 20THB For our return trip to Bangkok we treated ourselves to 2nd class  which was complete with windows and doors that shut plus air con  cost 260 Baht A fantastic experience

title: STILL the best way to get through the city. (especially during rush hour)
review: it's got ice cold aircon and runs like clockwork the only downside is that it doesn't run into the DEEP into the late hours of the night if you are into high end destination shopping malls that also have loads of restaurants this train hits just about every major site with a station stop

title: Normally runs frequently without issue
review: Sometimes overcrowded sometimes not Fast efficient and cheap way to travel to and from the airport to multiple areas of the city

title: Airconditioned and easy to use
review: Save time and money and travel on the BTS Bangkok's traffic can make getting around slow if you are not prepared to brave the motorcycle taxis The BTS is airconditioned which is a welcome relief on Bangkok's mostly hot days It does not cover everywhere you want to go but it does get you around to many areas quickly and efficiently Pretty easy to follow just make sure you know which direction you need

title: Skytrain is the best way...
review: Avoid the traffic & smog tuk tuk's etc and use the Skytrain  Pretty quick safe air conditioned friendly helpful staff extensive network cheap tickets open from 06002400 what more do you need

title: Ease of travel
review: Bangkok has a very well connected sky train network which makes it very convenient to travel to most of the tourist places with ease & comfort

title: Excellent system
review: We bought the 15 trip pass which cost us around 400 Bahts We used our pass to travel to many places and if not of the pass the total cost would have been at least 600 to 800 Bahts

title: An excellent way to travel within Bangkok
review: Its very easy to use with the signages buying tickets is easy as well faster and convenient way to travel and escape the traffic jams

title: Quick and easy transportation
review: Using the SkytrainBTS is a quick and easy way of getting around central Bangkok Much cheaper than using a taxi or tuktuk Usually the price is about 13

title: Well working train system
review: The BTS well working with good frequency clean and nice air conditioned and reasonable priced You can buy a day pass for 140 bat  4 $

title: Great service for unbelievable price
review: It must be kidding that the rail link cost about one euro Great and easy link to city center and easy to change in Skytrain

title: Day trip out of Bangkok not to be missed.
review: The train ride and boat was good It was a shame that due to covid the floating markets were a bit underwhelming with the lack of boats Our guide Sarah was very insightful helpful and funny I have never been a fan of large group tours but the transportation was also very nice I went to Bangkok with my mother for the first time in the future I will most likely come again with my other family members and would book this tour again

title: Convenient & clean
review: When it’s rush our in Bangkok this is the bet alternative to getting somewhere quick The BTS is the cleanest train subway I’ve been on  The intercom calls out all the station before each stop in thai and English so you will not be confuse unlike other country

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Easy  clean inexpensive organized train system in Bangkok  Beat the hassles and bargaining with taxi drivers  And more efficient since it avoid Bangkok traffic jams  It runs to BKK airport as well  make sure people working at airport don't lure you to use taxi instead because train is out of service It's TRAP  CU Around

title: 15 minutes to town!
review: Beat all traffic jams But note that the MRT at Makkasan is out of the station and across the road on the left

title: Pricey
review: The use of this transportation system is iffy If you are traveling with more than one person it is probably cheaper to use a taxi However it can be a good way to avoid sitting in traffic if you are in a hurry

title: very useful!!!
review: it has great connections with skytrain that helps u to reach ur destination for a cheap price without making u obliged to use taxi which is waaaay more expensive

title: Great Public Transport
review: Excellent Public Transport and so easy to use very busy at all times but everyone was very helpful and accomodating I would not recommend doing the trip from airport with lots of luggage as we did unless your fond of hard work and being wrecked at end of your journey For getting around it's bliss for airport runs pay that little extra and get a taxi

title: Less stress
review: If your Hotel or Guesthouse is downtown I would always reccomend to take the Airport Rail Link It´s fast save cheap and comfy And much less stressfull then take a taxi No traffic jam

title: Night train to Vientiane
review: We arrived in Bangkok midday and had been trying to book tickets on line which seemed a bit expensive and not a user friendly website Therefore we decided to get tickets at the station on the day which was a much easier process and cheaper We got 2nd class sleeper tickets for a 1000B which was great value for money The train itself was really modern clean and well thought out The staff even made our bed for us and answered any questions we had  Very smooth trip and easy to fall asleep and wake up at our destination they even had a restaurant car with WiFi I will definitely use this train again when we travel back into thailand

title: Excelent service!
review: I have been many times in Bangkok and I love to take the BTS to avoid traffic and to share with the locals because they are normally very smiley  and friendly  people but last November the were still very sad and affected for the death of their king and the general ambiance at the BTS wasn't the same

title: Best way to move in Bangkok
review: A city like bangkok with a intense traffic and crazy taxi and tuktuk drivers the best way to go anywhere is the skytrain  In Bangkok tuktuk and taxi drivers dont want to know where you want to go but where they can make some money with tourists

title: Great way to get about
review: It doesn't go everywhere but when you can use it do because it is clean fast and cheap

title: Best way from the airport to central Bangkok
review: These trains run every 15 minutes and are fast and easy to use costing only 45 baht it must also be the cheapest

title: Excellent Service
review: This Rail Link is much better than being stuck in traffic its has a lot of stops but it takes you directly to the airport Excellent Service

title: BTS perfect for me.
review: I just feel relaxed to move around Bangkok without almost ever using a car BTS is 100% reliable from early mornig up to midnight  Together with Metro you can just skip all the traffic in Bangkok This is great Wish I'd the same at home

title: Quick and easy
review: Quick and easy to get into Bangkok and all for 70 that a taxi would charge 500 that its a no brainer

title: Subway transporation
review: Very good underground train with good access for people with physical limitations The areas of coverage are mostly for residence areas However if you want to visit the Night Flower market and not be too much in trafic jams you can take this train to its end station and tkae a taxi from there The train and stations are very modern and well organized Discount on tickets for children and seniors

title: Sky train - very efficient
review: Quickest way of getting around Bangkok with possible exception of motor bike taxis Only covers a limited part of the city

title: Excellent except for the katoeys
review: Wonderful clean and efficient system  only problem and this goes for all of Bangkok is there are too many damn katoeys

title: Way too crowded now during peak times.
review: The Skytrain used to be great but now that they have expanded the lines it's too crowded during peak times Try to avoid Asoke and Siam stations during rush hour I used to use the Skytrain all the time and even though I live very near a station I try to avoid the Skytrain these days

title: good but a bit costly
review: As compare to other country i found it to be a bit costly It is really life saver specially in the evening as there is hell lot of traffic and you can easily travel without any problem

title: efficient and cool (temperature-wise) way to travel
review: BTS makes it easier to get around than walking because of the streets Recommend if you have a clear idea of where you are and where you're going to

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: I love Bangkok but traveling can be a nightmare The BTS is without a doubt the best way to get around the city Clean fast and safe and with plans in place to expand the network it should only get even better

title: Good public transport
review: It's a great way to get around Bangkok It's cheap and normally runs on time The only thing is you may want to avoid rush hour if you don't like crowds or being squashed like sardines

title: Best way into the city from the airport
review: Taxi's in Bangkok are notorious for attempting to rip off the tourists  Why risk the headache  One more floor down is the Airport Rail Link with two choicesthe City Line or the Express  City Line is 45 baht (about $140 as of this writing) and makes many stops picking up commuting locals on it's way into the city  It has hard plastic seating and is very crowded  However the Express line is only 100 baht (slightly over $300 as of this writing) and is worth it  Comfy European style train seats that are plush and padded luggage racks available (noticeably absent from City Line) and a look around the place on the way in since the seats look out with windows rather than with your back to the windows as they are on City Line  Make the splurge and enjoy the ride

title: Convinient best way to skip trafic jams
review: The most convenient to skip the hazel guzzle and the huge line of jams in and out to the city supper fast easy and efficient try and special day tickets are available do except queues of few tourist to get tickets and they are mini malls also available at stations

title: Subway and skytrain are connected at Taopoon station, more convenience !
review: This subway used to start from Bangsue to Hualumpong on the other end Right now it is extended from Bangsue station to Taopoon station which you can connected to skytrain purple line to Bangyai on the 4th floor platform You don't have to change train at Bangsue station to go to Hualampong if you are travelling from Taopoon station likewise if you are trabelling from Hualumpong towards Bangsue you don't have to change train to go yo Taopoon This is very convinience But they are getting popular among commutor if you are using are train at rush hour you may have to wait for the secod train or even the third one to get a seat though you are getting on the first station of the route MRT prepaid card can be used at Taopoon station for a blue line subway ride but I don't know about the purple line

title: No hassles
review: For one or two people this is the way to travel from the airport to down town Bangkok For more people you might as well take a taxi but take into account the traffic jams Foir us Airport link in combination with BTS worked very well

title: Great Connectivity
review: Cheap and very well connected to everywhere you wanna go to in Bangkok Even when crowded you will always find enough room to stand Very easily accessible to most malls

title: Fast and convenient way to get to central Bangkok
review: The fast service  every 1520 min gets you to Makkasan in 15 min (currently 90 Baht) Perfect and certainly preferable to any taxi that will be definitely much slower and much more expensive (given the terrible traffic jams in that city)   The company running the AirportRail link service should definitely do more to popularize it  I'm glad I found out at it before I went to Bangkok Used it 4 times (as we went to Krabi & back via Suvarnabhumi airport) Every time infalliable Not sure what the previous reviewer is taking about  every 40 min    perhaps the other branch  the regular service The fast service I took from Makkasan express operated every 1520 max

title: easy to travel center of Bangkok
review: One day ticket is budget and good for traveler Please avoid rush hour morning 7  9 am and evening 5  7 pm

title: The best way to get around central Bangkok
review: Clean airconditioned public transport in Bangkok offering easy to get to the central area of the city with shopping malls hotels and restaurants

title: Super Easy Option
review: We were lucky to catch the last one into Bangkok at a fraction of what a cab or taxi would cost Look up the maps and timetable online before your trip  Super easy and convenient

title: Good way to get around
review: Clean and above ground so you can see the city  It is crowded

title: Easy way to travel
review: BTS is an excellent way to travel to various location within Bangkok city Well signed and  good announcements on the train regarding next stops Excellent value for money

title: Easy to use and convenient
review: The Skytrain is a great way to visit different places inside Bangkok (which is a large sprawling city) for a relatively cheap price  The trains can get a little crowded and are usually quite noisy because of the constant video ads playing on the walls inside the subway cars

title: Convenient and efficient means of tranaport within Bangkok city
review: If you are staying within the city this is the best means of transport  Bangkok traffic is always challenging with the perpetual traffic jams As such you should avoid taking taxis and tuk tuks unless you don't mind getting stuck in traffic  The BTS stations are very well spread out across the city and you can get almost everywhere in the city but you must be prepared to do a bit of walking While it can get crowded it is fairly comfortable  The downer for me is the need to change coins manually at the station to purchase single trip tickets

title: Short Journey
review: Took a short journey on the SkyTrain from Phaya Thai to Siam I was very impressed with the entire experience Ticket was very reasonably priced and the train was ontime quick and comfortable

title: A part of history
review: Nice and preserved section of single track railway still operating passing through cliff and some wooden bridge pros supporting the rails A cave with Buddha as well Plenty of local shops at entrance to a local station selling Tshirt and local stuffs

title: Easier than the tube in London!!
review: I live and work in London and consult the tube map weekly on how to get certain places The sky train is so much easier to navigate and it's air conditioned I didn't spend more than 42B on a single journey that would have cost me 200B++ in a taxi or tut Tut Solo female travellers  it's perfectly safe Trust me if I can do it so can you

title: Convenient and fast means of transport .. saving grace actually!!
review: Absolutely must use in Bangkok  Bangkok has very busy roads traffic jams and a lot of one ways add to the pain You wait hours in slow moving traffic So do look for hotels near sky train stations you will save money but more importantly you would save lot of time Lot of attractions like siam center ocean world MBK chatuchak market pratunam etc are all close to some station or the other so it makes sense to use the sky train  It may be crowded enough for one to not get seats but not that crowded that you will mind  Its clean fast and convenient Ticketing is easy there are ticket machines where you can select English choose the destination choose the number of passengers place your money and process the transaction its that easy Take help from locals if required  There are 2 different lines so you may have to change trains to reach destination our ticket had stations printed on the back that made it easy to identify where to get down  There is announcement about the next station so no worries at all  If you want to save time make sure your hotel is close to a station  Absolutely recommended

title: Not so easy at the platforms
review: The BTS was easy to use because we had the BTSMetro map I loved the BTS because we could sightsee while travelling to our next destination The only problem was the chaos at the platforms trains were travelling to and from both directions so u needed to listen carefully to ensure you boarded the correct train I think having separate tickets for BTS and MRT is kinda problematic too Apart from these 2 minor issues would take  the BTS over the Beijing subway any day

title: Hua Lamphong to Nong Khai
review: Easy to locate the station especially to a tourist with a reasonable price and a comfortable place to stay while waiting for the scheduled train to arrive You can also enjoy the view during your trip (sunrise view) and the sleeper train is a well recommended if you are going for a long trip journey

title: So easy
review: Great service to get over mega crowded streets easy to understand for foreign visitors and average 40 baht single fare👍🇹🇭😎

title: From the Heart of Bangkok Straight into the Terminal
review: Not only do you save money by going this way you get there faster  no traffic  It has become very popular already so they need to add on more trains so that everyone can sit down

title: Great way to travel
review: We loved it   clean  on time and affordable We found it a great way to travel Nice maps were displayed  at stations and staff were helpful

title: Excellent way to get around downtown BKK
review: If you plan to use the BTS for a few days or more I recommend the smart pass   It works out cheaper per trip and saves you time

title: A nice journey...
review: Getting ticket is easy Proper guidance by the people around and the security people in the station Proper sign boards are there so travelling is not a difficult one

title: Best fastest mode of transport
review: Best fastest mode of transport and cheap too It must be done in to get around BangkokPlan where you are going then check out the BTS to get the closest to where you want to go then get a taxi or tuk tuk if it is further from the station Plus you get to see parts of Bangkok from the train too

title: Only way to go
review: We took a taxi going in so we know the difference Chalk and cheese really Fast clean on time all at a fair price

title: Impressive
review: Really nice Very clean The ticket kiosk and ease of entry were very good Not hard to figure out at all The signs for the most part were printed in both English and Thai

title: Quick, Cheap and Efficient
review: Although the fast non stop service from Suvarnabhumi airport to Bangkok no longer runs this "stopping" commuter train is still great for the average traveler taking just 30 minutes and costing 45 baht one way Purchase a token at the machine or from cashier Place it on the touch pad at the entrance barriers (like the oyster card at the London Underground) and you will be let in At the end of your journey drop the token in the slot at the exit barriers and you will be let out  The trains are fiercely air conditioned and can get quite crowded meaning you may have to stand for your entire journey Access is easy at the airport through lifts and ramps At Phaya Thai (for the BTS Skytrain) there are escalators and lifts too Makkasan station for access to the MRT (underground) Families and those with lots of luggage may find it to be cheaper or more convenient using a taxi Trains are reliable and run frequently between 0600 and midnight

title: Its basically a tube network but in the sky
review: Nothing daunting about this if your accustomed to travelling on trains or the underground in London Good clear sign posts nice air conditioning Can be a bit hectic in rush hour

title: Fast, efficient, cold!
review: Great system especially during the daytime when you don't want to be stuck in traffic Modern and easy to use but take a sweater the ac is bloomin freezing on the trains

title: Easy
review: Connects with airport train Easy to get around and cheap and faster then taxi during traffic times 😕

title: Amazing tour
review: Had an amazing time on my the railway market and floating market tour in Bangkok Very efficient but still felt like I got everything I wanted to dosee done

title: not so "tourist" friendly...
review: we were there 2 parents 1 kid 1 baby in stroller  many stairs making the stroller thing harder wherehow to buy tickets is not so clear and "tourist friendly" Train was VERY loaded  once we got the tickets drive was very fast much faster than Bangkok taxis

title: Brillain
review: Easy quick and cheap way of travelling around bangkok can be busy at times but it is a big city so what would u expect Really worth it and is probably quicker than getting an actual taxi

title: Works well, fast, many available.
review: Its a good way to get into town if your flight arrives during a peak traffic hour and is cheap and airconditioned Trains are very clean and run often A good option for budget travelers You will probably need to interchange to the BTS for the main downtown areas but its signposted in English and reasonably easy to navigate

title: Great transport in a great capital!
review: Forget about traffic chaos and heat ride with sky train in Bangkok and you will enjoy great views of the city from the high and the perhaps too chilly air con  Everything is brand new and it's really a nice surprise to discover how well the connections between sky train and metro work automatic machines very easy to use and staff ready to be helpful  And more importantly direct connections with the airport And this costs 10 times less than taxi Well done Bangkok

title: Pretty good transportation system
review: For a place like Bangkok where roads are chockers at the best of times BTS Skytrains offer a good transportation system if you're travelling along their routes I have to say compared to Singapore or Hong Kong it has a long way to go The routing is quite limited (ie you can't get out to Chinatown for example on the BTS) and the frequency is quite average for a major capital city mass transportation system But it is well air conditioned clean and convenient to use Would be better if they had tourist tickets for longer durations than 1 day

title: Must do trip
review: Brilliant morning trip Highly recommend this trip for anyone who wants to see the floating market and the cool train market  Sara was a great host

title: Forget the traffic
review: You can seriously spend well over 90 minutes getting into Bangkok so if you are staying anywhere near a BTS station get the Airport Link and then jump on the BTS It is clean safe and always on time

title: Excellent service
review: I went to Bangkok in January with my mother travelling in a wheelchair There are lifts to the skytrain platform only in a few big train stations such as Siam and Asok  In other stations there are no lifts and the escalators only go up  Station staff were exceedinly helpful  They stopped the upgoing escalators and made them go downwards for my mother in her wheelchair  I was greatly impressed and 100% grateful  Thank you BTS staff

title: poor service! the counter receptionist seems like not willing to explain much with traveller. impatient!
review: impatient services ever counter receptionists are very poor attitude to customers we have to get the way ourselves or else if there is security guard there then the guard will help us

title: Fast
review: Very fast connects straight from airport to city centre rajprarop station at pratunam And saves lots of time and money as well Good for couple to travel with less luggage

title: Cheap but extreme delay
review: I took train from dmk train station to ayutthaya I paid only 20 thb for 3rd coach Yes it was so cheap But there was also a downside It was delayed for about 1 and a half hour Warning all the announcement is only delivered in thai So if you are a foreinger you may not know what happened to your train Ask local people for translation   PS the bridge that connects train station and airport starts inside of the airport You do not need to exit the whole airport Find the sign inside of the arrival hall

title: City travel
review: Great service Very easy Helping staff Very convenient Fast Getting ticket and boarding was very convenient Train service was very frequent

title: heart of Bangkok
review: Its not far to walk to the sky train or take taxi to MBK Platinium Siam Square shopping centres and Pratunam markets many

title: Underground Rail
review: MTR is also a convenient way to travel in Bangkok you might as well try the sky train  to get around

title: A cool way to get around a hot city!
review: This is a cool way to get around BKK This is the cleanest most efficient way to move around the city Though a bit crowded at rush hour it still doesn't compare to riding a bus or minibus If you plan you use it frequently then best to get a Rabbit Pass card and refill it when it runs out

title: Cheap and convenient
review: The Thai government made the right decision to build this infrastructure Simple economical no frill mass trains network that link Suvarnabhumi Airport to the city Great for travellers that are fed up worrying with taxi drivers that will charge exorbitant fares instead of the meter The only complain I have is the train can get very crowded during peak hours because this network is used by the city population for daily transportation Otherwise I will give this a thumb up

title: Sky train
review: I visit often and the Sky train is absolutely invaluable for getting around and avoiding the jams It also links well with the new underground network and the airport link That said there are too many steps and too few escalators for the older traveller

title: Pence foolish.
review: Although obviously convenient after all these years I still fail to understand why the BTS and the underground MRT system remain 2 separate entities with the Rabbit Card only applicable for the former  Another really dumb thing is that the BTS ticket machines only accept coins which you have to queue up for at the counter if you haven't enough with you meaning in effect often queuing up twice  Still the best way to get around though

title: Cheap ticket with poor quality
review: Normally to go for Suwanaphubhumi airport with very cheap price and not encounter with traffic jam I hove to see more frequently train round from airport direct to centre city On the train I hear a lot of noise from railroad while train moving I have no idea why

title: only for light travellers
review: Not a seemless travel to BTS which does not have lifts or escalator for travellers with heavy luggage

title: Very convenient!
review: The best public transportation a city could offer for tourists All the staff at the stations were very friendly and helpful and the local people using the train even more impressive everyone would help you if you asked for any information Love it

title: Great way to travel
review: Clean and efficient transportation One of the best trains I have been on in the world

title: Take the train right from the end
review: We took the train back from Nam Tok on our recent trip to Hellfire Pass We shared the train with one tour group and a handful of other people and there was plenty of room for everyone The scenery is mainly rural Thailand with silhouettes of mountains in the background  very pleasant A few stations along another couple of tour busloads of people joined us and there were only a handful of seats left At the next stop (directly before the viaduct) another busload of people joined us and some people were even left standing The viaduct and views of the river were beautiful but I couldn't help wondering what the point was for those people who had just gotten on and were left standing They got off at the next station and the train quickly emptied out A couple of stations later another busload got off and the train became practically empty  there were only 4 other people in our carriage all the way back into Kanchanaburi It wasn't the most comfortable train in the world (hard bench seats no aircon but windows that open all the way) and the scenery wasn't spectacular for most of the trip but it was a nice relaxing way to get back into town and see a bit of rural Thailand in the meantime It was fun going over the bridge on the train too If you're doing this as part of a tour I recommend checking with them where you will be getting on and off the train If it's the stop directly before the viaduct be prepared to stand for your journey

title: Best transportation
review: Easy and convenient for foreigners who need to travel to other place also connect to MRTAirport link As it is not too complicated and the staff are always be there for you

title: Best public transport
review: Easy and affordable way to zip around Bangkok  Staying close to one of the stations makes it very convenient to go wherever and you also have the option of the metro as well

title: fast , easy and conviencet way to and fro from airport to city
review: Use this train  to go closest  area in  city where you planned to visit  Then take taxi if necessary   This train link has good connection to underground  and sky train station w at cheaper than taxi

title: The Best way to travel.
review: As long as I arrive at BKK between 0700 and 2200 this is the way I always get to (and from) my hotel No hassle just follow the signs buy a token and get on the train to Phaya Thai There I change to the BTS and quite independent of traffic I will be in my hotel on Sukhumvit Soi 29 within an hour at a cost of well under 100 Baht  The only downside is getting luggage from the Airport Rail Link to the BTS  there are some steps in the way Just wonder why escalators were not installed at this most significant junction

title: Excellent but overcrowded during rush hours
review: Great way to get around Bangkok is the elevated BTS Skytrain Just try to stay away from Siam Station on a Friday evening as it gets incredibly and I do mean incredibly crowded and is not for the faint of heart Well air conditioned but travelers during the summer months are advised to take a light sweater as the trains will feel like refrigerators especially when traveling during less crowded off peak hours

title: Getting around
review: Bangkok BTS system is so well organized and the trains arrive very timely Recommend taking the BTS instead of cab or grab as the traffic situation is quite bad in Bangkok

title: Crowded and efficient
review: Crowded all the time and quite expensive But it is efficient and there are no train faults signal faults and delays

title: Good value half day tour
review: The trip was well organised Pick up time from hotel was spot on and very good communicated Our guide Tee () was really good and gave loads information The van ride was smooth with a short stop   First dont expect anything Thai authentic its all for tourists nowadays the train ride is nice and seeing the market stall fold up and down same for the boat ride in the canal   The train ride was nice to see landscape for a bit and the railway market is busy with tourists our guide took us to a different route through the market and we were able to escape the madness and had a good view from the train leaving back again There is really no need to stay longer there as the market is just tourist things and the local market for groceries which you dont buy while on a tour next stop was the floating market a boat ride through the canals and then a lunch stop the floating market is again just touristy no need to stop to haggle for anything other than a coconut drink no point as all is nippy things and overpriced   the lunch food stall were busy but quick and tasty it was time to get back to beat traffic jam tour length is just right we were happy and not feeling rushed at all yes its tightly planned but there is really no need to stroll or wander around after seeing the train and boat ride as well good to be back mid afternoon into MBK shopping center and not stuck in traffic This one is recommended as great value if you have enough days in Bangkok to spend and dont know what to do If you want real Thai life take another tour into the countryside

title: Fast, safe, dependable, cheap
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok while avoiding traffic tieups It is inexpensive and can get you all the way to the international airport It intersects with the excellent cheaper subway system at several locations You can avoid climbing the many steps at most stations by going into a public building or hotel to take their escalators to an upper floor that connects to the Skytrain

title: Brilliant
review: Although not as far reaching as the London underground the Skytrain is better in nearly every other respect A fast frequent service modern air conditioned trains clean well maintained and ticket purchase was so easy Nearly all the main attractions within the city and most of the shopping centres are within easy reach of a Skytrain station and there are no traffic jams to worry about

title: Well connected
review: An easy way to get around the city of Bangkok Well connected to all tourist spots in the city Practical and cheap

title: Fun and Exciting
review: I was on a short trip to Thailand and happen since its my very first time to be in Thailand I wanted to treasure every single moment I'm there First i wanted to try the culture and the sights To be able to reach Siam Center where most of the sights can be seen I had a trip with the rail link It was cheap fast and very convenient I has a passage right inside the their International Airport Accessible and comfortable And it is very easy to get to where you wanted to as Rail itself has operator with english and thai speaker  It was very fun and adventurous for me as a first time traveler in Thailand

title: A good way to get around Bangkok!
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok You can see loads from the trains they are well maintained and you get to avoid the busy roads The only negative thing would be that sometimes they are rammed with people but that is no different than travelling on the London Underground

title: Part of the Thailand experience!
review: Watching the train go through the market with people and goods lined up along the track was remarkable  The tour included going to salt flats and the floating market  A good experience with a great tour guide named Lucky

title: Great value travel
review: Great value 120 Baht day pass gets you most places

title: Good to beat the traffic
review: As those will know who have been to Bangkok before getting around is a nightmare The Skytrain just zooms above without problems Cheap and easy to use make sure you get your tickets before boarding at the booths Nice and clean and comfortable not like most means of transport here

title: Fast way to reach your destination in Bangkok
review: This is the fastest way to reach some where in Bangkok Please avoid to take it during morning and evening (700800 AM 500600 PM) because of the crowd of working human I suggest to buy 1daypass ticket with unlimited trip for a day The most stations located near the attractions

title: Easy, efficient, a few things to be aware of
review: BTS is the sky rail through Bangkok  There are other transport systems (MRT train bus) and the ticketing is different  You can buy a single trip ticket at the vending machine at each station (I recall you need coins)  Or buy a day pass  I purchased a Rabbit card that had value I could top up  It's a smartcard touch and go style and I can use it next time  But Rabbit isn't accepted on MRT (yet) so only applies to BTS    Some stations have an escalator but most only stairs  Be aware of this if you are carrying luggage particularly tofrom the airport  Also it can get very busy and sometimes not enough room for everyone to board (so they wait for the next ride which is a few minutes apart)

title: Great way to travel. Fastest way to the city
review: Cheapest and fastest way to travel to the city centre even with luggage  Trip only cost me 45 bhat  Taxi would have cost you 100 times more  Quick link to BTS at the terminal station Phya Thai

title: Cheap, easy and, most importantly, cool
review: The Skytrain was our preferred choice of transport around Bangkok It's a lot quicker and reliable than the taxis that are often hot stuffy overpriced and if you're really unlucky you'll get a driver that's rude and tries to scam you for a higher fare   Any tourist to Bangkok would be smart to take the Skytrain It's consistent with trains around every 35 minutes The route maps are uncomplicated and printed in English as are the fare maps and ticket machine instructions Tourists familiar with Malaysia's and Singapore's train system should pick this up very quickly  The interior of the trains are pretty clean (as public transports go) and well ventilated with a strong airconditioner Though the seats may be limited the passengers are happy to surrender their seats for the elderly or pregnant Disability access to the train is also fair but may get a little hard to maneuver in peak travel hours Each station is also monitored by staff and security guards who are friendly and happy to help the lost tourists  The downside is that the train doesn't travel to some of the temples and you will need to catch a connecting ferry to reach some spots Also ticket machines mainly accept coins with only a handful at various stations that take notes so save your 10 Baht coins Fortunately there is a counter for change but prepare to queue   Tip A quick way to pass the time on the train is to watch the TV commercials playing in the train and guessing what product they're selling My partner and I made it into a game to make the journeys quicker

title: The best option to reach downtown from the airport
review: This is the fastest and cheapest transport option between the airport (Suvarnabhumi) and downtown   The only negative is the train does not operate between midnight and six in the morning although the airport operates all night long

title: Best way to get city center
review: With only 40 bath the local currency you can get the city center with only 30 minutes Aircon inside train is very strong

title: Great way to travel!
review: Its easy to use air conditioned and clean and also cheap Would recommend to all

title: Convenient
review: Safe time and easy to use without traffic Moreover most of hotel and shopping mall are near BTS so it is very convenient for everyone

title: A lot of travel with little information or town visits.
review: We were quite disappointed in this tour as we did not realize that it is a 1525 hour drive each way before you get to the railway The van ride is not very comfortable (cramped and poor air conditioner) and we could not really hear much information from our guide  It would have been nice to get more information about the salt mining from the guide as well as more information about the history of the railway and towns we visited  We did not have much time (about 20 minutes) at the railway market (which was a zoo)  Once we got back into the van and drove another 20 minutes to the water market we then loaded into a paddle boat and moved around a canal to buy goods  There is no education on how to shop etc and there were many motor boats (so lots of carbon dioxide and noise)  I think this tour could have potential if a guide would be more engaged in the history of the area gave us more time at the first town to explore and if the company be honest and state that it is approximately 2 hours of travel each way  We do have some great photos but not so great memories

title: Cost effective
review: Great way to get to and from the airport unless it is rush hour or you have a lot of luggage Then take a cab Meter cab is about 300 tbt plus 75 tbt toll or about 12 bucks

title: Overcrowded
review: It does get you to the airport but it's so busy die to the reduced frequency It is also crush full and never a pleasant trip Also much more expensive than normal trains (10 times more)

title: avoid the traffic glideing over the roof-tops
review: the Sky train is cheap and frequent BUT crowded  But worth that to avoid the awful traffic in bnagkok

title: Its certainly best and fastest way to travel
review: You can actually get the train from the airport terminal it self the train services starts in morning around 6 AM so if you are reaching there early you will have to wait the floor is carpeted and there are usually people resting on the floor you can also do the same if you do not want to spend lot of money on Taxi

title: Easy and Convenient way to travel in Bangkok
review: Very easy to move around in Bangkok with their BTS We travelled from Chitrom to Chatuchuk then to MBK and to Paragon Siam and to Terminal 21 at Asok stationall on the BTS Given the heavy traffic in Bangkok city it's the best way to move around in BTS Next time I will venture out to further places

title: Easy and cheap
review: MRT is cheaper than BTS but don't reach to my place T_T The queue time is longer than BTS Some stations are very big and looks empty and there are Metro Mall in some stations too

title: Clean and A/C is great!
review: Very clean cheap and safe Also AC is great and that is a major plus It does get very crowded at rush hour but people line up in an orderly fashion and board

title: Amazing experience for all to do.
review: This was an amazing experience and enhanced by having Ken as my tour guide nothing was an issue for him and the driver Being picked up in Bangkok and then travelling in my own private vehicle to Kanchanaburi to start the tour The emotions felt whilst visiting the JEATH museum war cemetery Bridge over the river Kwai and especially at Hellfire pass is just indescribable  Would recommend doing this tour during the week as there are fewer numbers compared to the weekend which is full of tourists & locals

title: Fast, Efficient and Cheap!
review: As a matter of habit I used to cab it from the airport to Bangkok and back For the past few years I always use the rail link saving over 600+ baht per trip Highly recommended

title: Reliable and more convenient than i thought
review: forgot to book a taxi to go to the airport for my flight in the morning decided to try out the airport link was not packed and was satisfied with the price if you dont have a lot of luggage i would recommend this

title: Good way to take in the modern side of Bangkok
review: We got the BTS skytrain to see the moderncommercial area of Bangkok and really enjoyed it We were staying in the old part of Bangkok so it gave us a very different perspective on the city It is very cheap and tourist friendly

title: A must to get around in the city
review: great AC and easy to get around Use it to get around the city very easy to buy tickets but if you are in town for more than a day the buy a card at the service counter to add funds too when you need them because some of the stations have lines at the ticket booths that is too long to wait in  but if you have a card pass you can just go right to the train without waiting in line

title: Quick Airport Rail link.
review: Depending at what time you arrive at Subvarnabhumi this is a good alternative Cheap and quick transport straight to the centre of Bangkok without traffic jams

title: Best way to travel
review: The best way to travel in BangkokFast efficient and hassle freeTickets are of standard price and the system is very well maintained

title: Very Easy Way To Get Around
review: We really enjoy how the Skytrain is run it's very regular and easy to use  The way people wait for the passengers to get off is great not something you see in other places  We bought a Rabbit card for 700 baht this gives you 25 trips

title: Yes! Use It Whenever You Can!
review: Not much to say The Skytrain (BTS) is an elevated train that operates on two lines with plans for expansion The fare is reasonable it has AC and it's comfortable It gets crowded and sometimes you stand but the Thais are easygoing and have no problem any of it and so nor should anyone else The TVs play hokey commercials and you can practice your Thai pronunciation as all the stops are announced on the speakers in Thai and English  Tip If the BTS guard tells you not to bring your gasfilled balloon aboard just do as he tells you and deal with it

title: Over nighter
review: We travelled overnight second class sleeper its actually second time we have done this trip Ticket easy to book a couple of days in advance at the train station after being given a price from agent of ticket price plus 400 bhats each robber 75 bhats each way in a taxi result Train is clean and well staffed but no alcohol changed since last time Seemed to be a lot of transport police and normal police on board the train Food available via a average priced menu be careful with drinks that are offered they are expensive Instead of buying breakfast when you get of the train and leave the main station entrance look to the left you will see Bossotel when you are facing it look to the right restaurant selling buffet breakfast 99bhats its good value Overall a pleasant journey and a good sleep

title: 4 Cabin insufficient for growing City
review: Compared to many modern efficient metro station BTS needs to resolve it's overcrowding issues by expanding cabin cars or frequency  The stations require more coverage to prevent slippery staircase during rainy days  Some stations do not have escalators or lifts More gantries are needed Overall the BTS has potential but require modular approach to meet growing demand

title: extremely convenient and cheap
review: SO easy to use and very very cheap perfect take ARL and connect to Metro or BTS where you will need to buy a separate ticket

title: Skytrain
review: Very efficient service Quick and very clean Also very cool which is appreciated when moving around Bangkok Well communicated

title: Cheap and Safe form of Travel
review: The BTS is a quick and cheap way of travelling around Bangkok  The trains are airconditioned but as with all big cities rush hour is best avoided unless you like to be up close and personal

title: Don't be afraid to give it a try!   Cheap, clean and easy!
review: Make sure you use the Bangkok Skytrain to get around it's the cheapest and easiest way to go  You can get pretty much anywhere in the city from 1045 baht  The cars are clean and air conditioned and come every few mins  There are also guards and people that can assist you on every platform  With all of the traffic jams in bangkok this is by far the best mode of transportation  It also takes you directly to the weekend market and to the water taxi pier if you want to check out Asiatique   If you're just wandering around looking for a place to get off and are hungry  a great option is Nana station there's a place called Aryaa's Vegetarian cuisine right in the skytrain station that has some of the best food we had in Bangkok (see my other review on aryaa's)  The skytrain also has a direct line to the airport and Novotel Hotel  The skytrain is a MUST do while in Bangkok

title: Skip this one
review: Sadly this trip wasn’t great We didn’t have a tour guide because too many people were booked for one guide Our guide road in the other van so we had zero discussion about any of the place la we visited The first mistake was that all the tours going to the same location meet up at the same spot and leave at the same time So you have dozens of people all going to the same place without any separation so it’s overly crowded all at once It took two hours to get to the markets As stated the markets were overly crowded and it was almost impossible to shop The wait at the floating market was an hour Half of the market was empty so most of the ride was looking at unused spaces on the backside I would not recommend this tour because for us it was not a tour We over paid for someone to drive us out to the market places when exactly everyone else would be there with no explanation We should have been returned at least half our money since this was a tour without a tour

title: Best way to get across the city in Bangkok
review: If you ever visit Bangkok for the first time you automatically become overwhelmed at the number of cars and road congestion there is With the heat averaging in the mid 90's you want to find a place where you have air conditioners available and swift movement from point A to point B Well look no further The BTS or Skytrain as it's called not only is the fastest transportation there is but its a place to get in away from the heat if only for 10 minutes   Traveling in over 60 cities and many having a train system in place I can confidently say that Bangkok's BTS is the finest there is It's clean fast and comfortable for the traveler If you have small kids or are elderly whoever is close by will get up and offer you hisher seat It's a policy that is highly regarded A big difference than in many places I've been where even a pregnant woman would be left standing   The cost to travel varies depending how many stops you want to travel between If you want to go from one end of the route to the other end it costs the equivalent of about  $250 USD Each stop is about 10 Baht with a maximum of 55 Baht needed to go the great distance   Getting a ticket is relatively easy once you know how to work the ticket machines and how much you need to feed it with coins If you need help there's the ticket booth where you have a customer service person taking care of you Trains run about 8 minutes apart but vary depending on the time of day You can get a schedule from the ticket counter or online  The BTS is one of the best things Bangkok has done to help people get around and especially for tourist traveling for their first time It gives youyou a birdseye view of the city especially cool at night with are the lights I would encourage a 1 month pass for those that are staying 3 weeks or more It's easy and the money savings in well worth it Very modern and well kept sums it up Hope you have a great time in Bangkok

title: Train Bangkok
review: The train is great You get to see a lot and  can get around Bangkok You need to buy tokens to put into the turnstiles

title: save a bundle of money
review: this is the easiest way to get to the airportand most cost effective the train is clean and it is fascinating to check out the people and the stops along the way

title: Very fast and cheap
review: The best thing though is it removes the hassle No more taxi drivers who don't want to put on the meter have no change can't find the hotel or generally want to overcharge

title: An efficient underground rail system which  integrated with other major transport facilities.
review: Travelling around heavy traffic and congestion city central in Bangkok to variety of tourist attractions and shopping centres is best via  BTS or  MRT  MRT provides quick easy efficient air conditioned underground rail service  you can purchase station to station token daily pass or best value is a 3 day pass for 230 bht  I  found the MRT  easy to navigate Clear signs and very reliable The price to ride was good and ride was conducive The trains are also well airconditioned and a great place to escape the heat even temporarily This rail system  been integrated with  BTS or ARL at some stations  It was fast economical  and air conditoned   Unfortunately the payment system was not integrated with BTS Skytrain Many popular and tourist attraction venues  located with close proximity of  the MRT stations Although obviously some peak times are best avoided due to the crowds most other times there's plenty of room  There is also the airport link for tourist who travel light    MRT uses token and BTS uses card It will further enhance efficiency of both rail links if they are using the same system so that we will not have to change all the time or line up to purchase tickets at the machines which is usually very crowded Public announcement in the trains and the stations  are in both Thai and English   Relevants maps of Bangkok city available  at the stations for tourist     The maps exhibited are also user friendly and easy to understand

title: Only way to travel
review: Easiest way to get around Buy a 'Rabbit' pass ticket which gives you 15 trips for 450 baht Connects with airport  weekend market shopping areas

title: Cool and clean train.
review: You will never complain to this skytrain (BTSMRT) they looks great The schedule always on time Unique ticket machine and kind security man will help you to guide

title: Once you know your way, you'll be OK
review: Caught the train from Silom to get to the main shopping area in Bangkok  The experience was not so good at first as we were not able to find someone who could assist with which platform we need to go to however when we did (15 minutes later) it was hassle free   The train was nice and cool inside roomy but when it is full it is really fully  You will be very close and personal next to the person to you    All in all once we found how to get from one place to the other it was easy    I would highly recommend the BTS Skytrain who would like a fast way of getting from one place to another a cheap way of going around the city

title: Easy  access
review: Easy access  to main areas  with no traffic jam   unfortunately they don't have family  package or all day access  as far as I know

title: Fast clean & Safe
review: It is the best way around the city although with only two lines on the system its range is limited  Used in conjunction with the MRT BRT River Bus & local Road Buses its an integral part of Bangkok's transport system

title: Fast, cheap and efficient travel into Bangkok
review: At less than $2 Australian to get from Suvarnaphumi to central Bangkok this is a good alternative to a taxi 45 baht per person right into Phaya Thai adjacent to the BTS station Ideal if you can easily reach your destination via BTS

title: Easy way to travel
review: The Bankok BTS Skytrain is by far the easiest way to travel around the capital  Unlike the roads which are bumper to bumper and slow moving  the skytain runs about every 5 minutes with clean inexpensive air conditioned carriages to whisk you around the capital delivering you atvor nearby most of the popular tourist sites you might want to visit The rail system continues to expand  i further into the suburbs with another 6 new stations opened recently The only downside it that with so many wanting to use the system the trains can become crowded at peak times and would benefit from extra carriages being added At present the top fare is 52 baht per person which is a great deal when compared with a taxi which charge 35 baht as soon as you get in  Definitely worth using to move quickly around the city asan alternative to sitting in the traffic below

title: Cool, convenient and best views !
review: Its my favourite city train system anywhere  A great way to view the city  You could have a very nice time just staying on the train from one end to the other enjoying the view outside and people watching inside

title: Airport rail link beats rush hour traffic every time
review: If you arrive at Suvarnabhumi airport or need to get to suvarnabhumi airport during rush hour consider taking the airport rail link  It will get you there faster every time Depending on where your hotel is located will determine if you need to transfer from MRT to BTS to Rail Link  Some transfers can be challenging  but once you are on the train  the trip is easy  And once you have witnessed Bangkok traffic you will understand Enjoy  Safe travels

title: Quick & Comfy (non-peak hours)
review: The BTS is not an attraction unless you don't have a train transportation system in your country It is however an efficient way of travel in Bangkok due to the infamous Bangkok Jam In saying that during peak hours in the morning and evenings it can get pretty crowded (ie sardine packed carriages) It also has limited coverage with 2 lines + the Airport Rail Link line This wasn't much of a problem with us as we used the BTS in conjunction with the MRT system (underground) Also some stations are not disabled friendly as there are no lifts or elevators

title: Easy, cheap and convenient
review: Easily the easiest and most reasonable way to get from central Bangkok to the newer airport if you have any access to the Sky Train

title: Easy, cheap, convenient option to/from BKK airport
review: The Airport Rail Link is an easy cheap convenient option tofrom BKK Airport unless you're a large group with a lot of luggage or babies or kids in strollers  If that's the case you should either get a large taxi (don't forget to make sure they turn on the meter) large grab taxi or book the airport transport to your hotel  But if there's a major traffic jam in downtown BKK or the highways the Airport Rail Link could be faster to get to BKK airport

title: Limited network but does its job
review: The MRT has only a limited network but does its job adequately  Stations are spacious and generally clean  Limited ticket vending machines but has English language option and easy to use  Useful to take MRT wherever possible

title: Fast and Easy...
review: Avoid the endless traffic jams that plague Bangkok by taking the Airport Rail Link the BTS the MRT to get almost anywhere you want in Bangkok forget about taxi and buses (unless you have all the time in the world to be stuck in heated pollution)

title: Gettiing from airport
review: Very fast and  clean and seating  When peak time and full hard to get out luggage You can change at several stations to conect to other trains

title: Beautiful Scenery
review: Beautiful relaxing scenery and the train tracks also add to the history  Some food and beverage stalls around  Good tourist attraction )

title: Best way around Bankok
review: Bangkok SkyTrain is far the best way to get around Bangkok Even if the rail network is limited you can quick and easy get across the city to a location from where to continue with a taxi tuk tuk or other means  On a hot day you'll probably want to take a ride just to get cooled down by the effective aircon

title: FLYING QUEEN
review: Fast and easy available Clean and clear map so all visitor use this facility It is over the bridge so all city we see

title: Amazing vehicle
review: The best way to arrive to the main area of Bangkok from the airport Much more faster than a cab and also cheaper Also great option to use for visit the Chawtuk Market and the MBK

title: Best way for transporting yourself
review: Clean and fast Not the cheapest but deffinitely the fastest and easiest way of traveling And some nice views on the way to your next stop

title: Very Convenient !
review: We were in Bangkok in March this year Most of the times we took BTS Skytrain as we could go to the most places we wanted Sometimes we took Tuk Tuk also Bangkok is hot so it is better to take BST

title: Great Experience!
review: Great service no slow downs AC but very busy at times I live in T Toronto and must say this was a much better experience than what i go through everyday

title: Brilliant way to beat the traffic
review: Absolutely the best way to get around BKK coupled with the BTS Hectic and quite crammed during rush hour outside of those times it's a great way to beat the Bangkok traffic Staying any longer than a few days and it's a good idea to purchase the MRT card and preload it with 1300 baht to avoid the queues at the ticket and change kiosks

title: Easy transport
review: Really efficient transport in the city  If you are a bit older like me it can be a bit challenging to understand at first  But once mastered really good

title: Best way to travel in Bangkok!!
review: Bangkok was wellknown for its heavy traffic But with this Sky Rail I had completely no problem in travelling around fast and conveniently And most importantly it's airconditioned It's surely the best way to travel around in Bangkok

title: A great way to get round the city.
review: We used the sky train like most of the tourists and locals to get round The signs are easy to understand and there are plenty of places round the city you can get to on here   Whilst it can get very busy we haven't had to miss a train yet Getting it early does mean you'll get a seat though The only downside is to buy a ticket you need ample coins you can't pay with notes Who carries 56 baht in coins This means queuing for change and the queuing for the machine   At one point my card didn't work but the staff were more than happy to help Lots of places to buy food but you can't eat on the train So don't try

title: A good way to get to the city centre
review: Airport Rail Link  The rail link is like just another MRT route which the locals use as well It links Suvarnabhumi Airport to Bangkok city centre with a total of eight stops As the train frequency is not as high as BTSMRT the train could be very crowded at times However it is still a convenient and cheap way to get to the city centre Please note that it operates from 6 am to midnight   My suggestion is to alight at Makkasan Station or Phaya Thai Station and then catch a taxi from there The main reason is that the BTS and MRT stations in Bangkok are generally not luggage friendly

title: Operating frequently but always crowded.
review: For traveler one day ticket is convenient B 140 Train is very clean and running very safely Customer is very polite and staff are friendly

title: An amazing way to get around parts of Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great mode of transportation around Bangkok It's fast and convenient and connects to the MRT and the Raillink to the airport If you are staying for a while invest in a Rabbit card available at any ticket office They are reloadable and you won't have to wait for change

title: Easy to use and clean
review: With all the traffic in Bangkok the BTS Skytrain can be a life saver It is fast efficient and clean Everyone is very polite on the train and are willing to show you how to buy a ticket or which track to be on

title: fast, cheap and easy way to get to the city centre
review: Easy to find in the airport you buy a token for around 35 Baht (depending on your destination) Ticket machines take notes and give change and have an English language option The ride is smooth and quick (around 40 minutes to Makkasan) Just use your token at the other end to exit the barriers  Note that BTS tourist passes are not valid on the airport rail link

title: Excellent way to travel within Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great way to travel within Bangkok Although the  system may not reach all places of interest it does get you close to many much faster than taxis motorcycles etc A taxi may be more comfortable but you could be stuck in traffic for hours (literally) The stattion map is easy to navigate and there are large signs that point out directions within the stations The trains are mostly used by tourists middleclass locals and white collar professionals  It may be difficult to find seating so be prepared to stand for most of your trip Be careful of pickpockets who exploit the crowdedness to get close to unsuspecting victims Aside from the pickpockets the system is relatively safe (and in all honesty you have to be wary of pickpockets everywhere)

title: Clean
review: It is so crowdy but very clean  People who works there are so kind and gentle to us the police at the entrance who control your luggages is very gentle

title: Very organized visit to the famous Maeklong railway station and the Damnoen saduk floating market
review: If you are looking for a well organized tour to the Maeklong railway and the floating market (about an hour south of Bangkok) this tour is for you The tour guide arranged for stops along the way and explains the Thai countryside as you make your way down to the station Since you are traveling with a group ( other groups from the same company will be there at the same time as well) there is very little time to explore the attractions on your own The schedule can get a little tight

title: Nice, save, and clean
review: My first time use this transportation and really nice cause in Indonesia still don't have but lucky me I go with a friend who's already friendly with this transportation This sky train actually go to attraction place on Bangkok to shopping mall or even to temple can go by sky train first then take a boat and better take one day pass which cost only 140 baht till 12am midnight so very economic just don't forget in this transportation didn't allow to have drink or food so if bring food do not eat inside

title: MRT Bangkok
review: The MRT is essentially a mainly underground rail network throughout Bangkok and Metro Bangkok in contrast to the Sky Train or BTS which is essentially above ground The MRT network is being extended considerably to bring in more outlying areas which at present are plagued with traffic jams getting into work from 5 am onwards  That in turn will help to raise the value of properties in those areas

title: Great experience!
review: Sara is a super nice and fun lady She explained us a lot about Thailand always with a smile Great experience

title: Use this at peak traffic periods
review: If you are going to or coming from the SVPHM airport during the peak traffic period this mode of transport saves you enormous amount of time You can then connect to the BTS to many of the major hotels after you alight from the Airport Rail Link

title: up above from the traffic
review: traffic in bangkok is horrible in rush hour  luckily they have airport metro which takes half the time to reach your destination it is fast and cheap and runs frequently

title: Best transportation in Bangkok
review: one day ticket is a very good to hop on and off several time   u can go yo many places by following the route map

title: Avoid the traffic jams
review: This is the fastest way into downtown Bangkok and avoids all the traffic jams I've tried a taxi into Bangkok from the airport before and it can take around 2 hours depending on the time of day Airport Rail Link is to be found underneath the airport and it's not expensive It will take you as far as Phraya Thai station I think it runs from 6am to midnight and is around 45 baht whereas a taxi will be around 500 baht Best bet is rail link then taxi to your hotel once your in downtown Bangkok It can get pretty packed but if your getting on at the airport you'll get a seat easy enough because it's the first stop or Phraya Thai is the first stop depending on which way you are going Check your maps and you'll see where it goes and how close you can get to your hotel It's the fastest way into town if your arriving and the fastest way to the airport if your leaving

title: Among the best mass transit systems in Asia
review: Excellent and easy to use  All of the destinations are marked in both Thai and English  Most of the trains have a map with lights showing where you are and where you are going  Crowded but clean and comfortable

title: Great way to get about in Bangkok
review: Our hotel was near the Skytrain and at about £350 for a day ticket and it's a great way to get about this bustling  city

title: Well connected
review: Many trains have lights and announcement on next stop Easy to use Well connected that makes traveling from place to place easy

title: Great service and cheap
review: This is an excellent service and very cheap I used it extensively during my stay and signs are in Thai and English so easy to use  Carriages are air conditioned  Fares are cheap and I bought a day ticket which at 140 baht is a bargain in my view  Highly recommended

title: Efficient and affordable way to get around
review: I loaded my BTS card the staff can speak English and able to read maps to get to where I need to go No complaints

title: Modern, efficient.
review: This is (along with the MTS) the BEST way to get around Bangkok Cheap fast modern airconditioned easy to navigate

title: Clean and easy to use
review: No problem using the skytrain Wonderful way to get around the city Clean and very frequent Would very much recommend

title: Visiting Bangkok? Forget Taxi -Take the BTS!
review: Hands down the best way to get around Bangkok The BTS is modern clean and air conditioned Tickets are cheap and sold in machines but if you're uncertain you can buy over the counter as well Security has been tightened and stations feel safe

title: Best transportation to overcome Bangkok traffic
review: Fastest way to move in and out of city centre within 35 mins A cheap and effective mode of transportation

title: Super clean and convenient
review: We used the train to get to and from the airport The ticket booths and signs are also in English The train is very clean

title: Wow efficient
review: Push destination It tells how much to pay pull your pass and board You can buy a day pass  also  Probably can get longer passes for longer staysclean and safe Arrives every 510 minutes Gets crowded sometimes so plan

title: Easy, comfortable & air-conditioned
review: We used the sky train a few times and it is the best way to move around Bangkok It's easy comfortable and airconditioned It stops in front of all major tourist destinations and shopping centres Really couldn't complain Very clean and quick Better than getting stuck in the smelly traffic jams

title: Good but difficult with lugguage
review: Airport rail link is convenient for travelers to and from Suvarnabhumi international airport It is affordable and fast But when transfer from airport rail link to BTS train at Phayathai station it is not convenient if you travel with luggage The transfer is not smooth need to carry your luggage

title: awesome trains
review: Connects to major areas with connections to the BTS and other trains in Bkk Took the cityline since we needed to change trains at Makkasan station

title: Good network of trains for exploring the city on your own
review: We loved exploring the city through this vast expanse of skytrains They were ideal for travelling for those who want to avoid roads and traffic Although could be a bit tiring compared to travelling in comfortable limos

title: Improving, but still lousy!
review: Thailand's rail system is notoriously terrible although to be fair they are making some serious efforts to improve in recent years  The trains still tend to have ancient carriages and are dirty and roach infested Service is spotty  Sales of beer and alcohol on the trains have been banned by the overzealous antialcohol lobby in Thailand Like all public transportation care should be taken to avoid belongings being ripped off

title: Best Choice Transportation While in Bangkok
