review: Travelling in Bangkok with its traffic jam  Just chose BTS to move from one place to another With one day pass for 140 Baht I could take BTS all day long from early morning until midnight Or you can buy for a single journey ticket which is in various fare according to the chosen destination It just take 5 minutes to one BTS station to another I could see Bangkok Capital with its beauty from skytrain enjoyed the trip And the best part is the BTS stations are near malls tourist attractions and some buildings Just make sure knowing where the exit gate to take is It depends on what places to go There are informtaion boards in every BTS station which is written about some places and which gate I should take When I exited from the Siam Station Gate it was comfortable to walk in skywalk connecting from bts station to another places like Platinum mall Big C and so on If I got starving just stop by in food stalls in the station   My suggestion for tourist  Just take skytrain for one day pass ticket it's keep your time and money

title: Accessible and affordable
review: When we came here at Bangkok it easy for us to reached our hotel in just airport rail way link thru our hotel   Very clean and organized

title: Easiest was to get into the city
review: This is by far the easiest and very cheap way to get into the city You do need to do a little research on the best place to stop but it is easy

title: Great way to get about
review: Loved the BTS safe and clean and very easy to get around the city  Bought the card for about 180 bhat and lasted me 9 days jumping on and off it

title: Fast and efficient
review: What a way to be ushered into the country  Upon arrival just proceed several levels down you get to hop into clean cool coaches It brings you straight into the heart of bangkok Terminals are so clean and the cost to is very affordable

title: Quick and easy!!
review: When in Bangkok the easiest way to get around town is by BTS The trains and system is fairly new well looked after and spotlessly clean So if you want to avoid traffic avoid the odd rogue taxi driver then stick to the BTS Agree the system does not reach all locations but it is expanding For multiple journeys buy a 'Rabbit Card' and then avoid looking for coins in your pocket and queuing to use the ticket machine more convenient

title: The great way to get in to the Bangkok city
review: Very fast and convenient Has room for luggage Operates daily from 0600 to 2400 departing every 10 minutes during peak hours (06000900 and 16002000) and 15 minutes off peak and weekends  Bangkok Airport Rail Link is a commuter rail line connecting Suvarnabhumi Airport to Phaya Thai (BTS) station via Makkasan Station (MRT Phetchaburi) In between you can change the lines to reach your preferred destination I prefer this service If not with too many luggage or in late night flight usually to avoid the hassle of taxis and their various confusing charges subway fee toll fee etc etc & avoid the unpredictable and terrible Bangkok traffic   Standard fare for the City Line is between 15–45 baht (while TAXI will charge to 300400) depending on distance which is a little over a USD and less than 30 minutes to the heart of Bangkok Anyone can buy ticket either from automated machine or ticket window Has both local & English written as well as announcement inside the train  Really the great way to get in to the city

title: Interesting Journey
review: It was interesting to travel along these tracks  The views on both sides are quite amazing A good opportunity to get to know something of the landscape and local agriculture

title: Bangkok saviour from total collapse
review: With one of the worst traffic situation globally BTS is Bangkok's life saving transportation tool It's impact on surrounding environment is huge affecting businesses land and rental price around its stations It's rather pricy though compared to Bangkok's average level of income

title: New train service
review: The train network is still under construction and does not at time of typing reach the CBD National stadium is the nearest stop The trains are modern and run frequently They are cheap to use purchasing tickets from the kiosk just beside the entrance Staff speak English and can assist with any questions you may have A limited service but compared to the traffic in Bangkok much quicker If you can I would recommend taking the train

title: Good experience
review: So many people enjoyed the sky train I tried it my friend and I felt Los funny but it enjoyable I recommend to try it This will make you feel happy

title: Easy way to get around!
review: I did both the single trip purchase from machines in the stations (42Bhat) I also did an allday pass which made it very convenient to not have to carry so many coins Clean trains and stations directions in English as well so very easy to navigate as a foreign language speaker in Thailand

title: Cheaper and Faster way to Bangkok City Center from BKK International Airport.
review: The Airport Rail Link is a good ay to get from BKK (Suvarnabhumi International Airport) to Bangkok City Center and connect with the BTS (Elevated Train) or take a taxi and save the hazel of taxi stand at BKK This is best if you have little luggage Apple has an App Bangkok Transit TH It will show where the BTS and MRT(Subway) routes go

title: Easy!
review: Definitely the best way to get around the main area of Bangkok if you can book accommodation nearby one of the BTS stops It's easy efficient and air conditioned

title: Easy to use, convenient, unearthly cheap!!
review: Only 45 Baht from Phraya Thai BTS Station (last station in the city centre) to SVB Airport Unbelievable but true Phraya Thai is just 2 stops from Siam Paragon and the numerous other shopping areas of central Bangkok The travelling time is about 45 mins with about 6 stops in between This should be the preferred transportation from airport to city and viseversa Beats the traffic jam and costly taxi fare

title: Very cost effective
review: Fast effecient and cost effective Beats sitting in traffic in a taxi which will cost a fortune if you get grid locked

title: Very cost effective, clean and on time
review: We used the BTS skytrain a lot as it was conveniently close to our accommodation if you visit Bangkok you will most definitely use the skytrain because there is just too much to see and Bangkok is so big  It is way to expensive to use Taxi's for everything so I would recommend buying tickets only for the stop's you need  Unless you plan to spend a day traveling up and down locations with the Skytrain then you can purchase a daily ticket    The Rabbit ticket are only cost effective if you spend a long time in Bangkok but not a few days only

title: Great day out with a superb guide
review: We were picked from our hotel by Mr Alex our guide and our driver After picking up the rest of the group we headed out of Bangkok for the railway market Mr Alex was super attentive ensuring everyone was comfortable and informing of the days itinerary and other parts of Thai culture After riding on the train up to and through the market He escorted us through the market describing various items After the train had passed through we went back towards the bus stopping and sampling a variety of street food and snacks After a short ride we ended up at the floating market He took us down to our little boat which skillfully navigated us through canals and past a variety of stalls selling tourist stuff and snacks We ended up eating there as well which was not included but really good value and tasty He then escorted us back to Bangkok All in all a great day out we worth the ride Mr Alex was the perfect guide helpful with stacks of knowledge Don’t miss this trip

title: Buying succulent and pitcher plants
review: Took the BTS to Chatuchak from stadium station It was a breeze Can be quite crowded during peak hours But it is so much better than taxi Value for money At chatuchak we went succulent and pitcher plant hunting and was very pleased with our haul

title: Get avoid the traffic jam in BKK get MRT
review: I always take MRT more than taxi or bus to get avoid the traffic jam in Bangkok which make me feel less stress and reach the destination on time Although it costs a little bit expensive

title: Easy to navigate!
review: The MRT can be accessed off of the Skyway system and is easy to navigate  Very clean and a great way to get to the Hua Lamphong train station via the Skyway and MRT very easily

title: Perfect city transportation
review: There is no better way to travel through Bangkok Sometimes a little bit crowded but fast cheap and safe Staying in a hotel with a BTS stop nearby is a huge benefit

title: Clean, affordable. easy and efficient system!
review: With the type of traffic in Bangkok one cannot afford not to appreciate the BTS skytrain The train system is clean and the fare is very reasonable The train network is also very easy to understand for usage and it is very efficient Understandably it is jampacked during peak hour but we never had to wait for more than two trains to get going  Really a bliss to move around in Bangkok with the BTS Skytrain  Note  So it would be wise to stay in an accommodation that is near to one

title: clean and air conditioned
review: super trains clean platforms clean trains and easy to use for tourists they are air conditioned so you will get respite from the heat whilst on the train not sure if they have wifi but everyone around me seemed connected to the internet whilst on the train

title: Great operation light sky train!
review: Easy access normal operation hours the only downside ia somewhat inefficient system of ticket purchasing

title: Great transportation in Bangkok
review: Very convenient comfortable and good price I love the BTS much better than using taxi grab or tuk tuk in Bangkok Easy to be overcharged by tuk tuk

title: Goes everywhere you need to go
review: Efficient clean and gets to most of the malls and places worth visiting The best way to travel in Bangkok

title: Fun and Quick
review: Can take you around Bangkok in "no time" FastFresh and Clean with Ac and you can just sit down and look around thé surroundings👍👍  this is a cheap way to "see" Bangkok from a Little bit above

title: Most convenient
review: Most convenient to move around Bangkok what with their horrendous jam Be prepared to walk a bit to maximize coverage though People are generally well mannered and patient follow and you will appreciate this more  Recently though noticed that a few times some travelers from Middle Kingdom will just stand in front of vending machines while their friend  partner  someone was at counter exchanging coins  holding back others from purchasing tickets u til they are done  duh The next time I’ll probably just tell them off

title: good way to get to the airport
review: The sky train won't take you exactly to the sight seeing spots in Bangkok but it is a good way to get from the airport to the city and the other way round It is easy to understand and to buy tickets

title: One of the Best Public Transport Systems
review: This is one of the best public transport systems I have been on Very clean efficient used by everyone The only downside is how packed it can get during rush hour and on the weekends especially in the area surrounding Siam but people are generally nice enough to step out of your way when you need to alight

title: what more do u want for 45 thb.
review: the service is extremely handy and value for money I paid 45 thb to go from Aport to City Center in 35 minutes service on time very clean not overcrowded and easy to find

title: MRT
review: This system is currently limited in access to Bangkok We could see evidence of future expansion This was an easy system to navigate Ticket staff are very competent and we found this system easy to use Some of the security staff are more problematic with language and not understanding requests for directions and assistance

title: Discovery Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a great way to get around away form the street level pollution and heat So easy to use and very clean and safe way to travel

title: Convenient
review: Comfy and convenient Makes me wish we also have one in the Philippines takes you to the airport from the city OR to the city from the airport in the most practical way Less hassle i should say fast and cheaper than a taxi cab

title: Visit
review: I am in bankok so i travel with bts its good but litttle difficult to find way because most of places writing thai languageanyway its good in very low budget

title: Overrated
review: I had read that this was one of the top things to do in Bangkok and it was an efficient way to travel but not as an activity in and of itself  My travelling companions were wondering why I suggested we do this as Uber was very efficient  When we got on the Skytrain at around 6 pm on a Saturday night we were jammed in like sardines and could not really see out the window at the sights If you have a problem with crowds I would not recommend it  The ticket buying was a little confusing but easy enough to figure out  It was much like taking BART in the Bay Area but much cleaner We felt very safe travelling and walking around Bangkok

title: So easy
review: This is such an easy and cheap way to get around the streets seem to be a constant car park so you will save a lot of time You can connect to the airport link station as well  this cost 40 baht and takes 30 min to get to and from the airport A taxi will take an hour or more depending on traffic and will cost you around 300 baht

title: it is ok, looks like delhi metro but costlier than delhi metro
review: we got the train from airport and travelled to another pointloved itloved the ride it is like riding delhi metro in bangkok with paying some extra money

title: Cheap & efficient
review: the fastest way to get to the train market without any jam map is also easy to locate because there's English instructions

title: Recommended for to/from airport
review: On arriving at Bangkok we tried to get a taxi and had read up what to expect and what price to expect  but our experience wasn’t great and the taxi drivers were trying to rip us off quoting double what we expected and without meter So we decided to use the airport rail link transferring on to the BTS Affordable quick and comfortable A little bit of a hassle with our luggage but as all 4wheel suitcases not too bad

title: Easy
review: Very easy to use and understand Clean efficient and everything the British transport system isn't

title: the best way of getting around Bangkok
review: don't think past the Skytrain for travel around Bangkok It's relatively cheap frequent efficient and cool

title: Nice, modern elevated train
review: The BTS Skytrain is clean and efficient  We never had to wait long so they run quite frequently  It can get very crowded during rush hours but that is expected  The train goes nearly everywhere we need it

title: Modern and Very Clean
review: Modern look English announcing the stations should be much better Sometimes we have to guess the name of the station

title: Very Crowded but better than a Taxi!!!!!!!!
review: My friend took me all over Bangkok today  I put some money on a card and we took off  It was very easy getting on and off the train but I'm a neophyte in Bangkok and it was a little intimidating changing trains and making sure we got off and on at the proper stations  They do have an electronic board inside the train that lets you know where the heck you are at and where you are heading but I'm so glad I had a native Bangkoker with me to make the proper decisions  It actually was easy and fun but as my title says extremely crowded where bodies touched each other for quite a distance

title: Busy
review: This is a very easy and convenient way to get around Bangkok However it does get busy use the very front or back cars to avoid the worst of the congestion The internet map is very good with suggestions of what to do at each station It's 140 bht for an all day pass

title: a very good 1.5 dollar option to city center instead of 20 dollars taxi even with a luggage
review: after passing passport controla and receiving your luggage you will find yourself in front of the exits to the streetjust do not exit and use the electrical stairs to go one level down buy a token to the city center the price will depend on the destined stationthe maximum price is 45 baht about 15 dollars for the last station very quick and clean and efficient mean of transport to city center even when you are coming with a heavy luggage

title: Totally Worth It
review: I generally don't like to take the subway and prefer a cab but in Bangkok this is such a better way to get around  Bangkok has the worst traffic in the world so take the skytrain  They actually make it easy to navigate

title: We can learn
review: Amazing If only London underground could learn from Thailand Friendly clean and no chewing gum on the seats

title: Great way to get around
review: Highly recommended You may need to walk a little bit if you don't stay close by the stations but it's worth the hassle as you beat traffic that bangkok is known for

title: Fun fast ride
review: Apart from being way cheap than taking a taxi the trip was amazingly fast We arrived in no time at all at Chat a chuk

title: Fast Efficient Cheap
review: It's super fast and efficient even during rush hour It's kept clean and the air cons are refreshing First world service

title: Queue is shorter at manned counter
review: If there is a long queue of tourists at the automated ticket machine proceed to the manned queue The tourists will struggle with the instructions on the machine and the machine often rejects coins and notes You are better off queueing at the manned counter where the staff is faster at selling the ticket token

title: Economical and efficient means of travelling around Bangkok
review: The trains are regular reliable clean safe and cheap making it a great way to safely travel around Bangkok

title: Ugh
review: The BTS or Bangkok Transport System is really convenient especially when travelling right across the city It is very crowded early in the morning and around 17301930 for rush hour The BTS is still more convenient than a taxi during these times even if there are huge crowds If you are claustrophobic or can't handle being pressed up against strangers avoid rush hour times

title: Good way to travel in Bangkok
review: The BTS(and the MRT) will bring you to many places without suffering from traffic jams Sometimes difficult to get a seat

title: Good, but express would be good as well
review: The train avoids the traffic and gives you good views of the city but wasn't as fast as I expected stopping at several stations An express service would be even better

title: Truly amazing
review: What an amazing experience We were collected from our hotel and taken first to the Railway Markets Miss Sara was our guide and along the way she told us about the history of the area and the markets She even took the time to give us a Thai language lesson which was hilarious The Railway markets were fascinating a truly wonderful experience From there we then drove on to the floating markets which were also fantastic and of corse along the way we had another history lesson and language lesson from Miss Sara The whole trip was a truly memorable experience and I cannot recommend it enough Thank you Big Country and Miss Sara for looking after us so well and for making it so much fun Stan and Martin

title: Convenient transportation
review: The airport link is a convenient way to travel to & from airport We took a ride when heading home Just take BTS to Phaya Thai station Pay a separate fee to take the railway link It’s fast cheap and avoids Bangkok traffic

title: Great way to get around
review: The Skytrain system is a great option for easily navigating the city We were lucky to have a nearby stop and you can easily make your way to the river to catch a ferry up to the temples or around to some of the other shopping districts

title: Perfect if you stay in the city center!
review: Clean fast reliable the airport link is a very good way if you stay close one of the station or near to a BTS station since there is a connecting station between both train systems Good way to avoid traffic If you stay a bit outside Bangkok or reach outside peak hours however taxis are still a good options as they will (should) take you directly to your place

title: Excellent way to get around
review: Great way to get around the city Simple to purchase a prepaid rabbit card so you can just swipe in and out Otherwise need to have change around for individual tickets but that is not complicated either

title: Clean,quick, cheap!
review: Best way to travel  avoid sitting in taxis and taking ages  Most destinations are around 4050Baht and you get decent views in a cool train  Try to avoid rush hour though as you get more closely acquainted with fellow passengers than you might like

title: Cheap and Cool
review: Great subway Clean cheap and very cool Not a lot of stops and only a few transfers to to the BTS Supposedly they're going to have a single fare card for both the MRT and BTS but in the meantime its a great way to get around town

title: no better way to travel in Bangkok
review: While at peak hours the waves of people might intimidate the ticketing counters that cater to first timers and people confused by the local are unfailingly polite patient and extremely helpful With that help the BTS is THE alternative to the clogged up streets down below in Central Bangkok

title: Get a map and you should be right
review: Pretty easy to useif in doubt ask at help window and they will tell you what it costs then you put coins in machine for that amount Uses coins only gives change On single track line don't do what I didjumped on next train without checking sign on front of train and went off in wrong directionall good funwith the benefit of hindsight

title: Best way of Transportation
review: This is the best was for transportation within BK Just check the map to know the nearest station to you

title: Easy way to see bangkok
review: I wouldn't bother booking a tour This system is so easy to use and cheap Ild recommend buying a day pass and getting on and off at stops as you please Nice clean trains and they are very frequent )

title: The nightmare of the morning commute!
review: Unfortunately the BTS was having technical difficulties at the time however in general it's the best way to get around Bangkok especially on a Friday evening

title: Great...but.....
review: Excellent way to get out to the airport no surprisesnice view en route BUTBUTBUTonly FOLDING bikes allowed Which is crazy because there are special large LUGGAGE AREA standing room cars on each train that would be perfect for a regular bike They have an Airport bike track surrounding the airport235 km yet you can't get there on the SkyLink###&*1 Someone not thinkingthe smaller Skytrain allows regular bikes at least at certain hours

title: Great way to beat Bangkok traffic
review: Great way to beat Bangkok traffic SkyTrain Stations are well positions Its an easy connection to the ferry to get to the historic parts of the city

title: Easy & Fast around Bangkok
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to get around Bangkok  Most stations we went to had escalators up to them  Easy to get from Suvarnabhumi Airport on the Express train with connections to the Skytrain  Also good to connect to the river ferry station at Saphan Taksin and to the weekend market at Mo Chit We find it clean air conditioned fast and timely

title: ASIM CHAKRABARTI
review: Trains are nothing extra ordinary Only you can watch the television  which is not add any extra value  Fare is too high  though service is very frequent

title: Highly recommend this trip!
review: Our guide Tom and our driver did everything to make our day excellent Tom was very caring making sure that we wouldn't get lost and get back on time He took as many pictures as we wanted and even bought some snacks on the market for us to try out As a solo traveller it was great to take part of this organized trip as both markets are quit far from Bangkok center

title: Good but not excellent
review: I suppose that it is easier to go around with Skytrain to different places in Thailand I have three problems with the system Rabbit card is confused for us even when we travelling around The stair cases are long for middle age people like me Air condition cannot be available in the station Please forgive me if I am a little difficult

title: The best way to get into town
review: Traffic from BKK airport to the city is a bear especially during the day If the train is running it is the fastest way to get between the airport and town Unfortunately the express line  was not running the two times we tried to take the train But consider that the cost is still less than 110th the cost of a cab and it is likely faster during the day

title: Efficient, cost effective.
review: Takes you everywhere the BTS doesn't Not as easy as the BTS but would definitely use the MRT over a taxi any day

title: Special train trip
review: We took the train from Kanchanaburi to Nam Tok It work very will Many tourists left the train at Saphan Thamkra Sae Cave then there were more room for us to take pictures

title: Destination Possible
review: The best way to commute SkyTrain is easy cheap & approachable One can certainly depend on its avaialbility for commuting

title: Perfect, fast and affordable
review: Want the travel fast for a good price and on time  Take the BTS its perfect Much cheaper than taxi’s and even tuktuks

title: Public transportation is the best in Bangkok
review: For the last eleven winters I stayed in Bangkok the best mean of transportation is the sky train  No hassle with the taxi drivers and no fighting with the bad traffic  Ones can always hop on the motor cycle for the rest of the journey if your destination is too far within walking distance from the BTS station

title: brilliant
review: Excellent tour  picked up from hotel on time  quite a long drive ( about an hour and 20 mins but stopped after an hour for short break where we could get a drink etc Train and market good fun  also floating market  my children are 17 and 20 and thoroughly enjoyed it Guide was excellent

title: Best and easiest way to travel in Bangkok
review: Fast reliable travelling with affordable cost Also air conditioning Good service for tourists if any questions

title: Easy to use and cheap.
review: We used the BTS train on several occasions to get across town The trains are on time clean and have AC Cheap way to get around town

title: On time w/ cool AC
review: What a relief from hot humid Bangkok Easy to use (same as Myki card in Melbp) which called Rabbit card per May 2012 (multiple trips) or buy onetimeuse magnetic coin from machine Plenty of food n drink outlets within any stasion area Siam BTS station is the main hub to change between 2 lines

title: Best option to get around
review: It has AC it is fast it is cheap  what more do you want from public transportation Oh also they make it really easy to figure out the price for tickets Some European cities could learn from that

title: Clean and convenient
review: We love the skytrain it is very easy to use and great for the shopping complexes Clean inside a cool respite from the soaring heat  It can be standing room during peak hours

title: Great, if It's Going Where You're Going (and it's not rush hour)
review: The Skytrain is the better of Bangkok's two commuter rail services (the undergound metro is okay but no views Most of western Bangkok is not served by the Skytrain including touristheavy Khao San Road and Banglamphu But if the Skytrain is going where you're going (Silom Sukhimvit Chatuchak Market airport) it's an efficient affordable aircon way to go It can be insanely crowded during rush hours however

title: Very accesible and useful to avoid traffic
review: Been using the service when in bangkok city Most places to visit are walking distance to bts station Well maintained car and good airconditioning People are polite and patient Never experienced being push even rush hour

title: Cheap and easy
review: This is SO the way to get to and from the airport  cost 40 baht and takes 30 min A taxi will take an hour or more depending on traffic and cost around 300 baht On this last visit it seemed like the highways were little more than a car park

title: Nice overhead rail.
review: Very easy to us and a cheap way to go around Bangkok  Vert clean and safe We used it to go to the river and some of the markets

title: Good sevice....overcrowded
review: This is a very convenient economical and fast way to get around Bangkok  Biggest problem on my most recent visit was the number of people on each train  they were packed all the time  May be time to add more trains to the line

title: Beat the airport-Bangkok road traffic
review: Train runs every 20 minutes from the international airport and takes about 3035 minutes to central Bangkok  Price is $12USD so excellent value  Only thing that was odd is why they would make an airport train with such small seats and hardly any place to put luggage Obviously poor planning but efficient

title: Don’t let the bus ride scare you off!
review: Our guides were amazing I was hesitant about the long bus ride but the bus was nice and they stopped so we could all use the rest room It was SO worth the ride Our guide recommended what we should get for lunch and was kind funny and communicative   One of our best tours so far The markets are a must see and it was an amazing day trip

title: Stream way to get around
review: Fantastic way to get around Cheap and easy and station is connected with river boats Buy one day pass if wanting to use it all day

title: Metro Train
review: Airport link railway is like metro in Mumbai and delhi But little beat costly it charged 40 bhat for 30 km Also main pont is it is just inside airport So no need to go outside and took texi But see nearest station to your hotel

title: The cheapest way to go to the airport
review: One of the best if not the best transportation means in between the new airport and downtown Easy connection withMetro and taxis

title: Awesome
review: Taking the BTS was really simple and fast It is very clean inside unlike the NYC Subway I would definitely recommend taking the BTS whilst travelling in Bangkok

title: Efficient and cheep transport
review: We used the BTS Skytrain to get around Bangkok one day and the service is very cost effective and runs like a swiss watch felt safe at all times and  would use again

title: timing was very good
review: excelent transportaion in bangkok departed on on time and working till late time  but you have to have the train card

title: Makes Australia train transport look poor
review: Great way to get around town Clean on time very air conditioned and cheap The Trains line up their doors to the lines on the platforms with great precision ever time You stand at right angles to the track and when the train pulls in and the doors open you let the passengers get off and then you swing in and get on Amazing to see especially at peak hour If you want hang on the overhead handles or want to have your phone in your hand choose that before you get on at peak hour because you won't be able to change when your in the crowd Don't be put of by the crowds Thai's are very curteous and very pleasant in their personal grooming etc Buy a card and load it with 200 baht and enjoy Bangkok

title: Cheap Travel thru Bankok
review: We took this everywhere  Very reasonable clean and routing questions are anways answered at the agents' desk

title: Clean and efficient
review: Clean and efficient However if you travel during peak times you may have to wait for 23 trains before you can squeeze onto one and it will be absolutely packed The saving grace is the incredible politeness of the Thai people Orderly queuing to get on the train and no pushing to jump ahead If you have luggage I would not recommend trying to use this service during the morning or evening busy times

title: Interesting but too full of tourists
review: The tour operator and the guide were fine  I was warned before booking the floating market that it was a “tourist trap” and it was We first went to the train market and the train was delayed by almost a half hour so by the time we got to the floating market there were very few vendors to see  JAMMED packed  with boats carrying tourists and very few vendors You do get the idea of what it must’ve been like years ago  Perhaps if this tour left earlier (7 am) and went to the floating market before the train it wouldn’t be so packed  You can skip the train market  Take the floating market but go early in the morning is my advice for a better experience

title: Very fast and cost effective.
review: If you are staying downtown and need to travel to the airport during the day then I would recommend this as a good money and timesaving option You can avoid the traffic during the day and the train is usually pretty empty So it isn't much of a hassle with luggage I think if you arrive at night then a taxi will be just as fast but cost more than 300 baht to the airport

title: Don mueang airport
review: Worst customer service i had ever experienced those working in the shops in the airport are completely rude and abrupt I had approached a saleswoman in a shop that sells scarfs and asked her the price of an incense bottle that was there Instead of telling me the price like a normal person she raised her voice and only after asking the third time she replied annoyedly After i walked out of the shop pissed off she started complaining about me to the rest of her workers in Thai The sales persons there already cant speak Englishon top of that they don’t even take the initiative to try and understand what you ask as a customer In my case i just asked “how much is this” The worst experience I’ve ever encounteredruined my mood and gave a bad impression

title: great
review: the best way to go from place to place Fast clean and cheap What else to ask Easy to use we like to use it Except when the crowd leaves the office

title: Great
review: Got this from the airport into the city was really good and quick journey Very cheap However Bangkok is much bigger than people think Do check how far your accommodation is from here their maps are a little disproportionate and it was much further than we thought to walk  Backpackers trying to get there for cheaper and being unorganised about it

title: convenient  but  not cheap  for groups
review: Good  for moving fast  in  neverending traffic in evening hours Bad  many stations dont have escalators elevators  for people  to  climb up the  tickets machines   Bad  each time you lineup in ques  for coins  Common Thais  simply this   Most vending machines for tickets dont have  papercurrency  handling  facility  Bad  day tickets  are not sold  or encouraged  to tourist

title: Great service
review: So easy to use and they have accommodated different languages also Even when you get off the train there is directions to your hotels Absolutely spotless inside the station and also on the trains For such a busy city we never had trouble getting onto a train nor were they over crowded as you never had to wait long for the next one The service was unbelievable very cheap

title: Easy way to get places
review: Very easy to figure out and faster than being stuck in traffic

title: Cold & Crowded
review: It's the best way to travel around Bangkok in time and leave traffic jam behind but if you travel during morning and evening you'll face the massive of workers

title: So easy and cheap!
review: Definitely recommend using the SkyTrain to get around Bangkok There are names written in English and it's easy and straightforward to figure out where you are and where you need to go Also airconditioning on these rocks

title: Great tour, we recommend it!
review: Our guide Sara took good care of us She gave us many insider tips about local habits and food She helped us translate while shopping bought local specialties for the group to try and provided us with water twice on this hot winter day in Thailand 😁

title: Really useful and cheap.
review: We stayed by the national stadium and found the BTS line a really easy way to get to everywhere we needed to go  It is 140 baht for a one day pass so super cheap especially if you are using it a lot and the AC on it is brilliant  a welcomed break from the very humid Bangkok weather

title: Clean, fast, cheap
review: Everything a modern link should be   the railway system works well and you never wait long for a train

title: Cheap and efficient!
review: Honestly a great way to avoid the traffic and get to the airport in approx 30 minutes Very cheap to use as well

title: easy to accesss and regular
review: very reliable stop at most shopping malls and very cheap as we bough a day pass and boarded loads of trains whilst touring Bangkok

title: EASY
review: Connected to Sky Train from airport easily   Easy to navigate   Lots of English signs and information booths

title: Superb service
review: Ok so these trains are always crowded especially late afternoon but they run on time are relatively cheap and get you from a to b quicker than most modes of transport in Bangkok also the aircon is most welcome after suffering the humid weather of Thailand

title: Most convenient way to get around the city core
review: The skytrain is the best way to get around congested city It covers only a small portion of Bangkok and runs from 6 AM to about midnight If you are staying more than a day buy a Rabbit Card and load it with a few hundred bahts to avoid standing in line to purchase tickets

title: Convenient but so crowded
review: I took it for sightseeing and decided not to take it when I went back to the airport  It is so crowded and not every exit has an elevator  I ended up taking a taxi instead

title: BTS is Bangkok's best public amenity
review: Get a travel pass at the ticket counter and use it all the time It's quick efficient clean and comfortable In conjunction with underground rail you can go anywhere in Bangkok quickly and easily over the top of the traffic chaos and delays on the ground

title: Great connection
review: I traveled with the Airport Rail Link in january 2013 and it worked perfectly It's on the lower ground of the airport and I just got a oneway ticket at the ticketbooth I went on the 'slow' train which takes 30 minutes to Phraya Thai Great way to Bangkok

title: Acessible, fast and cheap
review: This service train is very convenient This joins the main BTS and MTR link in Bangkok However this link is not available for people who are using the Don Mueng Airport

title: Good experience
review: Interesting to experience  the train market and the floating market Tour guide was very friendly and helpful Worth the money

title: Mmm a bit different
review: Once you get used to the system off letting people off and our you get on it's fine Same with walking up & down the stairs Once you get your bearings it's fairly straight forward & easy to use Used 3 times now & each time gets easier

title: Great for avoiding the traffic!
review: Bangkok is wellknown for its traffic jam Bts is the best way to avoid the traffic and very convenient to go to places

title: Convenience, Clean
review: the BTS skytrain is very convenient able to reach most attractions and must visit places within bangkok AC is cold considering the weather of bangkok and very easy to navigate and while line to use to get to where train is very clean which is good pricing though is prolly a little high(in my opinion) but the maximum price they charged for as far u wanna go is 520bhat  most of the ticket vending machine only accept coins so u have to change your note to coins at the counter every single time there are very very few machine ticket vending machine that accepts note(which are new machine)

title: "Cool Train"
review: It's just near to the hotel if were we stay walking distance only better than the Tuk tuk and the taxi and less expensive and comfortable Take BTS skytrain if you want to visit the chatujak market all what you wish for is all there

title: Just keeps getting better.
review: Every time I come to bangkok I take the sky train And every year I notice surely changes that allows for better efficiency

title: Great, especially with the express train
review: It's actually a very convenient comfortable and reasonably rapid ride from downtown BKK to Suvarnabhumi Beats the taxis at almost all time of day And even with big luggage you can move easily across the stations start and end But take the oneperhour express version

title: Only covering a small area of the city
review: Unfortunately the MRT is only covering a small area of the city and there s no way you can get to the important stuff in Bangkok by using it This is the only downside The stations and trains are clean you can buy tickets easily and the system is very well explained

title: Better than taking the taxi
review: Clean easy to follow maps If in doubt ask the control station Avoid rush hours it can be quite packed

title: Great way to move around Bangkok
review: Both Skytrain and Metro are very reliable clean and "aircondition ed" ways to commute in Bangkok It cover the 34 of the city There is not link to the area of the famous palace Khao San China Town and the most tourist part of the city but a tuk tuk can always take you there )

title: Great
review: I would use this method of transportation again  Very easy to use and very comfortable service for Bangkok

title: Best way to get around
review: Don't take a taxi if you can avoid it  Watch a video on YouTube and get oriented so you understand how the signs work and it's a piece of cake  Cheap easy clean fast  What more can you ask for

title: Easy to use
review: Helpful staff and locals can direct you to your destination Affordable quick way to travel around the Bangkok city Led station tracker above doors which give your exact location and how many stops to yur destination

title: Good train
review: The train was clean and reasonable price Very affordable for their local people or foreigner It was safe and tidy

title: Convenient
review: Very easy to understand and convenient for people don't have a car there But if you are traveling in a group can try taxi sometimes the share money is less than a BTS tickets

title: Useful and easy
review: 140 for a day pass was exceptional Air conditioning was good and there was no litter or mess on the tube All tubes were fairly regular

title: fast, easy to navigate once you know the basics and cheap
review: convenient to the major shopping areas and attractions regular trains running and easy to ask for directions also well air conditioned

title: A fantastic way to travel around Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is a wonderful way to travel around Bangkok  a city often choked by traffic and long delays  It's very easy to "work out" and navigate and with spacious air conditioned carriages  A real bonus to BKK and a great way to travel through the city and get a different perspective on it with some interesting views en route

title: BTS - Best way to travel in Bangkok
review: I've been traveling to Bangkok for almost 10yrs and use the BTS sky train every time I'm there It's so convenient and efficient that it makes traveling very easy out there

title: An easy system to use but it is not called Skytrain for nothing.
review: Skytrain is a reliable and inexpensive way to move around Bangkok and as the traffic gets slower and slower Skytrain becomes even more attractive  There do not appear to be quiet periods now the trains are packed all day and young locals stick firmly to their seats with their eyes glued to their smartphones while elderly Thais and foreigners strap hang There is one disagreeable aspect that is access It is not called Skytrain for nothing The tracks are elevated well above street level and lifts or escalators are often absent or hard to find When there is some help getting up to the track level more often than not it is only a part service In the Bangkok heat the prospect of a hundred or more steps up to the train can be dispiriting for the older traveler

title: Huge time saving
review: I travelled from city to the airport using the Airport Link and would not regret I saved a lot of time as the Bangkok road are always full of traffic Its the best way to travel to the airport

title: superb transport
review: Very sistamatic and easy for forigners to use and very very clean trains and the stations superb transport system

title: 35Baht from Makassan MRT to Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: The cheapest way to airport A luggage friendly way to airport without the worry of traffic jam Cost 35B one way from Makassan MRT

title: First time in the trains
review: Went on the trains for the first time with my family very cheap and super fast all trains are on time I would recommend using them to get where you need too

title: Great way to travel Bangkok, but limited in city coverage
review: Considering most taxis are unreliable due to refusing to take you to certain destinations due to traffic and overcharging tourists the BTS is one of the best ways to get around Bangkok The cost of a one way ticket will vary based on starting and ending points it is usually around 40Bperson or $130 USD A one day pass is 140Bperson There is a green line and blue line with one station Siam to transfer between lines The train can get crowded between 2 pm and 9 pm Taking the BTS is also a good way to see the politeness of Thai people You will find that Thais will line up neatly to enter the train they will willingly give up their seats for children elders and pregnant riders Further it is common that most men will stand to not occupy seats for women and children Go with the flow Advice  The lineup to buy a pass for the train can be long especially in key stations like Siam and Saphan Taksin When you get off the train and if there is no lineup buy your return pass to avoid the lineup If you have an allday pass there is no need to do this  Watch YouTube videos on how to use the BTS passes beforehand  You can combine the BTS with public water taxi and a little bit of walking to get to all tourist attractions around Bangkok Personally I have eliminated the use of taxis while in Bangkok as I got tired of their cheating ways  Keep an eye out for free shuttle boats or buses to some tourist attractions from your hotel such as to Icon Siam Asiatique Siam Centre Wat Arun etc

title: Review for Sara
review: We took this tour with Sara She is highly recommended she is very knowledgeable and trustable If you pick this tour choose Sara The tour was very puntual and they gave us everything they promoted and even more

title: Huge Markets that arent ON the train tracks
review: but are next to them Its a really big local market every Wednesday night from what we could tell Our hotel only gave us an hour to run around which isnt near enough at least 2 needed The array of food is amazing from bugs to delicacies all cooked freshly in front of you Everything from shoes to clothes to cheap crap but don't expect a lot of English but its enough to get by though (even if they have to go find someone to help out) Its jammed packed rows tightly crammed with shops and people the only comment I would say is that its hard to find local art and craft (if indeed its there) it doesn't seem broken up in sections so we didn't find any which is what we are always interested in A good fun evening from 630 on

title: Used to be better
review: The train from Phaya Thai is still a great way to get to Suvarnabhumi airport cheaply and reliably but they used to have a more expensive fast train that only stopped 2 or 3 times which has been cancelled so now there is only the slow train that stops at every stop which takes a lot longer and is always jampacked with tourists and airport workers Unless you are travelling solo to somewhere near a skytrain stop a cab is the best way to get to town from the airport You can’t buy a connecting ticket for the MTR so when you come from the airport you have to join a long queue to buy another ticket and the ticket machines only take coins

title: Fast clean cheap
review: One of the best mass transport systems in the world  Super simple to understand Cheap Clean  Great street food around most of the stations  Given that traffic can grind to a halt in Bangkok this is a fine option for getting around

title: Review
review: Tom was a fantastic tour guide My 9 year old and I had a wonderful time We were able to see a lot Well organized tour Would recommend

title: Traffic is terrible in Bangkok, so see if the sky train goes where you need to go.
review: If you have an itinerary in advance check to see if you can use the sky train as traffic in Bangkok is terrible We spent hours in a cab or tour bus at the worst times

title: Sort of convenient
review: Depending on where you want to go  Connects indirectly with the subway   and that connects indirectly with the sky train Would not try this with heavy luggage as you have to walk a lot to  get to alternative  transportation for the "final mile"

title: STOLE OUR TOUR MONEY AND ABANDONED US
review: This is by far the absolute worst tour operator I have ever dealt with They has zero communication We speak thousands on tours for our trip All emailed or called Not this one This was to be our first tour in Bangkok We did hear from them until beyond the 24 hours cancellation threshold The wanted out hotel info Was provided There the next Emil informed us they would not be picking up up and to meet them at some Hostel in downtown Bangkok at 0600 in the morning I believe we were abandoned because we are Americans and were being discriminated against We could It even cancel at that point We attempted to go to this Hostel Of which TWO Grab drivers had never heard of The tour offered hotel pickup in Bangkok we were in Bangkok Then refused when they discovered we are Americans So I called call Viator after attempting to get to this creepy Hostel they mentioned Again that Grab drivers never heard of  This company REFUSED to refund This company DEMANDED we pang additional to even reschedule our missed tour There was never a reason given for our abandonment or an apology for all the poor communication pathetic customer service and discrimination Nerves a word came from them beyond expect being confronted when we complained to Viator Viator did take care of us We did get a refund from Viator We did find another tour and did enjoy the Train and Floating markets with a very professional legitimate tour company This company ruined our first day in Bangkok Save your self the heartache and money and book another tour This one is a thief and ripoff

title: The way to get around Bangkok
review: The BTS is brilliant  No traffic jams and they leave regularly  Everything is written in Thai and English so it's easy to understand  If you're going to be travelling on the BTS a few times in a day buy the daily ticket as it will save you heaps

title: nothing special
review: We only took the 30 min train ride and apart from the occasional stunning scenery it was just a train ride There is one curve when the train rumbles over a wooden bridge which provides some good snaps from leaning out the window Maybe the longer journey would be better but l don't think so Have the short ride just because you are there and spend time at the war museum cemetery and Hellfire Pass then you have a truly memorable day

title: Efficient railway system.
review: Very confortable and efficient means of mass transportwidely used by both local and tourists alike Very clean and cool Almost all parts of bangkok can be reached on different lines and very convenient to transfer

title: Extremely convenient mode of transportation
review: We took 3 days to realise the importance of skytrain Really we were first avoiding the train as we would not know which train to take to go to our destination and kept on struggling in the roads with the long traffic jams Finally on our 3rd day we realised we should have availed the sky train right from day one It is extremely convenient and everything is on display You do not need to worry as every intermediate station is also on display indicating which train to take as well You can also collect your own ticket at one of the automated ticketing machines Extremely convenient

title: Fab!
review: We visited Bangkok for one week and stayed with friends who live here During that time we navigated the BTS lines (changing at Siam) to get to different attractions It's really cheap the rabbit card is free (unlike an Oyster card) and the trains are all air conditioned

title: Excellent
review: We used this to travel round Bangkok very clean air conditioned reasonably easy to navigate if you don't read Thai

title: An excellent adventure
review: This was an excellent little adventure A friendly tour guide the train ride was a lovely touch to go through the railway markets then the floating markets were wonderful Some reviewers said the shop keepers were pushy and 'forced' you to buy things but we didn't find that at all

title: BTS SKYTRAIN IN BKK
review: Traffic in Bangkok could be more than horrible particularly if it rains  The BTS is a saviour   So whatever I plan to do it has to be within the walking distance of BTS in Bangkok

title: Very Convenient
review: My family and I are in Bangkok almost every winter for at least a month and we have 3 children in tow everywhere we go The Bangkok BTS is above all very convenient & safe and the best way to avoid traffic etc But it must be mentioned that it is also very prompt clean air conditioned and uncrowded Next step for Bkk BTS would be to extend their routes further out of central Bangkok

title: Taking the Train is a No Brainer
review: Depending on when you arrive in or are leaving Bangkok taking the train can be a fantastic option It is a great way to beat the traffic and the heat especially if you are heading downtown  If you’re like us and your baggage doesn’t arrive with you or you are meeting up with friends or family it is a great way to get back to the airport and make a quick trip back  It is reliable not expensive and I don’t recall being in overfull train cars like in other cities in Asia So is less stressful than taking a cab can sometimes be

title: Brilliant
review: Would not go any other way  easy to use  cheap & not stuck in traffic in a taxi  As a foreigner don't be afraid to use 👍 only downer usually the lifts don't work when you get off at your destination

title: Interesant
review: This is the first what I did in Bangkok and I was surprised have it works It's easy to do And you can ask for help

title: Perfect way to transit within BKK
review: Except for the rush hour and everything would be perfect also offered a special card per day so you don't have to queue and buy the regular tickets

title: Easy to use...BUT
review: If most of the sightseeing that you want to do is up and down SUKHUMVIT RD then the BTS Skytrain is a better optionsince it runs along that street

title: Only way to travel in bkk
review: Either the sky train or the subway are the only way to quickly and reliably get around Bangkok At least to main locations Travel above the city see the sites in AC comfort   Can be a bit cold at times And packed during peak times But otherwise clean and reliable service   Buying tickets have coins or swap notes for coins at the counter And use the vending machines Easy to understand and use

title: Very Convenient and Easy to Use
review: The Skytrain has great access to the city from the airport It runs every 15 minutes so you always have a chance to get tofrom the airport We chose a hotel that was located close to the blue line and it was great No complaints Very cheap

title: Cool experience
review: Really cool experience to see the railway market  It’squick but neat and also to take the train  Floating market also unique  I understand everyone needs money now but it was annoying to have such a long stop at the mainland market knowing all the vendors would be grabbing our arms and begging us to buy things  Better to have the guide company trim that off because you tell Stop was just to try to sell us things  Guide was good and fun but also unable to understand some of our questions

title: Simple way to travel
review: Day 1 may seem daunting dont feel afraid The simplest way to travel quick no traffic snarl ups a change of 1 rail possibly  But easy to negotiate  Helpful staff if you are unsure or have incorrect money denominations

title: easy way to get around
review: The sky train is the easiest way to get around a massive warm and cramped city no escalators at the stations but no problem unless you have bad knees or cant go your flip flops properly trains are regular and cool

title: Cheap and Quick
review: Once you paid after queuing then the train itself is pretty quick its just the queuing for the tickets and also the process waiting for the train as it was very busy

title: A quick and cheap way into the city
review: For the equivalent of about £100 you can save time and money getting into the city by this rail link Getting a taxi will cost around 600THB but the rail ink is about 40THB and you won't get stuck in traffic jams You will need to change if you intend to get the BTS skytain to areas such as Sukumvit Road which will cost you another 40THB or so but everything is easy and linked so is no bother at all   Trains are quiet quick cool and usually not too packed (depending on time of day)

title: information office very helpfull
review: we found the skytrain to be very clean and tidy and very efficient the staff in the information office very helpfull easy to use  the train took us straight into the city centre and straight into the shoping mall where you where allways in air con

title: Efficient
review: The Airport Rail Link is very efficient It is an easy way and access from the airport to and from the city

title: Easy to move
review: Better buy the daily pass which will cost you 140Bth per person of you want to commute frequently In my case we stay in and apartment where it is 500m from the Ploen Chit BTS

title: Fast
review: Very fast clean and comfy  Was very well organised and extremely safe  Great way to travel in Bangkok

title: Quick and easy to use
review: We used the sky train several times during our stay in Bangkok After we got used to the system and the map (got lost once but friendly folks directed us to the right train) we did just fine The trains experienced trouble on one day and the system was backed up During rush hour the trains are usually jammed and you may have to wait for the next train Buying a ticket is a little different You have to go to a ticket person who will give you the necessary coins to enter into the ticket machine The ticket agent will tell you what fare you will need and you then pay in scrip Once on the train listen for the announcements in Thai and in English but you should look at the map above the windows to make sure you get off at the right stop Even if you miss your station you simply get off go under the tracks to the other side and take the next train back No new ticket is required If you are in difficulty ask anyone

title: Great transportation
review: Fantastic train system air conditioned TV and fast Appreciate the cleanliness and the guards It pretty much gets you anywhere you need to go And buying tickets is comprehensive too

title: Great!
review: So cheap and easy Connected directly from the airport  made a quick transition to the BTS and to my hotel Provided a nice little view of the city and outskirts on our way in

title: Airport Rail Link
review: connecting right through the airport very easy and convenient  You need to know the area you want to go  Route Map  Suvarnabhumi airport  Lat Krabang  Ban Thap Chang  Hua Mak  Ramkhamhaeng  Makkasan  Ratchaprarop  Phaya Thai  You need to know which is the closest place to your destination get down there and take a metered taxi make sure you don't go on fixed rate but meter  beat the traffic if you think your city has more traffic than bangkok even if it does not have more traffic than your city it would definitely match your city standards atleast in traffic  Airport Rail Link Go ahead and try it

title: Fast and Efficient
review: Expensive locally speaking  No air con on the station platforms which is poor  can get busy  much better than battling traffic

title: fast and safe
review: best way to go around after you experience the chaotic traffic of Bangkok and cheap

title: Great way to get around
review: Great way to get around but very busy espacialy getting on at the ferry terminal you can get change from the kiosks at the train stops to use to but tickets for the sky trian

title: Jump the traffic jam
review: Very convenient especially at peak times when the roads from and to the airport are congested Very clean and very well air conditionedFurthermore you have a nice view of the city from the elevated rails

title: "Predictable and easy transportation to the city"
review: On our return from a short journey to Cambodia my wife and I decided to try out the airpori link rail service On exit from the customs into the arrival hall the direction to the underground platform is clearly marked If you are able to manuver the amount of luggage you are carrying easily this is the best way to reach different parts of the city without getting caught in the unpredictable traffic on the roads and at a fraction of the cost of taking the cab We can reach the station using escalators moving from one level to the other On reaching the station there is a reception desk where staff greeted us with the usual Thai warmth and smile They informed us that the express train was not functioning and that we can take the regular train which goes from the Airport to Phayathai which iis centrally located We bought our tickets from the vending machine (a member of staff was nearby to help if required) Trains arrive at frequent intervels and very clean and tidyThere was no problem finding a seat near the exit with enough room for our luggage nearby As we proceed the train gets busy but not overcrouded We changed at Makkasan 5 stops away from the airport and walked to Petchabury a MRT station nearby the 5 minutes walks took us through a sky bridge over the road and down the escalators to the MRT platform We bought our tickets for MRT and proceeded to our destination Between us we had a medium sized suitcase on wheels back pack and a handbag We had no issues with the journey which took one hour door to door including 10 minutes walk at our destination

title: Alternative to taxi
review: At 45 baht a great comfortable & easy way to get to the airport We preffered this as we didn't get an asleep behind the wheel going 120kph overtired Thai taxi driver( Great peace of mind if you have kids )

title: Fantastic Form of Transport
review: So easy to navigate easier than the London Underground  Air conditioned very clean and on time  Loved the way to board wait for passengers to disembark before alighting yourself  Train pulls in at designated boarding spaces making it much easier to board  Announcements made on board and stations highlighted  Used this to to get to the river and pier  You can use coins only the buy your tickets but if you are unaware about your destination queue for your ticket and information  The staff are efficient and very polite  Also this form of transport will take you direct to the Airport  I would definitely use again

title: More convenient travel option for the elderly than Sky train
review: The MRT is newer than the overhead sky train and benefits form air conditioning on the platforms wider stations and convenience of access with escalators on almost all entry points   I travelled with my parents in their 70s and they found this aspect much better than climbing stairs into the sky train system though of course the MRT has a smaller service offering it does take you directly to the Chatuchak weekend market and other attractions such as the train night market at the Thailand Cultural Center  There are plenty of ticket machines but the touch screens are not always working efficiently and it’s easier to simply queue for the counter assistants to buy a ticket they understand and speak English well If you’re over 60 it’s worth asking for a senior’s ticket though often the staff don’t believe you look your age which is flattering at least The only downsides to the MRT are that no toilets are provided as also is the case with the sky train  and services aren’t as frequent as say in other major metropolitan areas overseas If you want to avoid the heat and enjoy usually less cramped carriages than the sky train then this is a great option Very reasonably priced

title: Go anywhere fast and comfortably...
review: Having been on many commuter trainssubwaysmonorails etc I have to say that this is one of the best and most modern  It is fast clean and efficient covering most areas of the city above ground so one get's a free city tour thrown in (It has very large windows)  Also I've invariably been able to secure a seat within a stop or two  Although Bangkok has an efficient and clean underground as well I much perfer this for it's sightseeing benefits

title: Excellent airport connectivity
review: Its  very good cheapest and convenient way to reach Bangkok airport You can get this  metro from many points of Bangkok city easily

title: Good connectivity
review: The MRT and skytrain links most of the places in Bangkok and it is easy to use if you have done a bit of homework The staff speak little English and you cannot inquire anything in the counter if there is doubt about where to get downThey don't sell tickets in the counter when you give money they give coins in exchange of the money we give Then we have to put coins in the vending machine to get tickets  Dont know why they do this Its kinda difficult to understand for me when they were trying to tell me this And if you are travelling single you save money by taking BTS but if you are a family with 34 people then the total amount of money you put in for the trip is almost equal to what you pay for a metered taxi Overall we can give it a go

title: BTS rides
review: BTS clean efficient convienient and inexpesive  I found it to access most major attractions in the city heart and easy to use  Second day there I took it everywhere I wanted to go wo issue

title: too crowded.............................................
review: in rush hoursit is too crowded and some time difficult to get space even for standing

title: airport rail link
review: it's very convenient and cheap way to get from the city t the international airport just make sure t be there before midnight because they close by that time

title: Easy, reliable, and cheap!
review: I used the Airport Rail link last month on my visit to Bangkok  It was very easy to get from inside the airport and with a little research beforehand you can figure out where you need to get off  I had to change trains once in the city but my hotel gave me perfect directions  With traffic being so crazy in Bangkok I would highly recommended this if you can access it  They did claim not to take CC which I am unsure about but there was money exchange places right near the ticket counter so no issues

title: Totally worth a visit
review: The Wednesday night markets are totally worth a visit especially if your a foodie It's pretty big & has everything fresh food bars clothes & the usual market items

title: Cheap and good
review: Great way to arrive and depart from our hotel The train departs from the basement of the airport terminal and we arrived at our hotel in Sukhumvit area after a short transfer to BTS skytrain at Makassan It's not difficult to work out the system as the station staff cxan converse in basic English Total cost  50 baht per person and best of all we are not stuck in the nasty Bangkok traffic jam if travelling by taxi However a taxi may be a better option if  there are 34 people in a group (you don't save much by train)  you have lots of heavy luggage (there's 10 mins of walking between connecting stations at Makassan)  your hotel is a long walk from the station (taxi provides doorstep service)

title: Best mode of transportation in Bangkok
review: Cheap and cheerful air conditioned skytrain is the best way to get around in Bangkok Just make sure your on the right platform before boarding you could land up going in the wrong direction

title: Just ok

title: A mixed bag but clearly an event that we will remember and have a good laugh
review: This review is for my trips from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and then the return  We were extremely lucky the trip to Chiang Mai was so rough [the word 'bad' is a bit too harsh] and the trip back to Bangkok was much better  Had they happened in reverse this review would be much less complimentary  Train 13 to Chiang Mai We were in the second car in the train and it was a second class sleeper  The picture above showing the parallel bunks with a hallway down the middle is like the one we had  Pro electrical outlet between seats 6 and 9 arrive early if you're sitting in seats 569 or 10 and claim at least one plug to recharge your stuff  Con almost everything else   1 Damn car was right next to the engine  The doors between the cars do not shut so you're listening to the engine all night bring ear plugs just in case  Smoke from the engine routinely infiltrates the car so you enjoy the smell throughout the night  Doors that don't latch tend to bang about as the train lurches throughout the night 2 The folding seats for the lower bunk leaves your lower back without support because it is the joint between the seat and the back of the seat when it is folded down  If you managed to find the video of the bunks being madeup the pad is several inches thicker than the one you will be using 3 The curtain for the top bunk leaves a 2" gap and does NOTHING to reduce or block the garish light from the florescent bulbs stabbing through your eyelids 4 The foodyou should seriously consider bringing some with you  If you don't care about your tastebuds then you should know the food in the dining car is the same stuff they are willing to bring to you but they may be expecting a tip if they bring it to you  Train 14 to Bangkok Pro Clearly a Japanese car [lots of kanji]  These second class cars have the hallway on the rightside of the car while the pair of bunks are in little private rooms on the left  Picture the Hogwart's Express but with bunks as the facing seats  Inside the room you can store your luggage in the loft that is over the hallway  Each room has a sliding door and each car had two WORKING doors at either end  This means up to three closed doors between you and the noisy outside  The curtains close and obscure the exterior light sources but they are not blackout curtains so you should expect that light will infiltrate into your space  This configuration is great for small groups until you decide to go to bed  Cons Food  We decided to bring our own food  Train ride between the cities I love Thailand but my experience with Thai construction is that there is a very wide range of workmanship that is considered "good enough"  The men who built this railway had an EXCEPTIONALLY WIDE range that was "good enough"  When traveling at speed both cars jolted and jumped [not rocked and swayed] as we moved  The old car on train 13 was shot the worn springs and the beatup doors were clear evidence of decades of abuse on the car by the rail  Being 25 hours late to arrive in Chiang Mai did not help the fact that each member of the family only managed 34 hours of broken sleep throughout the night    The Japanese handmedown that we rode to Bangkok handled the railway much better but the odd jerks and jumps still managed to work their way through the newer car's springs  Recommendations  1 request cars that are not near the engine (anything 4 or higher) 2 try to get the Japanese handmedowns 3 bring your own food 4 don't expect to arrive on time

title: Avoid the Traffic
review: I'll start off with the good points for the Airport Rail Link the two biggest positives are that you completely skip all the traffic (which depending on the time of day can be really bad) So this is bar far the quickest option at getting into central Bangkok   There are two types of Airport Rail Link the City Line & Express Line The City Line will stop at each station along the way (7 stops) and will take a little bit longer but is only 45 baht (one way) The Express Line goes straight from Phaya Thai to Suvarnabhumi Airport and is 90 baht (one way) The Express Line takes about 15 mins for a journey The other major difference about the two lines is that the Express Line has racks  spaces for luggage so if you are traveling with a lot of baggage then the Express Line would be more convenient  The frequency of these lines tends to change every few months so the best way to keep up to date on departure times in to download the Airport Rail Link app from App Store  Google Play Store  Getting into and around Bangkok from the Airport Rail Link is rather straight forward Get off at Phaya Thai and the BTS station (SkyTrain) is attached to the last stop of the Airport Rail link  about 5 mins walk If you need to get the MRT (metro) you can either get off at Makkasan (second last stop of Airport Rail Link  will need to take City Line to get off here) and walk to Phetchaburi MRT  although this isn't the most pleasant of walks particularly in BKK heat   There is a second option that's a bit longer to get on the MRT Get off at Phaya Thai and get on the BTS (SkyTrain) and take this to Asoke BTS stop  there is another MRT stop at this interchange station  Sukhumvit MRT stop This will only be convenient if it isn't busy on the SkyTrain (rush hour etc)  Which leads me into my negatives about the Airport Rail Link  it can be busy If you are taking the City Line and its busy and you have a lot of luggage  this isn't going to be a pleasant experience Likewise using the BTS (SkyTrain) to get tofrom the Airport Rail Link is awful when you have baggage and its rush hour

title: Sheer travel pleasure
review: My wife and I flew into Bangkok on 1st January 2019 for a quick break post New Year obviously  We had taken the Airport Rail Link years before and I remembered we were struggling with lumbering luggage This time around both of us only have a cabin baggage each and time to kill  We made our way down to the Rail Link platform at Suvarnabhumi AirportWe were most pleasantly surprised when we were advised by the guards that fares of 35 baht per person were waived in appreciation of supporting the system and being the New Year of course  The platform was comfortably huge with signboards evidently clear in dual language Since we were staying in Sukhumvit area it is best to alight at Makassan Station  There were about 5 carriages and seats were abundantly available We poked ourselves down to enjoy the ride into town We were pleased with our decision made when we saw the roads were slowly but surely clogged up with increasing volume of traffic as we get closer to the city proper  The ride was expectedly smooth and dual language announcements clearly made as we approached each of the station In less than 30 minutes we reached our destination  Makassan Station is a huge multi storey station Maybe because its the New Year but the station was deserted in just a few minutes Naturally we were trying to get hold of a taxi to our hotel and we were quite lost  A query with a station staff pointed us to the direction of Petchaburi MRT station across the road from Makassan Station but linked through a walk way Sukhumvit was straight ahead and a taxi was secured in no time  End of our stay in Bangkok we also took the Airport Link to Suvarnabhumi It was tremendously useful that we were just carting cabin baggages We saw a couple of travelers lumbered with big luggage and can sympathize their predicament   We certainly would recommend travelers to use this system as its cheap convenient and efficient Only if you're with cabin baggage though as even the taxi did not drop us off at the main entrance of the Makassan Station

title: Fastest way to get around Bangkok.  Bar none.
review: The BTS is an aboveground public transit system in the heart of Bangkok  The various lines are well laid out the trains and stations are clean and easy to navigate with one catch    Here's the catch  at each station at the fare machines is a map of the system  The fare prices vary from about 15Baht to about 60Baht  At first we could not figure out how much to pay (keep in mind 60 Baht is less than US$2) then we looked at the map  The map labels the station you are located in  The closest stations are labeled "15"  The next closest are labeled "25" then "28" then "31" and so on  Your fare is based on how many stations you wish to travel  Let's say you want to travel 3 stations here's what you would do  You select your fare by hitting the  "28" button  Next you insert your coins until at least 28 Baht have been registered  Your ticket pops out the bottom along with any change  You then head to your platform (need to know your direction based on the name of the last station in that line)  At the turnstile you insert your ticket  IMPORTANT  your ticket pops up in front of you  you must take your ticket out this will open the turnstile  Once you reach your destination you must enter your ticket at a turnstile to leave the station This time the machine will keep your ticket  Only issue I had was the subway (ie underground) system is not on the same fee system  So when your are going from the BTS to the subway or vice versa you must buy a new ticket
