title: Beat the Bangkok Traffic and Heat.
review: I worked in Bangkok for a couple of years and go back frequently Getting around the city is the same kind of art as most major cities You have to learn to mix and match different kinds of transportation to get exactly were you want to go As in most cities traffic can get unmanageable Bangkok also has some intense heat which needs to be considered The MRT Subway system is a key part of the options available and stays cool year around    To my knowledge there are no plans to build anymore subway tunnels in BKK  because of some of the challenges which were found building the current tunnels Future expansion will be above ground and involve the BTS SkyTrain System Still the interconnectivity of the single MRT line with the two BTS lines works well to get you generally close to where you want to go in most parts of Central Bangkok   The MRT is very clean and runs very efficiently Did I mention it is always cool There are security check points at each station and restrictions on things which can be brought onto the train plan ahead    Modesty needs to be set aside during commute times in the morning and the evening The MRT is heavily used and physical contact on all four sides at the same time is not uncommon Personal hygiene is appreciated by everybody     I can no longer image Bangkok without the MRT Did I mention it is cool year around

title: Great First Time experience
review: Never been on a sky train and gee just loved it Will do it again no matter in what town or city I am it was a great experience

title: Easy to use
review: Very easy to use even though we didn't speak the language Good visuals Just make sure you know the name of your final destination before getting on board

title: Bangkok's MRT is convenient and fast- but sometimes very crowded!
review: If you're in Bangkok and stay in a hotel that is close to the MRT it's a convenient fast way to get to where you want to go (as taxi's have to fight the traffic and Bangkok's traffic is very bad)  But watch out when you take the MRT as peak times are very crowded

title: Ideal
review: The Skytrain takes you to the main shopping centres around Bangkok at a very low cost and helps you avoiding the horrendous traffic  Clean and comfortable

title: Very easy way to get around
review: It's cheap efficient super clean and highly preferred to being stuck in Bangkok's traffic jams Highly recommended

title: Sky Train Bangkok
review: A good cheap way to get around Bangkok or to and from the airport Can be packed at times especially at peak times Trains run about every ten minutes View of Bangkok is good been up in the air Only annoying thing that I found was those damn back packers with they back packs on Knock everyone flying when they turn around

title: Easy to use
review: It was safe and easy to use however it doesn't go into the city and is quite small So it depends where you want to go

title: Easy
review: Place like bangkok this good  Easy to get airport not traffice  Very good system  Use airport Rail Link easy and first

title: Most convenient
review: This rail service connects the city with the airport and I found it the most covenient mode  of transport The signs are easy and one can follow it easily without getting lost The trains are quite modern and very comfortable and spacious with room for your big luggage bags too

title: Older than the others
review: Poor maintenance so it's quite usually out of order during the journey And not  convenience if you carry the big luggage Don't use it during rush hour or you rush timeyou will missed your flight

title: Clean and comfortable
review: Used it today to get from Bangkok bus terminal to the market It was easy to use clean and efficient You may need to stand initially but there will be seats eventually Sir conditioning excellent and done great views

title: Great way to get into city
review: The rail is located at the basement of the airport easily accessed Just to note not to board the train when it arrived immediately as there will be security check  Only thing is the train stations are not located very near any BTS station for transfer to hotels etc nonetheless better way to get into town

title: Really good fun!
review: Really interesting tour with a lot to see and do Sara our guide was very informative and fun to be around  It would have been nice to spend a little more time in the railway market but since this is a half day trips it is to be expected

title: Best way to get around bangkok
review: It's  clean modern and very efficient It's the best way to get around bangkok It's has plenty of air con too Much cheaper than taxi's for westerners it's very cheap and you don't get stuck in bangkok's awful traffic jams

title: Cheap ride from the airport
review: No worries of being overcharged by taxis this is the best way to get into the city with easy access to the other rail system Costing a max B45 (depending on where you want to get off) you get a comfortable safe ride to the city in an aircon rail car

title: Very useful to get around
review: Very cheap and useful to get to most tourist places in Bangkok  easy to use clean and on time  Highly recommended

title: The ONLY way to travel.
review: Very effective and efficient service Try the MRT before you even consider other forms of transportation The rail maps are very easy to follow As a senior I was very impressed with the kindness and politeness of the Thai people I even used to travel on the MRT in busy times and was always offered a seat on a packed train Get a smart card this is similar to the oyster card in London Just swipe in and out of stations very efficient way to travel Highly recommend

title: great to move around
review: cheap and convenient to move around can get almost everywhere with the Skytrain only nuisance is that you need coins and if you don't have some you have to queue up for quite some time

title: MRT
review: Very easy to navigate once you figure out where you want to go and where you currently are Have change or smaller bills ready to purchase the oneway chips The chip is your ticket You select your stop at the ticket machine pay the rate and a chip is dispensed You place the chip on the marker above the entrance gate and it opens and at your final destination you drop the chip in the slot and the gate opens Great to use during high traffic time as you can be stuck in a cab for extended amount of time There will be more people using the MRT but it will still be faster

title: Well organized
review: Really enjoyed this trip Well organized and experienced travel guide Little longer than half a day arrived back in the city center by 3PM

title: Ideal way to get about
review: The Skytrain is developing and expanding throughout the city which is great news It gives tourists a good option to get about for cheap money Whilst it's not as hairraisingexciting as a tuk tuk you know you will be safe with the added bonus of being able to see the city as you travel which you don't get with the underground It's clean efficient & easy to use

title: Kind tour guides but I would never recommend to friends
review: Pros  Very nice tour guide who kept us engaged  Kept to schedule and communicated clearly  Cons  The floating market is NOT what you see in documentaries with fresh produce and vendors serving food The market is entirely designed to sell cheap souvenirs to tourists It is also completely packed with hundreds of tourists so it's far from enjoyable The coconut plantation had several animals locked in cages for tourists to view These animals should not be caged to begin with but even so the cages were too small and lacked basic needs for any animal It was pretty sad and every person on our tour made a comment that it was disturbing to see I would not support these types of plantations going forward If you're an animal lover you should stay away from funding these types of tours  The description says they can pick you up from any hotel in the Bangkok area but they ended up only offering pickup from a cluster of hotels around the meet up point Not a big deal at all if they would refund the price difference (or more clearly state the pickup zone on their description)

title: Fast through the City
review: Much more faster through the city than with a Taxi or something else It's really easy to use and not expensive

title: Best way to move around Bangkok

review: The rail link take you to Phaya Thai station connecting you to BTS which takes you to most areas of BKK city Fast clean and affordable way to travel in BKK   Runs until midnight every 15 min

title: its worth it
review: given bkk traffic and especially at certain times taking the airport link is really worth itits just a ride to Petchaburi station (MRT)and walk 250 mtseasy

title: Air conditioned

title: The easliest way to travel
review: BTS is the easiest way to travel in Bangkok without having to be stuck in the traffic jam Cheap and very convenient public transport

title: Ultra Convenient

title: Go places via the skytrain

title: Easy
review: We stopped in Bangkok enroute from Vietnam to Melbourne and had 4 hours to look around get a meal and return Taking the train made this quite an easy trip 45 Baht 30 minutes no heavy traffic into the centre of town so we could go from there Easy

title: Becomes very important to beat traffic!
review: Bangkok traffic can be bad and this might be a problem if you have to catch a flight take the metro Sometimes it gets a bit crowded as it is also a suburban metro but better than the traffic

title: Easy Bangkok Travel
review: The BTS Skytrain is a fast easy and convienent way to travel in Bangkok  Combine it with the MTR one can cover a large swath of area around Bangkok  Buying a card or pass is the most convienent way to use the systems  It would have been even better if the two systems are integrated to use a common travel card such as the Octopus card in Hong Kong but each requires the purchase of its own card  Information on the cards can be found on their respective websites

title: convenient ride
review: We took a ride back to the airport and was very convenient and cheaper comparing to the taxis Well Good experience for us getting to the airport

title: Cheap, good and efficient
review: This probably the best way to go to the city from the airport it's fast it's cheap and it's efficient

title: Travel BTS and avoid taxi scams
review: If you can avoid the traffic in Bangkok you will see much more and save money Take the BTS MRT and klong boats whenever possible Bangkok traffic is the pitts

title: The best way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok is a vast city and at certain times it gets gridlocked where traffic comes to a standstill We have found the best way to get around is with the BTS Skytrain and MRT Underground  This is a cheap efficient way to get around and with a bit of prior research you can access most of the main parts of the city The trains are clean air conditioned on time and normally packed as this is also a popular way of travel for the locals however we have never felt uncomfortable The MRT is cheaper than the BTS and uses discs rather than cards The network is not as extensive as the BTS and caters more for the residential areas and the Chao Praya River and the ferries There are extensions presently under construction which will add additional links to the BTS and previous areas not serviced There are presently four transit stations where one can access the BTS Stations You can buy either single trip tickets or if you are planning to visit Bangkok often or for more than a week then think about buying one of the more permanent tokens which are valid from a few days to longer periods as and when required this can save time during busy periods and takes the need for small change for the single tokens out of the equation

title: Easy for foriegners
review: Was surprised at how easy it was to figure out the map and get the correct ticket with the right fare Very easy

title: Airport rail link
review: Excellent service from the airport to the city of Bangkok Easy to understand and use Plenty of space for your luggage Very friendly staff Excellent value

title: Efficient and inexpensive transportation
review: Always use the BTS when I visit Bangkok and try to lodge nearby a station The trains are clean and safe The price is good and the aircon is a bonus in steamy Bangkok I have literally planned entire visits to Bangkok using the BTS and connects to the MRT Only downsides  doesn't penetrate the Old City main palace area doesn't run from midnight to 6 Am and depending on the time of day can be jam packed with commuters Of course most locals are Thai friendly and this is a much pleasanter experience than the Tube Metro or NYC subways Easy to understand fare machines and map info in english plus most stations have a ticket booth for change and help Faster than ground transport most of the time

title: Best of transportation
review: I like it  Very fast comfortable and cheap  I use BTS constantlywhen live in Bangkok Strongly recommended to all travelers

title: Better than Taxi
review: Take the airport rail if your destination is near the train stations It’s faster and cheaper than taxis

title: Crowded & expensive
review: Easy to use with ticket machines however trains get very crowded and are quite expensive in terms of local costs

title: Clean and always on time!
review: This is my first time in Bangkok and I am thankful for BTS to get around Bangkok The train is clean and it is not stuffy inside Although it is very packed during peak hours I will just wait for the next train which will arrive in 5  10 minutes and most of the time it will be less crowded Good experience and will definitely get a hotel near BTS on my next trip to Bangkok

title: Really easy to use. Good way to move around "new" bangkok
review: Used to move around Siam and Silom You enjoy great views of Bangkok surroundings The bad thing is that it is pretty far away from the old town  really easy to buy the one time passes and staff there is very helpful

title: Don't even think about a cab
review: Don't even think about a cab This is an efficient way to get to central Bangkok and provides a link to the growing network of metros that are being developed in Bangkok

title: Great way to get around downtown Bangkok
review: Bangkok has numerous subway lines running throughout the city plus a really easy connector from the International Airport to a substation that links easily to downtown Very inexpensive to use (ie cost me 80 baht $3 Cdn vs 500 baht ($20) from downtown to airport) and although a wee bit intimidating on your first try if you're downtown (super busy most of the time anywhere downtown in this huge city) people in Bangkok are super friendly and will assist you to the right platform etc and within a few times you'll be a pro at using this very efficient system

title: Use it
review: This is the cheapest fastest and most comfortable way to get from the airport to the city centre Trains run regularly around every 30 minutes with around 7 stops before arriving in the centre Compared to taxis it is an extremely cheap way to travel and is much faster than using them Taxis are frequently caught up in traffic jams when leaving the toll roads in to the centre Providing your hotel is close to the BTS skytrain you can connect to this system at Phaya Thai and walk or even then take a short taxi ride to your hotel

title: best airport transport
review: About $150USD brings you to city to a metro connection Goes directly into the Airport faster and way cheaper to get to city than by Taxi Cars very clean new all around signsmaps were you are and were you going very user friendly

title: A new real estate requirement - 'must be close to Skytrain'!
review: Fast efficient cool clean and costeffective the BKK BTS Skytrain is a great way to get about Bangkok If you live or stay anywhere near this system lucky you because it is so easy to get around The system is easy to use and very efficient  there is a train in any direction every few minutes The trains are cool and clean the maps are very easy to read and the English  Thai announcement are easy to understand I used to visit the city before the Skytrain and the difference is just fantastic And there are very good connections with the other systems (MTR etc) If I had a complaint I'd wish all the Bangkok rail systems could be covered by a single card system (like the HK Octopus card system)  and I wonder how you'd go getting through those turnstiles with a bag of golf clubs

title: No need for better
review: This is a newer lines which doesn't belong to the BTS network The ticket can be bought also in the machines Full air conditioned and cost is pretty low

title: 12go.asia poor service
review: I booked train tickets with 12goasia from Chiang Mai to Bangkok for an upcoming trip Their website showed 15 first class sleeper tickets were available at the time of booking Only a couple of hours later my bank account had been charged for all four tickets yet 12goasia say there are no tickets available I requested a full refund Just received a message back from them to say the refund will come into my account in 2 to 4 weeks less a charge for their efforts Their email blames banking processes for this processing time When I tried to provide feedback there was no return email provided Won't be using this company again

title: Linked to your hotel, maybe
review: If you arrived at Suvarnabhumi airport (not Don Muaeng air port) & your hotel is near a BTSMRT train station you can board the train at the airport & get to your hotel if you don't have many heavy big luggages   Clean Aircon comfort low cost & no traffic jam View the city from the elevated BTS train  Not all train stations have upwards escalator Not sure about the lift

title: Bangkok to Hua Hin train
review: The train from Bangkok to Hua Hin was mostly good old style train with operable windows good views The new station at Bang Sue is too much like an airport enclosed in AC waiting in line but the food court is good but you can skip if needed since there are food sellers on the train One major caveat on our train at least no bathrooms for 4 hours It left and arrived on time

title: Easy access and fast
review: Hotels Stay near bts  I alway just need to TOP up my card at the station and just tap in to go  A new card need deposit of 100 baht non refundable going to siam paragon  siam discovering and siam square may just alight siam station Terminal 21 is at asok Mbk is at National stadium Chatuchak is at Mo chit

title: GForce
review: Great experience and a must to visit Recommend this highly Try and get there early as it’s absolutely jam packed with people The market folds away as the train comes into the station

title: Considerable
review: not the best option for family travel and you still to connect with metro to be able to get to where you want Carrying 6 suitcases was not ideal for busy public train might work for someone that travel light

title: Worth it
review: For 150 thb for the tourist ticket and you get a seat drink and a certificate Great little experience and beautiful views along the river It’s a a 30 minutes tid but you get to see and experience a lot

title: Best way to get around Bangkok
review: The extension over the past few years has really helped make the sky train even more wonderful than it was in the past I for one am totally impressed with how far I can get to in Bangkok now Certain places that I would have never gone to are now just a short 20 minute train ride away Great job on Bangkok for keeping the train going and keeping it clean throughout too

title: the best way to travel in Bangkok
review: Traffic in Bangkok is horrible and the solution is to get on the BTS Skytrain It takes you across the city in minutes and now hours It connects to the Airport Rail Link and the MRT (underground) Cheap and easy time saver )

title: excellent service
review: So easy to use its much cheaper to go to the airport on this and to get around its a bit like the London under ground

title: Direction City Center!
review: OK I took it only once so I might have been lucky but it is probably the easiest and fastest way to get to the city from the airport Announcements are also in English it is clean not much crowded and it feels safe (which is good if this is your first impact with the city) If you don't have big luggages take it

title: Modern and first class
review: Fantastic service it does get crowded at times but the BTS beats sitting in Bangkok traffic Trains are clean airconditioned safe on time and at a good price  I use the BTS when possible as it’s so reliable Recommend using it

title: Fantastic
review: It depends of your destination and how much luggage you have but it's fast clean reliable You can't ask for more really It saves you time and hassle

title: A Lovely Train Ride
review: Although it was packed with tourists it is a beautiful train ride through the countryside  It demonstrates what hardship the POWs went through when building this railway

title: Convenient and quick
review: Highly recommend for those with little luggage and don’t want the 12 hour drive into the city   Cheap and cheerful

title: Awesome!
review: Clean cheap and on time what  more could you ask for Air conditioned bliss above the chaos of the city= a fantastic way to get around Bangkok

title: Convenient
review: This is a very convenient way to travel in Bangkok  We stayed near the Victory monument stop and the skytrain was very easy to navigate around the city  Nice and airconditioned but very crowded

title: Best to travel
review: Safe for travel price is great very smart to ride clean securities are friendly helpful Save time

title: Long travel times for a 6 hr trip.
review: This trip is very long and should be considered a full day rather than half day tour since the travel time to the destinations can last 2 hrs each way First our guide was wonderful They work very hard and deserve tips and appreciation With that said the overall train experience was fine albeit crowded The floating market was nice but if you’ve seen one you’ve seen them all souvenirs and very touristy The 45min left to eat lunch is rushed and be sure to order food first   Overall a pleasant journey but the travel time of 4 hrs roundtrip makes this excursion a meh at best

title: Fast, easy and cheap!
review: Although the express train to Makkasan is not operating the train goes through there Cheap and quicker alternative to get closer to town

title: Super fast!
review: This type op transportation is just perfect Get in the train (as many trains are available) and be on time in the city within a limited amount of time

title: Amazing for getting to/from JJ on weekends
review: We took this to get to Chatuchak market on a Sunday and it was fast and clean Our uber car had been stuck in traffic the day before just passing within a mile of the market on the highway This was by far a better method of getting there

title: Easy cheap air conditioned
review: Very easy to get around if you are staying close to the line Our teenage kids took off on their own and managed to get around Bangkok on the sky train Note no lifts and no escalators in case you can't walk up multiple flights of stairs

title: Convenient and avoid traffic jam
review: An easy to travel from airport to the city Avoid all Bangkok's famous traffic jams However there are time where there will be a sea of people during peak hours Ends at a BTS station where you can connect to the other parts of the city

title: Worth consideration
review: Caught train number 14 from Chang Mia to Bangkok Family of two adults and 3 children 11 9 & 5 shared a 2nd class 4 berth sleeper Aircon was freezing make sure you have very warm clothes asked for extra blankets they would only give an extra two Asked for extra pillow but no luck one bed one pillow 5year old slept with mum paid half price but was a bit squashy Slept with jackets and pants it did warm up once curtains were closed Toilets stink but expected that We took our own food which I recommend For some reason no alcohol allowed on train 14 Kids enjoyed it worth doing once Flights can be booked in advance for same price

title: Best way to travel to the city.

title: Efficient way to get around Bangkok

title: Very convenient for travellers

title: Sky train
review: Brilliant and cheap way of getting round Bangkok Very easy to use and very reliable  one ticket for each journey 40 baht ( about £1 )

title: Amazing Sara!

title: ,not advisable, sleeper from bangkok to surat thani
review: We took the sleeper from bangkok to surat thaniThe train was old and quite neglected not very cleanThere was a strong smell of polluted air from the trainIt was so noisy that I could not sleepBeds were hard and blankets very thin air condition cold in the beginning and could not   be adjusted the food was expensive and had to be ordered so I'd advice  to buy some local dish in the other second department as we did chicken and rice which was good I have heard from modern better trains but unfortunatly our experience was bad

title: Perfect transportation
review: Super easy to use for getting around in Bangkok to the riwer China town or in generel and its so  cheap transport and fast through town

title: Kevin was amazing
review: Great tour by Kevin who had all the secrets and safety tips for the trip Really fun discovering the rail way market and the floating market was a different experience to just see it with your own eyes Really great tour over all would highly recommend if you ever got curious about what the markets would look like in person then just reading about it  Support the locals

title: Easy way to travel around bangkok

title: drive on time

title: Must do
review: Very cheap to use and gives you a quick great view of the place Don't have to buy the full pass for a week Also make sure you know where you going Google maps will also help with Apple maps will change to Thai and this may make it hard to read

title: Good ride!
review: Took this when I went to Or Tor Kor Market for my durian fix coming back from Krabi  Just like BTS it was clean and a hasslefree ride  Unlike BTS this will require a token which you can get from the token counter Just say your destination and the counter staff will give you the equivalent token of your ride’s cost  Hop on hop off Easypeasy 😉

title: Fabtrain
review: Worked out at about 60p to get to the amazing MBK mall where we could barter and bargain to our hearts content So reliable and quick wish we had this at home

title: Busy but efficient
review: Travelled from downtown to the airport on a Friday night Was very busy but cheap and efficient In less than an hour with much less stress than a taxi I travelled from my meeting in the centre of Bangkok and was at the checkin counter at the airport Yes I did stand most of the way but the AC was working well and there was enough space for my suitcase Will be using it again next time I visit

title: Big help
review: Bangkok has terrible traffic so having the BTS is such a saviour We havent tried using it during peak hours so i have no idea how terrible it would be with too much peopke around What i dont like though is you can only use coins in buying thru the machinesit would have been better if they accept bills so you dont have to go thru the counter Also your buying option is limited only to 4 so if you come in a big group you have to do multiple transaction to get your ticket It so tedious i must say

title: Travelling on bts
review: Very clean and easy to use fantastic way to get around Just buy tokens for your journey at any of the stations  the instructions are in English as well as Thai and the machines show the price of the fare to each destination

title: Crowded, but clean and convenient.
review: As I said in the title Bangkok's BTS is a bit crowded but it's also very convenient cheap and clean The system is very easy to learn and get around with even for a Westerner who doesn't speak Thai

title: Easy ride from the airport
review: Cheaper than taxi links right to metro clean fast lots of room in isles lots of room for luggage Very quiet ride

review: When you land at or try to get to Suvarnabhumi International Airport this is the easiest and cheapest way to get around We payed 40 TBH pp to get to Ratchaprarop station in the middle of Siam That's really cheap

title: Excellent transportation

review: If you are not encumbered with too many suitcases this is a good way to travel tofrom Suvarnabhumi International Airport as it interlinks with the BTS & MRT I live on Sukhumvit Road Bangkok and it takes me less than one hour to travel to the airport via BTS & Airport Rail Link The total cost is about $250 one way versus a Taxi that can go between $610

title: Efficient
review: BTS is fast and efficient It's easy to understand and AIR CONDITIONED  Well worth the 60 Baht price

review: Hey folks I don't want to sound like a grumpy old man but it's just a train  Yes it's on a track 50 feet above the ground but so are ski lifts and we don't get all 'oh you must do the ski lift' when one goes skiing   The only good thing was getting off at the National Sports Centre and wow  they have a 9 hole golf course blended with a lake blended with a race track and more  So yes go get the sky train but the sky walk is way better

title: Railway market
review: Fantastic would of loved to of spent more time here the view from the incoming train is amazing all the locals selling produce on the track

title: First Time Experience
review: Nothing much to say about the train ride to Chiang Mai We traveled through the night so it was convenient that there were beds that folded out on the train The beds weren't super comfortable but I think I have a biased experience because I was dealing with some stomach issues All in all it was fine but I would definitely recommend traveling through the night because the ride can be long if you're doing it by day

title: Clean and prompt
review: The BTS Skytrain is the easiest way to get around Bangkok Just be sure to have coins to buy the tickets

title: Fantastic
review: Fantastic trip got to see the amazing floating market and also the train market along with the salt production fields Easy pick up from our hotel lobby by a very comfortable AC bus Tum tum was the absolute best tour guide providing us with lots of information about Thailand lots of jokes and of course much needed bottles of cold water Tum Tum made sure we were all safe and together as a group she was also on hand to take photographs through out the trip she really did make the day so enjoyable Thanks Tum Tum and thanks also to our driver and to the translator who was also with us all day if needed Recommend this tour 100% it is a must

title: Easy

review: I used BTS almost everyday but the ticket started from 1552 thail Bath It is not cheap comparing to any orther asian contry If there is no traffic and more people Taxi would be the better choice If you are the tourist with more time you can also explore the bus non AC one normally cost less than 10 baht the bus with AC woul be less than 20 Bath You would found no 2 48 and many more along Sukhunvit road

title: Best way to the airport

title: A fast, clean and inexpensive way to get around Bangkok
review: Avoid the traffic chaos and use the BTS to your advantage to get around the city I combined the BTS map with a YouTUbe video on how travel from my hotel to Pantip Plaza fro electronics shopping and it saved me 1 12 hours and many baht in taxi fares It gets crowded during peak hour but if you can plan your trip around that the amazing air conditioning and cheap fares make for a really easy experience and you can see a lot of the city from the train so planning where you'll explore next is easy

title: Why cant we build rail systems in the UK like this.
review: We took the rail link from Bangkok airport to the city centre  20km rail ride for 80pence each amazing value  You could eat your dinner off the floors of this train it is so clean and user friendly no graffiti no chewing gum no filth on the floors just brilliant  Beware though for the shock of Bangkok when you get off the train

title: Must use if traveling round Bangkok
review: The skytrain is a god send in Bangkok and something you must use if visiting different parts of the city  Get to grips with it early in your stay it's incredibly easy to use and will save you hours sat in non moving taxi traffic down below Buy a pre loaded card with say 200 bahts of credit and save having to buy a ticket each trip you make  It's well worth making sure your hotel is within close walking distance to a station as you will come to rely on using the skytrain throughout your stay

title: How else would you get around BKK?
review: BTS is the way to go I have the BTS skytrain map in my phone that I refer to when wanting to figure out where things are Taxis suffer from jams take the skytrain instead

title: Quick way to get from Airport to  City Centre
review: Only use this if hotel etc is within few hundred metres of station drop otherwise it is still cheaper approx 300THB to 500THB MAX to get anywhere in Bangkok from Airport

title: Great family excursion to Floating market and railway market
review: Had an enjoyable experience at the floating market and railway market Our tour guide  Penny was very helpful and friendly She really took the trouble to lookout for my family especially  my elderly mum

title: Quickest & economical way to city center from airport
review: We used the rail link from the airport to the city center and it is the quickest as well as economical way as it is 40 bhat per person compared to taci which 8001000 bhat Moreover taxi takes an hour during rush hour where as it 20 odd mins by train

title: Inefficient and overcrowded. Cheap
review: Always full and crowded since they are too much challenged of maintaining an image of a modern city which Bangkok definitely isn’t than maintaining a fast and reliable airport connection  There are flights leaving at 4 am why can’t they at least maintain 24hr running trains This is nothing more than a gadget a nice deco but not at all useful It’s cheap but you know the saying you get what you pay for…not much

title: Cheap, easy, fast and efficient
review: Arriving in Bangkok for the first time we found this an easy way to get into the city and then change onto the BTS skytrain to get to our hotel N worries about being ripped off by taxis or about getting stuck in the famous Bangkok traffic

title: Holiday
review: Wonderful service on the train  carriages inspected at airport in Bangkok before any passengers get on  better service then Australian trains

title: Very convenient
review: We took the airport rail link to Makkasan 35 baht per person Clean and convenient Most of all you won't have to deal with the traffic

title: Convenience at its best!
review: While visiting bangkok the best alternate option for transport Connects major shopping districts to other parts of Bangkok Takes a moment gettings used to but totally worth it

title: Just great!
review: If Bangkok ever wants to catch up with Kuala Lumpur or one day even Singapore having efficient public transport was needed Skytrain is good efficient fast  but not cheap though at least not for Thai standards But sometimes it can be such a relief to simply buy a ticket and hop on  instead of endless arguments with taxi driver to turn the meter on and take you where YOU want to go (which never is the next gem sale around the corner) So yes Skytrain is a big plus for Bangkok

title: Effective and cheap
review: The best and easiest way to move around Bangkok as it is cheap and well organized and you never have to wait more than 35 minutes for the next train

title: Better than the bus!
review: My teenage son and I took the overnight train from Chiang Mai to Bangkok We booked a 2nd class aircon sleeper a couple days before our trip which was a wise move as we were able to get the bottom bunks right across from each other From reading other travellers' reviews and the guide books the bottom bunks are better because there is less light and the air con is not too cold The train left on time had a smooth trip and managed to get a fair bit of sleep Arrived in Bangkok not long after expected time which was not a problem as it was too early for our guesthouse anyway We got dinner delivered to our seats promptly on time as ordered and the meals were quite good Toilets were okay pretty much what you would expect on any 2nd class train anywhere in the world After some long bus trips my son and I found this a more comfortable way to travel It may be a bit cramped if you are tall but my almost 6 foot tall son fitted in okay My tip would be to book at least 2 days out from when you want to travel to make sure you get what you want When I booked there were 3 trains running at slightly different times and we were able to get our second choice

title: polite staff
review: The staff there were polite and have a pleasant smile They offered  some help when taking it for the first time The ticketing staff too was helpful when confirming the station for us

title: good service
review: great service on time every time  clean and friendly staff   faster and more efficient than a taxi and beats the hustle and bustle  air con is a great relief from heat

title: Cooling
review: Cooling and I didnt experience any delays or breakdowns Not all stations have lifts though So be prepared

title: Great value tour
review: Terrific tour our guide mindy was informative humorous and kept us entertained We were given clear instructions and relevant advice and history etc floating markets were fantastic experience Our driver Handled all the traffic snarls and congestion with aplomb Highly recommend

title: Better way to travel to Bangkok city than in a taxi
review: For people wanting to travel from Bangkok's main airport (BKK  Suvarnabhumi) to the city it is easier and quicker to take the Airport rail link rather than travel by taxi as the level of traffic has become so heavy in the past couple of years that you can end up sitting a taxi for up to 2 hours  For travel between the two airports it is about the same travel times by taxi or by trainbustaxi If you take the Airport train to the city you then need to change to the skytrain to go to Mo Chit and then take a taxi or bus for the 20+ minutes ride from Mo Chit station to Don Mueang airport (DMK)

title: Change Mai to Bangkok overnight train journey
review: What an awful journey As a couple we travelled in 2nd non sleeper non AC We travelled this class due to these being only tickets left on train (booked only 2 days prior would definitely recommend travelling better class and booking further in advance if you have to travel by train) There is a new training however this is only running currently for the 6pm service we travelled by the old train   Overall  Horendously dirty train Toilets gross  squat toilets and guess with moving get train  you can imagine wet floor and stunk of urine There was no water (or soap) to wash hands with Desperately wish had taken hand sanitiser   Train massively dated felt like was getting on something from 1900s   Food service horrendous  take your own   The non sleeper meant we had a reclining chair Not very comfy for a 15 hrs journey and certainly not to get a nights sleep  Be prepared to be tired the next day   Non ACDC basically meant had window down Ridiculously hot for first few hours unbearable then once got dark and lights went on plagued by bugs and insects coming in You get ridiculously dirty also from pieces flying in the window I've never felt so dirty as when got off that train  train was 15hr late in getting in  conductor didnt speak English and no stop announcemeets in English so no idea where we were other than  end of line  there is a gazillion stops this is such a slow train  We regretted not flying as essentially wasted the day we got in as we were super tired a day it was an awful journey

review: The BTS Sky Train has connections to the MRT Underground and the Airport Link  Instructions are in english so it helps tourists to get around  Just check if you have the correct connections and the way that you are going  Buy your weekly or monthly ticket if staying a long time or buy a daily ticket if travelling a lot in one day  During rush hours the ques are very long so get tour ticket beforehand  There are both automated coin machines some take bank notes or else get it from the ticket counter  The service starts at 6 am and ends at 11 or midnight  The ticket counters has guides and maps and they can speak a little english so it's helpful  It's very safe even at night as there are security guards and it's well lit

title: A preferable means of transportation in Bangkok
review: Going around the city is more convenient if you take the BTS Skytrain in Bangkok This is better than taking a taxi or bus With the monstrous traffic jam in the city it will take you a longer time to reach your destination if you commute by taxi or bus  The BTS Skytrain has two lines the Sukhumvit Line which will take you from Bearing Station to Mochit Station and the Silom Line which will take you from the National Stadium Station to Bang Wa Station  The BTS Skytrain connects you to the Airport Link Express Train from Phaya Thai Station to Suvarnabhumi International Airport  The BTS Skytrain also connects you to the MRT (subway) so the railway system brings you to various interesting places within the city  Services start at 6am until 12 midnight

title: Bangkok BTS service
review: Can't beat the BTS train excellent service clean and very cheap and easy to use  Can get to most places in bangkok with ease  Ticket machines are easy to use   just pick the lanuage you need and follow the simple instructions

title: So easy to travel around Bangkok
review: Most main shopping centres and tourist sites are close to a BTS link it's a very easy system to use with a variety of ticket options we got out travel passes with a shopping deal with the Amari hotel chain excellent value for money and issued to us on checking in at the hotel Trains are clean with AC and run like clockwork extremely efficient

title: Bangkok Sky Trains for Disabled
review: I visited Bangkok in December 2017 with 2 disabled people using wheel chairs My 6 year old son and 60 year old aunt At first I was a bit apprehensive to try it but then decided to give it a shot   BST are definitely wheelchair friendly I quickly learned that if you in a wheelchair all you need to do is find a security guard and they are really helpful with their radios and whistles   Every time we use it we got hold a security who escorted us to the nearest elevator if there was no elevator he quickly called a few more officers reversed the escalator direction as required to move the wheelchairs up and down levels We also learned to use adjacent malls elevators to get to the BST level   The BST security also help us get on to the trains And when we disembarked all we had to listen for was the security guards whistle to be escorted to the nearest elevator   I'm glad I used the BST it was so much cheaper and quicker getting around without the hassle of loading and unloading wheelchairs from cars

title: Very good because of the experience...
review: The train was great for the experience  We contemplated first class but went with 2nd class ac  TBH not a lot of difference from what we could see other than 4 people crammed into a small space in 1st class  The toilets and sinks are not particularly appealing regardless of your travel class so dont expect too much hold your nose do what you have to do get out use your anti bac gel and drink your own bottled water  Seats are comfy and wide with decent leg room  Lady came round with drinks and food menu so we ordered  Food was okay not great but decent enough  Lady persauded us to order breakfast also as said the train would be delayed by an hour So we did  My recommendation do not order breakfast  Its expensive for what it is isnt that great and they wake you at 7 to give it to you  So bleary eyed you have to sit up in your bunk and try to hold onto coffee and orange juice while also trying to eat your food  If like me you are also travelling with kids you have to try and manage theirs too  no mean feat They then come round and try to convert the beds back to normal chairs as soon as they can Sleeping on the train was a challenge but then again what do you expect on a train Would highly recommend the bottom bunks they are warmer (AC is fierce up high) and you can block a lot of the light out  They do not turn the lights down or off so the top bunks let all the light in making it difficult to sleep in hindsight would have bought eye masks Overall a great unique experience for the family  Dont expect luxury but its decent enough and one we will talk about again in the future

title: Great value 20 day rail pass including second class sleepers for only THB3000
review: Thailand State Railways may lack true high speed trains but whether travelling on local trains or the numerous expresses that link Bangkok and down as far as Malaysia and Singapore or north northeast to points such as Chiang Mai or Nong Khai it is the best way to see Thialand  Reserved seat and sleeper trains were very popular in January and February 2018 but bookings only open 60 days in advance  I bought an amazing value 20 day Thai all lines rail pass for only THB3000 at Bangkok's main Hua Lamphong railway sttaion (accessible by MRT underground railway and also with one change from the international airport by train)  This pass is not available online and can only be purchased with passport in hand in person at this one location  It includes second class sleepers for no supplement so is terrific value  I gather one can upgrade to first class sleepers by payment of a typical THB500 for an overnight single trip but I did not do this as typically there is only one first class sleeper on a few trains and none on many  The all lines pass requires one to obtain a computer printed ticket (for no charge) on each trip so get these at any booking office even at smaller stations  The ticket will show your seat and car number  \  Normally foreigners buy advance tickets at the 'foreigner booking office' at Hua Lamphong station but this has closed for renovation so I was directed to one of the three closest booking windows  The male clerk spoke reasonable English but made a couple of daydate mistakes so check your reservations before you leave  The second class sleepers are Pullman style longitudinal berths  You can ask for lower or upper lower has a window and does not require use of the ladder  Bring suitcases on board on the 2016introduced Chinese made newest trains store under your berth older sleepers have steel racks into which you place belongings  The berths are comfortable as they come with a cotton blanket always very clean and a non rubber pillow  The train drivers generally drive very smoothly most unusual to have the train jerk  You can bring your own food and non alcoholic drinks on board but since 2014 the sale or consumption of alcohol has been banned (sadly)  The day trains are variable  The 'super expresses' shown in David Bernstein's online terrific Thailand Railway Guide have full aircon in all three railcars other slower trains sometimes have only one or no airconditioned cars    The local trains can have locomotive hauled antique wooden carriages that with the windows open are a pleasure to travel in  When purchasing my all lines ticket sleepers were booked out a few days later from Chiang Mai south but by arriving at the latter at 12 noon on the day of travel the helpful girl clerk (who laughed at my pronunciation) secured me a lower berth as some travel agencies had cancelled unsold sleeping berths  Thai stations are great  The larger ones have cloak rooms with a day's luggage storage varying from THB20 to THB40  The toilets may or may not have toilet paper so BYO  On trains toilet paper is supplied the more modern the train the more likely that it will have a Western style toilet rather than the squatting variety  Train punctuality is pretty good but there is road tollway construction near Bangkok proceeding north so this slows trains  Don't discount wonderful day trips such as Surat Thani to Kantang (past Trang) a convenient fun 11 hour return trip with the Kantang terminus having an aircon restaurant 80 metres from the station  Vendors proliferate on all but the high end trains  They sell snacks and drinks and can be handy even if their continual trudging up and down becomes a bit annoying after three hours  All in all Thai State Railways is the best way to see Thailand  It is also easy to connect to buses and ferries if say visiting Ko Samui or Phuket  For the former I used Lomprayah catamaran (with connecting bus) on the forward journey and Raja Ferries (connecting van) on the return  I enjoyed the latter more and it didn't take any longer for the trip to Surat Thani railway sttaion where the travel agents are 100 metres from the station  Every sleeping car train on which I travelled was booked out in the sleepers so please please (at least from December to April) try to book trips 60 days in advance  This can be done efficiently through the TSR website but not if one buys an all lines ticket as noted above  The day trains with express railcars were also typically booked out but on all trains not everyone travels the full distance sometimes a reserved seat may turn over a second or even third time

title: FABULOUS WAY TO GET AROUND
review: Easy convenient fast compared to catching wheels on the road Great views and you get a good look into the nooks and crannies Get on and off wherever and start exploring Stay within 15 minutes from a station and it will make all the difference

title: It sure beats Taxis!
review: This terrific comfortablecool low cost service operates from downtown Bangkok to the airport [its about 18 miles29 kms long] and it also links up with the "Sky Train"  The trains run every 1012 minutes  It will be expanded [after many years of recent delays]  It operates from about 530 AM until midnight  It has 8 stations and can be at times quite crowded at some stations  There may also be a problem if a traveller is staying in the "old city" as public transportation links do not exists and taxis can be VERY EXPENSIVE (so much so that some travellers feel it is cheaper and easier to take a taxi from the airport  I hope that this Review has been helpful

title: Convenient
review: One of the most suitable and cheapest ways to get to Suvarnabhumi International Airport  especially at peak times

title: On time and Rapid
review: MRT is one of the public transportation in Bangkok you can rely on   Along the way to MRT there are many shops you can stop and shop good food Like it )

title: The fast way to the airport!
review: The train tofrom the airport is excellent Cheap fast frequent  highly recommended It is not an express service at the moment but good enough   Arrive early if you're heading to the airport to make sure you can get on the train which can become crowded at times

title: Great way to get around
review: get a day pass and get around quickly and easily Easy to find your way around The MRT staff are very helpful and the passengers as well

title: Clean and cheap
review: I rode the train all over Bangkok  Its cheap and east to use  I just wish it stayed running later in the night Find out what time you need to get back if you plan to use it late or you risk buying braces for a taxi drivers kid

title: Whizz and you are in town
review: When we first moved to Bangkok Don Muang was the airport and it was a nightmare to get to taxi drivers would ream you out eughthe rail link to Suvharnibumi is excellent cheap and reliable and you end up in the middle of town Bonus

title: Easy to take
review: Directions from airport to hotel were fairly easy to follow as long as you take an overview of a basic rail and road map prior to departing

title: Great way to travel
review: Get a fast pass and go all over the city Fast safe and convenient AC can be a bit too cool Take it to the weekend market at Mo Chit Station

title: Team Tammy
review: Tammy did a wonderful job keeping our group on time and together She provided us background of the Thai culture My cousin and I had a wonderful time visiting the railway market and the floating market

title: Visit to Maeklong Station
review: The place was very unique as it was a market besides the railway and when the train is arriving all activities stopped for a short time  They still selling fresh fishes and meat although some stalls caters to tourists Place is about an hour from BKK and we charter a car to go there (Maeklong Station) If you have not been there it’s a good experience but take note that it is very crowded especially when the train arrives

title: Best time EVER!!!
review: Most recommended From the meeting location to the end of the tour was the best  Amazing experience  Sarah was the best tour guide very helpful and made us feel very comfortable Sarah is very knowledgeable of Thailand

title: Only if you're traveling light
review: I've lived in Bangkok for over 10 years When the state railway announced plans for a rail link from the airport I was thrilled Unfortunately the reality has limitations The Airlink does meet the urban Skytrain But both train systems are crowded most of the day Escalators and lifts are few and far between If you're traveling light and don't mind lugging bags up and down stairs Airlink is a good way to avoid Bangkok's notoriously congested surface traffic  But if you've got a rollaway carry on plus a 26" suitcase you'd probably be wiser to take a taxi and bear with traffic Taxis are comparably inexpensive and the airport manages taxi queues

title: Excellent way to commute in Bangkok
review: If you want to avoid traffic jams and taxi scams use BTS Its very easy there maps in the hotel as well as at the BTS station Try to get hotel near to the BTS station you'll be happy

title: Efficient, clean, organised system
review: Modern clean efficient way to travel great air conditioning Better option than travelling by car stuck in traffic congestion

title: Convenient but...
review: Simply identify the station no for your origin and destination in advance it's easy to access BTS Sky Train  However unexpected there is no senior fare also not all ticket machines accept bank note and we had to queue up to buy our tickets at customer service counter instead

title: A tour you shouldn’t miss!
review: We had an amazing and moving day However if we were basing our review  on just the tour guide it would be a two star review he was adequate but disinterested and unenthusiastic The highlight of the tour was seeing a place of history and a different side of Bangkok then you do in the city The range of transportation made for a interesting experience  We would highly recommend this tour However we left it marginally disappointed We felt it lacked  that extra element of personality and information that a private tour would normally have From his own mouth we were much younger than he was expecting As such he didn’t seem to know what to do with us so he gave up If you want to immerse yourself in this part of Thai history and see more than just the city than this tour is perfect It was poignant heartbreaking and a symbol of resilience

title: Take it to reach centre faster
review: ARL is a good way to reach Phaya Thai on the main BTS line Unfortunately the express airport link has been suspended so you will have to endure 7 stops of the ARL but this is still good time management as you will avoid incoming Bangkok trafic

title: Cheap and Easy
review: We caught the Skytrain from the airport to the Baiyoke Skytower Hotel It only cost 45baht and was much quicker than by road Would definitely recommend it if your hotel is near a station

title: One of the best Metros
review: One of the best metros i have travelled in Yes its busy during peak but you wouldn't feel that its crowded Its well connected from hotels in the centre to all the big shopping malls and shops

title: very convenient

title: Overnight sleeper to Chiang Mai - Train No. 9
review: Very happy and counted myself lucky to be able to get a first class cabin to Chiang Mai on the number 9 train I booked a sleeper compartment for 2 people 3 months in advance at £80 for the room2 seats After initially thinking this was a lot of money spent in our budget I didn't regret it I don't know what the price difference is between 1st and 2nd class but after walking down the train I'm sure its worth it   Very comfortable relaxing journey meals were paid for and brought to us beds were made for us and had access to our own sink and even a shower down the carriage  Be sure to book well in advance as a lot of people we spoke to missed out on getting one Very happy with this as it added to our thailand experience especially when when the sun is coming up looking at all the mountainous scenery outside

title: Simple, convenient and fantastic!
review: There is almost no reason not to use the BTS when you're traveling in Bangkok  The traffic is so intense sometimes a short distance would be better off walking by foot  The BTS is easy to use has clear directions and with english headings  Get yourself a Rabbit card (like the OctopusOyster cards you can find in HongKong and UK) load it with credit and off you go  However one downside is that the Rabbit card cannot be used with MRT (metro line in bangkok)  The BTS line spans across multiple key touristy areas (ie BTS Saphan Taksin to go to AsiaTique BTS Bang Wa for floating market etc) and there are key intersections where you can switch over to the MRT line to go to markets like Chatuchak  Try it out and you definitely won't regret it )

title: Nam Tok to Kanchanaburi really special journey
review: This was my second time taking this train journey but last time we disembarked at a pre arranged station to be collected for the bus trip back to bangkok This time we wisely stayed in Kanchanaburi so we could explore on our terms & time frames So this allowed us to take the train from Nam Tok station the whole journey to Kanchanaburi What a beautiful journey it  was i highly recommend it Of course the Wampoo Viaduct  the crossing of the Bridge over the River Kwai are the standouts & highlights Walking across the rail tracks & exploring the caves near the station is not to be missed But sitting looking out an open window on a beautiful old wooden train clickclacking over bridges past farms open fields & beautiful scenery is something special  The train was rather full & a scramble to get on board from NamTok till the bus trippers exit a couple of stops down the line then its just you locals & school kids Train trips are a beautiful way of getting snippets into everyday people going about their everyday lives We stopped at several beautifully maintained & proudly cared for stations We had to change tracks to allow our train to travel on & another to pass having the big open windows allowed us to view it all  So finally we approach the River Kwai crossing the train slows down & sends out a warning that its about to make the crossing The bridge is always crowded with people walking across & when the train crosses they simply just cram into small landings located on the pylons Its surreal to pass all these beautiful faces smiling & waving at you as the train clickclacks by It was a very exciting crossing & that feeling will stay with me for ever The whole trip was a joy from start to finish i hope i get the opportunity to do it again some day

title: Often  the best way to get to hotel
review: I feel safer on public transportation and Airport Link is fast cheap and connects to MRT and BTS My usual strategy is to use a 26" or so 4wheeled spinner style bag with a second bag (stowed overhead during my flight)  mounted on the trolley handle (so the weight is off my back) This is very manageable on the Airport Rail Link and subsequent transition to BTS MRT and finally sidewalks Although most up & down transits are via escalator and your spinner will fit on the narrow steps occasionally (eg Asoke) its all stairs  unless you are adroit enough to spot the often hidden elevator and get an attendant to unlock it for you The other option is to go beast mode and grabe the handle and walk up (or down) the steps DO NOT Airport Link if you cannot haul your bags in a pinch The handicap friendly amenities we take for granted in the USA  which also benefit luggageburdened travelers  are hard to find overseas  Of course this is Covid so arrival is SHA+ taxi certified required Also I overpacked this time so I guess it's back to a 20 year old or so Corolla taxi to get back to the airport for the trip home

title: Train Travels
review: What a great way to travel if you have the time  We booked a first class cabin for our overnight trip from Bangkok to Chiang Mai Railway staff are very helpful so we had no problem accessing our train and carriage Accommodation is basically bunk style (the back seat folds up to make another bed) Staff come around and place a foam mattress over the seat and then a crisp clean white sheet on the bottom with a clean fresh white blanket  Airconditioning in carriages works great so no need for more blankets  Someone comes around offering food and drink (no alcohol permitted or smoking) You can also place your order for breakfast for the following day  Prices are high (diner car is cheaper) but you are paying for the convenience and hand delivery  Toilets are located at the end of the carriage well kept and reasonably clean  Showers are also available but they are located within the toilet cabin so alittle crampbut if you are desperate for a clean up quite sufficient The clackety clack of the train and the constant sway are quite lulling but the occassional station stop and bright lights tend to intrude on an otherwise peaceful sleep  If youre not in a hurry and would like to travel at a slower pace I would highly recommend the overnight train from Bangkok to Chiang Mai

title: Overnight train to Chiang Mai is a great experience
review: An inexpensive way to get from Bangkok to Chiang Mai without wasting time   Trains leave Bangkok station around 530pm and you arrive into Chiang Mai around 8am the following morning  After a great night's sleep You can catch Bangkok local trains to the outer town station where these trains depart from without a problem   The seating is turned into two large bunk beds which are curtained off  Clean sheets pillow case and blanket are unpacked from plastic bags and the bed is made up for you around 730pm or whenever you request this  Food and drinks can be purchased throughout the journey  But easier and cheaper to take your own if you are concerned about a budget  No point is paying more than the 2nd class sleeper because it is perfectly adequate and comfortable  You can book either the upper bunk or lower bunk  The 2nd class carriages are air con and have large ceiling fans throughout the carriage that can be turned on or off  I found it can get quite cool throughout the journey so take a warm jacket or wrap just in case  Standard toilet as well as squat toilet are in each carriage as well as a couple of basins for washing facehandsteeth  If you take some dried noodles on board you can get hot water for them  You will seriously be ripped off by taxi and tuktuk drivers at Chiang Mai when you emerge the station in the morning  Do not pay any more than 100 baht for your trip as accommodations are pretty central to town  If you are wanting to head up to the hills for temples or anywhere else use the red truck vehicles  Very inexpensive  around 60 baht  Or you can be ripped off by paying a taxi 800 baht to take you on the same trip and then bring you back  Seriously  the red truck system in Chiang Mai is brilliant to take you anywhere  If in doubt check with your hotel front desk for more information    A word of caution  if you are going to Thailand to ride elephants PLEASE THINK AGAIN  I rode an elephant my first trip to Thailand and thought it was great but did wonder about the treatment towards this poor amazing creature  My latest trip to Thailand I spent a number of days staying at the Elephant Nature Park outside of Chiang Mai and found out first hand how CRUEL these practices are and how CRUEL the owners of these riding elephants and their mahouts are  It should be banned but tourists doing this are providing a lot of money to these owners and mahouts  And this cruel practice will continue for as long as there are people willing to pay for this 'pleasure'  At the Elephant Nature Park you get to view videos of the appalling treatment and socalled "training" of these elephants  Once you get to see this video you will never ever want to ride an elephant again and you will be disgusted with the practices of these people  The Elephant Nature Park is purely a rescue park for badly abusedtreated elephants hundreds of dogs and around a hundred cats  You can sign up as a volunteer at this park as well for however long you wish  Around 40 volunteers a week carry out projects care for the elephants dogs cats assist in planting of new trees preparing all the food for the elephants  it goes on and on  People from around the world volunteer and visit this wonderful facility that was set up by an incredible woman Lek  Her her husband Derek and all their amazing staff have a love of all these animals and it shows throughout your stay here  You can do day trips to the park as well  Better still I recommend at least one overnight stay  Accommodation is great and the meals are provided and are substantial  Everything is vegetarian and very healthy  Water is provided 24hrs free of charge  That may sound stupid but most everywhere else you have to pay for your drinking water  If you have a week in Thailand a suggestion would be to have a couple of days in Bangkok take the overnight train to Chiang Mai book at least one night at the Elephant Nature Park (they even have a shuttle that picks you up from Chiang Mai and returns you to Chiang Mai which is included in the price) have a night in Chiang Mai and then take the overnight train back to Bangkok for a day or two of shopping to finish off your trip  If you truly LOVE dogs cats (who are all rescue animals and who wander the park freely) and seriously want to see elephants truly living an incredible life after years of terrible abuse and with disabilities eg blind land mine survivors partially blind brokenunrepairable hipleg who are cared for by lovingdevoted people spend time at the Elephant Nature Park

title: Quite good for 1st timer
review: Near malls easy to read the map but the coin machine for one time usage is hardly recieve any one thb coins

title: It could not be easier.
review: The rail link takes one into the heart of Bangkok to great hotels shopping and attractions It also hooks up to the BTS which will take you all over the city

title: BTS
review: Beat the heat and traffic by taking the BKK Skytrain Make sure you buy the rabbit card for extra discounts on your trips

title: The Only Way To Fly
review: If you are going to Suvarnabhumi Airport or leaving don't mess with the taxis Take the city line From the airport to Makasan is 45Baht and you hook up with the subway there The train is air conditioned and mostly quiet If is fairly easy to get a seat if you board at the point of depature Returning to the airport I always go to Phaya Thai to ensure to get a seat It is a lot easier and takes less time than by taxi The only way to go

title: Best way to get to central Bangkok
review: Only 30 minutes (against 15 to 2 hours at times by taxi) and only 45 Bhat to get to the end of the line makes this a great choice to get to your hotel by taking  taxi the final part of the way

title: Reliably fast transport to and from Suvarnabhumi Airport
review: Beats the traffic jams when traveling to and from the airport Fairly cheap but often overcrowded because it is also used by locals who don't go to the airport A good alternative to taxi service where drivers refuse to turn on taxi meters Instead of 600 Baht to the airport I paid 150 Baht to the Airport Rail Link station plus 40 Baht train fare

title: time saving transport to the airport
review: Its an excellent way to travel to the airport Bangkok traffic is really crazy but this train makes you reach airport within 25 minutesReally practical

title: Best mode of transport to avoid the traffic.
review: Best way to get to Airport punctually no need to worry about the traffic Cheap and reliable Only 45 baht if you are traveling from Phaya Thai station

title: Too Crowded
review: Too crowded compared to MRT Also the train doesn't go to a lot of places Should take taxi or MRT instead

title: Meh at Best
review: We did this half day tour and it was OK at best They could've skipped the Train Market all together and it would be OK We didn't really have time to walk around as you're on a tight schedule Furthermore there isn't much to see at the Train Market Very so so The floating market saved this review from being a 1 however be warned this is for tourists only This is not something locals would do That said it's still pretty cool to be on a boat to check out the market The drive back is terrible and takes 23 hours because of the traffic I think it's ok to do this once but not something I'd highly recommend

title: Efficient way to get around Bangkok
review: Been to Bangkok multiple times and stayed in various parts of the city  Purchase a day pass or longer if needed to get around the city conveniently  From the famous weekend market to the river to numerous incredible shopping locations along sukumvit its a great way to get around and faster than taxis in the terrible traffic

title: Excellent reasonably priced way to get around Bangkok
review: If you ride during commuter hours during the week it's a bit crowded but the trains run every couple of minutes  Trains run about 20 hours per day with trains every couple of minutes during peak times to about 10 min apart during off peak hours   Modern air conditioned trains and all signs and announcements are in Thai and English This was my second trip and I bought a multi ride pass which you can buy at every BTS station and credit cards are accepted  Single rides can be purchased from automated tellers    Best way for business or pleasure to get around

title: Stay Close
review: real easy and reliable service Easy access and a great way to move across the hustle and bustle of Bangkok

title: If you can find the station, the hard part is over
review: I decided not to take the taxi to the airport and tried my luck with the skytrain Bad news I almost missed my flight Good news I didn't but ran like a crazy person in the airport also begged my way to jump the customs line All because I got lost looking for the station But once you got on the train it's pretty easy to understand the map and the trip Next time I'll allow myself more time  before my flight

title: Super Convenient
review: The Skytrain affords visitors a safe and cleancheap and friendly way to negotiate a big cityThe ticket taker at the window where yoo pay your fare will answer all your questions

title: Cheap airport travel
review: If your hotel is near a BTS or MTR station this is a good cheap alternative to taking a taxi from the airport about an hours trip to sukhimvit with transfer

title: best way to travel to airport
review: it saves a lot of time to travel to the airport in Bangkok however if you have a lot of luggage then it may not be practical

title: Fast clean easy to use and quite cheap.
review: As stated above clean and easy to use throughout city Best of all they are air conditioned so some relief from heat for 5 minutes Quickest way to travel around capital

title: Very convenient
review: This is very clean fast convenient and affordable It runs from since in the morning until midnight and we enjoyed it

title: A must do
review: What an amazing experience It's been a highlight of my Asia trip till now Highly recommend if you would like to learn about life outside of Bangkok The car service and guide were great as well

title: Economic way to get around.
review: It was our first time in Bangkok The BTS was a great way for us to get around Bangkok But make sure to get a map where the train stopsWe never wait for more than 5 mins We did connect with MRT(subway) to be able to go to more placesIt’s economical

title: Satisfied customer
review: Works dell has good signs Cons effective aircondition (sometimes cold) moving with heavy luggage hard because of stairs Still really happy

title: Efficient and speedy
review: Whitmore can I say Bit of a faff with the whole queuing to get change then to get tickets bit it's speedy and zips through that never ending Bangkok traffic

title: Moving with ease astound Bangkok
review: This is by far the best and easiest way to get from place to placeAlthough often very crowded instructions on where to alight are clear and easily understood At peak traffic times it is quick and taxis take an eternity to get from place to place My advice go by BTW

title: Easy to navigate, staff speak reasonable English
review: It's so easy to use as long as you know where you are going You can use a ticket vending machine or a Kiosk with English speaking staff No eating or drinking on the MRT

title: Excellent, I was sceptical at first but after using it, it beats a taxi or limo.
review: So easy to get to and from the airport All signs are visible so you can't get lost I travelled from there from the Sky Train Ticket  kiosk are in Thai as well as English So cheap around about $1 USD

title: Crowdy
review: Its fast and cheap way to get to main places But its very very crowdy and not directly as tuk tuk of course )

title: Skytrain awesome transport
review: Staying at Silom the skytrain can't be beaten Cheap air conditioned transport to anywhere in the city Connects to MRT and BRT which are other train lines BTS SKYTRAIN is very modern and comfortable reprieve from bangkoks heat  Can be certain busy at peak when people going to and from work but just do as the Thai people do and squash right in  stops are close to each other do uncomfortable travel does not last long Try to keep coins to use in the ticket machines  trip from Silom to city only 34 baht Most trips less than 60bHt which is about 2 Aussie dollars but most trips around 30 baht

title: the best way to move around Bangkok
review: this is the cheapest and fastest way to get around in Bangkok If you combine taxi boats and the sky train you can cover almost all the attractions for minimal cost and a great experience

title: Very modern
review: It's Bangkok's saviour in terms of getting around as traffic is so bad Really modern with air con and very clear indications Also cheaper than taxis and tuk tuks

title: Quick and easy to use
review: Our first time in Bangkok and use of the BTS Was very straight forward to use with English speaking staff in ticket offices and English language signs on the ticket machines An easy and fun way to travel around Bangkok

title: Cheap was to get to the airport
review: About the cheapest way to get to the airport It can get a little crowed during rush hours though You can get to it very easy from the Metro line

title: The BTS Skytrain is better than being in traffic but very crowded at times
review: The BTS skytrain is not bad to move around Bangkok especially if you have some distance to cover The skytrain is sometimes very crowded with locals and tourist It is inexpensive but not the cleanest trains in the world

title: Very convenient and pocket friendly
review: I used the Sky Train almost every day in Bangkok  it's just the best way to beat the traffic and very convenient to move around different locations The trains are clean and well maintained A must use in Bangkok to move around the place   Jabir

title: Great way to travel around the city
review: The BTS system is a very affordable transportation option in the city It is very clean is almost always punctual and you don't have to deal with taxituk tuk drivers trying to scam you

title: Easy to go every where
review: I am enjoy to took BTS all the time I stay BKK Very convenience and easy Not so expensive transportation that I met in other country

title: safe and quick travel
review: Very convenient to get everywhere and hassle free not like the tuk tuk who make 'shopping' stops

title: Easy and Fast way to get around
review: The BTS Skytrain is an easy and fast way to get around most of Bangkok  For an easier experience instead of using the ticketing machine you can go up to the counter to buy from the counter staff  However only cash is accepted  Credit card is not

title: Very good solution for getting around.
review: Very good solution for getting around however there are only two lines and very crowded So if your destination has sky train station near by it it much better using it than any other transportation

title: The best way of transport in Bangkok
review: The Skytrain is covering most of the Bangkok areas and there is one station connected to the airport train

title: chill and clean
review: This is fast and cheap way to move around center of Bangkok Also to avoid heavy traffic during peak hours

title: Take the train!
review: Great way to get into the city particularly in peak hour when you can sit in traffic for hours without moving

title: Clean but expensive and confusing
review: It was confusing to use  You need to choose your destination on the map and the number within that destination corresponds to the price of the ticket you need  You must buy this ticket at the kiosk but this kiosk only accepts coins  So you then need to wait in a line to get change from an attendant  Don't know why the kiosk does not accept bills nor why they don't have change machines  Cost of two tickets was about the same as a taxi so would have taken that instead  On the other hand the trains are very clean and well air conditioned

title: Awesome connectivity
review: We stayed in Sukhumvit area and availed BTS for a city trip  The connectivity is awesome  and I suggest you to avail BTS to avoid the pathetic Bangkok prime time traffice

title: Cheap, clean and efficient
review: Such an easy and cost effective way of getting around Bangkok  The system is pretty easy to navigate and your ticket cost is based on the number of stops you need to go to get to your destination  5 stops cost us 33 baht each as a guide  Trains are airconditioned and there are announcements letting you know which station you’re about to arrive at both spoken and on the monitors onboard

title: Easy transportation
review: This is an excellent form of inexpensive transportation We took it from the old district to the airport and we were very pleased with the service efficiency and cleanliness

title: Convenient means of transportation around Bangkok
review: Travelling in the train is way safer and very convenient It saves you from the hassle you will have with taxi drivers whose prices are not the same as what is displayed on the meter

title: Train market is marvelous but the floating market is a tourist trap.
review: Train market great and very authentic Floating Market is just tourist trap Tom the guide was brilliant Trip very well organised

title: The only way to get through this city
