review: Get thyself to the sky train if you have to get across town or to the JJ Market  It is easy to navigate clean on time and faster than a taxi or tuk tuk

title: Easy to use and cheap way to get around Bangkok
review: The streets around our hotel on Sukhumvit Road were very conjested with traffic so taxis were not a great option The Skytrain was frequent and quick

title: Cheap and quick
review: Very handy for getting you into town from the airport and if your hotel is near a skytrain or metro stop it'll save you loads compared with a taxi

title: Nice view on the train.
review: Very convenience to go around downtown to avoid bad traffic daytime It is a good choice cheap and safe for us

title: Clean, Fast and Cheap.
review: The SkyTrain is a welcome refuge from the heat along with being clean fast and cheap with tickets easily accessible The ideal way to get around Bangkok

title: cra car how packed this was
review: It took us a second to figure out why the ticket purchase kiosks had a very long line to the left and a short line to the right  I thought maybe the right line was for Skytrain card holders only because they all looked like locals using it  However it was simply credit cards to the left and cashtokens to the right  There was nothing there to explain that in English and all the tourists went left and waited  After getting our tickets we found our train by only because I already had a map because very few employees spoke English and were therefore unable answer questions about how I needed to get to my destination  My cell phone wouldn't pull up Google Maps and I don't know what I would have done without an old school paper guide  It was SO packed on the train way more than anything NYC has ever seen

title: Convenient
review: We took the train twice going to and from the night market It was clean spacious and fast The only downside though is they had a few ticket windows and few ticket machines Do add more ticket machines or ticket windows for efficiency

title: Easy way out
review: Airport rail link is safecomfortable & easy way to reach from airport to the heart of city up to Asok

title: Fast and cold
review: Love that the train is always very cooling in Bangkok sweltering heat The most viable transportation since Bangkok's traffic aint exactly the best

title: Excellent Service
review: Love the speed it gets you into town (as long as your destination is close by a station which mine is) Shame it get's so busy from the 2nd and 3rd stations into town

title: Convenient transportation
review: Tried train many times and very convenient way of transportation I tried Suvanabu airport to central BKK and found very Ok

title: Perfect transportation!
review: Using the rail link takes you fast and efficient to or from the airport for a very low cost This is the way to get into central Bangkok if you arrive at Suvarnabhumi Direct connection to the BTS at Phaya Thai station Ticket is 45b

title: careful now with the Covid pandemic
review: now with the Covid pandemic best to avoid public transit  Taking alternatives eg a taxi or Grab is basically the same price (if 2 travelling)

title: Convenient Clean Frequent
review: Easy to use and many trains Aircon and clean Friendly ticket staff and others will help you get started Recommend get BTS and walk or then Taxi Avoid tuk tuks  scammers

title: Lovely ariel views of Bangkok
review: What a great way to travel across the city in an airconditioned train Cheap and cheerful we used it to get to Wat Pho from Sukhavit Beats the traffic in BK

title: Good experience and the train market is ok. However the location of both markets is far from Bangkok
review: Good experience although the floating market is overrated and  not as expected everything else was ok The train experience is great Location is far from Bangkok

title: Potentially a good service
review: In the future when the airport rail link is completed it will be an awesome service but currently I have found it to be a bit of a mission when you have relatively heavy luggage on your homeward bound journey We have used the service twice and upon arrival both times thought it to be very convenient to our hotel (Mercure Siam) although this also meant a couple of station changes for the correct line Carriages were full but not jammed in like sardines However when changing stations things did get a little funky not too out of control but we were still travelling pretty light at this time that is why I say arrival is a good service Departure the first time we used this service was Ok we seemed to be ahead of the crowd and the carriages were relatively spacious and stations seemed less chaotic however last time and it will be the last time for  awhile it was a struggle with our 2 heavy suitcases plus each with a small but full back pack The carriages were packed and the stations were crowded it made moving through people with our luggage very difficult and a nightmare to handle in the crowed On the plus side though if you are travelling light and at times that don't conflict with work hours then it is the best option so you don't miss your flight by being stuck in Bangkok traffic

title: not bad!
review: Travelled twice during my 1 week stay in Bkk I didn't have a card (I had RABBIT card for BTS) so it was less convenient But you can stand in queue and get tokens from the ticket counter Very clean and service is excellent

title: Easy to use
review: Have used subways and train systems all over Europe and North America  Watched a quick utube on how the fare system worked (trip priced by length of ride well payed out at every ticket machine you enter price and get printed ticket) BTS cars airconditioned and easy to use

title: It is a train for goodness sake!
review: I wouldn't call this an attraction It is a commuter train for goodness sake You don't go on the sky train because it is an attraction you take the train because it is an economical way and sometimes the fastest way to go from point A to point B Basta

title: Very eficient
review: A well built and vital travel option in one of the most hectic and crazy cities in the world Exceptionally well priced and comfortable as well as easy to navigate Also offers a unique view of many areas of the city  Bring a jumper

title: Comfortable and Convenient
review: Good way of getting around the city  This is a skytrain and different from the Metro (MRT) There are only 2 lines and these do not cover the whole city However it is easy to use and comfortable  Tickets are expensive though and they should have ticket vending machines that accept notes

title: good way to travel
review: not very cheap either but very accesible to all the main places like shopping eating etc worth using it than the cabs

title: Best choice and affordable price!
review: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel Good sized clean room and comfy bed Only a few minutes away from ChongNonSi BTS station One thing that I don't like "The breakfast buffet doesn't offer a wide selection of dishes" Overall value for money Best choice and affordable price I'll come back and stay at this hotel again

title: Very easy to use
review: We got around Bangkok in BRT  it's very cheap and very easy to use  It can get very crowded at certain stations  The walkways at lots of BTS stations lead to malls  Also train from airports final station phaya thai BTS

title: Easy acces.
review: Saves you a great amount of time instead of taxidrives Cheap as well Also fun to see how the thaipeople respect each other when standing in line when the train comes in

title: Excellent - fast and efficient!
review: On a recent trip to Myanmar (Burma) my wife and I stopped in Bangkok and stayed there for two days As this was over the weekend we decided to go to Chatuchak  incredibly big and really interesting flea market which is highly recommended But the best was how fast one can get from there to the central parts of Bangkok  Siam Square for example  or the other way round The train is fast clean and fantastic The price of the ticket is very acceptable Bht 42 Go and see

title: Best used when traffic is bad
review: The Airport link is good not great  The pros are that its clean comfortable and fairly quick and inexpensive  The cons are its not as well connected as some would like and it is not 247  Currently it only runs from the main airport  The Don Muang link will be another year or two (or 3)  There are a couple main interconnects to the central BKK metro system  You can transfer to the BTS (above ground light rail) and MRT (underground system)  If you travel light it's great  If you're staying somewhere near a station close to the MRT or BTS it's also handy  With no traffic I can get to the airport from CBD in 30 minutes  When traffic is bad 2 hours is not uncommon  At those times I'll hop the rail link to avoid the frustration of sitting in traffic

title: Easy to use
review: Clean easy to usenavigate and cheap If you're tired of sitting in traffic then hop on the sky train We took it from our hotel in erawan to the river and it was so much faster than taking a taxi or tuk tuk

title: Best mode of transport
review: No need to haggle about taxameters great aircon cheap  Nice to get off the street for a while Stops at great locations throughout the center of the city

title: How to move in Bangkok
review: Bangkok traffic is back to its 80's chaos so taxis (although incredibly cheap) are a bad option in peak times The Skytrain is an inexpensive fun and quick way to move about It will take you almost everywhere you want to go in the city

title: just a train
review: Very good and easy to use (English option in ticket vending machines)  Good way to move around Sukhumvit Rd and other main areas (including connecting to boatbus)

title: Great Service
review: The Sky Train from the airport to the centre of Bangkok is a great service I always take it if I don't have too much luggage The stations on the line are all near the popular Hotels

title: Convenient to access most places but Train Interval is too long !
review: It is a good Link from Suvarnabhumi Airport to down town but the train interval is too long with only 3 compartments which is quite crowdy during the busy Office duration

title: Excellent tour
review: Very well organised trip Both the railway market and floating market were fascinating Tammy was an excellent guide  interesting fun and responsible Very good value tour

title: A lovely ride through the Thai countryside on a historically significant railway
review: Having read the history of the railway construction during WW2 riding the train was a must do when we were in Kanchanaburi The train provides A lovely ride through the Thai countryside on a historically significant railway There is a special car that costs B300 per ticket that provides a snack box tean & coffee cold drinks and a very nicely done certificate that is provided to all ticket holders This train is a credit to the Thai State Railways and can be taken all the way from Bangkok

title: Much better than taxi
review: Easy to access via BTS and relatively cheap Better than taking a taxi What more can I say with at least fifty characters

title: Avoid the Bangkok traffic - take the BTS!
review: Easy to use and pleasant trains Tickets can be purchased at the station or some hotels also give complimentary day passes For the day passes  you need to activate them at the BTS counters before you use them Totally recommended instead of braving Bangkok traffic

title: The easiest way to get around the city
review: This is one of the more straightforward public transports I've ever been on If you're here for multiple days buy a card with "trips" on it If you are just arriving in BKK to live here buy a rabbit card and load it up

title: smooth
review: very good service connects to mtro and bts A good option if you dont want to get into maddening traffic and your hotel is close to the MetroBTS stations

title: Use rail link instead of taxi
review: It you are not carrying a lot of luggage I find it best to use the airport link to beat traffic and tolls Even if you take it to a station close to your destination it will save time and money

title: Just awesome
review: Easily the best way to get around Bangkok if you don't mind some stairs and a bit of a walk now and then  A daily ticket is 140baht and there are few places you can't commute to in Bangkok  The trains were frequent clean and very easy to navigate  Highly recommend though for those with mobility issues it might be a little challenging at some stations

title: On the go in Bangkok
review: Very cheap and fast mode of transportation around Air conditioned too A good way to explore the city

title: Train and Floating Market
review: My wife and I had an amazing time visiting these places Sara our tour guide was very informative of the good places and fair prices to buy She's very friendly funny and helpful We would recommend Sara because of her bubbly personality

title: Convenient and Cheap
review: Took the Airport Rail Link on arrival to Bangkok Payed a little over 1USD for oneway transfer to the end of the Rail Train ride was smooth Luggages weren't an issue as the train is spacious and was not crowded We arrived in Bangkok on a Friday evening right around sunset Be advised the Phaya Thai Express is no longer available Also what out for the lady at the Information Booth in the Airport before entering the Station She has an attitude problem

title: Cheap fees and convenient
review: The price is cheap if compare with Malaysia Can by the token within airport and convenient to link to BTS from the airport but takes time and a lot of passenger during the off work time

title: Great and efficient
review: Most reliable and efficient transport along Sukhumvit in Bangkok Whereas taxis are always stuck in traffic jam it's very reliable to be on time taking the BTS

title: crowded but convenient
review: This is a slow moving crowded but most convenient way to reach important places in bangkok The line passes over cities important landmarks and connects chao phrya from saphan taksin to siam mall in middle and airport link at phaya thai

title: Excellent and clean
review: Clean fast and reliable They come every 510 minutes are often crowded but the air conditionning is working very well

title: Excellent Transportation
review: Don't hesitate to use the sky train  very safe and efficient mode of transportation  pricing is affordable

title: Convenient and fast
review: Its nice and convenient specially if you want to get away from the long traffic its really fast and sometimes its crowded but its good the view looks good from the window and has good price to offer

title: The most effective and efficient way to travel Bangkok
review: The BTS as it's called is a good way to travel around this large and traffic congested city It also links with MRT which is an underground train system

title: Must use!
review: With the busy traffic in Bangkok BTS is highly recommended as the main transport It connects to places in the city Easy access and cheap

title: Clean and Convenient
review: Clean and convenient Usually i would just take a taxi around but on this trip i felt that the traffic around Bangkok was worst than my previous trips and therefore i relied more on the BTS on this trip

title: If your confident to use it then it's a great mode of transport
review: If you know your way around and confident of using it then this is a great cheap way of getting around BKK  just remember this is not for tourists only this is general transport for native residents of BKK who are involved in everyday living  so don't expect any airs and graces  don't get me wrong Thais are never rude but this is their world you need to fit in here not the other way around

title: Convinient
review: The skytrain provides excelente access to almost all tourist attractions in Bangkok It is simple to ride get a map and locate your interests locations Pay your rides at the automatic ticket dispenser and go The train is clean and people ride it in a very orderly way Don’t miss the opportunity of saving and moving fast in a city that has a complex  and huge traffic problem at all times

title: Excellent transportation... On the Go!
review: Best way to travel in Bangkok if you want free and easy It's an Airconditional train Locate and stay at hotels nearby to the stations The straight line stations cover many popular places where you need not walk much and easy to find The few stations I like and happening is Asok Nana Chlom Phit and Siam Station  Reasonable fees for travel THB 42 per person or lower Depends on distance  Try it and it's real convenient

title: Aug-17
review: Very cheap and quick access tofrom airport and Bangkok Taxi took an hour to get to hotel because of heavy traffic but train took 20 minutes and only 100 baht Not very busy but onward taxi ride from  station may be necessary to get to hotel

title: AWESOME TOUR GUIDE!!!!
review: The highlight of the tour is Kiwi our tour guide She is funny with so much energy and proactive The trip was just enough time to experience and explore both the railway and floating market I'd say the railway is more interesting I think bcoz the floating market is still not back to its normal busy days Few restaurants to eat at Our driver Apple even tho cannot speak English is also very nice

title: The way to travel downtown
review: We stayed at a hotel close by a TBS station Great way to travel through the city Efficient and comfortable because of the airco Better than any other kind of transportation during rush hours

title: Beat the traffic
review: If you are traveling light then this is your best connection to and from Bangkok downtown Transfer with MRT at Makkasan

title: Fast & Cheap
review: The Airport Rail Link from the International Airport to Downtown Bangkok City (It's link to the BTS System)  cost us around 45 baht which is really cheap The ride itself took us around 30 mins which was pretty fast as compared taking a taxi from the airport which could take up to an hour   This is definitely recommended for tourist who prefer a quick and cheap alternative to the City Centre

title: Visit to railway market and floating market
review: It was a very good experience We had an excellent tour guide (Tom) from Big Country Vacation who had a good sense of humour We transited from activity to activity seamlessly Would recommend the tour to my friends

title: Convenient way to get to airport
review: very convenient way to get from the main international airport into the city FYI the airport rail link ticket is separate from the BTS train ticket

title: Nice trip
review: It is a good way to see something different The tour was well organised and we got to the rail station before anybody else with was great   Our kids are a bit too young to walk on the rail market (8&11) but it gave them a view of what it was The floating market has become over touristy compare to what it was 15years ago and is saturated with exhaust fumes   Please don’t take picture with the animals there it supports illegal trade and

title: Comfortable public transportation
review: Depends on your destination the skytrain is an enjoyable ride amongst 6 others  subway bus taxi tuk tuk motorcycle and river boat  crossing the commercial area of Bangkok

title: Great
review: No better way to travel in this congested city Nice clean and safe this will get you around faster than any other local mode of transport

title: fantastic
review: if you pick a hotel close to transit routes simply only way to get to and from airports as long as you do not get in or out too late

title: Perfect underground transport.
review: Easy and cheap way to get around in Bangkok correspond with the BTS Skytrain too at some stations Recommended for everybody who wants to avoid the constant traffic jams in downtown Bangkkok

title: Very reliable
review: I use this often  the air conditioning is a nice break from the heat  Stops every kilometer at most important areas

title: Great alternative to Bangkok traffic!
review: Hop on the AIRCONDITIONED Skytrain and speed off This train is very easy to navigate and incredibly cheap You'll sit in traffic for 20 minutes to go 2 miles down the road in a taxi at all hours so taking the Skytrain is a perfect alternative

title: Very easy
review: If you want to discover Thailand on an easy and cheap way skytrain is the best You dont have to wait long  every 5 minutes there's a train coming

title: Great way to get around
review: Excellent way to see the city very easy to use just take some time to look at the maps beforehand also use it in conjunction with the metro to get around It can get quite full and buying a ticket from the machines can initially daunting but don't worry just do it Alternatively a better way is to buy an unlimited stop day ticket from the ticket office Baht 140 (Euro 400) The trains are spotless as are the stations no graffiti

title: Very easy and inexpensive way to get around
review: Doesn't take much to get to and use the BTS system  Understandable intuitive and friendly people  Really enjoyed using this service to get to the water taxi area  I thought it would be intimidating but it was much easier than you would think

title: best travel
review: great used many many times once you get into the swing over commuting on skytrain its very easy to go most places with ease and aircon

title: Best way to travel in this busy city.
review: Bangkok is a busy city with heavy traffic all day long It seem to me that BTS is the best and the most effective transport in the city But you cannot access every part of the city with the BTS as there are only two BTS line in the city But if covers many important tourist destinations basically all the major shopping centres like MBK Robinson Watson Terminal 21 Time Square Siam Paragon Siam Central Central Chidlom and some hotels like Sheraton Ambassador Westin

title: Perfect
review: Love it I hope we soon can go with airtrain to Pattaya and Hua Hin The connection to airport is the best change in Bangkok

title: Very convenient
review: Easy to use and very convenient way of exiting the airport into the city In the airport it is easy to locate the entry point of ARL thanks to the clear signages The fare is also reasonable

title: Clean, affordable, convenient public transport across Bangkok
review: Tickets range from 21 to 51 THB about $075 to $150  Ticket machine only accepts coins but you can get change at the service desk  Not too crowded easy to navigate  Good value

title: easy access to many attractions around the city away from the skytrain route
review: very frequent trains run in a network system serving many parts of the city chatuchak market lumpini park amongst many other destinations

title: Good way to go to the airport
review: I've used this service since it opened and it is very good clean and cheap However from 58pm from Makkasan station it is so crowded often have to wait for two trains

title: Easy Fast Safe
review: The best way to commute and beat the road traffic Its fun and fast You can cover huge distances way faster  It can get a bit crowded during rush hour but its still the best bet You can either buy a day ticket or get a pass depending on your plans and convenience its a very good option

title: Good Train System
review: If you plan to use the BTS while staying in Bangkok I would suggest getting a BTS card and putting a couple of hundred Bhat on it  You can purchase these at any BTS station  This way you don't have to purchase individual tickets each time   The only downside to the BTS is that it can get very crowded

title: Fast and Cheap
review: If you are traveling solo or as a couple this is the best way to get to the city from airport Not only that this is cheapest method to travel to the Bangkok city from Swarnabumi Airport It cost me only 45 THB last time I came to Phaya Thai  If you are coming 1st time to Thailand I recommend to use this because cab drivers can rip you off  End of the Red line you can connect to the BTS trains and that will take you to most of the places in Bangkok city (check for my BTS review)

title: On time and Cheap and Safe
review: use Airport link to down town Bangkok it take about 45 Min for about 40  60 Baht per Pax it will arrived on Time and if you take Taxi  if you Luck will take you about 300  400 Baht by metre if you met a bad drive will cost you 2000 Baht or more

title: Efficient
review: A quicker and cheaper way to arrive downtown than a taxi Efficient clean inexpensive Exactly what would be needed in each large airport

title: Great cheap fast
review: With Bangkok traffic being awful this is a great way to get around he city  It’s fast cheap and clean It’s above ground so just walk up the stairway where you see the sky train logo

title: You can't take pictures, so it's best to just think of it as an experience.
review: It was good that they spoke Japanese When I selected the 800 hotel they would come to pick me up even if it wasn't on the list I filled in the hotel name and address when I signed the contract but I was worried because I didn't receive a reply email I waited in the lobby from 730 but they came at about 815 The email said to wait from 700 so I waited too long but they came despite being a small hotel so I was relieved There were so many tourists on the train that I was doing my best to ensure my safety and neglected to take pictures It would be better to think of it as an experiential tour I took pictures of the train's arrival and departure but it was impossible (tears) The floating market was a crowded boat but the mainlanders must have had money because they were not afraid to make waves and crash into enginepowered boats If you want a more elegant ride you'd be better off going to Venice Anyway the rivers in Thailand are too dirty Overall I'm glad I went on a Japanese tour I don't usually choose Japanese tours but I was tired of the large number of customers The tour conductor was a man but he was very reliable and even handed out sweets as souvenirs to everyone

title: Bankok transport system
review: Excellent way to travel thru Bankok This train goes to all the Tourists spots with a close walk to most attractionsIf a little furtherthen take a Tuk Tuk

title: efficient and preferred!
review: it's efficient and simple my preferred choice of exiting suvarnabhumi airport doesn't make sense to battle the horrible Bangkok jam on road

title: excellent way to travel around
review: Brilliant and it works Cheap to get to the Airport etc and getting more stations planned No escalators in some stations if like me you hate stairs

title: Fast and cheap
review: Excellent access from the airport and very cheap (4550 THB) The best choice to go to downtown Bangkok and avoid traffic chaos Approximately takes about 4550 minutes to the last stop (Paya Thai)

title: easy to go to APT and express
review: good option to use APT Rail Link there have express train and normal train to go to APT and Siam Area and many hotel around platform

title: Best way of transportation
review: Cheapest and easiest way of transportation in Bangkok Skytrain is clean and airconditioning is provided Good way to cool down and to get to your location fast Would even advise it above taxi or tuk tuk

title: Efficient travel in Bangkok
review: If you need to travel more than a walking distance the Skytrain is an excellent and efficient way to travel The money changers at the stations are helpful although the agents have a very limited of English

title: Much longer wait then Skytrain
review: Although they state its for airport and yes it goes there the general public use it and its crowded if travelling in a pair i would still use a taxi

title: Quick Travel
review: We live in Hong Kong so you can't really compare the one line they have going through Bangkok to what we have However it does the job and Gets you quickly from AB So for first time travellers don't be put off take the skytrain to get you around

title: Great Public Transportation
review: This pubic transportation is clean fast and safe  Avoid rush hour or you might have to stand  Otherwise all the maps and connections are wellmarked and the local population is eager to help you find your destination

title: Chapter 7 Hilton Millenium Bangkok Mar 11, 2017 - Mar 19, 2017
review: My mother had cancer She would normally bathe herself but I had to bathe WITH her so she didn't slip and fall Anyone ever had to hold on to their frail and exhausted 83 year old mother for dear life in a pitch black shower after a 7000 mile flight past midnight in a 5 star hotel We had front door entry foyer lights and a lamp in the bedroom to find our way around Use the BTS to explore the city Faster and cheaper than taxis

title: Thailand Holiday
review: Thank you so much Ms Sara and Mr Pong for the wonderful experience Looking forward for the next visit 💞🙏

title: Smooth and pleasant ride.
review: The aircon is very effective in the summer heat Direction and ticket pricing are also very simple and straight forward

title: It's easy and efficient
review: Once you're out from the arrival gatestraight down to level 8 and get your token to the citythe best way is buy one way to Phya Thai station and from here you can decide whether you wanna get on BTS to other lines or if your stayin' around Pratunam the bustling area or Sukhumvit or Silom you'll have to switch train accordinglydon't border TukTukTaxi is fine if they  follow by meter is pretty cheap compared to many other big cities

title: The best asset in public transport.
review: Most efficient in running times and there are security guards on each platform station They are clean run smoothly and above all comfortable All trains are air conditioned and the best way to get across Bangkok is by this public train During the rush hours  it can be crowded but nothing as bad as London However  having air conditioning does help tremendously

title: Good Railways to connect to Aiport
review: Its connect from Suvarnabhumi Aiport to City You have to change to BTS if you wan to go to Don Mueng Aiport

title: Best way of travelling to the Airport
review: Better to put two more coach because in a rush hour you need to wait 2 trains or more just to step on It's cheapest and fastest way to bring you from Airport to the city

title: Great public transport to reach airport
review: this public transport is unique and great for airport transportation mostly when there is heavy traffic in bangkok road you can easily and on time reach airport through it

title: Clean , fast, easy better than taxi
review: MRT  and sky train interchange help to go around city easily   AC in train give real relief in Hot bkk weather

title: Not bullet train but very efficient
review: I'm impressed The BTS definitely made roaming around Bangkok so much easier The locations of the stations were strategic most tourist attractions were made accessible via BTS And the trains are always on time Loved it

title: Avoid trafic jam in Bangkok by combining the Sky rain routes, the Metro line and the boat shuttles on the Chao Phraya .
review: The two BTS lines and the connected metro line MRT cover most of Bangkok areas except for the old city center It is safe clean and convenient The trafic jam in Bangkok is not so bad as the legend says but on rush hours BTS with MTR is THE solution You can reach your office with a clean shirt trains are AirCo  You can either buy tickets at vending machines or at the offices open at every station and manned by helpful staff from early hour until almost closing of the stations   A map of combined BTS and MRT is included in most city plan available at your hotel Station names are also in English and announced in the train   The BTS system is connected to the Chao Phraya boat shutlle systems at Sathorn Pier Saphan Taksin BTS Station Prices range from 15 to 50 bahtspersonride depending of the destination

title: Clean and safe
review: Easy to use clearly labelled ticket office agents speak good English can point you in the right direction Much quicker than the road avoid rush hrs

title: Used it four time
review: I used the airport express many tines and it was defiantly the fastest way in and out of the city It is also clean since they don't allow food or drink in the cars

title: Very convenience
review: Nice trip for traveling into the city Very convenience and economy It is linked with the others BTS line

title: the fastest and most reliable way to and from the airport
review: the Airport Rail Link connects Suvarnabhumi AP with the inner city Without Highway fees traffic jams or other hassles Every time i used it it was clean felt safe and brought me where i wanted to on time Of course if you do have a lot of luggage a taxi or an uber is more convenient but you will have to plan sufficient time to get to your destination depending on daytime and rush hour traffic The Rail Link works reliably

title: Getting around
review: The train is the fastest way to get around the city and visit some of the hot spots Air conditioning and very quick  great system

title: the best way around bangkok
review: cheap clean punctual getting a liitle overcrowded however still the best way to get round busy bangkok

title: Cheap & Fast
review: the airport rail link is so good cheap and fast i went by this rail to sukumbit by transit point it takes only 20 minits

title: The only way to leave or return to the airport
review: the fastest way into town by far  This is my favourite way to get into BKK and it's crazy traffic  quite and efficient

title: Quick & clean
review: Travelled on the sky train is well worth doing as taxi rides can be very long traffic here always seems to be busy  Make sure if you are getting a taxi you ask them to put on the meter as some will rip you off if they refuse just get out and find another

title: Great transport around Bkk
review: Best way to travel around Bangkokvery easy to use gets a bit crowded peak times but some of the views are like something from the future only drawbackit closes at 11pm

title: The sky train is an excellent way to get around.
review: We took the sky train to The Jim Thompson museum and back too our hotel and to the river to get to Asiatique and back It was easy to use We purchased the tickets at the station each time It is best to have small denomination bills or coins If you do not have small currency then you must get change then go to the ticket machine The train stations were clean and the instructions were in English and Thai and helpful

title: Took this for a short distance but had to walk a bit after
review: connecting at Sae Dalongwalk through a metal detector just to get to the ticket and window gateAlso have to take a lot of stairs just to climb downI like to walk up and downstairs when having the option I know there are escalators but you get a little exerciseAfter the driver and police inspect the trainI get on at Hua Lamphong Train stopBangkok has very clean trainsand the people follow the rules by lining up to get in and allowing the people to disembark first

title: Very interesting
review: It was a very interesting tour and our tour guide was friendly and helpful The floating market was really cool and definitely worth a visit

title: Great if you have no luggage.
review: The MRT is the best way to get around BKK  However it you have luggage it can be a challenge    I now get a taxi to Makkasan instead of the MRT to get to the airport  If you have little or no luggage then it is the best way to travel fairly clean cheap and fast

title: Efficient, affordable transportation
review: Easily accessible efficient and pleasant way to discover some of Bangkok's main attractions and much faster than taxis especially during rush hours However with only one line it has limited reach

title: Wish London Underground could be this good!
review: A wonderful easy and cheap option to move around the city It's quicker as there are no clogged up roads to consider and incredibly easy to navigate Be brave and give it a try

title: Easy to figure out.  Cool. Comfortable and safe
review: Easy once you sort it out Very fast Doesn’t always take you to exactly where you want to go but will get you close

title: Great day at the Half-Day Railway Market and Floating Market Tour in Bangkok
review: Great day at the HalfDay Railway Market and Floating Market Tour in Bangkok Thailand There was a group of 11 of us in an air conditioned transport It was very comfortable We had a great guide and driver very knowledgeable and I was pleasantly surprised that we actually rode on the train and went through the market We then got off the train and were in the market and able to experience it from the ground Great experience I also enjoyed the floating market and the guide looked after us very well It was a full but very enjoyable day I highly recommend it

title: Best way of travel
review: Sky train is the quickest mode of transport in Bkk Clean efficient and great to use if your destination happens to be on one of the lines Shame they finish at midnight

title: A little confusing at first
review: Our hotel was near the Skytrain and it took a few minutes to figure out the purchasing system Go to the person at the information booth to exchange paper money for change Be aware if you are not quick enough the locals will jump in front of you or right next to you and the booth person will attend to them   With your change go to the ticket machine and look for the stop you want The number (21 31 41 etc next to the stop) is the amount of change you need to put in to get a oneway ticket to that stop When you're on the train and you go past your purchased stop your ticket will not open the gate  you have to go to the information booth and pay the difference  The Skytrain does not take you from one end to the other of Bangkok To get to Wat Pho you can only take the Skytrain so far then you have to jump on a tuktuk or taxi to get there The tuktuk driver said we should've taken the water taxi as it would've been much easier quicker and cheaper to get to the attraction The traffic to get to Wat Pho was horrendous  at least the tuktuk driver can weave around cars and cut lanes    There is also a market by the Wat Pho attraction  it's also where the water taxi is Go to the market it's covered and has a lot of the fake antiques for purchase And a lot of street cart vendors

title: Instruction is not clear
review: A little bit unsure on the route map this is the only thing I want to say  How may words you expect me to write  Why 50  Please cut this down

title: fast and reliable
review: the best option by far to go to Suvarnabhumi airport Do not even ATTEMPT to go by road The traffic snarls in Bangkok are legendary and the last thing you want to experience when you are rushing to catch your plane

title: An excellent way to travel in Bangkok
review: There is a good service and as there are platforms enclosed with doors the stations are air conditioned (a very good feature in steamy Bangkok

title: Awesome tour with Sara
review: Great day exploring the railway market and floating market with Sara She’s a great guide with awesome jokes which made the drive go fast

title: Airport link
review: Its worthcheap then taxi  Its accessible for all things like wheel chair and big bags  Direct from airport to the downtown  I would highly recommend to travel

title: Take the bus
review: Taking the bus is simplicity itsself We followed the orange line out of arrivals The A1 bus arrived one minute later plenty of room for rucksacks etc it took about 20 minutes to get to Mo Chit BTS cost 30thb each We then took BTS   I would use this everytime as long as I was staying in downtown We were staying off sukhumvit road the whole journey took less than an hour and cost144thb so much easier than a taxi

title: So easy to use
review: I was going to take a cab to the airport until my Thai friend told me not to since there are so many issues with drivers ripping off tourist not to mention the awful Bangkok traffic   I was worried that I would get hot and sweaty on the way or get lost But using the airport rail link was so easy

title: Cheap convenient way to get around Bangkok
review: A day ticket will cost 140 baht (just over £3) The trains are fast and efficient air conditioned and sometimes very busy (but another will be along very soon if you don't fancy getting squashed)

title: Australia could learn from this
review: Excellent rail system  Reasonably priced clean regular service  Public transport as we would like it to be

title: Awesome way to travel
review: If you want to travel to suvarnbhumi airport this is cheapest and fastest mode Taxi take 500 baht from asok station whereas by airport rail link ticket is 45 baht only So it's easy cheap and fastest way 😍

title: a lot of fun
review: Sarah was a very funny tourguide we learned a lot about the country and saw many things Thank you for that Malvina & Andrea

title: Slightly pricey but good way to get around
review: Found it a little pricey compared to other transport systems around the world But it is very good comes along quick and clean They should extend the line to more places like Grande Palace etc

title: best way to travel- fast and cheap
review: The train in great convenient and easy it’s the best way to travel in the city especially during the peak traffic time We took the train everywhere we went and the best part about it is the skywalks connecting the train stations with all malls and tourist areas making it very easy to walk to one’s destination without having to deal with the traffic or heat The first time it was a little difficult to figure out how to use the network and the ticket machines but the people staff and locals alike are very helpful  The trains are very comfortable air conditioned and neat and clean and the travelers are very organized and disciplined

title: Perfect to be fast
review: You need to go to the (new) International airport fast  Use the Airport Rail Link It's very fast but do yourselves a favor with no or with little luggage only  It doesn't matter what time of the day (as long as they operating stop midnight) you're arriving at the airport about 30 minutes after the train leaves the station  It would be perfect if the train not stop at Makkasan but stop at Sukhumvit (Asoke) station as there's also a station of the BTS (Skytrain) and the subway MRT  But still using this link means saving a lot of nerves and money

title: Taxi alternative
review: If you're travelling from Suvarnabhumi Airport in Bangkok into the CBD and you gave a case and it's morning or Kate in the afternoon grab the Airport Rail Link ( the express) and be in town in 20 minutes  Taxis at those times can be held up in massive traffic hames and can turn a 25 minute trip into an hour or more

title: Holiday Site Seeing
review: Please use the BTS Skytrain as it’s a challenge to walk around BKK in the heat and humidity Air conditioned and very clean  Great way to access sites and beating the traffic plus the views  Tip   come armed with lots of coins to use the self service ticket machines

title: Discovering Bangkok for the first time.
review: This is our first time in Bangkok  We were lucky enough to assist this tour  we were accompanied by this wonderful lady  Her name is Tanya She was our guide for this tour  We had an amazing time  it was really amazing The train track market followed by the floating market  I was surprised amazed  Bangkok is beautiful the people are amazing and very friendly

title: The most convenient transport in BKK
review: The sky train saves you hours by avoiding the traffic of Bangkok I took it from my drop off from the river taxi to the weekend market near JJ MALL it was crowded but entertaining Take the sky train for a nice experience in public transportation

title: Skytrain
review: Great way to get around very busy but frequent service you can buy  a day ticket for 120 bhat  hop on and off all day great shopping malls skytrain also goes to the airport

title: Rot Fai Fah Sanam Bin (Sky Train Airport)
review: A very sensible idea implemented with Thai wisdom so therefore rendered virtually useless 2 services City Line and Express both use the same track so you can see a problem from the start If you want to use the Express it goes at 20 minute intervals whereas the City Line is at around 5 minute intervals by the time you have waited for an Express you could have been there on the City Line for half the fare The idea was to be able to take your luggage with you there is sufficient space but Makkasan Station has no taxis waiting and is not as close to the subway as they suggest so if you go there you have to lug your bags to the road and try and get a taxi there If you go all the way to Phaya Thai station there is a fair walk to the Sky Train and you need to open your luggage for a security check Best not to bother On arrival the cheapest taxi s are at DEPARTURES make sure they use the meter and pay about 200  300 Baht right to your hotel Airport Rail Link TO the airport could have been good I think they were copying the one in Hong Kong where you can check your bags in at the station then just travel to the airport Sadly as this is Thailand none of the airport checkin desks are ever occupied except Thai and if you want to check in you MUST use the Express Having said that if you are just meeting someone at the airport it can't be beaten but for its intended use  it is a complete failure

title: Clean, fast and convenient
review: The BTS Skytrain is a great way to travel around Bangkok without worrying about the constant traffic jams The lines run extensively across the city and serves as a welcome alternative to taxis

title: Best way to get around by far!!
review: So easy to use and cheap tooonly 150 bht for a day passbrilliant and saved my poor legs ha Trains run very regular and when I over ran a stop I just jumped off and back on to head the right way

title: Quickest Service to/form Airport
review: The airport railway link is the fastest and easiest way to get tofrom the main international airport in Bangkok it saves not only time but money   Traffic is Bangkok is terrible taking the train is in my opinion the easiest and smartest option  Recommendation Fully recommended for a stressfree journey

title: To crouded
review: It is to crouded You have to get there and then you have not saved that mutch after all You are then all svetty before the flight

title: Great way to get around
review: The BTS is a cheap and safe way to get around in congested Bangkok The routes are easy to navigate and exits are numbered making heading in the right direction after exiting much clearer The trains have great airconditioning which feels good after climbing the many flights of stairs to the platform Buy a rabbit card if you'll be traveling on the BTS daily

title: HISTORY
review: Many people died building this railway  I wish I would have studied my history more in depth before visiting  The people building the railway were treated in inhumane ways  Hence the name "Death Railway"

title: Fantastic
review: The Bts is probably the best way to get around Bangkok and they are adding new stations all the time Very easy to use

title: Pretty fast to bring u into mid town
review: We took this 2x n the second time this year we noticed that they have linked the express station to the mrt station with a sky bridge Even though u have to get out from the express station to change its pretty easy with the link bridge  It's good especially if you can link up to the city through the mrt However if you can't and need to use bts then probably not as u have to change the trains multiple times This is excellent to beat the traffic jam during peak hours and it's pretty affordable

title: Easy to find - follow the signs to the lower level in the airport
review: A cheap and convenient way to get to central Bangkok Check out the BTS map beforehand and plan your journey to your accommodation this will save you a taxi fare and loads of hassle

title: Convenient
review: If you don’t have many luggage and stay close in town this is very convenient and cost less Take the BTS skytrain to PhayaThai station and follow the sign to the airport rail link I also take this train when get back from Pattaya There’s a bus from Pattaya to the airport Then take the airport train which go over the traffic on the highway especially during rush hours

title: Slow Ride to BKK Airport
review: First time ever we tried the train never again Express service is almost every hour and the city line is slow and cramped Its better to take a cab

title: Quick efficient and cheap transfer
review: From the terminal to the hotel (near Asok BTS) in an hour for 50baht Obviously it depends on where in Bangkok you are heading but for Sukhumvit Road it is hard to beat There are interconnections with BTS and MRT and even travelling at peak time I had no problem with overcrowding or dealing with my luggage Two taxidrivers tried to rip me off at the airport telling me the fare was 500 and 900 baht respectively plus tolls plus charges Avoid the traffic take the train

title: The best way to get around
review: BTS is the most hassle free mode of transport in Bangkok Very efficient public transport system that is easy affordable and pleasant Just get a map of the BTS in Bangkok and you can get to your destination or at least a convenient neighbourhood within no time In Bangkok you must get yourself acquainted with the BTS to make your movement smooth To travel on BTS you can reach your nearest BTS Station take a ticket from the vending machine and hop into one of the frequent trains on your route Siam is the station where you need to change to Silom Line to go towards the river and ferry pier of Saphan Taksin Phaya Thai on the Sukhumvit line is the station where you can change for the airport line Just one ride and you get addicted to the BTS

title: Why do they not increase the Capacity?
review: Great network that is thoroughly under utilized   Generally they are a 3 carriage train Yet they have the infrastructure for seven carriages  Regular travelers to Bangkok as well as the local population continually get squeezed in like Sardines Not logical that a simple solution exists to assisting the numerous traffic congestion problems by increasing services to ease the traveling public’s woes in Bangkok Let alone the significant improvement to the Polution levels in town To the powers that be please ACT

title: An Ease to use
review: The transport network is easy to use stress free clean and cheap Easy way to get around Bangkok   Word to note the network runs overhead there are quite a few steps to negotiate getting to the platforms Lifts are there for disabledelderly people

title: Air con, cheap, easy, layout all in English!
review: Best method to get around central Bangkok  Ride high and fast above the below congestion & you get an elevated view of that area of Bangkok which helps if you like exploring on foot  Can be busy around Siam & Aso not surprising  Air con is much needed on those tired busy tourist days but not many carriages so rarely sat down no big deal though

title: Transport to city centre / old town. It is on time, effective and very cheap only 45 bth.
review: Perfect for transpor to and from airport super effective snd very cheap only 45 bth per person Very easy to find and use From the station i used motorbice and tuctuc both works fine

title: Interesting Experience
review: I had absolutely no idea of what to expect from this trip We had the second class sleeper train with just a fan The train was more basic than even I imagined in my head It was really hot as you could imagine but I found it pretty easy to deal with during the night if you want to save the extra money Our biggest issue was that not long after departing our train came to a standstill for what seemed like forever We asked one of the workers what the issue was and was told that the engine had broken down This happened multiple times during the train ride so we didn't arrive until hours after we were supposed too In hindsight if I knew we were to spend so long on the train I would've gone with aircon But despite the hard sleeping conditions I still woke up in the morning in the best mood The view you'll see is incredible

title: Fast and easy
review: Fast easy and Very clean We enjoyed both the metro and the skytrain in our last week in Bangkok Gets you where you want and on the skytrain you can even catch a glimpse of the city as well

title: Always great service
review: Always very clean and on time  Allows you to travel very quickly in Bangkok instead of rush hour traffic

title: Hellfire Pass
review: What a great experience an incredible day So much history The whole day was very well run we fitted so much in Our guide was informative and friendly

title: Impressive, value vor money
review: Absolutely worth the travel time outside of Bangkok The train is so close you can actually touch it when it passes by  ~The floating market was impressive with a wonderful boat ride through the canals Absolutely value for money

title: Very convinient and very clean
review: Probably the best way to travel due to traffic its convenient and clean and cheap You can get to most of the top site places in Bangkok on this train

title: Cheap and regular
review: Easy to use this service is very regular and a cheap way of moving from the airport Not the cleanest and always busy But very cheap

title: Great way to get around the city
review: The stations are extraordinarily clean and security is Omnipresent  I took the MRT from JJ market (Chatuchak Park) to my hotel (Sukhumvit) and it was not real crowed and a very pleasant rideof course it was 10 at night  I think its a little less crowded than the BTS so its a great option   Don't LOSE your token  You need it to get in and out  This is a good option to beat the Bangkok rush hour traffic and still get to where you want to go  I would pick this over a Tuk Tuk and sucking exhaust fumes anyday

title: A good way to cool off
review: One thing I loved about the skytrain is the great aircon that it has which is needed as Bangkok is so hot and sticky

title: Value is off the rails!
review: Cheap easy to use can't get lost Can see the city and fast Do you need to know any moreo yes it's very clean and safe

title: fast and rapid
review: the best way to travel in the crowded streets of Bangkok fast safe and no traffic jam the best way from and to the airport and all for just THB 35 the taxis is much more stressful and slower take the airport link and catch a taxi if needed downtown

title: busy but good
review: tho crowded it's always quicker than any other transporti rarely go anywhere thats not near a skytrain station or the metro

title: May be the fastest travelling way in Bangkok
review: BTS may be the fastest way to travel in Bangkok although some places cannot be reached There are some stations that not have escalator so it may not be suit for peoples who have leg and knee problems and also peoples who travel with big bags to carry up the staircase During morning 7  9 am and evening 5  7 pm are very busy if available you may avoid this time for more comfortable

title: Best Mode of Transport in Bangkok
review: Don't waste your time in an uber taxi motorcycle or tuk tuk Yes you heard me right Even the Tuk Tuk is might useless in Bangkok traffic Take the train you'll see more of Bangkok and you won't be stuck in traffic

title: Unreliable. Overly crowded during peak hours.
review: If you need to arrive on time never use airport rail link Train is always full because it is too little number of cars

title: Best floating and train markets tour
review: Visited the floating and rail markets on 15 Oct 2023 and the most memorable tour we had with Bigcountry and our tour guide Jokey The aircon mini coach picked us from our hotel very punctually and the coach was very comfortable Would like to thank our tour guide Jokey who made sure we were comfortable and also looking after our safety He was able to give us the historical backgrounds of the markets Gave us tips on how to bargain and where to get good deals and also recommended some good foods at the two markets and those in Bangkok Thanks Jokey and Bigcountry Highly recommended tour with them

title: Quick and easy to use
review: Loved it  It is very easy to use They have different ticket machines I recommend using the one that lets you say to which station you're going as it will calculate the amount Don't loose your ticket you'll need it to get out of the station If you're staying for a week buy the pass it is much easier Get your map and enjoy the city

title: An experience
review: Now i know what a sardine feels like when its stacked in a tin cause thats what i felt like the sky train is useful outside of bangkok it does not go into the city at all you have to get out a siam or central and take a taxi back to bangkok city

title: efficient
review: very efficient and on time service they have announcement system which helps foreign travellers to get down at the desired destination

title: Terrible transport to airport
review: Station didn't support trolley bag (small elevator)  if you are backpacker it alright always have problem train need to fix asap

title: Best way to travel
review: The Skytrain is by far the quickest and cheapest way to get around Bangkok It is clean and air conditioned The traffic and pollution in and around Bangkok is horrendous so this is the best way to get around

title: Superfast journey
review: Saved a lot of time during our return journey towards Suvarbhumi Int'l Airport Fast Less crowd & no worries of traffic Despite heavy baggage didn't have trouble due Escalator

title: Leisure
review: Great system for queuing with arrows to show you where to queue whilst allowing passengers off Air conditioned well sign posted and easy to buy tickets Friendly helpful staff

title: Great way to get around Bangkok
review: Bangkok's roads are notoriously congested so (as it is usually too hot to walk around the extensive city area) alternative transport modes such as river bus and metro are very useful There is also a really good Skytrain network extending out to the airport and as the Silom station was close to our hotel we used it quite a bit  especially to get down to the river and pick up one of the excellent local water 'buses' at Sta Sathorn The skytrains are frequent and very easy to use  carriages also air conditioned which made it nice walking in off a baking hot platform and 90% humidity Not the cheapest form of transport in Thailand but a very convenient way to get inout and about in Bangkok

title: The best way to get around
review: Easy to get from and to places besides the shuttle boat services Self tkt machines in English Very convenient

title: Very easy to use!
review: Loved taking the BTS around Bangkok The air conditioning was so nice and it was very easy to figure out how to use it

title: Great link
review: Great way to get into the city and very cheap and so clean Found it very easy to use been using  it for  years and  it's so much better than we have in the uk

title: Just to experience the BTS !
review: We were at Siam Paragon after the Kidzania Bangkok and wanted to go somewhere to shop and eat I decided on Terminal 21 since it is relatively near One consideration was that I have 3 young children and 5 adults We wanted to take a cab but decided against it because it was the evening peak hours Even though we knew that the BTS will be crowded but since Asok (where Terminal 21 is located) is just 4 stops away from Siam Station (where Siam Paragon is) we decide to brave the evening crowd and let my kids and folks experience the BTS   Am glad to say that we got in and out in one piece but it was squeezy

title: Great Experience
review: the trip timing and schedule were great  very little down time between events van was waiting for group after each experience was over  Seems driver took the long way slow way home which was frustrating after a very nice day  Guide very helpful and friendly  I would recommend to friends to go

title: One stop transport
review: Using BTS in Bangkok will more helpful to avoid the crowded traffic for tourist who stay more than 1 day and always frequent to day trip its best to use their 1 day 3 days and 7 days pass for unlimited journey If you buy the rabbit card for long stay it profitable as they give a complimentary award and u may change at many restaurant and cafe

title: Quick and cheap!
review: Lots of stairs to walk up and down in all stations and not many are mechanical Avoid if you suffer from disabilities

title: Cheaper and faster way to/from airport
review: Definitely the faster way to gofrom the airport especially during peak hours Cheaper and faster It was quite crowded as it gets nearer to town but it's better to stuck in the traffic

title: Handy to miss city traffic
review: The airport rail link is a handy form of transport to miss out on traffic jams even if you aren't staying in the city centre you can then take the BTS to the area you need to be

title: Quick and easy
review: I enjoyed using the skytrain as it was much faster than using taxis or any way of transportation on ground level the only thing I didn't enjoy was the excessive AC I was just freezing on the skytrain

title: Easy to use
review: Regular time table No problems with traffic jams Buy a day pass (140 Bth) Day pass not valid for metro unfortunately

title: Good choice
review: Very convenienceand save the time when you use the skytrain

title: what better way to get around?
review: Great rail system that is cheapclean and airconditioned I highly recommend it to anyone travelling around Bangkok

title: Does the job, very safe, beats the traffic.
review: This airport link is INVALUABLE when there are traffic jams in Bangkok It can take a long time to get through traffic by Taxi when there's a bad storm a lot of rain or just rush hour traffic I always consider the rail link for the airport as a backup incase there is a huge traffic jam   Always know your nearest stations on route to the airport which means you can ask your taxi driver to just drop you at the rail link if it looks like you're going to miss your flight due to extreme traffic

title: beats taking the taxi !
review: I'm a true fan of the Airport Link as a means of traveling to and from the airport  The main reason is that there is no uncertainty about the commute time or the price  Plus you don't have to worry about the traffic or unscrupulous taxi drivers  The commute will always take approx 30 min or so from Phaya Thai station  I've had some horrendous experiences in the past with taxi cab drivers and I try to avoid them at all cost  There is simply never any drama associated with taking the Airport Link to and from the airport and I love that  I just wish the Airport Link was available for travel 247 vs 6am to 12am  Also the Airport Link can be very crowded sometimes but I can usually find a seat so it's still a comfortable experience  Plus you can't beat the price which is significantly less than taking the taxi  Finally the Airport Link never gives you any attitude unlike Bangkok taxi drivers

title: The breathing transportation system!
review: Thanks a lot to BTS ( Bangkok Transport system) Because with the sky train all Bangkok city is accessible very easy and very fast and comfortable way to go around the city  From early morning till late night we can g around over the city clean fast on time

title: Great to get around
review: The BTS has been a great addition since my last visit in 2007  So easy to get around  Everything is clearly marked and easy to understand  Def a thumbs up

title: Perfect!
review: Fast clean comfortable made to be easy to use by foreigners and with support staff well trained   The ticket value is very good for the service offered

title: Convenient but too slow and old
review: The train is an alternative to the taxis but only since the roads are very busy It would be advised to renovate the stations and have faster trains

title: Easy to use
review: Buy your ticket at the station all signs are in Thai and English maps are easy to use I was amazed and in awe that the Thais are so polite that they queue to get onto the trains  really impressive The trains are crowded at rush hour but are cool and there is little jostling people respect each others space Please take your rucksack off but do hold onto it

title: Makes getting around Bangkok so easy & fast!
review: We always make use of BTS whenever we are in Bangkok  Our service apartment in Sathorn is less than 10 minutes' walk to Chong Nonsi station  And from there it is just 3 stations away from Siam station  From Siam station you are right next to Siam Paragon shopping mall  It was reasonable at 26 THB per adult for the one way journey  The trains are clean and the frequency excellent  It sure beats the traffic jam via taxi

title: MRT
review: Quick clean and convenient way to get around Bangkok Trains every few minutes during peak times when it can be crowded Easy to interchange with SRT Airport Rail Link and BTS Can get tickets from either a machine or ticket window

title: Don’t bother using taxis
review: So easy to use  Platform in airport terminal  Line runs into central Bangkok with connections to the underground on the way  Very cheap  avoid the traffic

title: Great transportation but quite expensive!
review: It is a very convenient way to get around Bangkok but I found it to be quite expensive Although it is much better than the cabs in Bangkok they are REALLY expensive

title: Perfect
review: Cost effective way of getting from the airport to Bangkok centre I would suggest better without a lot of luggage but still doable Likely need a taxi ride from the get off station However about 18th the price of an airport taxi

title: Ideal way of transporation to beat the taxis
review: An ideal way of transportation to beat the highprice taxis at the airport Connects easily with the city center but also with other modes of public transportation (BTS etc) Low rates

title: Excellent for traveling around Bangkok
review: Cheap and fast way to travel around Bangkok Faster and cheaper than both taxi and tuk tuk (depends on where you are going of course) Always full so don't expect to get a seat

title: The only way to get around Bangkok.
review: When in Bangkok I mostly use the BTS Skytrain to get around  Traffic is terrible but the skytrain gets you to most places in Bangkok  The trains have great AC and run frequently enough that you aren't waiting very long  It can be difficult to get a seat as the Skytrain is almost always crowded  The fares are reasonable and I like the option to buy a day pass for 140 baht (around $420 USD)  They limit the time on the rail which keep vendors and beggers off the trains

title: Perfect way to go city centre!
review: I go to Bangkok often and always take the train so cheap and so much faster (especially rush hour)

title: Most convenient form of travel in Bangkok
review: Thankfully with the BTS system in Bangkok tourists and locals alike will be able to travel easily to many places  The good point about the BTS system the maps also show the places of interest which tourists can stop over and visit Prominent shopping malls were also reflected in the systems map I think that is really awesome  Just take note it could get really squeezy and crowded during peak periods as locals are rushing to get home after work

title: A blessing in BKK high traffic
review: The most convenient way to explore Bangkok with comfort & less cost  It connects almost every corner of the city least tourist attractions  shopping malls riverside what not Also has Airport Link  I always prefer this not just to save times It's much cheaper & convenient than taxi Anyone can buy a dayweekly pass or trip wise ticket either from automated machine or ticket window Has both local & English written as well as announcement inside the train  It is no doubt best way to travel in Bangkok

title: Exceptional service
review: The Skytrain is a fantastic transport system to use whilst in Bangkok It is cheap punctual clean and very easy for tourists to use

title: BTS SKYTRAIN
review: Best way to travel unless you have been shopping and bringing things Back with you then grab a taxi  Please Note in the Mornings you sometimes have to wait inline  For a TRAIN THAT HAS SPACE TO GET ONRUSH HOUR

title: Great way to get around
review: uy a "Rabbit' card at any station Then tap to get on and tap when you get off Easy and simple Refill the card (min is 100 Baht (about $3 USD) when needed and keep riding

title: Super efficient route to city
review: Easy non stop route to city where you can interchange with other transport to reach your destination Approx 30 mins ride Very affordable and easy option

title: Cool calm and efficient
review: When possible this is the only way to travel around Bangkok It is heavily air conditioned very clean and really really cheap

title: Stressless
review: The airport rail link is simple to use and cheeper than taxi If you use it you can be sure that you will be on airport on the time no matter if there is rush hour in the city or around Great choice

title: Fun and Easy to Navigate
review: With clean train cars and easy to navigate stops and starts the train was great for us to get around Bangkok Also the ad's for posture and engaging with people were fun and in English

title: cheapest and easiest way to reach the airport
review: it is the cheapest and the easiest way to reach the airport but you have to plan to reach the airport well in advance of your time as the frequency is only one in 20 mins and there are only 3 wagons so the capacity is far less than expected If you have more than one piece of luggage not every easy to go around

title: Perfect transport from airport to Bangkok centre.
review: A perfect way to travel from the airport to Bangkok centre  Cheap (THB 35  45 pp) clean  fast and with good connections with the Metro and skytrain Easy acces also with suitcases on wheels or backpacks More crowded after a few stations

title: great way to avoid traffic
review: even if you have never been to Bangkok before an easy way to travel and actually get places if you get sick of the traffic Cheap regular easy

title: Fantastic
review: Easy to understand pay per stop  super cheap to get to some of the inner city attractions comfortable and air con Great views  Avoid around 56 pm due to peak time

title: good service
review: I use BTS skytrain from ekamai to siam fast trip easy and comfortable good for the trafic jam on the roadday not expensive cheaper than taxi if you come alone

title: Ease of access
review: We used the sky trains and boats instead of taxi in Bangkok because of potential trouble with taxi Many hotels can be reached by trains

title: Easy transport
review: We used the Bangkok MRT several times and found it to be an easy inexpensive and efficirnt way to get around town  It doesn't go everywhere in town but it's always easy to pick up a tuk tuk or cab

title: BTS
review: Long wait for trains Too many stairs to climb Easy to use if not exhausting Helpful staff Convenient stops Shame not linked to airport train

title: Easy to use
review: Don't bother with the taxi especially if you can manage with your luggage It is convenient easy to use and much much cheaper

title: Great Ride - Beat car and cycle traffic for sure!!!!!!
review: This is a great link to ride  I perhaps like the subway system better but there are literally thousands of riders constantly  The road traffic in Bangkok is legendary and you need a quick way to navigate this beautiful city this works

title: Great to avoid traffic jams
review: It gets crowded around 89am but otherwise it s a great transportation system   I use it when i want to avoid traffic jams especially when traveling in and around the center of Bangkok (sukhumvit silom central world)

title: The only difficult bit is...
review: checking which way you are going otherwise it is brilliantthe day ticket at 135 baht is better value if you are going to be moving around

title: very convenient
review: We bought a day pass that save alot of time and aloud us to avoid the long queues At 5 or 6 o'clock it is too crowded to use But on a saturday morning to go to Chatujak market it is very convenient

title: Life line of the city
review: Sky train has got good connectivity throughout the city The wait time between 2 trains is about 5 minutes Must experience

title: The only way to travel the busy streets of Bangkok!
review: Traffic is usually so bad that it seems that the Skytrain is the only way to travel  Highly air conditioned and convenient to get almost anywhere in the downtown areas  Inexpensive compared to North American transit systems

title: The most convenient transport from airport to center of Bangkok,
review: This is the best transport to avoid traffic jam from Suwannaphum airport to the center of Bangkok You can get off at Phayathai station and hop on BTS to other destinations or you can get off at Makkasan station and get into MRT to you desired destinations Cost is reasonable It's quite punctual most of the time Make sure you study your destination so you know where to get off

title: Crowded at Rush Hour
review: We took a train from the start of the line to a market and if we were not at the start we would have had to wait to get on Every stop after that had a line and people jammed on Imagine those photos of the Japanese metros It was cheap and got us to where we needed to be

title: Clean and Quick
review: We caught the train from one end to the other ironically it was cheaper by taxi chatuchak market to Grand Station

title: organize!
review: nice train clean and organized nice spot to see the locals people in thailand are good peoplerespectful and down to earth i think

title: Fast and efficient
review: We used the Skytrain for the 2 days we were in Bangkok a great way to see the city tuck tuks are fun but the Skytrain is far more efficient

title: Cheap, easy way around Bangkok
review: You can buy single ride 24 hour or longer passes It is extremely affordable and takes you to the far reaches of Bangkok and 3 very fancy malls

title: Easy and fast to Phaya Thai last station.
review: Really great way to get to the city centre from the airport Tickets are cheap it goes every 20minutes doesnt stuck in the traffick jam and its last station is Phaya Thai so if you go to the place that is not near you must take tuk tuk or Taxi to get therethey are waiting on the groud where you will leave sky train

title: No Drinking on the train
review: This is the only way to travel Bangkok Easy to use takes you anywhere  but do not drink or eat on the train I just pulled out a water bottle to take a sip and an announcement came over the loud speaker "DO NOT DRINK ON THE TRAIN" and everybody stared at meoops

title: Day pass on the train
review: We use the train with a day pass from the victoria monument station The trains are regular cool but very congested

title: Easy to use
review: Easy to navigate good maps helpful staff Trains are clean and on time Rush hour is what you'd expect rush hour in a major city to bejust when you think you can't fit one more body fifteen more people get on the train

title: Family trip
review: Limited system so not confusing to navigate  You may need switch to the MRT subway to link to certain locations  The connection with DML airport should be complete next year

title: Best way to travel around as a tourist
review: I think this is the best way to travel around Bangkok's neighbourhood as a tourist The stations are accessible to many places of interest and most of the time it is much faster to commute from one location to the next compare to getting stuck in traffic jam  Plus the aircon are blasted to keep you cool in the hot and humid April

title: A great idea with poor integration into the environment
review: I always want rail connections to airports worldwide But this one is an indication of why many Thai projects stumble "Poor megaplanning" Connections to the local elevated trains and subway are poor with little thought about luggage Changing to and from taxis often requires navigating congested streets lacking traffic signals I wish I could recommend this but that will have to wait until they install more escalator connections and other amenities Taxis are low cost and they use compressed natural gas so at least they are low contributors to hydrocarbon pollution One day this rail link will be a complete implementation

title: Air ventilation needed !!
review: Cheap and easy with noisy closing door and air ventilation needed So warm inside the train platform I saw they added some small fans but dont even help

title: Good choice from Suvarnabhumi Airport to city
review: Good choice if you travel to Thailand and want to leave from Suvarnabhumi international airport to city you can use it from airport please ask office to get the platform it's easy to find it  You have to take it from airport and get off Phayathai station that you can connect to sky train city line to travel bangkok inner area    I attached rate and time table from photos that will be your benefit and useful   Please enjoy your staying in Thailand

title: From Airport to town (budget traveller)
review: Like in the other big city Bangkok also provide trian from airport to town Don't get bored and upset with the cap and their charged Make it yourself by take airport rail link at the cost less than 2$ to downtown in 45 min Get off at Phrayathai station to connect to other train the BTS sky train to Sukhumvit area or strat chasing your luck with the cap here to Khoasan area is much more easier Feel free to ask me if you need help

title: Great mode of transportation
review: First off the air conditioning is the bomb Second it is fairly clean Fairly easy to navigate Nice alternative to taking a cab or tuk tuk

title: Convenient and inexpensive
review: Once you get past the whole crowding in the train thing this is a very efficient way to get around Living in Saigon means one is part of the motorbike culture as it's really the only way to get around This was a great way to shirk driving and parking responsibilities  The drawback is that it stops running long before you do

title: tidy and quick ride to the city
review: Having experiences from 20 years back there was now other choice than going to the Hotel with a fast train and not a cab  the train arrived after some time was cleaned and checked before the waiting peole were allowed to enter We had to go to the last station which took about 45 minutes From there we had to change to another high train This was also fine Execept that we had to buy due to a different system again tickets  As we were 4 travellers we saw tat the toll roads are not crowded so on the return we took a taxi from the hotel This saved us changing and walking a bit on the skywalks  The taxi costs were a little lower than the trains

title: so easy
review: The Sky Train is the fastestcheapest way to navigate the city It's very easy to map out the route and the trains are clean and air conditioned

title: Great form of transportation in Bangkok
