review: Do you want to avoid traffic jams Then think about BTS ( Skytrain ) you can get to the most commercial and touristy areas in within no time through the BTS system Very easy to use so some people think its essential to get coins from the counter No if you already have the coins which is enough to take you to your desired station then then no to spend extra money  You can use the coins  you already got from the vendors shops stalls from where you bought or you buy your foods just check the station and the station number then you would know how much coins you would need to spend in the ticket machine  then simply press  your desired station number and the tool number of coins you need will appear on the screen then you put that amount in the machine and there you would get your coupon Now you can  go through the get and go upstairs to take your train but you have to be which train to take carefully read the sign there Good Luck

title: Loved the ride
review: So fun quick and efficient We travelled several times on the bts skytrain and got around bangkok quite easily

title: Trip to town
review: Great service and easy to manage tickets Price was 37baht each way (around £1) so good value  Stations are well set for access to shopping centres but if you like to walk then you can alight early and visit local places of interest keeping the railway above you to rejoin at any time  Get a day ticket if you want to explore

title: VERY EFFICIENT & CONVENIENT
review: BTS is indeed a boon for Bangkok Good network connecting most of the city and even the suburbs Touristfriendly with signs and announcements in clear English Efficient service with trains every 2 minutes during peak hours However I found the trains quite crowded most of the time  even around 10 PM and one would be lucky getting a seat  If you plan exploring the city a Day pass for 140 Bhats is a good option

title: A Fantastic Way To Get Around.
review: Clean cheap and air conditioned There are only 2 lines  The big advantage of this is that it is very easy to navigate I can't recommend this system enough For the adventurous try a motorbike taxi They are awesome and fun

title: Bts experienced
review: From airport to downtown city of bangkok bts is the most convenient means of transportation I teally love taking bts as we roam the city

title: ฺBest way to travel in Bangkok
review: I walk from my hotel to BTS skytrain National Stadium station for 3 minutes I take BTS to Saphan Taksin Station to connected with express at Chao Phraya River

title: Awesome public transport
review: By far one of the easiest ways to move around Bangkok A very cheap and clean way to move between areas and usually on a short walk from attractions and major shopping destinations The train arrives every 510 mins and cost very little compared to the rates a taxi or tuk tuk may cost Also in the heat of the day its a very cool retreat   Also a great link to the Central pier to catch the ferry system up and the down the river as well   Could not recommend enough for tourist to use Wish we had such an easy system here in Australia

title: Great choice of transportation in Bangkok
review: Specially when you live in heart of Bangkok like Asoke   This is the best way to escaped all those traffic on Sukhumvit Ratchada Roads   It's reliable and on time   Buy a prepaid reloaded ticket to avoid long Q at rush time   The price for prepaid reloaded ticket for adult is 180 THB which will deduct 50 THB deposit and 30 administration fee The money left in card is 100 THB For 2 bucks you save a lot of time to Q up

title: Superb service on special borky
review: There is a special borky on train from kwai bridge station to waterfall and back costed 300baht for foreigner The service was better than a low cost airline one a snack box with a coffee or tea plus a cup of coke Moreover you can booked you seat

title: fast way to town
review: fast and cheap way to get to the centre of Bangkok the only thing is its a pain if you have BIG luggage fast quick and cheap need I say more

title: Great value
review: This tour is excellent value for money  Great content and pace  Our tour guide Nine was very organised informative and friendly We were sadly disappointed that none of the largely British tourists in the party gave this hard working guide a tip  It seems a terrible reflection on British tourists who from overheard conversations were more interested in what drinks they would have at Happy Hour than rewarding a female guide from a third world country who worked her socks off to provide a premier surface

title: Best way to commute
review: Staff are super friendly Helped we get through Bangkok for my 1 week stay   If you wanna go somewhere all you have to do is ask

title: Cheap and fast transportation
review: Cheap and easy way to get from the airport into the city There was nothing to complain about Service is every 15 minutes

title: Train Market & floating market
review: Early morning pickup from the hotel We were driven to the pickup point from where we took the train The train was an experience in itself Arrival at the market and seeing the train depart was amazing The floating market although crowded was an interesting sight Our guide Sara was very kind and caring throughout the trip Definitely recommend

title: Fast, and cheep.
review: Love the Skytrain  It's the oly way to travel in Bangkok  Air conditioned and fast  Don't bother with taxi's if you can help it

title: No fuss straight to Downtown
review: Very convenient train from the airport to downtown with NO traffic or rain surprises in your travel time Most likely you need to connect to the BTS Ask the lady at the information desk and get a map to mark your getoff station Remember that you will need two tickets one for the Rail link the other from BTS this latter you buy at the BTS station

title: clean and easy access to Sukhumvit from Siam.
review: We used the line often from Chit Lom station to access Sukhumvit Pretty good service The only negative point was no train information on the platform Even though we at the longest waited 5 min for å train But would have liked to know frequency of the train was more like a blind game Seats ok pretty or crowded from 48

title: Excellent
review: Nice experience we used BTS to travel till national stadium ( MBK) 28thb per head i recommend rather taking taxi pls use BTs which is very close and to avoid traffic

title: Quick & efficient
review: A good cheap alternative to a taxi for going into the city A little crowded but the staff are friendly and helpful We had to change lines and we accomplished it with no problems

title: Take the Airport Link
review: The best thing Thai government did is to put the Train line from the Airport Link I love it  and use it very often and it is inexpensive way to travel and quickest

title: good link
review: link with all other city transport  to avoid traffic jam and save on time good to catch BTS fast and economical

title: Cheap and fast way to get around
review: The BTS is a super efficient way to get around BKK  Beware peak hour gets very squeezy be patient you'll still get there The ticket system is easy  Enjoy BKK

title: Good way to get around
review: I had fun on the skytrain it was fast not many seats had to stand most of the time It didn't take long between stations I found it a good way to get around

title: Railway market is awesome!
review: Great value for the tour Wellorganized and as mentioned here already  the railway market experience is definitely a highlight more authentic experience than the floating market But overall much recommended

title: The best way to get to and from the airport
review: Simply put this is the best way to get to and from the airport  It links with Skytrain and the metro both a must (and easy) to master if you are staying in Bangkok  Rail Link is much cheaper and faster than a taxi would be so  a nobrainer Just use it

title: Fastest way to get to the city
review: It's the best way to avoid the traffic Keep in mind to go almost anywhere you have to switch lines at least once And you can't buy tickets just once to reach your destination which is a bit of an inconvenience when you have luggages

title: Can't buy tickets with credit cards, really?!?
review: Many vending machines for buying tickets and a booth with a person in it if that's more your thing but no way to buy the tickets with the credit cards I mean come on Made me very angry Not to mention that it takes forever to get to the airport

title: Easy to navigate
review: My husband and I used the Skytrain a few times during our trip in Bangkok The trains can get crowded during the busy times of the day but that is to be expected in a metropolis such as this one The maps and signage is very clear making it easy to navigate The cars are very clean as well I must rather use this means of transport as opposed to sitting in traffic in a tax that charges you by meter

title: Superb
review: Love the train Fast clean and swift Dunt worry waiting And during peak period everyone queue in an orderly manner

title: Easy to navigate
review: Arrived in Bangkok and needed to get to Hua Lamphong for a connection to Chiang Mai No problems buying tickets nor with the transfer to an MST at a connecting station ( sorry name escapes me now)

title: Fast and efficient
review: This is by far the best way to get around the city as the roads are so busy day and night  It is cheap and fast  Also has fantastic air conditioning inside the trains  Also great views from the windows when traveling

title: Fast, economic transportation
review: Public transit is the way to go in Bangkok  MRT and BTS can take you pretty much anywhere in the city  Stops are announced in Thai and English

title: Brilliant rail link to the city.
review: My wife and I used the rail link to get us from the airport to Bangkok earlier this week It is so easy to use being at the basement of the airport   Trains are easy to board and run on time You're straight into the city in a few minutes where you can link up with the BTS and MRT Very good  Very cheap

title: Convenientiy
review: Very convenient and inexpensive is easy for go to shopping mall but sometime many people and very busy on evening time

title: Fantastic cheap views
review: Cheap travel cheap views Perfect  They can understand English Highly recommended Does get bust and crammed at work time just like the roads tho

title: The simplest way
review: Just the simplest way to get around Bangkok Cheap not so crowded clean quick and efficient Get a day ticket and explore  The Skytrain doesn't cover all of Bangkok  but in the areas it does cover is by far the best transport option

title: simple ,fast ,cheap!!!!!!!!
review: when you exit the sumkvarnaburi airport  go to floor B by a ticket which is like a yellow coin  for 1 euro  get on the train and wait until the last stop with is part of green line in skytrain anmd then just follow the map to your hotel all together 3 euros  taxi 25 you choose

title: Excellent mode of transport
review: This is a great way to travel in Bangkok The trains run every 5mins and are clean and smooth running It is not expensive and you can buy single or multiple tickets I wish we had one of these in Edinburgh

title: CHEAP AWESOME AND NEW EXPERIENCE (When there is a blackout)
review: Best way to get around Bangkok city Easy to nagivate and use the transport There is a rabbit card for travellers like me who frequent Bangkok however do note that there is a expiry date to the card And once in a while BTS will have blackout in the morning D but the train will not stop just that the lights will go off lastly BTS is not 24hours operation So if you are planning to party till wee hours take a cab D

title: Easy and efficient
review: I always use the Sky train when in Bangkok since it has a massive network and is safe and efficient  They check everyone's bag upon entry and they are efficient at making you buy a ticket  Mind you it's not that cheap now like travel in other Asian countries is It was about a pound per journey okay not expensive but also not cheap  Nevertheless highly recommended and efficient

title: Fast and convenient
review: The skytrain system in Bangkok is very efficient and connects you to most parts of the city that a tourist would want to go to You can also take it for a ride to see the architecture of the city from a birds eye view  Try to get a day pass if possible its very cheap for unlimited travels for a day Individual trips between stations tend to get costly There are metro maps and tourist spots marked everywhere You can't miss it

title: Avoid traffic jam
review: Bangkok is one of just a few cities with good public transportation system The fare could be cheaper but it's working and one can avoid all the traffic

title: Reliable.
review: I guess this is an attraction because it's a great way to view the city   The BTS is very reliable stops at most attractions and connects to the MRT   The more you use Bangkok's range of public transport the better your experience will be   Do it

title: Well worth a visit
review: We went on this train as part of a tour and enjoyed it and the history that surrounds it One of the railway workers chatted with us about the prisoners of war who built the line and his immense admiration of what they endured  It was a very hot but worthwhile trip

title: best alternative tranport in Bangkok
review: we used this BTS as our alternative tranport during our Trip at Bangkok  it was clean cheap and fast   you can use BTS if you don't want trapped in Bangkok traffic  The information at BTS also clear and easily understood even we don't know how to read the Thai language

title: Not a place, but a service.
review: This review is a little out of the ordinary in that I usually review a hotel or restaurant This concerns a service We’ve used the tubesubway in Bangkok before but it was many years ago It still looks new and works well The stations that we used were clean and efficient The AC is a welcome relief in the heat of a Bangkok day Some stations are obviously busier than others but the folks that travel on the trains know rider etiquette  I hope other people give it a try On this visit we weren’t as close to the Skytrain but I’ve found it to be a useful part of the Bangkok public transport system as well

title: Very Convenient Method of Transportation!
review: This is an excellent way to get around Bangkok and although it does not cover the entire city's vast landscape it does get you to most of the most soughtafter places to see  Trains come and go every couple of minutes and are all well airconditioned which is helpful considering the sweltering heat outside  I would recommend using the Skytrain system for any firsttime travelers to Bangkok and try to book a hotel with access to it if you can

title: Average trip.
review: Actually spent more time on the road traveling there  Breakdown of time spent at Railway Market 15 minsgetting to the Railway Market on the train 30 mins Time spent in the boat at the Floating Market20 mins Time given to walkabout45 mins  Entire trip 6 hours Do the math Don't think it is a worthwhile trip

title: Easy, quick.
review: The sky train is very much like the underground except it's not underground   It's confusing at first with the different lines and amounts you need to pay An od factor is that you can't put notes in to the ticket machine you have to go to the ticket office to get change but you can't buy single tickets from the ticket office so if you're not to prepared you can end up queuing for change then queing for a ticket Once you've got the hang of it though it's pretty simple  There's a map on each machine showing all the stations each station will have a number next to it this number is the price in baht Then the machine has a button for each number simply press that and insert the coins very simple but not so simple if you don't know this before hand or understand Thai   The sky train is very clean and quick and reliable there's screens with adverts and it's all a little high tech and futuristic   It can get busy at peak times so I wouldn't recommend it after a huge shopping trip or if you're clostraphobic   In terms of value there are much cheaper options if you know where you're going but if you're just exploring generally with no fixed end point I'd highly recommend it A day pass is around 120baht though single journeys can work out much cheaper

title: Best bet for friday
review: I arrived at the airport on a late Friday afternoon and took a taxi to Phloen Chit Park Hyatt Hotel at 430 The first part of the journey was fine on the highway but go down the ramp to Phloen Chit cost me 45 minutes And thus the journey was1 hour and 40 minutes  If I take the airport rail link and change to BTS it will be half that time  No more taxi

title: very convenient, for a very busy city
review: We loved using BTS skytrain in Bangkok ) it is very safe and very clean  We will have preferred to be able to buy one card to use BTS and MRT without the need of buying individual token for each trip Besides that it’s the perfect way to move around in Bangkok Careful last train is around midnight But then traffic in Bangkok is much easier and there is plenty of taxis available during the night

title: Great, Efficient System
review: NonThais should not hesitate to use this system It is not difficult It is clean and fast Take it to the Jim Thompson House or the Bangkok Art and Culture Center Two lines with easy transfers And you see sone sites as you cruise above the trafficjammed roads Terrific modern infrastructure

title: Excellent day trip on trains and boats!
review: Tawee was our rep for Big Country  He has excellent knowledge  & good English Kind & helpful he provided  an excellent value trip Nice free banana and water too You can buy lunch in the market  recommend the coconut ice cream and coconut pancakes  The boat trip in the Floating Market is extra & costs 150 bhat per person it is a must Back at hotel in Bangkok by 145 pm so still time for more sightseeing  Highly recommend this tour  it is an early start but with hotel pick up allows you to tick another experience off your to do list

title: Easy to use and cheap
review: It's a convenient form of transport to get around Bangkok without the Jam Locations are accessible and tickets are easy to get as well

title: Time and Money savier.....
review: One of the best way to travel to and from airport We used Rail Link service to travel from Makkasen to the airport and it’s an awesome service 15minutes and you inside the airport terminal Whereas taxi would have taken roughly around 45min60min depending on traffic The stations are clean and signboards are decent enough for one to make its way Though it seems like it’s not fully operational Ticket wending machines are user friendly The token are dispensed for the fare purchased Frequency is excellent Time displayed for the next arrival train is accurate  We made the right decision not to travel by Taxi and opted for Airport Rail Its inexpensive save a lot of money and a lot of time

title: Always busy but easy to travel to Ramkamhaeng
review: Poorly planned with Makassan Station being a good point but for those who are staying around Ramkamhaeng area and need to travel to Central Bangkok with the BTS connection in Phiyathai this is the fastest mode of transport And the toilets at Airport Link Ramkamhaeng Station is fully airconditioned and very modern

title: Not a bad idea
review: The airport rail takes u to makasan station or phraya station in the city The makasan allows u to switch to metro while phraya is the BTS line Traffic in Bangkok could be really bad during weekdays Using the railway could save your time

title: Excelent Service
review: Frequent and fast service throughout Bangkok Makes travelling convenient and you don't have to sit in traffic

title: Not user friendly
review: No escalator make it a bit troublesome when enter and exit also when exchange train It is a bit confusing when exchange train luckily i have a Thai friend with me

title: great way to get to the airport
review: easy comfortable inexpensive fast  and lots of help from locals to find out where to go and what to do

title: Convenience
review: It is very convenience if you would like to connect yourself from Suvannabhumi Airport to town as it is only take up to 30 minutes to get there

title: Easy to use
review: It was our first time in Bangkok and l was a bit daunted about getting around but we didn’t have to worry the Skytrain is so easy to use especially as you can get an all day ticket  We came back from our travels at peak time though and it was just like the trains here “packed” so they might not be everyone’s idea of a nice way to travel but it didn’t bother us

title: Clean and efficient service
review: Staff always helpful and polite to travellers  Make sure you have lots of change for ticket machines

title: Overnight fun Bangkok to Chiang Mai roundtrip
review: Our actual dates were in April 2013 during the Songkran Festival  The train itself is relatively clean  The first class bunk beds were comfy and the restaurant car served very reasonably priced food and drinks including Thai beer Chang I think it was called  The reason we gave the train a 4 is because the bathrooms were acceptable and typical of many long route train toilets  A shower was also at the end of the hall by the toilets but we did not use this   We thought at first we could buy these very cheap tickets online ourselves but then a glitch occurred with the Thai railroad online ticketing service and we ended up buying the tickets through an agency that delivered them to our hotel in Bangkok  We loved both Bangkok and Chiang Mai and the train allowed us to save on hotel rooms and arrive at both places pretty well rested  The landscape along the way is an added plus And finally this train allowed us one more way to experience the beautiful Thai culture

title: Clean and efficient
review: Like the London underground but above ground  Quick and efficient and even on a holiday not too crowded

title: Best way transporting in Bangkok
review: Escape from bad traffic in the Big City like Bangkok Thailand by using BTS is the best choice for everyone

title: Quick and convenient
review: if all you have is a carryon and you are headed for downtown this is the fastest cheapest and most efficient means to get to the center of town Connects to the BTS

title: Great way to get around town
review: The BTS is a great way to get around town very similar to singapores MRT most maps have the stations on them

title: Smart and cheap way to head to centre
review: Followed the instructions as posted in TripAdvisor forum Fast and efficient way to travel to city center from the airport Bangkok's weather is very hot with high humidity and is definitely overcrowded My advice is to travel with minimal luggage else you will be regretting it when the sun hits you

title: Pitiful experience, take a residents advice.
review: Please everyone take my advice and TAKE THE TAXI  This airport rain line is pitiful and not worth the time and money  Here's why  First you must schlep all the way down to the ground floor at the airport walk over to the rail line buy a ticket and ride a crowded narrow train  It rocks back and forth  Makes about 8 stops before reaching downtown Bangkok  Since Bangkok does not have an extensive mass transit system locals use the rail link to get back and forth to work and school  There is no place to place your bags  Crowded crowded crowded  If you have anything bigger than a carry on and traveling with another person or more take the taxi  Once into Bangkok you need to carry your bags down a flight of stairs walk over to the BTS Skytrian unless your hotel is right there which is unlikely  Buy a ticket and lug our stuff upstairs to the train which is also very crowded  Then when you get to your stop you need to carry your luggage back down 2 flights of stairs and also to roll your luggage to the hotel And who knows how far that is  The airport link cost 45 baht the skytrain will be about 45 baht so if 2 or more are traveling you can take a taxi from door to door for just a little bit more money  I am a resident of Bangkok not a tourists and have been on the airport link many times so please do not be fooled by tourist reviews who think this is great  It is not

title: avoid road traffic jams and move with BTS
review: its better to use BTS & MRT when in bangkok to get away from the traffic jams n move faster to ur stations and save time

title: Derfinitely the way to go to the airport
review: Traffic can be a nightmare in Bangkok  The train will get you there in 30 minutes  I loved it  I took a taxi from my hotel in Bangkok  The fare was around $2  I saw the traffic backed up on the freeway going to the airport  This saved me a lot of time getting to the airport

title: Good light rail system
review: I'd recommend the BTS The next train stops are announcd n the train in Thai & English There's also led displays of the line with the current location and the next stop written in Thai & English Can get very crowded in peak hour Buying tickets is easy Would highly recommend to avoid the heavy traffic on the roads below

title: Superb public transport that connects anywhere in Bangkok!
review: BTS is the far the most convenient mode of transport yet not too expensive It's clean cool and also very frequent This is the most convenient mode of transport in Bangkok )

title: Effective and cheap transport
review: We used the Sky train every day over the course of the week we stayed in Bangkok   It leaves you right beside the likes of chatuchak market the sukhumvit shopping centers Jim Thompson house (very recommended) or the river for a ferry   Cheap and quick and being crammed in during rush hour with the commuters adds to the charm

title: So Easy!
review: Bought a Rabbit pass card and visited Victory Monument area The card can also be used for food at some malls  AC ride always excellent

title: Great
review: Sky train but can be very packed You have to be ready to push a bit to get in  But good maps on stations and easy to figure out

title: Cheap and comfortable
review: Futuristic and comfortable but doesnt reach the historic and touristic centre around Khaosan Anyway its a great public transports system

title: Quick and easy to use but always packed no matter the time
review: Easy to use Very cheap Only 2 lines so you can't really go wrong Buying tickets per journey seemed to be the cheapest option for us but you can get a day pass if you wanted to

title: Easy & Convenient Travel
review: A great way to travel within the city of Bangkok The Skytrain is cheap easy to use and makes the commute quicker especially during peak times when the traffic is horrendous

title: Rapid transport system
review: Very convenient way of getting round the city with amazing views Clean and easy to navigate Would recommend

title: Nice tour with lots to see
review: We went for the private tour option as there were 4 of us and enjoyed the tour very much especially the railway market Only reason I didn’t put 5 stars is that the floating market is rather quiet only seems to cater for tourists so don’t expect to see lots of fruits and vegetables boats with locals buying their food for the week None of that maybe due to COVID Still it’s lovely going through those canals

title: Public transport in Bangkok
review: The public transport to use in Bangkok is easy and cheap to use and will take you to most of the main areas You can sue the skytrain or the MTR on the MTR if you are over 60 you get 50% discount and you don't have to be local you need to buy your ticket at the ticket counter The water taxis are also easy and cheap to use the orange flagged taxis are the cheapest The airport link is the best way to get from the airport the most you pay on this is 45baht Avoid the tuk tuks they will take you all the shops so that they can get petrol vouchers

title: Just do it into town.
review: Just do it into town No traffic safe and clean We then transfer to BTS or Metro don't confuse the two City lines download map in advance find elevators to levels if you have luggage

title: The best of the transport
review: Actually bts  subway  skytrain   France should learn about Thailand  So clean so nice to travel in the bts

title: Good Service
review: I have used this service many times its fast easy and cheap If you choose a taxi into Bkk you are looking at between 400 to 500 baht as a posed to 34 baht  but saying that if you dont travel lightly then a cab would be the better option

title: Good Service
review: We mostly preferred taking BTS instead of taxis Taxis are a bit more tricky as you need to get a meter taxi  most of the taxi drivers in the central area does't want to go on the meter etc BTS has got great air con as well Rush hour can be a bit busy but nothing like London rush hour tube so it is ok I guess

title: Excellent way to get around the city
review: easy access to all areas of Bangkok  clean and fast  Don't buy a starbucks before you get to the station  no food or drinks allowed

title: Sky Train
review: 1 mins walk only It is with overbridge connecting to that so can avoid congestion on the shop street

title: great
review: The sky train makes it easy to get around the city  stops regularly and easy to find some good shops

title: Recommended!
review: Nice tour guide and tour The railway market and floating market is a musttry schedule in Thailand believe everyone would love it

title: Cheap and easy
review: cost 45 baht to go the furthest station and it was cool and quick They do get very busy and cramped though

title: sometimes break down, but generally works most of the time.
review: sometimes break down but generally works most of the time Air conditioned and clean  get places faster than a taxi for sure

title: Save Big Money here
review: Using the Sky train can save hundreds of Baht to get to Sukhumvit Hotels andor Khao San Road  This connects to BTS train which goes ro Sukhumvit or Saphan Taksin station where you catch boat goin north to your desired location  Khao San Road and The Grand Palace arethe favored destinations for many

title: Fantastic service to the city
review: You can reach the city from Suvarnabhumi airport in about 30 minutes or less which in the taxi would take up to 2 hours and is more expensive

title: great ride
review: We used the  train about 4 times We took a  flight from Bangkok to Chiang Mai and to just go for a ride and check the city out The train was always clean safe comfortable and on time We rode from the our hotel which was in the shopping or stop A7 to the airport cost if I remember about 40 baht Well worth the cost

title: Vintage rail trip and a piece of history
review: The trip from the River Kwai station takes you across the famous bridge and on through some wonderful scenery and sights of real Thailand The full trip to Nam Tuk is 2 hours and there is nothing there I would suggest getting off in Krae Semae to eat and see the cave there Sit on either side on the way up as the wooden viaduct across the cliff face about 15 hours in to the trip is amazing wherever you sit  Sit on the right coming back and enjoy the views of the river  For all foreigners the ticket is 100 baht so sit in the carriages that show the 100 baht signs The others at the back of the train are for locals who have paid a lot less and the carriage is packed  There is a 300 baht ticket as well that gives you refreshments but it is not really needed The carriage is also labelled  Worth the trip

title: Mediocre
review: Went to visit the infamous death railway bridge over river Kwai Went for a train ride over it with a guide  however the trip was far to long the restaurant at the end pretty average so was overall quite a dull experience   By all means visit the bridge but leave out the train ride  Shame

title: Easy to use
review: Sky train very convenient and easy to use for start it does look hard but when u get into it its alot easier everything is marked in English and understanding

title: From the airport direct to city centre.
review: This train makes getting from Suvarnabhumi airport into Bangkok central (or vice versa) extremely easy Taxi drivers will often try to charge you 500 baht without running the meter but you can do the full length on this train for 45 baht A great service and they are currently busy building one for Don Mueang airport too

title: Not to be missed
review: A fantastic experience with both the train and boat Had a nice guide and a wonderful time They picked us from the hotel Avoid purchasing items from the boats in the floating market as it is very expensive compared to other markets

title: Fast moving
review: Bangkok traffic jams though improved is still a headache It is better to take the MRT to reach the destinations easily Of course the whole city is not covered but a huge area is covered and can be traveled by MRT They are easy within means and not complicated to purchase tickets People are helpful and new comers do not face trouble finding their ways to the trains MRT is efficient timely and nice We have been using it whenever we come to Bangkok and can see they are still operating well

title: Very easy to use
review: Very easy to use much more efficient then going by taxi or tuktuk and always takes you where you actually whants

title: Way to go !!!
review: The trains were clean air conditioned and comfortable some services were packed as it was Soncran time I should imagine gauging your time of use during normal working days is a must   We used their website which advises on local interests at each station vicinity  very helpful Our local station was Siam which is the central point of the system

title: Good for light sinle and luggage traveller
review: Airport Rail Link situated at basement of Suvanabhumi Airport One of the cheapest mean of transport to town i come across Well maintain and clean

title: Easy and cheap
review: Very easy to use Very cheap But you ll have to walk a lot when you transfer from train station to mrt

title: No traffic!!
review: fast way to get in and out from Bangkok I really recommend the airport link from the airport into the city especially in the morning and afternoon traffic

title: Convenient and Affordable
review: If you’re ever at Suvarnabhumi Airport and need to get to downtown Bangkok take the Bangkok Airport Link At a cost of 45 thb you can get to downtown Bangkok in about 30 minutes It’s faster and cheaper than taking a taxi and you avoid the crowded Bangkok roads  The Airport Link also has a stop connecting to the MTR as well as the BTS If you get off at the last stop in downtown Bangkok and need to take a taxi there is a waiting area for taxis so you will not have to walk to the main road to hail a taxi If there is not one there there are people there to help you hail a taxi  This is the way to go when travelling to Bangkok from the airport and vice versa

title: easy to move around
review: This is the ONLy way to get around Bangkok in a few days  it also gets you easily to Saphin Taksin boat terminal

title: Fun tour for a taste of life outside the city
review: What a fun tour We did this in September and were very lucky with great weather Sara our guide was so much fun She spends the drive out to the train teaching you some Thai and sharing history with a lot of laughter and humor mixed in Highly recommend during your visit to Bangkok
